title: Nutritional composition
abstract: The present invention provides a combination comprising or consisting of lacto-N- fucopentaose-l (LNFP-I), a LNFP-1 metabolizing Bifidobacterium, for example Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis and a galactose source, or a nutritional composition comprising lacto- N-fucopentaose-l (LNFP-I), aa LNFP-1 metabolizing Bifidobacterium, for example Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis and a galactose source, wherein the galactose source consists of a structure of Formula (I): Hex1(n)-Hex2(m) (Formula I) wherein: Hex1 is galactose, Hex2 is galactose or glucose, n = 1-9, and m = 1.
claims:
1. A nutritional composition comprising lacto-N-fucopentaose-l (LNFP-I), a LNFP-1 metabolizing Bifidobacterium, for example Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis, and a galactose source, wherein the galactose source consists of a structure of Formula I: Hex1(n)-Hex2(m) [Formula I] wherein: Hex1 is galactose, Hex2 is galactose or glucose, n = 1-9, and m = 1.
2. The nutritional composition according to claim 1, wherein the LNFP-1 metabolizing Bifidobacterium is selected from the list consisting of: Bifidobacterium lactis, B. longum, Bifidobacterium breve, B. longum subsp. infantis, B. longum subsp. iuvenis, B. bifidum, B. pseudocatenulatum, B. kashiwanohense, and any combination thereof.
3. The nutritional composition according to claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the LNFP-1 metabolizing Bifidobacterium is Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis.
4. The nutritional composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the galactose source is selected from galacto-oligosaccharides (GOS), Bovine Milk-derived Oligosaccharides (BMOS) and combinations thereof.
5. The nutritional composition according to any one of the prec

title: Compositions for use in the prevention or treatment of necrotizing enterocolitis in infants and young children
Compositions and methods for increasing the palatability of dry pet food
Dry animal digest composition
abstract: The dry animal digest composition may include dry animal digest particles having an animal fat content of about 16% by weight or less and a moisture content of about 3% by weight or less. The dried animal digest particles in this example have a volume diameter particle size distribution in which D10 is from about 20 [mu] m to about 50 [mu] m, D50 is from about 60 [mu] m to about 150 [mu] m, and D90 is from about 160 [mu] m to about 275 [mu] m. In addition, the dried animal digest composition is substantially free of silica flow promoters.
claims:
1.干燥动物消化物组合物，所述干燥动物消化物组合物包含干燥动物消化物颗粒，所述干燥动物消化物颗粒具有约16重量％或更少的动物脂肪含量和约3重量％或更少的水分含量，其中所述干燥动物消化物颗粒具有体积直径粒度分布，其中D10为约20μm至约50μm，D50为约60μm至约150μm，并且D90为约160μm至约275μm，并且其中所述干燥动物消化物组合物基本上不含二氧化硅流动助剂。
2.根据权利要求1所述的干燥动物消化物组合物，其中基于体积直径低于30μm的干燥动物消化物颗粒的百分比为3％至20％。
3.根据权利要求1所述的干燥动物消化物组合物，其中基于体积直径低于45μm的干燥动物消化物颗粒的百分比为5％至25％。
4.根据权利要求1所述的干燥动物消化物组合物，其中所述干燥动物消化物颗粒的体积平均直径为约60μm至约160μm。
5.根据权利要求1所述的干燥动物消化物组合物，其中D10为约25μm至约40μm，D50为约75μm至约125μm，D90为约185μm至约250μm，或其组合。
6.根据权利要求1所述的干燥动物消化物组合物，其中所述干燥动物消化物组合物完全不含所述二氧化硅流动助剂，并且还不含选自以下的化学流动助剂：粘土、面粉、粉煤灰、生石灰、淀粉、沸石、硅酸盐、硬脂酸盐、磷酸盐、多糖、脂肪酸盐、硅藻土、竹笋、玉米芯、豌豆纤维、豌豆壳、柑橘纤维、纤维素粉末、微晶纤维素或其组合。
7.根据权利要求1所述的干燥动物消化物组合物，其中所述干燥动物消化物颗粒为约40重量％至约80重量％的蛋白质和约10重量％至约16重量％的动物脂肪。
8.根据权利要求1所述的干燥动物消化物组合物，其中用于制备所述干燥动物消化物颗粒的动物组织的约80重量％至100重量％来自肝脏组织。
9.根据权利要求1所述的干燥动物消化物组合物，其中用于制备所述干燥动物消化物颗粒的动物组织被预处理以去除动物脂肪。

11.根据权利要求1所述的干燥动物消化物组合物，其中所述干燥动物消化物组合物的约25重量％至约99.99重量％来自所述干燥动物消化物颗粒，并且所述动物消化物组合物的约0.01重量％至约75重量％包含选自以下的一种或多种添加剂：磷酸盐化合物、焦磷酸盐化合物、焦磷酸四钠(TSPP)、胆碱化合物、氨基酸、维生素、益生菌、蛋黄和酵母。
12.根据权利要求1所述的干燥动物消化物组合物，其中所述干燥动物消化物颗粒包括酵母。

粗磨食物；和

title: Infant nutrition containing hydrolyzed protein and palmitic acid
abstract: The present invention relates to a composition for use in an infant or young child formula comprising a partially hydrolyzed protein and an oil mixture comprising palmitic acid wherein the palmitic acid esterified at the sn-2 position of the triacylglycerol is present in an amount of from 20% to 60% by weight of the total palmitic acid. Furthermore, the present invention relates to an infant formula comprising said composition and the use of said composition or infant formula.
claims:
1.一种用于婴儿或幼儿配方食品中的组合物，所述组合物包含部分水解的蛋白质和含被酯化成三酰基甘油的棕榈酸的油混合物，其中在所述三酰基甘油的sn-2位酯化的棕榈酸的量占总棕榈酸的20重量％至60重量％，并且在所述三酰基甘油的sn-1(3)位酯化的棕榈酸的量占总棕榈酸的40重量％至80重量％。
2.根据权利要求1所述的组合物，其中所述部分水解的蛋白质为部分水解的乳清蛋白质。
3.根据权利要求1所述的组合物，其中所述部分水解的蛋白质具有8％至24％的水解度。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述组合物还包含离子钙。
5.根据权利要求4所述的组合物，其中所述离子钙为选自柠檬酸钙、氢氧化钙、氧化钙、氯化钙、碳酸钙、葡萄糖酸钙、磷酸钙、焦磷酸钙、三磷酸钙、甘油磷酸钙、乳酸钙和硫酸钙的一种或多种。
6.根据权利要求4或5中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述组合物的离子钙含量为至少1.7mmo1/L。
7.根据权利要求1至6中任一项所述的组合物，其中以总脂肪酸的总量计，所述油混合物的棕榈酸含量为至少8重量％。
8.根据权利要求1至7中任一项所述的组合物，其中以重量计所述部分水解的蛋白质与所述sn-2棕榈酸酯之间的比率为1.5：1至35：1。
9.一种婴儿配方食品，包含根据权利要求1至8中任一项所述的组合物。
10.根据权利要求9所述的婴儿配方食品，其中所述油混合物的棕榈酸含量为8重量％至30重量％。
11.根据权利要求9所述的婴儿配方食品，其中所述部分水解的蛋白质的量占蛋白质总量的至少50％。
12.根据权利要求1至8中任一项所述的组合物或根据权利要求9至11中任一项所述的婴儿配方食品，用于向婴儿或幼儿施用以减少所述婴儿或幼儿的钙排泄。
13.根据权利要求1至8中任一项所述的组合物或根据权利要求9至11中任一项所述的婴儿配方食品，用于向婴儿或幼儿施用以改善钙稳态、增加钙吸收、增加钙存留、增加钙利用和/或减少棕榈酸皂形成。
14.根据权利要求1至8中任一项所述的组合物或根据权利要求9至11中任一项所述的婴儿配方食品，用于向婴儿或幼儿施用以软化粪便、预防粪便硬结和/或降低粪便硬结的风险、预防便秘和/或降低便秘的风险、改善喂养耐受性、降低哭闹不安的频率和持续时间、以及缓解消化不适和急腹痛。
15.根据权利要求1至8中任一项所述的组合物或根据权利要求9至11中任一项所述的婴儿配方食品，用于向婴儿或幼儿施用以改善睡眠持续时间、改善睡眠质量和量、改善婴儿和父母生活质量、以及减轻母亲焦虑。
16.根据权利要求1至8中任一项所述的组合物或根据权利要求9至11中任一项所述的婴儿配方食品，用于向婴儿或幼儿施用以增加骨矿化、增加骨强度和/或增加骨矿物质密度。

title: Device for preparing and dispensing beverages with an improved arrangement of solenoid valves
abstract: The invention concerns a machine (10) for preparing and dispensing beverages comprising at least one beverage preparation apparatus (18), which is designed for preparing and dispensing beverages, and at least one water supply apparatus (20), which is provided with one or more water delivering pipes (22) to the beverage preparation apparatus (18), and with one or more solenoid valves (50, 52, 54) each coupled to a respective water delivery pipe; wherein the solenoid valves (50, 52, 54) are positioned within an housing chamber at a door compartment of a main casing (12) to be immediately and easily accessible when the door (16) is open during respective adjustment and/or maintenance operations.
claims:
1. A machine for preparing and dispensing beverages comprising:
a main casing, able to define a housing chamber of a plurality of apparatuses of the machine and provided with at least one opening which defines a door compartment to said housing chamber;
at least one door, which is provided with an outer surface and an inner surface oriented towards said housing chamber, wherein said door is hinged to said main casing at a hinging axis and is configured to close said door compartment in the machine operating configuration;
at least one beverage preparation apparatus, which is designed for preparing and dispensing beverages;
at least one water supply apparatus, which is provided with one or more water delivering pipes to said beverage preparation apparatus, and with one or more solenoid valves each coupled to a respective water delivery pipe; and
at least one additive substances feeding apparatus, which is provided with one or more additive substances delivering pipes to said beverage preparation apparatus;
wherein said beverage preparation apparatus comprises:
at least one mixing and dispensing nozzle; and
at least one alcove, which is obtained on said door and which defines a seat open on the outer surface of said door to hold at least one container into which the beverage dispensed through said nozzle flows;
wherein the solenoid valves are positioned within said housing chamber at the door co

title: Methods using medium chain triglycerides administered prior to a meal to decrease postprandial glucose from the meal
abstract: A method reduces postprandial glucose from a meal. The method includes orally administering to an individual a composition containing medium chain triglycerides (MCT) and then subsequently orally administering the meal to the individual after the oral administration of the composition containing the MCTs and within about one hour of the oral administration of the composition containing the MCTs. For example, the meal can be administered about thirty minutes after the administration of the composition containing the MCTs. The postprandial glucose is reduced relative to postprandial glucose from (i) postprandial glucose from administration of an identically formulated composition containing MCTs at approximately the same time as the administration of the meal and (ii) postprandial glucose from administration of the meal without any MCTs within about one hour before or within about one hour afterward. The composition containing the MCTs can be a liquid oral nutritional supplement (ONS) providing incomplete nutrition.
claims:
1.     A method of reducing postprandial glucose from a meal, the method comprising: orally administering to an individual a composition comprising medium chain triglycerides (MCT); and subsequently orally administering the meal to the individual after the oral administration of the composition comprising the MCTs; and wherein the meal is administered between about fifteen minutes after the administration of the composition comprising the MCTs and about forty minutes after the administration of the composition comprising the MCTs.
2.     The method of claim 1 wherein the individual has at least one condition selected from the group consisting of obesity, diabetes and pre-diabetes.
3.     The method of claim 1 or claim 2 wherein the individual is an aging subject.
4.     The method of claim 3 wherein the individual is elderly.
5.     The method of any one of claims 1 to 4 wherein the composition comprising the MCTs is a liquid.
6.     The method of any one of claims 1 to 5 wherein the composition is administered to the individual in a serving comprising at least about 15.0 g of the MCTs up to about 30.0 g of the MCTs.

title: Compositions and methods that modulate phosphorus or enzymes in a companion animal
abstract: A specific type of organ health marker in a companion animal can be improved by adjusting the diet of the animal to increase the amount of a compound which positively or negatively modulates the specific type of organ health marker or adjusting the diet of the animal to decrease the amount of a compound which positively or negatively modulates the specific type of organ health marker. The specific type of organ health marker can be one or more of phosphorus, alkaline phosphatase, aspartate aminotransferase, or gamma- glutamyltransferase.
claims: CLAIMS: <div class="indep-clm" num="1"><seg-con>1. A pet food composition, </seg-con><seg-trans>comprising: </seg-trans><seg-refi>protein, carbohydrates, fat, fiber, and at least 8 distinct metabolites including at least 2 distinct metabolites for modulating each of phosphorus, alkaline phosphatase, aspartate aminotransferase, and gamma-glutamyltransferase in a companion animal; wherein the metabolite that modulates phosphorus is selected from the group consisting of homocysteine, erythritol, arabitol, betaine, N-acetylphenylalanine, 3-hydroxybutyrate (BHBA), citrulline, mannose, 2-oxindole-3-acetate, N-acetyltryptophan, glycerate, xylonate, threitol, 3-aminoisobutyrate, arachidonate (20:4n6), gamma-glutamylphenylalanine, phenylalanine, trigonelline (N1-methylnicotinate), allantoin, glutathione (oxidized (GSSG)), Nacetylserine, arabinose, and mixtures thereof; wherein the metabolite that modulates alkaline phosphatase is selected from the group consisting of lysine, gamma-glutamylphenylalanine, arabinose, phenylalanine, and mixtures thereof; wherein the metabolite that modulates aspartate aminotransferase is selected from the group consisting of 3-ureidopropionate, threitol, erythronate, gulono-l,4-lactone, Cglycosyltryptophan, urea, 2-hydroxyglutarate, butyrylcamitine, dimethylglycine, pseudouridine, eicosapentaenoate (EPA; 20:5n3), uracil, 1-linoleoylglycerophosphoinositol, dihomo-linolenate (20:3n3 or n6), phosphate, and mixtures thereof; wherein the metabolite that modulates gamma-glutamyltransferase is selected from the group consisting of 3-aminoisobutyrate, trigonelline (N'-methylnicotinate), N-acetylserine, taurochenodeoxycholate, erythritol, 15-methylpalmitate, allantoin, taurocholate, threitol, 3- phosphoglycerate, betaine, arabitol, sebacate (decanedioate), stachydrine, citrulline, citrate, glycolate (hydroxyacetate), campesterol, and mixtures thereof; wherein the pet food composition provides at least a 5% increase or at least a 5% decrease in the amount

title: Compositions and methods to treat or prevent metabolic fatigue using at compound oleuropein or metabolite thereof
abstract: To provide a method of treating or preventing a mitochondria-related disease or a condition associated with altered mitochondrial function in an individual in need thereof or at risk thereof.SOLUTION: There is provided a method for achieving at least one result selected from the group consisting of (i) improvement in a physiological state linked to metabolic fatigue in one or more cells, (ii) increased mitochondrial energy and mitochondrial calcium uptake in one or more cells, and (iii) treatment or prevention of a calcium deficiency/depletion disorder, the method comprises orally administering an effective amount of at least one of oleuropein or metabolite thereof to an individual.SELECTED DRAWING: None
claims:
【請求項1】
（ｉ）１つ以上の細胞における代謝疲労に関連する生理学的状態の改善、（ｉｉ）１つ以上の細胞におけるミトコンドリアエネルギー及びミトコンドリアカルシウム取り込みの増加、並びに（ｉｉｉ）カルシウム欠乏／枯渇障害の治療又は予防、からなる群から選択される少なくとも１つの結果を達成するための方法であって、
有効量のオレウロペイン又はその代謝産物のうちの少なくとも１つを、個体に経口投与することを含む、方法。
【請求項2】
前記１つ以上の細胞のうちの少なくとも一部分が、肝臓、腎臓、脳、及び骨格筋からなる群から選択される少なくとも１つの身体部分の一部である、請求項１に記載の方法。
【請求項3】
前記代謝疲労に関連する生理学的状態に、筋疲労又は筋力低下、エネルギーの欠如、身体的エネルギーの欠如、体力の欠如又は体力低下が含まれる、請求項１又は２に記載の方法。
【請求項4】
前記有効量のオレウロペイン又はその代謝産物のうちの少なくとも１つを、少なくとも１週間、毎日経口投与する、請求項１～３のいずれか一項に記載の方法。
【請求項5】
前記オレウロペインの代謝産物が、オレウロペインアグリコン、ヒドロキシチロソール、ホモバニリルアルコール、イソホモバニリルアルコール、これらのグルクロン酸抱合形態、これらのサルフェート形態、これらの誘導体、及びこれらの混合物からなる群から選択される、請求項１～４のいずれか一項に記載の方法。
【請求項6】
前記有効量のオレウロペイン又はその代謝産物のうちの少なくとも１つを、食品組成物、ダイエタリーサプリメント、栄養組成物、ニュートラシューティカルズ、飲料、摂取前に水又はミルクで再構成される粉末栄養製品、食品添加物、医薬、ドリンク、ペットフード、及びこれらの組み合わせからなる群から選択される組成物で投与する、請求項１～５のいずれか一項に記載の方法。
【請求項7】
前記有効量のオレウロペイン又はその代謝産物のうちの少なくとも１つを、カルシウムを更に含む組成物で投与する、請求項１～６のいずれか一項に記載の方法。
【請求項8】
前記有効量のオレウロペイン又はその代謝産物のうちの少なくとも１つを、タンパク質、炭水化物、脂肪、及びこれらの混合物からなる群から選択される成分を更に含む食品製品で投与する、請求項１～７のいずれか一項に記載の方法。
【請求項9】
ミトコンドリア関連疾患又はミトコンドリア機能の変化に関連する状態を、それらの処置を必要としている個体において又はそれらのリスクがある個体において、治療又は予防
assignee: ソシエテ·デ·プロデュイ·ネスレ·エス·アー

title: Beverage or food preparation system
abstract: A container for use with a beverage or food preparation machine, the container comprising: a storage portion for containing a precursor material; a code storing preparation information used by the machine to process the precursor material, the code being readable by a code reading system of the machine, the code reading system comprising: an illumination system for projecting emitted light to the code; and a camera system for obtaining a digital image of a code, the code being arranged to overlap with the precursor material; and a support layer supporting a code, the support layer being at least partially transparent to emitted light from the lighting system, the code comprising: an absorbing layer configured to absorb the emitted light and a reflecting layer configured to reflect the emitted light, the reflecting layer being arranged to reflect the emitted light before the emitted light is transmitted to the support layer.
claims:
1.一种用于与饮料或食品制备机器一起使用的容器，所述容器包括：
储存部分，所述储存部分用于容纳前体材料；
代码，所述代码用于存储由所述机器用来处理所述前体材料的制备信息，所述代码被配置为能够由所述机器的代码读取系统读取，所述代码读取系统包括照明系统，所述照明系统用于将发射光投射到所述代码，所述代码被布置成与所述前体材料重叠，使得来自所述照明系统的发射光投射到所述前体材料中；
所述代码包括：被配置为吸收所述发射光的吸收层和被配置为反射所述发射光的反射层，
所述容器进一步包括支撑所述代码的支撑层，所述支撑层由对来自所述照明系统的所述发射光至少部分透明的材料制成，
其中所述反射层被布置成在所述发射光被透射到所述支撑层之前反射所述发射光。

所述反射层是连续的；
所述反射层连接到所述支撑层以邻接所述支撑层；并且
所述支撑层在由横向方向和纵向方向限定的平面中延伸，并且在深度方向上具有贯穿厚度，并且其中，当在所述平面中观察时所述反射层与整个所述支撑层重叠。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的容器，其中，所述支撑层在由横向方向和纵向方向限定的平面中延伸，并且在深度方向上具有贯穿厚度，所述深度方向从外表面延伸；并且
所述吸收层在所述深度方向上布置在所述反射层与所述外表面之间，使得所述吸收层相对于所述反射层最接近所述外表面；并且
所述反射层在所述深度方向上布置在所述支撑层与所述外表面之间。
4.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中，所述容器的包括所述支撑层和所述代码的部分被配置为当每个穿透器受到大于5N至15N的力时能够被一个或多个穿透器穿透，每个穿透器具有成70度至30度的尖端。
5.根据权利要求4所述的容器，其中，所述支撑层具有50微米至150微米的厚度。

title: MCT-based nutrition blend for cardiac protection and treating degenerative mitral valve disease in companion animals
abstract: A method of treating degenerative mitral valve disease (DMVD) in a companion animal having DMVD, a method of preventing DMVD in a companion animal at risk thereof, and a method of maintaining or improving cardiac health in a companion animal. The methods include orally administering to the companion animal a composition containing medium chain triglycerides and optionally one or more of omega-3 fatty acids, vitamin E, lysine, taurine, magnesium, or sulfur-containing amino acids.
claims:
﻿CLAIMS
1. Use of a composition comprising a therapeutically effective amount of medium chain triglycerides for treating degenerative mitral valve disease (DMVD) in a companion animal previously identified as being at risk of DMVD by a factor selected from the group consisting of (i) a measured concentration of N-terminal pro B-type natriuretic peptide in the companion animal, (ii) a detected enlarged heart of the companion animal, (iii) a detected heart murmur in the companion animal, (iv) a identified history of one or more of coughing, exercise intolerance, decreased appetite, difficulty breathing, or temporary loss of consciousness caused by a fall in blood pressure in the companion animal, (v) the companion animal was identified as a small breed, (vi) detected mitral regurgitation, (vii) measured changes in serotonin, transforming growth factor beta, or nitric oxide signaling pathways, (viii) measured changes in energy metabolism, and (ix) combinations thereof.
2. The use of claim 1, wherein the measured changes in energy metabolism (viii) are compromised long chain fatty acid beta-oxidation, compromised branched chain fatty acid alpha¬ oxidation, compromised ketolysis or increased glucose intake and glycolysis.
3. The use of Claim 1 or 2, wherein the composition further comprises a component selected from the group consisting of an omega-3 fatty acid, Vitamin E, magnesium, lysine, a sulfur-containing amino acid, and mixtures thereof.

title: A nutritional composition comprising 2'-Fucosyllactose (2' FL) to improve the gastrointestinal barrier
abstract: The present invention relates to nutritional compositions comprising 2'- Fucosyllactose (2'FL) for use in improving the gastrointestinal barrier. In particular, the present invention relates to improving gastrointestinal barrier in an infant, a young child or children aged above 3 years to 8 years.
claims:
1. A method for improving a gastrointestinal barrier in a subject selected from the group consisting of an infant (child under the age of 12 months), a young child (between 1 year and less than 3 years), or a child (aged from 3 years to less than 8 years), the method comprising administering a nutritional composition comprising 2'-Fucosyllactose (2'FL) to the subject, wherein said improvement to the gastrointestinal barrier is improved barrier protection, and wherein 2'FL is present in an amount of 0.25 to 1.9 g/L or 0.15 to 1.5 g/lOOg of the nutritional composition on a dry weight basis.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein 2'FL is present in an amount of 0.75 to 1.65 g/L or 0.19 to 1.5 g/lOOg of the nutritional composition on a dry weight basis.
3. The method according to claim 1 or 2, wherein said improving the gastrointestinal barrier comprises improving the prevention of barrier dysfunction, improving the prevention of barrier leakiness, improving the protection of tight junction structure, and improving the protection of the intestinal epithelial lining integrity.
4. The method according to claim 3, wherein said prevention of barrier leakiness is prevention of pathogens, allergens and/or toxic compounds to migrate from the gut into the body through the gastrointestinal barrier.
5. The method according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein said improvement, said prevention and/or said protection is achieved by downregulation of TNF

title: Beverage preparation with simple capsule transfer
abstract: A machine (1) is configured to prepare a beverage from a capsule (5) having a body containing an ingredient The beverage is prepared by circulating a liquid into the capsule and centrifugally driving the capsule. The machine has a first capsule handler (10) and a second capsule handler (20) that are movable one relative to the other from a capsule transfer configuration to a capsule processing configuration for centrifuging the capsule (5) by rotation about a processing axis (30′) of the first and second capsule handlers (10,20). The machine has a capsule insertion passage (60) associated with one or more capsule insertion guides (61) configured to guide the capsule (5) towards a capsule holding position in a space (100′) between the first and second capsule handlers (10,20) in their transfer configuration. The capsule insertion guide(s) (61) comprise(s) at least a rotatable portion (38) that is stationary relative to at least one of the first and second capsule handlers (10,20) and rotates therewith when the first and second capsule handlers (10,20) are rotated for centrifugation.
claims:
1. A capsule processing machine for preparing a beverage from a capsule having a body containing an ingredient by circulating a liquid into such capsule and centrifugally driving such capsule, comprising:
a first capsule handler and a second capsule handler that are movable one relative to the other from:
a capsule transfer configuration for receiving said capsule by the first and second capsule handlers and/or releasing said capsule from the first and second capsule handlers; to
a capsule processing configuration for centrifuging said capsule by rotation about a processing axis of the first and second capsule handlers; and
a capsule insertion passage associated with one or more capsule insertion guides configured to guide said capsule towards a capsule holding position in a space between the first and second capsule handlers in their transfer configuration, for instance the space being associated with a holding device, such as one or more stop members configured to hold said capsule in the space prior to being held by at least one of the first and second capsule handlers relatively moving towards and/or into the capsule processing configuration,
a machine frame and/or housing which is stationary when the first and second capsule handlers are rotated for centrifugation and which supports the first and second capsule handlers,
the capsule insertion guide(s) comprise(s) at least a rotatable portion that is stationary relative to at least one of the first and second capsule handlers and rotates therewith when the first and second capsule handlers

title: Methods of monitoring feeding behaviors of pets
abstract: The present disclosure relates to the monitoring feeding behavior(s) of a pet(s), under the control of at least one processor. An example system includes a pet bowl comprising a load sensor configured to obtain load data while the pet is interacting with contents of the pet bowl. The load sensor can have a sensitivity of +/−50 grams or less and the load data can occur at a sample rate from 10 samples to 150 samples per second. The system also includes a processor configured to sequentially group the load data in 0.01 second to 5 second time increments. The individual time increments can include multiple samples. The processor can also identify a feeding behavior occurring within one or more of the time increments based on the load data resulting from the pet interacting with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
claims:
1. A system for monitoring feeding behavior of a pet, comprising:
a pet bowl comprising a load sensor configured to obtain load data while the pet is interacting with contents of the pet bowl, wherein the load sensor has a sensitivity of +/−50 grams or less and the load data is obtained at a sample rate from 10 samples to 150 samples per second;
a processor configured to sequentially group the load data in 0.01 second to 5 second time increments, wherein individual time increments include multiple samples; and
the processor further configured to identify a feeding behavior occurring within one or more of the time increments based on the load data resulting from the pet interacting with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the processor is further configured to exclude load data in identifying the feeding behavior if determined to be a result of human interaction, a false trigger, or an accidental interaction with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
3. The system of claim 1, wherein the feeding behavior is a count-based feeding behavior selected from lapping, licking, or biting.
4. The system of claim 3, wherein the processor is further configured to characterize the count-based feeding behavior by counting individual micro-events of the feeding behavior within a single time increment or a time period spanning multiple time increments, wherein the individual micr

title: Kit for the preparation of a beverage in a centrifugal brewing device
abstract: Kit for preparation of a beverage in a centrifugal brewing device by feeding liquid in a capsule and rotating the capsule along a central axis to produce centrifugal forces on the liquid traversing the capsule thereby forcing the beverage out of the capsule by such centrifugal forces. The capsule includes containment walls forming a main cavity of central axis containing beverage ingredients. The kit also includes an insert which is separate from the capsule, and the insert has a ring-shaped portion intended to form a valve engaging portion engaging against a valve of the centrifugal brewing device.
claims:
1: A kit to be inserted in a centrifugal brewing device, the kit comprising:
a capsule configured for preparation of a beverage in the centrifugal brewing device by feeding liquid in the capsule and rotating the capsule along a central axis to produce a centrifugal force on the liquid traversing the capsule to force the beverage out of the capsule by the centrifugal force, and
the capsule comprises containment walls forming a main cavity of the central axis; and
the kit further comprising an insert independent from the centrifugal brewing device and which is separate from the capsule,
the insert comprises a ring-shaped portion forming a valve engaging portion configured for engagement against a valve means of the centrifugal brewing device,
the insert further comprises transversal annular or circular portion which is inwardly and integrally connected to the ring-shaped portion,
the insert is hollow at and around the central axis, and the transversal annular or circular portion has one or more through-openings for allowing liquid flow outwardly or through the insert, and
the ring-shaped portion extends axially beyond above and/or below the transversal annular or circular portion and has an outer diameter larger than the largest diameter of the capsule.
2: The kit of claim 1, wherein the ring-shaped portion has a structure in relief and/or recess on an upper surface and/or a lower surface thereof, the

title: Beverage pouch system with pouch identification
abstract: The invention relates to an extraction device for extracting a beverage ingredient from a capsule (3), said capsule (3) comprising a code (34), said device comprising:-upstream and downstream capsule enclosing parts (1, 2), the upstream and downstream capsule encapsulating parts are relatively movable between an open position and a closed position for inserting and removing the capsule (3); the invention relates to a device (1) comprising a path (41), a code reader (71),-a removable capsule stent (6),-a top insertion section (4) for introducing the capsule stent (6) into the device,-a capsule stent stop (42) for stopping the capsule stent (6) in an intermediate temporary position inside said path (41), and wherein in the intermediate temporary position, the capsule stent (6) is inserted into the path (41). The bag holder (6) is configured to hold the bag such that the code (34) arranged on the bag faces the code reader (71), and wherein during introduction of the bag holder into the device, when the bag holder reaches the intermediate temporary position, an operation of reading the code by the code reader is triggered by movement of the bag holder (6).

title: Package comprising a face comprising a removable section comprising a pull TAB, and methods of making and using such a package
abstract: An opening arrangement includes a substantially planar top face and a tearable foil membrane underneath the top face. The top face contains a removable portion. A first section of the removable portion is not sealed to the tearable foil membrane, and a second section of the removable portion is sealed to an opening-forming portion of the tearable foil membrane. The opening arrangement further includes an extended sealing flange extending outward and/or upward from adjacent the removable portion of the top face and adjacent the opening-forming portion of the tearable foil membrane. The opening arrangement is configured for a user to pull the first section of the removable portion of the top face to remove the removable portion while the opening-forming portion of the tearable foil membrane remains sealed to the removable portion, and the opening-forming portion is removed in one piece with the removable portion, to thereby form an opening extending completely through the opening arrangement.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. An opening arrangement comprising a substantially planar top face, and the opening arrangement further comprising a tearable foil membrane underneath the top face, wherein the top face comprises a removable portion, a first section of the removable portion is not sealed to the tearable foil membrane, and a second section of the removable portion is sealed to an opening-forming portion of the tearable foil membrane, wherein the opening arrangement further comprises an extended sealing flange extending outward and/or upward from adjacent the removable portion of the top face and adjacent the opening-forming portion of tearable foil membrane, wherein the opening arrangement is configured for a user to pull the first section of the removable portion of the top face to remove the removable portion while the opening-forming portion of the tearable foil membrane remains sealed to the removable portion, and the openingforming portion is removed in one piece with the removable portion, to thereby form an opening extending completely through the opening arrangement, wherein one or more of (a) the removable portion of the top face, (b) the opening-forming portion of the tearable foil membrane, or (c) the opening in the opening arrangement formed by removal of the removable portion and the opening-forming portion of the tearable foil membrane, has a lateral sides having a width which continuously increases as the lateral sides extends from the center of the opening arrangement toward the extended sealing flange.

title: Methods of determining a perceived immune fitness of an individual
abstract: The present disclosure provides a method of identifying and/or quantifying a perceived immune fitness of an individual. The method comprises identifying a frequency and/or a severity of one or more conditions experienced by an individual. The one or more conditions includes sore throat, headaches, flu, runny nose, coughing, cold sores, boils, mild fever, warts, pneumonia, bronchitis, sinusitis, sudden high fever, ear infection, diarrhea, meningitis, eye infection, sepsis, long healing injuries, shortness of breath, skin problems, muscle and joint pain, and common cold. The method further includes calculating a perceived immune fitness score of the individual based on up to 10 of the one or more conditions with the highest frequency and/or severity.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A method of identifying and/or quantifying a perceived immune fitness of an individual, the method comprising: identifying a frequency and/or a severity of one or more conditions experienced by an individual, wherein the one or more conditions is selected from the group consisting of: sore throat, headaches, flu, runny nose, coughing, cold sores, boils, mild fever, warts, pneumonia, bronchitis, sinusitis, sudden high fever, ear infection, diarrhea, meningitis, eye infection, sepsis, long healing injuries, shortness of breath, skin problems, muscle and joint pain, and common cold; and calculating a perceived immune fitness score of the individual based on up to 10 of the one or more conditions with the highest frequency and/or severity.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the calculating of the perceived immune fitness score of the individual is further based on a sex of the individual.
3. The method of any one of claims 1 and 2, wherein the calculating of the perceived immune fitness score of the individual is further based on an age of the individual.
4. The method of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the perceived immune fitness score of the individual is determined one or more times at discrete intervals.
5. The method of any one of claims 1-4, the method comprising assigning a value to each of the one or more conditions experienced by the individual, the value representative of the frequency and/or the severity of the corresponding condition, and the value of each of the one or more conditions is on a scale of 1

title: Capsule for the preparation of a beverage
abstract: A biodegradable and/or compostable capsule for use with a beverage preparation machine (10) for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff thereof is disclosed. The capsule comprises a cup-shaped body (1) and a closing membrane (2) for closing the cup-shaped body, both elements defining a closed cavity for a beverage and/or foodstuff ingredient, preferably roast and ground coffee, and a liner (20) or a coating having barrier function providing barrier function to the cup-shaped body. The cup-shaped body is made of cellulose-based material, preferably molded pulp-based material and comprises a bottom wall (4), a tubular lateral side wall (5), an annular flange (3) connected to the lateral wall for the closing membrane to seal thereon, and an outwardly extending rim portion (6) connected to the annular flange. The rim portion is made of cellulose-based material and comprises a curved and/or curled end portion (6A) comprising a treated region in which the cellulose-based material has a porosity that is less than 40%, preferably between 0% to 25%.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A capsule for use with a beverage preparation machine (10) for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff thereof, the capsule is biodegradable and/or compostable and comprises: a cup-shaped body (1) and a closing membrane (2) for closing the cup-shaped body (1), the cup-shaped body (1) and the closing membrane (2) defining a closed cavity for holding a beverage and/or foodstuff ingredient, preferably roast and ground coffee, and a liner (20) or coating having barrier function providing barrier function to the cup-shaped body (1); said cup-shaped body (1) is made of cellulose-based material, preferably pulp-base material, and comprises a bottom wall (4), a tubular lateral side wall (5), an annular flange (3) connected to the lateral wall (5) for the closing membrane (2) to seal thereon, and an outwardly extending rim portion (6) connected to the annular flange (3), characterized in that the rim portion (6) is made of cellulose-based material and comprises a curved and/or curled end portion (6A) comprising a treated region (6B) in which the cellulose-based material has a porosity that is less than 40%, preferably between 0% to 25%.
2. The capsule according to claim 1, characterized in that the rim portion (6) is integrally made with the annular flange (3) which is also made of cellulose-based material.
3. The capsule according to any of claims 1 or 2, characterized in that the treated region (6B) extends over the entire rim portion (6) or is limited to a portion of the rim portion (6).
4. The capsule according to any of the preceding claims, wherein the treated region (6B) is a compressed re

title: Beverage preparation machine
abstract: The invention concerns a beverage preparation machine (1) in which the beverage is prepared by introducing at least one jet of liquid, such as water, in a container (2) comprising a beverage ingredient (3), said machine comprising a nozzle (11) connected to a liquid supplying system (12), said nozzle comprising a tube (110), said tube comprising a liquid inlet (111) and a liquid outlet (112), the jet of liquid emerging from said liquid outlet, wherein the nozzle (11) comprises a sleeve (120), said sleeve presenting an internal section (Ss) greater than the internal section (So) of the liquid outlet end of the tube and said sleeve surrounding the jet of liquid emerging from the liquid outlet (112) of the tube.
claims:
1. A method for preparing a beverage with a beverage preparation machine, the beverage preparation machine comprising at least one nozzle connected to a liquid supplying system, the at least one nozzle comprising a tube, the tube comprising a liquid inlet and a liquid outlet, wherein the at least one nozzle further comprises a sleeve, the sleeve presenting an internal section greater than an internal section of the liquid outlet of the tube, and the sleeve surrounding the liquid outlet of the tube, and wherein the sleeve comprises at least one opening in a lateral wall of the sleeve, the opening being positioned near the liquid outlet end of the tube, the method comprising:
introducing a beverage ingredient in a container in the beverage preparation machine;
introducing at least one jet of liquid into the container through the liquid outlet of the at least one nozzle, wherein the sleeve surrounds the at least one the jet of liquid emerging from the liquid outlet; and
sucking air through the at least one opening into the sleeve such that the air in the sleeve is flowing in the sleeve around the at least one jet of liquid, wherein the at least one jet of liquid enters inside the beverage in preparation, carrying along air bubbles in the beverage and producing foaming.
2. The method according to claim 1, further comprising, before the introducing of the at least one jet of liquid, measuring the height of the container.
3. The method according to claim 1, further comprising moving, during the introducing

title: Beverages having clear appearance, shelf stability, high protein, and neutral pH
abstract: A method of making a beverage includes adding one or more other ingredients to hydrolyzed protein to form the beverage, which is clear, shelf-stable, and high protein and has a neutral pH and an energy content of at least about 100 kcal per 240 ml of the beverage. Optionally the hydrolyzed protein is obtained by subjecting protein to a protease. In some embodiments, the high protein is at least about 15 g or at least about 20 g of protein/100 kcal, and in some embodiments the energy content is at least about 150 kcal/240 ml or at least about 200 kcal/240 ml. Other aspects are directed to the resultant beverage, a method of producing a high protein beverage containing hydrolyzed protein, a method of increasing transparency in a high protein beverage containing hydrolyzed protein, and a method of providing nutrition to an individual.
claims:
1. A method of making a beverage, the method comprising:
hydrolyzing protein with a protease; and
adding one or more other ingredients to the hydrolyzed protein to form the beverage, which has clear appearance, shelf-stability, high protein, a neutral pH and an energy content of at least about 100 kcal per 240 ml of the beverage,
wherein
the high protein in the beverage is 10 g to 25 g protein/100 kcal of the beverage; and
the one or more other ingredients comprise sugar in an amount up to 25% of the energy content of the beverage.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the protease is selected from the group consisting of trypsin, chymotrypsin, pancreatin, papain, bromelain, and pepsin and mixtures thereof.
3. The method of claim 1 or 2, wherein the energy content is about 100 kcal to about 360 kcal per 240 ml of the beverage, preferably wherein the energy content is about 100 kcal to about 300 kcal per 240 ml of the beverage, more preferably wherein the high protein in the beverage is about 10 g to about 20 g protein/100 kcal of the beverage and the energy content is about 100 kcal to about 200 kcal per 240 ml of the beverage.
4. The method of any one of the preceding claims, wherein the beverage comprises the protease.
5. The

title: Application of bifidobacterium longum transition type microorganism
abstract: Treating and/or preventing allergy and/or allergic sensitization. The present invention relates to a Bifidobacterium longum transition microorganism for use in the treatment and/or prevention of allergies and/or allergic sensitization in infants or young children.
claims:
1.长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物，所述长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物用于治疗和/或预防婴儿或幼儿的变态反应和/或变态反应性致敏。
2.益生元，所述益生元用于通过促进长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物在婴儿或幼儿的肠道中的生长和/或存活来治疗和/或预防所述婴儿或幼儿的变态反应，其中所述益生元是：
i.聚糖底物，所述聚糖底物适当地选自表1至表3中任一者列举的组；和/或
ii.人乳低聚糖(HMO)，所述人乳低聚糖(HMO)适当地选自由2'-O-岩藻糖基乳糖(2'-FL)、3'-O-岩藻糖基乳糖(3'-FL)、乳糖二岩藻四糖/二岩藻糖基乳糖(di-FL)、3'-O-唾液酸乳糖(3'-SL)、6'-O-唾液酸乳糖(6'-SL)、乳糖-N-四糖(LNT)和乳糖-N-新四糖(LNnT)以及它们的任何组合组成的组。
3.根据权利要求1所述使用的长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物，其中所述长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物与益生元结合地使用，并且其中所述益生元是：
i.聚糖底物，所述聚糖底物适当地选自表1至表3中任一者列举的组；和/或
ii.人乳低聚糖(HMO)，所述人乳低聚糖(HMO)适当地选自由2'-O-岩藻糖基乳糖(2'-FL)、3'-O-岩藻糖基乳糖(3'-FL)、乳糖二岩藻四糖/二岩藻糖基乳糖(di-FL)、3'-O-唾液酸乳糖(3'-SL)、6'-O-唾液酸乳糖(6'-SL)、乳糖-N-四糖(LNT)和乳糖-N-新四糖(LNnT)以及它们的任何组合组成的组。
4.根据权利要求2所述使用的益生元，其中所述益生元与长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物结合地使用。
5.长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物和益生元的组合，所述组合用于治疗和/或预防婴儿或幼儿的变态反应和/或变态反应性致敏；其中所述益生元是：
i.聚糖底物，所述聚糖底物适当地选自表1至表3中任一者列举的组；和/或
ii.人乳低聚糖(HMO)，所述人乳低聚糖(HMO)适当地选自由2'-O-岩藻糖基乳糖(2'-FL)、3'-O-岩藻糖基乳糖(3'-FL)、乳糖二岩藻四糖/二岩藻糖基乳糖(di-FL)、3'-O-唾液酸乳糖(3'-SL)、6'-O-唾液酸乳糖(6'-SL)、乳糖-N-四糖(LNT)和乳糖-N-新四糖(LNnT)以及它们的任何组合组成的组。
6.根据权利要求2至5中任一项所述使用的长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物、益生元或组合，其中所述益生元是选自表1至表3中任一者列举的组的聚糖底物。
7.根据权利要求2至5中任一项所述使用的长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物、益生元或组合，其中所述益生元是选自由2'-FL、3'-FL、di-FL、3'-SL、6'-SL、LNT和LNnT以及它们的任何组合组成的组的HMO。
8.根据权利要求2至5或7中任一项所述使用的长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物、益生元或组合，其中所述HMO是3'-FL。
9.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述使用的长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物、益生元或组合，其中所述长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物能够代谢所述HMO和/或所述聚糖底物。
10.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述使用的长双歧杆菌过渡型微生物、益生元或组合，其中所述长双歧杆菌过渡型微生

title: Method for detecting and/or quantifying mood disorder and/or improvements of the mood disorder status using butyrate as biomarker and improved methods and compositions thereof
abstract: The present invention relates to the use of butyrate as biomarker for detecting and/or quantifying improvements of the mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction of a subject. It also relates to a method for detecting and/or quantifying mood disorder, improvements of the mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction of a subject, in particular for monitoring the progress of an intervention to treat or ameliorate a mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction in a subject, wherein the intervention comprises the administration of a probiotic. It also relates to an improved intervention to treat or ameliorate a mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction in a subject in need, comprising administering to the subject, an effective amount of a composition combining a probiotic with butyrate.
claims:
1-2. (canceled)
3. Method for detecting and/or quantifying mood disorder,
improvements of the mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction of a subject, comprising
assessing the level of butyrate in a body sample obtained from a subject to be tested, and
comparing the subject's butyrate level to a predetermined reference value,
wherein an increased butyrate level in the sample compared to the predetermined reference value indicates an improvement of the mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction of the subject.
4. The method according to claim 3, wherein the mood disorder is mild to severe.
5. The method according to claim 3, wherein the predetermined reference value was obtained previously from the same subject.
6. The method according to claim 3, wherein the predetermined reference value is based on an average butyrate level in the same body fluid in a control population.
7. The method according to claim 3, wherein the levels of the biomarkers in the sample and in the reference are determined by mass spectrometry, according to by ultra-performance liquid or gas chromatography coupled to tandem mass spectrometry.
8. The method

title: Roasting apparatus calibration method
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: group of inventions relates to coffee industry. Disclosed is a method of calibrating an apparatus (X) for roasting coffee beans to reproduce roasting recipes for coffee beans determined using one specific roasting apparatus (M), involving: introducing at least one second temporary temperature sensor into the chamber of the roasting apparatus to be calibrated, or replacing said chamber with a temporary calibration chamber, wherein said temporary calibration chamber comprises at least one second temperature sensor, controlling the heating device to reproduce a predetermined curve Rset, wherein said predetermined curve provides a number of points representing temperature for use at predetermined successive times t1, t2, ..., tfinal, respectively, wherein said control is based on temperature Treg measured by at least one first temperature sensor (5), measurement of temperature Tcal during reproduction of a predetermined curve Rset as a function of time inside the chamber on at least one second temperature sensor, which makes it possible to determine at least a set of points, comparison of temperature measured at at least one moment in time ti with temperature at said same point in time ti of a predetermined reference curve Rref obtained using a control apparatus (M) for frying, wherein said reference curve Rref represents the temperature Tref measured in the chamber of the particular control apparatus (M) during control of the heating device of the control apparatus to reproduce said predetermined curve Rset, calibrating the roasting apparatus (X) based on said comparison by applying a correction in the feedback loop of the temperature Treg measured by the first temperature sensor, or by applying the temperature correction provided by the frying curves for the frying apparatus (X). Also disclosed is an apparatus for roasting coffee beans, in which the control system is configured to implement the described calibration method, and a computer-readable data medium containing instructions which, when executed by a computer, processor or control unit, cause the computer, processor or control unit to perform the described calibration method.EFFECT: group of inventions provides identical roasting of coffee beans at the same roasting profile in different roasting devices.18 cl, 10 dwg
claims:
1. Способ калибровки аппарата (X) для обжаривания кофейных зерен для воспроизведения рецептур обжаривания кофейных зерен, определенных с помощью одного конкретного контрольного аппарата (М) для обжаривания,
причем указанный аппарат (X) для обжаривания кофейных зерен содержит:
- камеру (1) для размещения кофейных зерен,
- нагревательное устройство (2), выполненное с возможностью подачи горячего воздуха в камеру,
- по меньшей мере один первый датчик (5) температуры для измерения температуры воздуха, подаваемого нагревательным устройством, причем указанный первый датчик температуры расположен за пределами камеры,
- систему (80) управления, выполненную с возможностью управления нагревательным устройством (2) и выполненную с возможностью воспроизведения кривых обжаривания, причем указанные кривые обжаривания обеспечивают по меньшей мере набор точек, представляющих температуру, которую нужно применять в отдельные последовательные моменты времени ti соответственно, причем указанное управление нагревательного устройства (2) осуществляют посредством регулирования контура обратной связи на основе температуры Treg, измеренной по меньшей мере одним первым датчиком (5) температуры,
причем указанный процесс калибровки включает стадии:
a - введение по меньшей мере одного второго временного датчика температуры внутрь камеры аппарата для обжаривания, подлежащего калибровке, или замена указанной камеры временной калибровочной камерой, причем указанная временная калибровочная камера содержит по меньшей мере один второй датчик температуры,
b - управление нагревательным устройством для воспроизведения предварительно заданной кривой Rset, причем указанная предварительно заданная кривая обеспечивает ряд точек, представляющих температуру для применения в предварительно заданные последовательные моменты времени t1, t2, …, tfinal соответственно, причем указанное управление основано на температуре Treg, измеренной по меньшей мере одним первым датчиком (5) температуры,
c - измерение температур

title: Process for the production of a container for the preparation of a beverage in a beverage preparation device, sealing station for carrying out a sealing step of said process, and a container obtained by said process
abstract: The present invention concerns a process for producing a container for the preparation of a beverage in a beverage preparation device, wherein, in the final container obtained, at least 70% of the surface of a compacted beverage ingredient body (2) contained therein, is in contact with the container walls (3, 4).
claims:
<div class="indep-clm" num="1"><seg-main>1. A process for producing a container for the preparation of a beverage in a beverage preparation device, comprising </seg-main><seg-clauses><seg-main>the steps of:</seg-main>
<seg-clauses>a. providing an injection wall of said container comprising a paper layer, said injection wall comprising: a peripheral sealing edge, and an inner portion capable of being punctured by an injection member of the beverage preparation device for circulating water under pressure inside said container;</seg-clauses>
<seg-clauses>b. providing a beverage delivery wall of said container comprising a paper layer, said delivery wall comprising: a peripheral sealing edge, and an inner portion capable of being opened by an opening member of the beverage preparation device when the pressure inside said container presses said inner portion against said opening member, to let the beverage flow out, wherein at least one, preferably both, of said inner portions of said injection and delivery walls has a cup shape;</seg-clauses>
<seg-clauses>c. placing a compacted body of beverage ingredient in the cup-shaped inner portion of the injection or delivery wall;</seg-clauses>
<seg-clauses>d. placing the injection and delivery walls one above the other such that the sealing edges of said injection and delivery walls are superimposed, in order to form a preliminary container chamber containing said ingredient body and comprising a preliminary headspace not filled by said compacted ingredient body;</seg-clauses>
<seg-clauses><seg-main>e. providing a sealing station comprising: first and second housing elements forming a sealing chamber for housing the inner portions of said injection and delivery walls, wherein said first and second housing elements are configured for being moved towards each other for sealing said edges, and such that the surfaces of said sealing chamber are in contact with external surfaces of said inner portions of the injection and delivery wa

title: Apparatus and method for roasting coffee beans
abstract: The invention concerns an apparatus for roasting coffee beans comprising: —a vessel (1) to contain coffee beans, —a heating device (12) to heat coffee beans contained in the vessel, —a control system (180) operable to control the heating device and configured to apply a roasting recipe (R) providing the temperature T@t1, T@t2, . . . to be applied at discrete successive times t1, t2, . . . , respectively, wherein for a customised quantity m of coffee beans introduced inside the vessel, —the control system is configured to obtain at least the quantity m of coffee beans introduced inside the vessel, and —the control system is configured to get access to at least one series of roasting recipes (Ri, Ri+1, . . . ) adapted to the roasting of different successive pre-determined quantities (Mi, Mi+1, . . . ) of beans of same type and to said pre-determined quantities Mi, Mi+1, . . . , and —based on said accessible series of roasting recipes (Ri, Ri+1, . . . ) adapted to the roasting of different successive pre-determined quantities (Mi, Mi+1, . . . ) of beans of same type and based on said obtained quantity m of coffee beans introduced inside the vessel, the control system is configured to determine the roasting recipe (R) to be applied on said obtained quantity m of coffee beans introduced inside the vessel.
claims:
1. An apparatus for roasting coffee beans, the apparatus comprising:
a vessel to contain coffee beans;
a heating device to heat coffee beans contained in the vessel; and
a control system operable to control the heating device and configured to apply a roasting recipe providing the temperature T@t1, T@t2, . . . to be applied at discrete successive times t1, t2, . . . , respectively,
wherein, for a customised quantity m of coffee beans introduced inside the vessel,
the control system is configured to obtain at least the quantity m of coffee beans introduced inside the vessel, and
the control system is configured to get access to at least one series of roasting recipes (Ri, Ri+1, . . . ) adapted to the roasting of different successive pre-determined quantities (Mi, Mi+1, . . . ) of beans of same type and to the pre-determined quantities Mi, Mi+1, . . . , and
based on the accessible series of roasting recipes (Ri, Ri+1, . . . ) adapted to the roasting of different successive pre-determined quantities (Mi, Mi+1, . . . ) of beans of same type and based on the obtained quantity m of coffee beans introduced inside the vessel, the control system is configured to determine the roasting recipe to be applied on the obtained quantity m of coffee beans introduced inside the vessel,
wherein the control system is configured to determine

title: Dietary supplement
abstract: An oral composition comprising at least one probiotic bacteria selected from the genera: Lactobacillus, Bifidobacterium, and Bacillus, and ferric pyrophosphate.
claims:
1. An oral composition comprising:
at least one probiotic bacteria selected from the group consisting of: Lactobacillus rhamnosus CGMCC 1.3724, Bifidobacterium lactis CNCM I-3446, and a mixture thereof;
ferric pyrophosphate, wherein the ferric pyrophosphate has a particle size distribution D90 of 200 microns or less, a particle size distribution D97 of 25 microns or less, and an average particle size of about 0.001 microns to about 10 microns; and
at least one pharmaceutically acceptable additive or excipient selected from the group consisting of stabilizers, fillers, emulsifiers, surfactants, solubilising agents, adsorbents, flowing agents, buffers, lubricants, wetting agents, carriers, antioxidants, thickeners, anticaking agents, coating agents, taste masking agents, preservatives, flavouring agents and dyes.
2. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the ferric pyrophosphate is in the form of a colloid.
3. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the at least one probiotic bacteria is the mixture of Lactobacillus rhamnosus CGMCC 1.3724 and Bifidobacterium lactis CNCM I-3446.
4. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the at least one probiotic bacteria comprises Lactobacillus rhamnosus CGMCC 1.3724.
5. The composition according to claim 1, wherein

title: Medium chain triglyceride compositions
abstract: A composition comprising medium-chain triglycerides (MCTs) wherein the composition comprises (i) a MCT comprising three fatty acid moieties each with 8 carbon atoms (MCT-C8) and (ii) a MCT comprising three fatty acid moieties each with 10 carbon atoms (MCT-C10); wherein the ratio of MCT-C8 to MCT-C10 is from 10:90 to 90:10 (mol/mol) and wherein the combined amount of MCT-C8 and MCT-C10 make up at least 50 mol % of the MCTs in the composition.
claims:
1: A composition comprising medium-chain triglycerides (MCTs) wherein the composition comprises (i) a MCT comprising three fatty acid moieties each with 8 carbon atoms (MCT-C8) and (ii) a MCT comprising three fatty acid moieties each with 10 carbon atoms (MCT-C10); wherein the ratio of MCT-C8 to MCT-C10 is from 20:80 to 80:20 (mol/mol) and wherein the combined amount of MCT-C8 and MCT-C10 make up at least 50 mol % of the MCTs in the composition.
2: The composition according to claim 1, wherein the ratio of MCT-C8 to MCT-C10 is about 20:80 (mol/mol).
3: The composition according to claim 1, wherein the combined amount of the MCTs in the composition.
4: The composition according to claim 1, wherein the three fatty acid moieties each with 8 carbon atoms are octanoic acid moieties and/or the three fatty acid moieties each with 10 carbon atoms are decanoic acid moieties.
5: The composition according claim 1, wherein said composition further comprises one or more agents that promote or sustain neurologic health or enhance cognitive function wherein said agents are selected from the group consisting of vitamins, choline, phosphatidylserine, alpha-lipoic acid, CoQ10, acetyl-L-carintine, herbal extracts (such as Gingko biloba, Bacopa monniera, Convolvulus pluricaulis and Leucojum aestivum), omega-3 or omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids (such as eicosapentaenoic acid, docosapentaenoic acid or docosahexaenoic acid as free fatty acid), aliphatic ester (such

title: Compositions for use
abstract: A paediatric supplement or human milk fortifier composition comprising at least one nutrients selected in the list consisting of: ALA, DHA, EPA, 2FL, LNnT, vitamin A, thiamine, thiamine monophosphate, vitamin B2, vitamin B6, vitamin B9, calcium and phosphorus, GD3, GM3. Said paediatric supplement or human milk fortifier composition is tailored or adapted for a child born via C-section who is breast fed and/or to fortify the breast milk of a woman who has given birth via C-section. Said paediatric supplement or human milk fortifier composition is beneficial to provide adequate nutrition to a child born via C-section and promote associated health benefits.
claims:
1. A paediatric supplement or human milk fortifier composition comprising at least one nutrient selected from the group consisting of: alpha linolenic acid (ALA) in a daily amount ranging from 19 to 80 mg; docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) in a daily amount ranging from 13 to 25 mg; eicosapentanoic acid (EPA) in a daily amount ranging from 6 to 9 mg; 2-fucosyllactose (2′-FL) in a daily amount ranging from 280 to 1050 mg; Lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT) in a daily amount ranging from 30 to 50 mg; vitamin A in a daily amount ranging from 224 to 342 kg; thiamine in a daily amount ranging from 6.6 to 10 kg; thiamine monophosphate in a daily amount ranging from 10 to 15 kg; vitamin B2 in a daily amount ranging from 9 to 19 kg; vitamin B6 in a daily amount ranging from 15 to 68 kg; vitamin B9 in a daily amount ranging from 1.1 to 9 kg; calcium in a daily amount ranging from 10 to 16 mg; phosphorus in a daily amount ranging from 4.5 to 14 mg; GD3 in a daily amount ranging from 8 to 12 mg; and GM3 in a daily amount ranging from 1 to 1.5 mg; and combinations thereof.
2. (canceled)

title: Method for producing moist salty products
abstract: The present invention relates to a method for producing a moist salty product. In particular, the present invention relates to a method for producing a moist salty product comprising the steps of mixing a composition comprising water, oil, soluble fibers having a molecular weight of less than 6000 g/mol and a flavoring agent, pasteurizing the mixture, and after cooling, adding ungelatinized starch, followed by packaging the moist salty product.
claims:
1.用于生产湿润咸味产品的方法，所述方法包括以下步骤：
a)将组合物混合，所述组合物包含基于所述总湿润咸味产品计15
重量％至60重量％的水、基于所述总湿润咸味产品计0重量％至
25重量％的油、基于所述总湿润咸味产品计4重量％至30重量％的可溶性纤维和基于所述总湿润咸味产品计5重量％至65重量％的风味剂；
b)对步骤a)的混合物进行巴氏灭菌；
c)将巴氏灭菌的混合物冷却至低于未糊化淀粉的糊化温度；
d)添加基于所述总湿润咸味产品计0.5重量％至20重量％的未糊化淀粉并进一步混合；
e)对所述湿润咸味产品进行包装；
其中所述可溶性纤维的分子量低于6000g/mol并且其中所述湿润咸味产品不是凝胶。
2.根据权利要求1所述的用于生产湿润咸味产品的方法，其中所述湿润咸味产品包含介于30重量％至75重量％(基于所述总湿润咸味产品计)之间的总固体含量。
3.根据权利要求1至2中任一项所述的用于生产湿润咸味产品的方法，其中所述组合物包含15重量％至45重量％的水(基于所述总湿润咸味产品计)、5重量％至25重量％的油(基于所述总湿润咸味产品计)、4重量％至30重量％的可溶性纤维(基于所述总湿润咸味产品计)和5重量％至60重量％的风味剂(基于所述总湿润咸味产品计)。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的用于生产湿润咸味产品的方法，其中所述未糊化淀粉以3重量％至20重量％(基于所述总湿润咸味产品计)的量存在。
5.根据权利要求1至4中任一项所述的用于生产湿润咸味产品的方法，其中所述未糊化淀粉选自玉米淀粉、马铃薯淀粉或其组合。
6.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的用于生产湿润咸味产品的方法，其中所述可溶性纤维选自可溶性玉米纤维、可溶性菊苣根纤维、可溶性甜菜纤维或其组合。
7.根据权利要求1至6中任一项所述的用于生产湿润咸味产品的方法，其中所述可溶性纤维选自分子量介于1000g/mol至2000g/mol之间的可溶性菊苣根纤维。
8.根据权利要求1至7中任一项所述的用于生产湿润咸味产品的方法，其中步骤b)中的所述巴氏灭菌在至少70℃的温度进行。
9.根据权利要求1至8中任一项所述的用于生产湿润咸味产品的方法，其中将步骤c)中的所述混合物冷却至介于25℃至65℃之间的温度。

title: Method for determining contribution of dog variety to test dog genome
abstract: The present invention relates to a method for determining the contribution of a dog variety to the genome of a test dog, the method comprising: a) providing a DNA methylation profile of a sample obtained from the test dog; and b) determining the contribution of a dog variety to the genome of the test dog by comparing at least a portion of the DNA methylation profile of the test dog to a reference DNA methylation profile from a different dog variety.
claims:
1.确定狗品种对测试狗基因组的贡献的方法，所述方法包括：
a)提供来自从所述测试狗获得的样本的DNA甲基化图谱；以及
b)通过将所述测试狗的所述DNA甲基化图谱的至少一部分与来自不同狗品种的参考DNA甲基化图谱进行比较来确定狗品种对所述测试狗基因组的贡献。
2.用于为测试狗选择膳食、药物或生活方式方案的方法，所述方法包括：
a)提供来自从所述测试狗获得的样本的DNA甲基化图谱；
b)通过将所述测试狗的所述DNA甲基化图谱的至少一部分与来自不同狗品种的参考DNA甲基化图谱进行比较来确定狗品种对所述测试狗基因组的贡献；以及
c)基于在步骤b)中确定的狗品种对所述测试狗基因组的贡献，为所述测试狗选择合适的膳食、药物或生活方式方案。
3.用于预防或降低测试狗发展疾病的风险的方法；所述方法包括：
a)提供来自从所述测试狗获得的样本的DNA甲基化图谱；
b)通过将所述测试狗的所述DNA甲基化图谱的至少一部分与来自不同狗品种的参考DNA甲基化图谱进行比较来确定狗品种对所述测试狗基因组的贡献；其中对所述测试狗基因组有贡献的至少一个狗品种与发展疾病的倾向相关；以及
c)基于在步骤b)中确定的所述至少一个狗品种对所述测试狗基因组的贡献，为所述测试狗选择膳食、药物或生活方式方案；
其中所述膳食、药物或生活方式方案预防或降低所述测试狗发展疾病的风险。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的方法，其中步骤a)包括确定来自从所述测试狗获得的样本的DNA甲基化图谱。
5.根据权利要求4所述的方法，其中根据包括以下方面的方法来确定DNA甲基化：(i)以下步骤中的一者或多者：(a)用APOBEC或使用亚硫酸氢盐转化来处理样本DNA以使未甲基化胞嘧啶脱氨基；(b)基于捕获的富集；和/或(c)高通量测序或阵列；或(ii)从头测序。
6.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中确定至少两个狗品种对所述测试狗基因组的贡献。
7.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中使用机器学习将所述测试狗的所述DNA甲基化图谱与来自不同狗品种的参考DNA甲基化图谱进行比较。
8.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中所述参考DNA甲基化图谱包含来自至少2个、至少4个、至少10

title: Beverage preparation machine with outlet
abstract: A machine (1) is configured for preparing a beverage (4) from a flavouring ingredient (5a) in a processing cavity (5) by mixing therein said ingredient (5a) with water (4'). The processing cavity (5) is delimited by an ingredient handling system (10, 20) associated with at least one water inlet (24) for supplying the water (4') to the ingredient (5a) in the cavity (5). The beverage (4) is dispensed out of the machine (1) via an outlet (25) so as to flow by gravity from the outlet (25) into a dispensing area (40) in which a user-receptacle (42) can be placed. The machine has a beverage passage (26) extending from the processing cavity (5) to the beverage outlet (25). Such outlet (25) is located above a bottom level (5') of the processing cavity (5) so that the beverage dispensing area (40) extends upright in front of the cavity (5).
claims:
Claims <div class="indep-clm" num="1"><seg-main>1. A machine (1) for preparing a beverage (4) from a flavouring ingredient (5a) in a processing cavity (5) by mixing therein said ingredient (5a) with water (4’), such as a cavity (5) for holding said ingredient (5a) supplied within a capsule (5b), such machine (1) comprising: </seg-main><seg-clauses><seg-main>- an ingredient handling system (10,20) delimiting the processing cavity (5), the system (10,20) having at least one water inlet (24) for supplying said water (4’) to said ingredient (5a) in the processing cavity (5), for instance the system (10,20) having a first ingredient handler (10) and a second ingredient handler (20) that are movable one relative to the other from: </seg-main><seg-clauses>- a distant ingredient transfer configuration for receiving said ingredient (5a) by the first and second handlers (10,20) and/or releasing said ingredient (5a) from the first and second ingredient handlers (10,20), optionally at least one of the handlers (10,20) being associated with a guide (20’) for guiding said ingredient (5) towards and/or from the handlers (10,20) in the transfer configuration; to </seg-clauses><seg-clauses>- a proximate ingredient processing configuration for mixing said ingredient (5a) and said water (4’), optionally said water (4’) having been thermally conditioned, e.g. by a heater or a cooler, and/or pressurized, e.g. by a pump; and </seg-clauses><seg-clauses>- vice versa; </seg-clauses><seg-clauses><seg-main>- a beverage outlet (25) fluidically connected to the cavity (5) and configured to dispense out of such machine </seg-main><seg-clauses>(1) said beverage (4) that flows, e.g. freely falls, by gravity from the outlet (25) into a beverage dispensing area (40) delimited by a placing surface (41) for placing a user-receptacle (42), such as a cup or mug, to collect the dispensed beverage (4); and</seg-clauses></seg-clauses>
<seg-clauses>- a beverage passage (26) extending from the processing cav

title: Reliable capsule removal system
abstract: A machine (1) has a capsule extraction module (10,20) for preparing a beverage from an ingredient contained in a capsule (100) by supplying an extraction liquid (e.g. water) into such capsule (100). The extraction module (10,20) has: first and second capsule enclosure parts (10,20) movable relative to each other between a proximate position for enclosing and processing the capsule (100) to prepare a beverage in the module (10,20) and a distant position for inserting the capsule (100) and removing the capsule (100) from the module (10,20); and a capsule removal arrangement (40,50) for assisting removal of such capsule (100) when the first and second parts (10,20) are brought from the proximate to the distant position. At least one of the first and second capsule enclosure parts (10,20) has a corresponding cooperating face (11,21) extending over a corresponding capsule (101). At least one of first and second pushers (40,50) comprises a pusher face (41,51) for pushing the corresponding capsule face (101,102) away from the corresponding cooperating enclosure part face (11,21). The first pusher face (41) and the first cooperating enclosure part face (11) have a surface area ratio of at least 0.1 and/or at most 10; and/or the second pusher face (51) and the second cooperating enclosure part face (21) have a surface area ratio of at least 0.05 and/or at most 0.2.
claims: CLAIMS <div class="indep-clm" num="1"><seg-main>1. A machine (1) for preparing a beverage from an ingredient contained in a capsule (100) by supplying an extraction liquid, e.g. water, into such capsule, comprising </seg-main><seg-clauses><seg-main>a capsule extraction module (10,20) having: </seg-main><seg-clauses>- a first capsule enclosure part (10) and a second capsule enclosure part (20) movable relative to each other between a proximate position for enclosing in an enclosure (30) formed by the parts (10,20) said capsule (100) to process it and prepare a beverage therefrom and a distant position for inserting said capsule (100) into the enclosure (30) and removing said capsule (100) from the enclosure (30); and </seg-clauses><seg-clauses><seg-main>- a capsule removal arrangement (40,50) for assisting removal of such capsule (100) when the first and second parts (10,20) are brought from the proximate to the distant position, the first capsule enclosure part (10) having a first cooperating face (11) configured to extend over a first capsule face (101) and/or the second capsule enclosure part (20) having a second cooperating face (21) configured to extend over a second capsule face (102), optionally said capsule (100) having a lateral face (103) extending between said first and second capsule faces (101,102), e.g. a cylindrical and/or conical lateral face (103), the capsule removal arrangement (40,50) comprising a first pusher (40) with a first pusher face (41) for contacting and pushing said first capsule face (101) away from said first cooperating face (11) and/or a second pusher (50) with a second pusher face (51) for pushing said second capsule face (102) away from the second cooperating face (21), optionally said first cooperating face (11) extending around said first pusher face (41) and/or said second cooperating face (21) extending around said second pusher face (51), characterised in that in the proximate position of the first and second capsule enclosure

title: Extensional viscosity to promote safe swallowing of food boluses
abstract: Nutritional products having improved cohesiveness of food boluses and methods of making and using same are provided. The nutritional products may include nutritional compositions and high molecular weight, water-soluble polymers such that the nutritional products have extensional viscosities that provide improved cohesiveness to the nutritional products and Trouton ratios of at least 6. Methods of administering such nutritional products to patients having impaired swallowing ability and/or dysphagia are also provided.
claims:
1. A method of replacing saliva in an individual in need thereof, the method comprising:
administering an effective amount of a liquid nutritional product to the individual, the liquid nutritional product comprising a nutritional composition and a food-grade polymer,
wherein the food grade polymer is selected from the group consisting of okra gum, konjac mannan, tara gum, fenugreek gum, tamarind gum, cassia gum, cactus mucilage, mallow mucilage, flax seed mucilage, marshmallow mucilage, ribwort mucilage, mullein mucilage, cetraria mucilage, and combinations thereof,
the liquid nutritional product comprises an amount of the food-grade polymer such that the liquid nutritional product has an increased cohesiveness relative to the nutritional composition and has a Trouton ratio of 6 to 15.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the liquid nutritional product has an extensional viscosity greater than 100 mPa s.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the food grade polymer is okra gum and/or cactus mucilage.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the food grade polymer is selected from the group consisting of mallow mucilage, ribwort mucilage, mullein mucilage, and mixtures thereof.

title: Moulded pulp article
claims:
Claims
1. A method of producing a moulded pulp article (1), the method comprising: a) shaping the pulp (2); b) applying a composite phase (3) comprising a polymer and particles (4) of metal, metalloid, or oxides thereof to the pulp; and c) converting the composite phase (3) to a coating (5) comprising the polymer and a continuous barrier (6) at least partially embedded within the polymer, the continuous barrier (6) comprising metal, metalloid, or oxides thereof.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein applying the composite phase (3) comprises applying a thin film comprising the polymer and particles (4) of metal, metalloid, or oxides thereof, the particles (4) being dispersed throughout the polymer, to the surface of the pulp (2).
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein applying the composite phase (3) comprises applying an aqueous dispersion of polymer and particles (4) of metal, metalloid, or oxides thereof to the surface of the pulp (2).
4. The method according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein: i. steps a), b), and c) occur in order; or ii. step b) occurs before step a), which occurs before step c); or iii. wherein steps a) and c) occur simultaneously.
5. The method according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein converting the composite phase (3) to a coating (5) comprises fusing the particles (4) of metal, metalloid, or oxi

title: System comprising a static microdoser for introducing an additive into a container
abstract: The invention relates to a system for introducing an additive into a container (4) partially filled with a main liquid material. It comprises an automated conveyor for transporting the container (4) along a straight horizontal trajectory (T) at a substantially constant container speed (Vc). It further comprises a static microdoser (6) having a nozzle (9) from which at least one jet (8) of an additive issues upon passage of an opening (7) of the container (4). The system is configured to introduce a given mass of additive into the container. The nozzle of the microdoser (6) is inclined relative to a vertical direction that is perpendicular to the trajectory (T). The inclination of the nozzle, the number, the shape and the speed (Vj) of the at least one jet, the mass of additive, and the container speed (Vc) are configured such that the specific kinetic energy of the impact of the at least one jet on the free surface of the main liquid material is less than 3000 mJ/m2.
claims:
1. A system for introducing an additive into a container partially filled with a main liquid material, the system comprising an automated conveyor for transporting the container along a straight horizontal trajectory (T) at a substantially constant container speed (Vc),
the system further comprising a static microdoser having a nozzle from which at least one jet of an additive issues upon passage of an opening of the container in proximity to the nozzle to introduce the additive into said container,
wherein the nozzle of the microdoser is inclined relative to a vertical direction that is perpendicular to the trajectory (T),
wherein the system is configured to introduce a given quantity of additive into the container, said quantity having a mass (m),
the at least one jet hits a free surface of the main liquid material at a relative impact speed (V), over an area A of said free surface of the main liquid material; and
the system is configured, with regard to the inclination of the nozzle, to the number, the shape and the speed (Vj) of the at least one jet, to the mass (m), and to the container speed (Vc), such that
the specific kinetic energy (I) of the impact of the at least one jet on the free surface of the main liquid material, defined by the formula:
I=12⁢m*V2A

title: Thin donut-shaped dry kibble for small adult dogs
abstract: Methods for feeding small adult dogs include dispensing a serving of dry kibble to a small adult dog weighing up to about 11 kg, wherein from about 20% to 100% of individual dry kibble pieces of the serving are donut-shaped having an average inner-hole diameter from about 3 mm to about 8 mm, an average diameter from about 1.3 cm to about 2.0 cm, and an average thickness from about 3 mm to about 6 mm.
claims:
[0062] CLAIMS What Is Claimed Is:
1. A method of feeding a small adult dog, comprising dispensing a serving of dry kibble to a small adult dog weighing up to about 11 kg, wherein from about 20% to 100% of individual dry kibble pieces of the serving are donut-shaped having an average inner-hole diameter from about 3 mm to about 8 mm, an average diameter from about 1.3 cm to about 2.0 cm, and an average thickness from about 3 mm to about 6 mm.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the average diameter is from about 1.3 cm to about 1.6 cm.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the average diameter is from about 1.6 cm to about 2.0 cm.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the individual dry kibble pieces of the serving are about 1.3 cm to about 1.6 cm in average diameter and about 3 mm to about 5 mm in average thickness.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the small adult dog exhibits a reduced feeding speed and increased eating duration on average compared to the feeding speed of the same volume of a comparative solid round dry kibble having a diameter of about 1 cm or less.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein during feeding, the small adult dog exhibits a lower frequency of labored swallowing and increased chewing duration on average compared to when the small adult dog is feeding on the same volume of a comparative solid round dry kibble having a diameter of about 1

title: Beverage pod system with pod ejector
abstract: The invention concerns a device for extracting a beverage ingredient by supplying an extraction liquid such as heated water into in a pod, and comprising: —upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts (1, 2) relatively translatable between an open position for inserting and/or ejecting the pod (3) and a closed position for forming an extraction chamber (5) enclosing the pod during extraction, —an insertion section (4) for inserting the pod in the device, said insertion section being designed to position the pod with the lid facing the downstream piercing arrangement (12), and —a pod holder (11), said pod holder being attached to a peripheral area (13) of the downstream part wherein the central part (131) of the peripheral area of the downstream enclosing part, the downstream plane piercing arrangement (12) and the cage (21) of the upstream enclosing part form the extraction chamber (5), the edge (211) of the opened end of the cage defined by the upstream enclosing part facing/leaning on the central part (131) of the peripheral area of the downstream enclosing part, and wherein the peripheral area (13) of the downstream enclosing part is able to pivot around a bottom transversal axis (YY′) and in the upstream direction.
