title: Human milk oligosaccharides against future excessive fat mass accumulation and related health disorders
abstract: The present invention relates to human milk oligosaccharides against future excessive fat mass accumulation and related health disorders, in particular to nutritional compositions comprising at least one fucosylated oligosaccharide for use in infants or young children, the present invention relates to a fucosylated oligosaccharide having at least one fucose group linked by an alpha 1, 3 bond, at least one fucose group linked by an alpha 1, 4 bond, or a combination thereof, for use in reducing and/or preventing future excessive accumulation of fat mass and/or health disorders associated with excessive accumulation of fat mass, in which the fucosylated oligosaccharide has at least one fucose group linked by an alpha 1, 3 bond, at least one fucose group linked by an alpha 1, 4 bond, or a combination thereof. The invention also relates to a nutritional composition for use in promoting healthy growth.
claims:
1.包含至少一种岩藻糖基化低聚糖的营养组合物在制备用于预防婴儿或幼儿日后的脂肪量过度积聚和/或日后的超重、肥胖以及过早肥胖反弹的非治疗用产品中的用途；其中所述岩藻糖基化低聚糖具有至少一个由α1,3键连接的岩藻糖基团、至少一个由α1,4键连接的岩藻糖基团、或它们的组合，其中所述婴儿或幼儿是携带SNP rs3894326的母亲所生的，其中所述至少一种岩藻糖基化低聚糖选自：3'岩藻糖基化乳糖(3FL)、DFL、LNFP II、LNFPIII、LNFP V、以及它们的组合。
2.根据权利要求1所述的用途，其中所述至少一种岩藻糖基化低聚糖选自：3'岩藻糖基化乳糖、DFL以及它们的组合。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的用途，其中与脂肪量过度积聚相关的健康障碍为过早肥胖反弹。
4.根据权利要求1或2所述的用途，其中所述至少一种岩藻糖基化低聚糖以0.02重量％至10重量％的所述营养组合物的量存在。
5.根据权利要求1或2所述的用途，其中所述至少一种岩藻糖基化低聚糖以0.1重量％至5重量％的所述营养组合物的量存在。
6.根据权利要求1或2所述的用途，其中所述至少一种岩藻糖基化低聚糖以0.2重量％至1.5重量％的所述营养组合物的量存在。
7.根据权利要求1或2所述的用途，其中所述营养组合物还包含至少一种由1,2岩藻糖基化乳糖和/或2岩藻糖基化乳糖组成的岩藻糖基化低聚糖。
8.根据权利要求1或2所述的用途，所述组合物还包含至少一种另外的低聚糖和/或纤维和/或人乳低聚糖的前体，所述低聚糖和/或纤维和/或人乳低聚糖的前体选自由以下项组成的列表：GOS、FOS、XOS、菊粉、聚葡萄糖、唾液酸化低聚糖、唾液酸、岩藻糖、N-乙酰化低聚糖以及它们的任意组合。
9.根据权利要求1或2所述的用途，所述组合物还包含至少一种益生菌，所述益生菌的量为103cfu/g至1012cfu/g所述组合物(干重)。
10.根据权利要求1或2所述的用途，其中所述营养组合物为婴儿配方食品、1段婴儿配方食品、较大或2段婴儿配方食品、婴孩食物、婴儿谷物组合物、成长乳、强化剂或补充剂。
11.根据权利要求1或2中所述的用途，其中所述营养组合物用于促进婴儿或幼儿健康生长。
12.根据权利要求1-12中任一项所定义的营养组合物用于降低婴儿或幼儿日后出现超重的风险的非治疗用途。
13.具有至少一个由α1,3键连接的岩藻糖基团、至少一个由α1,4键连接的岩藻糖基团或它们的组合的岩藻糖基化低聚糖用于制备施用于婴儿或幼儿的营养组合物的用途，所述组合物用于降低和/或避免过早肥胖反弹、日后的脂肪量过度积聚；和/或用于预防日后的超重和肥胖，其中所述婴儿或幼儿是携带SNP rs3894326的母亲所生的婴儿，其中所述至少一种岩藻糖基化低聚糖选自：3'岩藻糖基化乳糖(3FL)、DFL、LNFP II、LNFP III、LNFP V、以及它们的组合。
14.用于预防婴儿或幼儿日后的过早肥胖反弹、脂肪过度积聚和/或与脂肪量过度积聚相关的健康障碍的方法，该方法包括以下步骤：

title: Beverage or foodstuff preparation system
abstract: A system comprising: a container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof, the container including a machine- readable code storing preparation information for use with a preparation process performed by said machine; a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof, the machine including: a code reading system to read the code of the container; a processing unit for processing precursor material of the container, and; electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on preparation information read from the code, and comprising electronic memory to store corresponding preparation information, which is based on one or more prior reads of a corresponding code of a container; wherein the electrical circuitry is configured to: read the preparation information from the code; retrieve the corresponding preparation information from the electronic memory; correct the read preparation information based on the corresponding preparation information, and; control the processing unit based on the corrected preparation information.
claims:
1. A system comprising:
a container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff ora precursor thereof, the container including a machine-readable code storing preparation information for use with a preparation process performed by said machine;
a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof, the machine including: a code reading system to read the code of the container; a processing unit for processing precursor material of the container, and;
electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on preparation information read from the code, and comprising electronic memory to store corresponding preparation information, which is based on one or more prior reads of a corresponding code of a container;
wherein the electrical circuitry is configured to:
read the preparation information from the code;
retrieve the corresponding preparation information from the electronic memory;
correct the read preparation information based on the corresponding preparation information, and;
control the processing unit based on the corrected preparation information.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the electrical circuitry is configured to:
identify the container, and;

title: Improved composite materials for food application
abstract: The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a fibre-based composite material, to the fibre-based composite material thus obtained, and to the use of the fibre-based composite material for preparing an item.
claims:
CLAIMS:
1. A method for manufacturing a fibre-based composite material, comprising the steps of: a) providing substrate comprising cellulosic fibres; b) preparing a mixture comprising one or more alkoxy silane monomers and an acid catalyst in water; c) applying said mixture to said substrate; d) reacting said mixture with the cellulosic fibres of said substrate; e) subjecting said mixture to the sol-gel process; f) drying the treated substrate to obtain the composite material.
2. The method of claim 1 , wherein said cellulosic fibres are selected from the group consisting of cellulose fibres, jut, beggase, hemp, and combinations thereof.
3. The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the one or more alkoxy silane monomers are selected from the group tetraethyl orthosilicate, triethoxy(methyl)alkoxy silane, triethoxy(ethyl)alkoxy silane, riethoxy(propyl)alkoxy silane, butyltriethoxyalkoxy silane, triethoxy(isopentyl)alkoxy silane, (3,3-dimethylbutyl)triethoxyalkoxy silane, triethoxy(vinyl)alkoxy silane, 3-(triethoxysilyl)propan-1 -amine, 3- (triethoxysilyl)propyl methacrylate, tetraethyl orthosilicate, trimethoxy(methyl)alkoxy silane, trimethoxy(ethyl)alkoxy silane, trimethoxy(propyl)alkoxy silane, butyltrimethoxyalkoxy silane, trimethoxy(isopentyl)alkoxy silane, (3,3-dimethylbutyl)trimethoxyalkoxy silane, trimethoxy(vinyl)alkoxy silane, 3-(trimethoxysilyl)propan-1 -amine, and 3- (trimethoxysilyl)propyl methacrylate.
4. The method of any of claims 1 to 3, wherein alkoxy silane-to-cellulose

title: Beverage or food preparation system
abstract: A container for use with a beverage or food preparation machine, the container comprising: a storage portion for containing a precursor material; a code storing preparation information used by the machine to process the precursor material, the code being readable by a code reading system of the machine, the code reading system comprising: an illumination system for projecting emitted light to the code; and a camera system for obtaining a digital image of the code; and a support layer supporting a code, the support layer being arranged for specular reflection of emitted light from the lighting system, the code comprising an absorbing layer configured to absorb the emitted light and a reflecting layer configured to diffuse-reflect the emitted light, the reflecting layer being arranged to reflect the emitted light before the emitted light is transmitted to the support layer.
claims:
1.一种用于与饮料或食品制备机器一起使用的容器，所述容器包括：
储存部分，所述储存部分用于容纳前体材料；
代码，所述代码用于存储由所述机器用来处理所述前体材料的制备信息，所述代码被配置为能够由所述机器的代码读取系统读取，所述代码读取系统包括照明系统，所述照明系统用于将发射光投射到所述代码；和
支撑层，所述支撑层用于支撑所述代码，所述支撑层被布置用于来自所述照明系统的所述发射光的镜面反射，使得从所述支撑层反射的所述发射光的至少50％或70％或80％被镜面反射，
所述代码包括被配置为吸收所述发射光的吸收层和被配置为漫反射所述发射光的反射层，所述反射层被布置成在所述发射光被透射到所述支撑层之前反射所述发射光。
2.根据权利要求1所述的容器，其中：
所述反射层是连续的；
所述反射层连接到所述支撑层以邻接所述支撑层；并且
所述支撑层在由横向方向和纵向方向限定的平面中延伸，并且在深度方向上具有贯穿厚度，并且其中，当在所述平面中观察时所述反射层与整个所述支撑层重叠。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的容器，其中，所述支撑层在由横向方向和纵向方向限定的平面中延伸，并且在深度方向上具有贯穿厚度，所述深度方向从外表面延伸；并且
所述吸收层在所述深度方向上布置在所述反射层与所述外表面之间，使得所述吸收层相对于所述反射层最接近所述外表面；并且
所述反射层在所述深度方向上布置在所述支撑层与所述外表面之间。
4.根据权利要求3所述的容器，其中，所述吸收层被布置成当在所述平面中观察时与整个所述反射层重叠。
5.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中，所述支撑层被配置为提供包括所述支撑层、所述反射层和所述吸收层的层压件的拉伸强度的至少60％或80％或90％。
6.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中：

title: Dispensing system
abstract: The invention relates to a dispensing system (100, 200, 300, 400, 500) for dispensing a bulk material (1), the dispensing system comprising: a flexible or semi-flexible bag (10) comprising: a compartment (11) for storing the bulk material (1); a distribution section (12); and a hanging part (13) by means of which the bag (10) can be hung in such a way that the bulk material (1) can flow out of the bag (10) from the compartment (11) via the dispensing section (12) under the action of gravity; a dispensing mechanism (110, 210, 310, 410, 510) attached to the bag (10), where the dispensing mechanism (110, 210, 310, 410, 510) comprises two components (111, 112; 211, 212; 311, 312; 311, 312; 411, 412; 411, 412; 511, 512) which are manually movable relative to each other so as to be moved between a closed position in which the dispensing section (12) is dispensed by the two parts (111, 112; 211, 212; 311, 312; 311, 312; 411, 412; 411, 412; 511, 512) in order to prevent the bulk material (1) from flowing out of the bag (10) via the dispensing section (12); in the open position, the dispensing section (12) is moved by the two parts (111, 112; 211, 212; 311, 312; 311, 312; 411, 412; 411, 412; 511, 512) is deployed or allowed to be deployed to form a dispensing channel (12.4) such that the bulk material (1) can flow out of the bag (10) from the compartment (11) via the dispensing section (12) under gravity; and a resilient element (120, 220, 320, 420, 520) arranged to force the two components (111, 112; 211, 212; 311, 312; 311, 312; 411, 412; 411, 412; 511, 512) is oriented towards the closed position.

title: Fermented ready to drink hemp beverage
abstract: The present invention relates to a ready to drink beverage composition comprising fermented hemp or fermented hemp extract. A further aspect of the invention is a method of preparing a ready to drink beverage composition.
claims:
1. A beverage composition comprising fermented hemp or fermented hemp extract wherein the weight ratio of the sum of 3-methylbutyl acetate and 3-methylbutanol to 3-methylbutanal is greater than 2000 and the beverage composition is a ready to drink beverage.
2. The beverage composition of claim 1 wherein the weight ratio of the sum of 2-methylbutyl acetate and 2-methylbutanol to 2-methylbutanal is greater than 2000.
3. The beverage composition of claim 1 wherein the weight ratio of the sum of 3-methylbutyl acetate, 2-methylbutyl acetate, isobutyl acetate, 2-phenylethyl acetate and 2-phenylethanol to 2,3-butanedione is greater than 50.
4. The beverage composition of claim 1 having an ethanol content below 1.2 wt %.
5. A method of preparing a beverage composition comprising;
a. steeping hemp in water to form an aqueous hemp extract and steeped hemp;
b fermenting the aqueous hemp extract in the presence or absence of the steeped hemp; and
wherein the fermentation is performed by yeast comprising Pichia yeast and the beverage composition is a ready to drink beverage.
6. The method of claim 5 wherein the Pichia yeast is Pichia kluyveri.

abstract: Abstract Use of a human milk oligosaccharide, or a nutritional composition comprising a human milk oligosaccharide, to enhance executive function in a subject. 2. Use of a human milk oligosaccharide or a nutritional composition comprising a human milk oligosaccharide according to claim 1 wherein, the human milk oligosaccharide is selected from the group consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2'FL), diFL, LNT, LNnT, a sialyllactose and any combination of the foregoing.

title: Blood and milk derived mirnas from a biological sample as indicators of stress and animal welfare
abstract: The present invention relates miRNA biomarkers and in particular to a combination of miRNA biomarkers, e.g. exosome-derived microRNA, as indicators of welfare in bovines. In particular, the present invention relates to the identification of heat stress in bovines allowing to propose management actions to improve productive animal welfare at the individual or the herd levels.
claims:
Claims
1. A method of determining at least one welfare parameter of at least one head of cattle, the method comprising i. determining in a biological sample the level of at least one miRNA that regulates the cell cycle, wherein the miRNA is selected from SEQ ID NOs: 1 , 2 or 3 or a functional variant thereof, wherein the functional variant has at least 60% overall sequence identity to SEQ ID NO:1 , 2 and 3 respectively; and ii. comparing the level of the at least one miRNA to a reference level; wherein where the level of the at least one miRNA is above said reference level the welfare of the at least one head of cattle is or has been compromised; and wherein said biological sample is blood and/or milk.
2. A method of determining at least one welfare parameter of at least one head of cattle, the method comprising i. determining in a biological sample the level of a miRNA as defined in SEQ ID NO: 1 , a miRNA as defined in SEQ ID NO: 2 and a miRNA as defined in SEQ ID NO: 3 or functional variants thereof, wherein the functional variant has at least 60% overall sequence identity to SEQ ID NO: 1 , 2 and 3 respectively; and ii. comparing the level of each of the miRNAs to a reference level; wherein where the level of each miRNA is above said reference level the welfare of the at least one head of cattle is or has been compromised.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein said biological sample is blood and/or milk.
4. A method for improving at least one welfare parameter of at least one head of cattle, the method comprising: i. determining in a first biological sample from at least one head of cattle th

title: Method for reducing emissions from manure
abstract: The present invention relates to a method for reducing emissions from manure and improving plant growth, the method comprising adding 1.7 - 3.5 g of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) per 1 kg manure and adding 10 - 60 g of biochar per 1 kg manure to manure. Furthermore, the invention relates to a manure additive for reducing emissions from manure and improving plant growth comprising H2O2 and biochar. Furthermore, the invention relates to an organic fertilizer comprising manure and the manure additive.
claims:
Claims
1. Method for reducing emissions from manure and improving plant growth, the method comprising adding 1.7 - 3.5 g of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) per 1 kg manure and adding 10 - 60 g of biochar per 1 kg manure to manure.
2. Method according to claim 1, wherein the manure is stored with hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) and biochar, or the manure with hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) and biochar is distributed onto fields, preferably by spray irrigation, surface spreading, injection, or broadcasting.
3. Method according to any of the preceding claims, wherein the hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) and/or the biochar limit(s) the generation of gaseous emissions from the manure including greenhouse gases (CO2, CH4, N2O) and odorous compounds (H2S) under strict anaerobic or/and aerobic conditions as well as atmospheric conditions.
4. Method according to any of the preceding claims, wherein 1.7 - 2.8 g of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) per 1 kg manure and/or 20 - 50 g of biochar per 1 kg manure is/are added to the manure.
5. Method according to any of the preceding claims, wherein calcium cyanamide
(CaCIS ) is added to the manure, preferably in an amount of 0.17 - 0.3 g calcium cyanamide (CaCIS ) per 1 kg of manure.
6. Method according to any of the preceding claims, wherein the hydrogen perox

title: Liquid creamer
abstract: The present invention relates to creamers for food products such as coffee and tea. In particular, the invention relates to a liquid creamer comprising casein based protein, phospholipids, gellan gum, bicarbonate, citrate and oil. Further aspects of the invention are a beverage comprising a liquid creamer and a process for preparing a liquid creamer.
claims:
1. A liquid creamer comprising casein-based protein, phospholipids, gellan gum, bicarbonate, citrate and oil, wherein:
the casein-based protein is present at a level between 0.45 and 1.55 %,
the phospholipids are present at a level between 0.1 and 0.7 %,
the gellan gum is present at a level between 0.02 and 0.04%, wherein the gellan gum is a high acyl gellan gum,
the bicarbonate is present at a level between 0.07 and 0.15 %,
the citrate is present at a level between 0.12 and 0.24 %, and
the oil is present at a level between 6 and 16 %,
all percentages being as a weight percentage of the liquid creamer,
wherein the liquid creamer has a shelf life of at least 6 months at 4°C, 20°C or 30 °C.
2. The liquid creamer according to claim 1 wherein the casein-based protein is selected from the group consisting of caseinates, micellar casein and combinations of these.
3. The liquid creamer according to claim 1 or 2, which contains less than 0.001 wt.% monoacylglycerols, diacylglycerols and diacetylated tartaric acid esters of monoglycerides.
4. The liquid creamer according to any one of claims 1 to 3, which contains less than 0.001 wt.% phosphate salts.
5. The liquid creamer

title: Dosing device
abstract: The present invention relates to a dosing device (100) that is integrally made of molded pulp fiber. The dosing device (100) comprises a container portion (200) for receiving and retaining a dosage material having an opening (250) at an upper side (US) of the dosing device (100) to access the dosage material. The dosing device (100) comprises a handle portion (300) for manually moving the container portion (200) in a dosing process. The handle portion (300) is connected to an outer surface (211) of the container body (210) by a connecting portion (350) of the handle portion (300). A rim portion (252) of the container portion (200), which delimits the opening (250), and the handle portion (300) extend in a common plane (CP) and define a circumferential edge (101) of the dosing device (101). The dosing device (100) comprises a ribbing portion (400), which extends from the circumferential edge (101) at least at the handle portion (300) to a lower side of the dosing device (100), for dissipating mechanical stresses arising in the dosing process. The invention relates also to a method for manufacturing the dosing device (100) and a use of the dosing device (100) for dosing a dosage material.
claims:
1. Dosing device (100) integrally made of molded pulp fiber comprising - a container portion (200) having a defined volume (255) for receiving and retaining a dosage material, the container portion (200) having a container body (210) delimiting the defined volume (255), the container body (210) having a rim portion (252) circumferentially delimiting an opening (250) at an upper side (US) of the dosing device (100) to access the defined volume (255); - a handle portion (300) for manually moving the container portion (200) relatively to the dosage material in a dosing process; wherein the handle portion (300) is connected to an outer surface (211) of the container body (210) by a connecting portion (350) of the handle portion (300) and extends from the container body (210) along a longitudinal axis (LA); wherein the rim portion (252) and the handle portion (300) extend in a common plane (CP) and define a circumferential edge (101) of the dosing device (100) extending in the common plane (CP); and - a ribbing portion (400), which extends from the circumferential edge (101) at least at the handle portion (300) to a lower side of the dosing device (100) such that mechanical stresses acting on the container body (210) in the dosing process are dissipated by the handle portion (300).
2. Dosing device (100) according to claim 1, wherein the ribbing portion (400) extends from the circumferential edge (101) at least at the handle portion (300) at opposite sides of the longitudinal axis (LA), and wherein preferably the ribbing portion (400) extends from the circumferential edge (101) at the rim portion (252) and/or preferably from the entire circumferential edge (101) of the dosing device (100), more preferred extends along the circumferential edge (101) in a contin

title: Human milk fortifier composition
abstract: The present invention relates to a preterm human milk fortifier composition, more specifically to a preterm milk fortifier composition providing 2'-FL and /or LNFP-I in amounts that are missing in human milk of women who gave birth to a preterm infant. In particular the present invention relates to a fortifier composition designed for infants as a supplement to preterm human breast milk at the time the infant leaves the hospital (discharge) and after. The invention furthermore relates to the use of said preterm human milk fortifier composition.
claims:
1. A human milk fortifier composition comprising at least one ingredient selected in the group consisting of: 2'-fucosyllactose (2'-FL) and lacto-N-fucosylpentaose-I 5 (LNFP-I) and a mixture thereof; which further comprises - 6'-galactosyllactose (GSLT6); - Lacto-N-neotetraose (LnNT); - Lacto-N-tetraose (LNT); 10 - 6'-sialyllactose (6'SL) or 6'-sialyllactose sodium salt; and - Sialyllactose-N-tetraose-c (SLTNTC); and/or - alpha-lactalbumin; - casein; and 15 - lactoferrin; wherein the human milk fortifier is not human milk.
2. The human milk fortifier composition according to claim 1 which further comprises at least one ingredient selected in the group consisting of: 20 - ingredients providing copper, for example cupric carbonate, cupric citrate, cupric gluconate, cupric sulphate, cupric lysine complex or mixtures thereof; - ingredients providing selenium, for example sodium selenite, sodium selenate,sodium hydrogen selenite or mixtures thereof; - ingredients providing zinc, for example zinc acetate, zinc chloride, zinc citrate, 25 zinc gluconate, zinc lactate, zinc oxide, zinc sulphate, zinc carbonate or mixtures thereof; - ingredients providing alpha-tocopherol, for exam

title: Food contaminant assessment
abstract: The invention concerns a computer-implemented method for predicting risks associated with the presence of contaminants in a food. The method can comprise receiving a query defining a food, a geography and a contaminant. The method can then determine a risk that the food contains the contaminant in relation to the geography. The method also comprises providing a response to the query comprising one or more recommended management actions in relation to the determined risk.
claims:
1. A computer-implemented method for predicting and managing risks associated with the presence of contaminants in a food or feed product, the method comprising:
providing at least one ingredient present in said food or feed product from a user query, and at least one marketing country for the product,
obtaining a geographic origin for said at least one ingredient,
calculating a risk score that the food or feed contains a contaminant in relation to said ingredient present in the food or feed product and their respective geographical origin, said calculation being based on the combination of at least one query data selected from the group consisting of: type of contaminant, type of food or feed, type of geography, with at least one input data selected within the list of contaminant intrinsic relevance, contaminant likelihood to be used or to be found in the food environment, contaminant maximum residue level, contaminant maximum limits status, analytical data, and contaminant derived properties,
and
providing a response to the query comprising one or more specified management actions in relation to the determined risk score, as follows:
if the score corresponds to no risk identified, the management action corresponds to an authorization to integrate the ingredient in the food or feed product, or
if the score corresponds to a risk identified that requires the ingredient not to be used, the management action corresponds to a recommendation to take at least one action within the following choices:

title: Low sugar-based food compositions with roasted ingredient
abstract: The present invention relates to a low sugar food composition with organoleptic properties for infants and young children comprising a plant-based roasted ingredient. The said food composition has low level of process contaminants and possess desired colour and aroma markers thus imparting desired organoleptic properties. The methods for preparing such compositions are disclosed too.
claims:
1. A low sugar food composition with organoleptic properties for infants and young children comprising a plant-based roasted ingredient, wherein the total sugars in the composition is less than 5 g/100 g; wherein said composition has a* colour space parameter comprising a a*value above 0; and wherein the roasted ingredient is obtainable by roasting to an extent that when said roasted ingredient is added to the food composition, the said food composition comprises sum of pyrazines containing 2-ethyl-6-methylpyrazine, 2-ethyl-5-methylpyrazine, 2,3,5-trimethylpyrazine, 2-ethyl-3-methylpyrazine, 2-ethyl-3,6-dimethylpyrazine and 2-ethyl-3,5-dimethylpyrazine in amount greater than 20 parts per billion (ppb).
2. The composition of claim 1 wherein total amount of sugars refers to mono-saccharides, except naturally occurring lactose from dairy ingredients.
3. The composition of claim 1 wherein the amount of furan is below 50 ppb.
4. The composition of claim 1 wherein the amount of acrylamide is below 60 ppb.
5. The composition of claim 1 wherein the total amount of Strecker aldehydes containing 3-methylbutanal, 2-methylbutanal, methional and phenylacetaldehyde is greater than 150 ppb.
6. The composition of claim 1 wherein the amount of 4-hydroxy-2,5-dimethyl-3 (2H)-furanone (HDMF) is greater than 200 ppb.
7. The composition of claim 1 wh

title: Maceration composition and method for preparing same
abstract: The invention concerns a method for preparing a maceration composition made from at least one component selected from the group comprising fruits, vegetables, plants and spices, said method comprising the following steps: •Macerating the component by dipping it into water in order to have the equivalent of 15 to 80 g of component for 1 L of maceration composition, at a temperature of 15° C. to 25° C. for a period of 30 to 120 minutes, thus obtaining a solid material in a maceration; •Separating the maceration from the solid material: •Acidifying the maceration and/or the water to obtain a maceration composition having a pH between 3.1 and 3.5. The invention also relates to a maceration composition obtainable according to this method, wherein said maceration comprises between 20 and 40 g/L of sugar. The invention eventually relates to a bottled beverage comprising at least one maceration composition according to the invention.
claims:
1. A method for preparing a maceration composition made from at least one component selected from the group consisting of apple, banana, pear, kiwi, passion fruit, mango, pomegranate, papaya, peach, apricot, watermelon, melon, strawberry, blackcurrant, currant, gooseberry, raspberry, blueberry, blackberry, cranberry, cherry, grape, cucumber, vegetables, plants and spices, the method comprising:
macerating the at least one component by dipping the at least one component into water in order to have the equivalent of 15 to 80 g of the at least one component for 1 L of the maceration composition, at a temperature of 15° C. to 25° C., for a period of 30 to 120 minutes, thus obtaining a solid material in a maceration;
separating the maceration from the solid material; and
acidifying the maceration and/or the water to obtain the maceration composition, the maceration composition having a pH between 3.1 and 3.5.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the maceration composition comprises an equivalent of 25 to 50 g of the at least one component for 1 L of the maceration composition.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the separating comprises at least one of a decanting step, a clarifying step, and a filtering step.
4. The method according to claim 1, further comprising mixing the maceration composition with sugar.
5. The me

title: Compositions comprising human milk oligosaccharides for use in a subject to support brain development and/or cognitive development
abstract: The invention provides a nutritional composition comprising at least one lacto-N- fucopentaose, especially lacto-N-fucopentaose-I (LNFP-I) or a combination of lacto-N-fucopentaose-I (LNFP-I), lacto-N-fucopentaose-II (LNFP-II) and lacto-N-fucopentaose-III (LNFP-III), for use in improving brain development and/or cognitive development in a subject. A nutritional composition comprising at least one lacto-N-fucopentaose, especially lacto-N-fucopentaose-I (LNFP-I) or a combination of lacto-N-fucopentaose-I (LNFP-I), lacto-N-fucopentaose-II (LNFP-II) and lacto-N-fucopentaose-III (LNFP-III), and Bifidobacterium kashiwanohense is also provided.
claims:
1. A nutritional composition comprising at least one lacto-N-fucopentaose (LNFP) for use in improving brain development and/or cognitive development in a subject.
2. The nutritional composition for use according to claim 1, wherein the improvement in brain development and/or cognitive development comprises or consists of an improvement in the development of auditory brain networks, sensorimotor brain networks, default mode brain networks, language, fine motor skills, or combinations thereof.
3. The nutritional composition for use according to claim 2, wherein the improvement in language development comprises or consists of an improvement in receptive language and/or expressive language based on a score of Mullen sub-scale or of the Bayley sub-scale.
4. The nutritional composition for use according to claim 2 or claim 3, wherein the improvement in language development comprises or consists of an improvement in expressive language based on a score of Mullen sub-scale or of the Bayley sub-scale.
5. The nutritional composition for use according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the improvement in brain development and/or cognitive development comprises or consists of an improvement in expressive language based on a score of Mullen sub-scale or of the Bayley sub-scale.
6. The nutritional composition for use according to claim 5, wherein the nutritional composition is for use in improving brain development and/or cognitive develo

title: Compositions and methods using a nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide (NAD<sup>+</sup>) precursor and at least one ketone or ketone precursor
abstract: A composition can treat or prevent at least one physical state selected from the group consisting of oxidative stress, a condition associated with oxidative stress, a reduced level of glutathione, and a condition associated with a reduced level of glutathione, in particular neurodegenerative disease, depression, anxiety, decreased/low motivation, impaired cognitive function, mild cognitive impairment. The composition contains an effective amount of a combination of a Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide (NAD<sup>+</sup>) precursor and at least one ketone or ketone precursor. The composition can be an enterally administered composition such as an orally administered food product or food supplement.
claims:
1. A method of (1) reducing risk, incidence and/or severity of or (2) mitigating deterioration of brain structure and function associated with the onset of Alzheimer's Disease (AD) in an individual in need thereof, the method comprising administering to the individual an effective amount of a composition consisting essentially of Tryptophan and medium chain triglycerides (MCTs).
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the composition is administered enterally.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the composition is selected from the group consisting of a food product, a food supplement, an oral nutritional supplements (ONS), a medical food, and combinations thereof.
4. The method according to claim 1, wherein at least a portion of the Tryptophan is administered in the same composition as at least a portion of the MCTs.

title: Sustained release melatonin compositions
abstract: The present invention relates to a composition comprising melatonin encapsulated within a calcium alginate hydrogel. It further provides an orally administrable dosage form comprising such a composition held within a gel, wherein the gel is formed using starch as a gelling agent. Processes to produce these compositions, as well as their use in therapy, are also disclosed.
claims:
1. An orally administrable dosage form comprising a composition comprising melatonin encapsulated within a calcium alginate hydrogel, wherein the composition is held within a gel, wherein the gel is formed using starch as a gelling agent, and wherein the weight ratio of the melatonin to the calcium alginate hydrogel is from 5:95 to 15:85,
the dosage form further comprising additional melatonin which is not encapsulated within the calcium alginate hydrogel.
2. The dosage form according to claim 1, comprising from 1 to 3 wt % of the composition based on total weight of the dosage form.
3. The dosage form according to claim 1, comprising from 0.01 to 0.03 wt % of the additional melatonin which is not encapsulated within the calcium alginate hydrogel, based on total weight of the dosage form.
4. The dosage form according to claim 1, wherein the starch in the gelling agent comprises potato starch.
5. The dosage form according to claim 1, comprising from 7 to 17 wt % of the starch based on total weight of the dosage form.
6. The dosage form according to claim 1, comprising from 8 to 18 wt % water based on total weight of the dosage form.
7. The dosage form according to claim 1, further comprising

title: Aerated confectionery
abstract: The invention relates to a water-based aerated confectionery product and methods of making the same. In particular, the invention relates to stable acidic aqueous mousses comprising aggregated plant-derived protein, such as hydrolysed pea protein, and sugar. In one aspect, the invention provides a plan-based, water-based acrated confectionery having a pHI less than 5.5 and a water activity less than 0.67, wherein the aerated confectionery comprises 30 wt % to 90 wt % sugar and between 1 wt % to 8 wt % aggregated protein. The aggregated plant-derived protein stabilises the water-based aerated confectionery.
claims:
1. A water-based aerated confectionery, wherein the water-based aerated confectionery: has a pH less than 5.5; and has a water activity less than 0.67; and comprises 30 wt % to 90 wt % sugar; comprises between 1 wt % to 8 wt % plant-based protein, and the protein stabilises the water-based aerated confectionery.
2. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, wherein the confectionery is a mousse or a foam.
3. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, wherein the confectionery has a pH between 2 and 5.
4. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, wherein the protein is aggregated.
5. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, wherein the protein is hydrolysed protein.
6. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, wherein the protein is present in an amount at least 2 wt % of the aerated confectionery.
7. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, comprising sugar at between 40 wt % and 90 wt %, wherein the sugar comprises or consists of: at least two different sugars; or

title: Plant-based composition comprising heat stable canola protein
abstract: The present invention relates to the field of plant-based compositions comprising canola protein isolate, a calcium salt, a vegetable oil and water. The invention also relates to a method for producing said plant-based compositions.
claims:
Claims
1 . A plant-based composition comprising at least one canola protein isolate (CPI), at least one calcium salt, at least one vegetable oil and water, wherein the calcium salt is selected in the group consisting of calcium chloride, calcium lactate, calcium citrate, calcium gluconate, calcium sulphate, and mixtures thereof.
2. Plant-based composition according to claim 1, wherein the composition has a pH below 7, preferably comprised between 4 and 6.5, more preferably between 5 and 6.5.
3. Plant-based composition according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the composition has a viscosity ranging from 10 to 50 cP measured at 25 °C at shear rate 100 s-1, preferably from 15 to 30 cP.
4. Plant-based composition according to any of claims 1 to 3, wherein the composition comprises from 0.5 to 10 wt% of canola protein isolate, preferably from 1 .5 to 5 wt%, more preferably from 2 to 4 wt%.
5. Plant-based composition according to any of claims 1 to 4, wherein the composition comprises from 1.5 to 3 wt% of vegetable oil, preferably from 1 to 3.5 wt%, more preferably from 0.5 to 5 wt%.
6. Plant-based composition according to any of claims 1 to 5, wherein the composition comprises canola isolate protein and vegetable oil in a weight ratio comprised between 1 :1 and 1.5:1, preferably between 2:1 and 0.5:1 .

title: Polymer, packaging material and process for preparing polymer
abstract: A polymer comprising repeating units comprising in the backbone an aromatic cyclic moiety, wherein a helical polymer structure is provided by pi-pi interactions between aromatic cyclic moieties, packaging comprising the polymer and process for preparing the polymer and the packaging. The polymer confers moisture and gas barrier properties on the packaging.
claims:
Claims
1. A polymer comprising repeating units comprising in the backbone an aromatic cyclic moiety, wherein a helical polymer structure is provided by pi-pi interactions between aromatic cyclic moieties.
2. A polymer according to claim 1, wherein the aromatic moiety is selected from the group consisting of benzene, naphthalene, anthracene, pyridine, quinoline, isoquinoline, pyrazine, quinoxaline, acridine, pyrimidine, quinazoline, pyridazine, cinnoline, and phthalazine.
3. A polymer according to claim 1 or claim 2, wherein repeating units contain two aromatic moieties in the backbone independently selected from the group consisting of benzene, naphthalene, anthracene, pyridine, quinoline, isoquinoline, pyrazine, quinoxaline, acridine, pyrimidine, quinazoline, pyridazine, cinnoline, and phthalazine.
4. A polymer according to any of claims 1 to 3, comprising repeating units of formula (I)
wherein
0, 1 or 2 of X1, X2, X3and X4are N,
2, 3 or 4 of X1, X2, X3and X4are CR1,
0, 1 or 2 of Y1, Y2, Y3, Y4, Y5and Y6are N,

title: Bulk dosing unit and related system
abstract: The invention concerns a bulk dosing unit (100; 200) of bulk products contained in a bulk product container (10), wherein a sliding assembly (122) of the bulk dosing unit (100; 200) is provided for sliding a dosing element (121) between a closed position, in which a bulk product is not dispensed, and a maximum dispensing position, in which a bulk product can be dispensed at the maximum flow rate, and vice versa, wherein in the closed position an opening portion (121'') of the dosing element (121) is able to be arranged spaced away from a container aperture (11) of a bulk product container and simultaneously a device engagement portion (123'') is able to arrange an aperture cover (12) of a bulk product container (10) to completely cover a container aperture (11) of a bulk product container (10) and in the maximum dispensing position the opening portion (121'') of the dosing element (121) is able to be superimposed to a container aperture (11) of a bulk product container (10) and simultaneously the device engagement portion (123') is able to arrange an aperture cover (12) of a bulk product container (10) to substantially completely uncover a container aperture (11) of a bulk product container (10), allowing the dosing of a bulk product to be dispensed according to the position of the dosing element (121) in between the closed position and the maximum dispensing position.
claims:
CLAIMS
<div class="indep-clm" num="1"><seg-main>1. A bulk dosing unit (100; 200) of bulk products contained in a bulk product container (10), said bulk dosing unit (100; 200) comprising: </seg-main><seg-clauses>a containment housing (110) which defines a containment volume for receiving a bulk product container (10); a dispensing opening (112) defined on said containment housing (110) for dispensing a bulk product; a feeding assembly (130) arranged at least partly inside said containment housing (110) and able to move a bulk product in a bulk product container (10) toward said dispensing opening (112); a dosing device (120) able to be actuated for dispensing and dosing a bulk product; characterized in that said dosing device (120) comprises a dosing element (121) and a sliding assembly (122) for sliding said dosing element (121) at said dispensing opening (112) between a closed position, in which a bulk product is not dispensed, and a maximum dispensing position, in which a bulk product can be dispensed at the maximum flow rate, and vice versa, wherein said dosing device (120) comprises one or more device engagement portions (123’, 123”), arranged toward said containment volume and able to engage an aperture cover (12) of a bulk product container (10), wherein said dosing element (121) has at least an opening portion (121”), and wherein in said closed position said opening portion (121”) is able to be arranged spaced away from a container aperture (11) of a bulk product container (10) and simultaneously said device engagement portion (123”) is able to arrange an aperture cover (12) of a bulk product container (10) in a fully closed position, to completely cover a container aperture (11) of a bulk product container (10), and in said maximum dispensing position said opening portion (121”) is able to be superimposed to a container aperture (11) of a bulk product container (10) and simultaneously said device engagement portion (123’) is able to arrange an aperture cover

title: Nicotinamide riboside trioleates chloride, compositions containing this compound, and methods of making and using this compound
abstract: Nicotinamide riboside trioleates chloride (NRTOC1) is a novel hydrophobic derivative of nicotinamide riboside chloride. It can be used in a composition formulated for oral administration, preferably a beverage, such as a Ready-to-Drink (RTD) beverage scaled in a container or a powder formulated for reconstitution in a diluent to form a reconstituted beverage.
claims:
1. (canceled)
2. A composition comprising nicotinamide riboside trioleates chloride (NRTOCl).
3. The composition of claim 2, wherein the composition is formulated for oral administration.
4-6. (canceled)
7. A method of promoting an increase of intracellular levels of nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide (NAD+) in cells and tissues, the method comprising administering nicotinamide riboside trioleates chloride (NRTOCl) to an individual.
8. A method of decreasing at least one of DNA damage or mitochondria damage and/or treating or preventing at least one condition selected from the group consisting of (a) a neurodegenerative condition; (b) overweight or obesity; (c) a cardiovascular disease such as heart disease; (d) one or more of diabetes, hyperinsulinemia, an insulin resistance disorder, or insulin insensitivity; (d) muscle degeneration; (e) a disease or disorder associated with aging; (f) a viral infection such as HIV, hepatitis B, SARS-COV-2 or COVID-19; (g) stress; (h) a blood clotting disorder; (i) inflammation; (j) cancer; (k) an eye disorder; and (1) flushing, the method comprising administering nicotinamide riboside trioleates chloride (NRTOCl) to a subject in need thereof or at risk thereof.
9-10. (canc

title: Determining medical staffing for oral immunotherapy
abstract: Described herein are systems and methods for determining medical staffing requirements for administering OIT to patients. Specifically, the methods and systems disclosed herein can determine the time required by a medical staff at a given treatment location to devote to administering OIT to patients as well as the number of patients undergoing OIT over a selected time period. The methods and systems disclosed herein can further provide the time required by providers and clinical staff at a given treatment location to devote to administering OIT to patients.

title: Compositions and methods for treating muscle decline associated with kidney disease or dysfunction
abstract: The compositions comprise at least two ingredients selected from the group consisting of fish oil, L-arginine, vitamin E, vitamin C, vitamin B3, vitamin B5, vitamin B6, vitamin B1, vitamin B2, folic acid, biotin, vitamin B12, and are formulated for the prevention and/or treatment of a disease or condition associated with muscle decline in a subject in need thereof. Preferably, the subject in need is an individual at risk of or having renal failure, renal dysfunction or/and nephropathy, such as chronic nephropathy, protein energy consumption, end-stage nephropathy, renal failure due to hospitalization in an intensive care unit, acute kidney injury, and the muscle decline is selected from the group consisting of muscle depletion, muscle loss due to renal failure or dysfunction, muscle decline associated with chronic kidney disease, muscle loss due to hospitalization in intensive care units during renal failure, metabolic acidosis during chronic kidney disease, protein energy depletion, or a combination thereof. The method enables the prevention and/or treatment of at least one outcome of a disease or condition associated with muscle decline in a subject at risk of or having renal failure, renal dysfunction or/and kidney disease. The composition and the method can be used to improve the level of at least one amino acid.
claims:
1.用于预防和/或治疗有需要的受试者的与肌肉衰退相关联的疾病或病症的营养组合物，所述营养组合物包含至少两种选自由以下项组成的组的成分：
鱼油，
L-精氨酸，
维生素E，
维生素C，
维生素B3，
维生素B5，
维生素B6，
维生素B1，
维生素B2，
叶酸，
生物素，
维生素B12。
2.根据权利要求1所述的营养组合物，其中所述营养组合物包含至少两种选自由以下项组成的组的成分：
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约100mg至约5000mg的鱼油，
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约100mg至约50000mg的L-精氨酸，
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约1mg至约80000mg的维生素E，
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约0.1mg至约2000mg的维生素C，
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约0.2mg至约10mg的维生素B3，
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约0.08mg至约500mg的维生素B5，
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约0.03mg至约50mg的维生素B6，
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约0.03mg至约5mg的维生素B1，
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约0.03mg至约5mg的维生素B2，
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约0.01mg至约5mg的叶酸，
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约0.01mg至约0.1mg的生物素，
每日量范围为每kg所述受试者的体重约0.001mg至约5mg的维生素B12。
3.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的营养组合物，其中所述受试者是处于肾衰竭、肾功能障碍或/和肾病的风险或患有肾衰竭、肾功能障碍或/和肾病的个体。
4.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的营养组合物，其中所述个体是人、家畜或宠物。
5.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的营养组合物，其中所

title: Method for producing packages from recoverable material
abstract: The invention relates to a method for producing a package (100) for encapsulating a substance (S). A flat sheet (110) made of recyclable material and having two opposing side edge sections (111, 112) is provided and formed into a tube (130) by folding the flat sheet (110) such that the two side edge sections (111, 112) overlap one another at an overlap section (139). The tube (130) is heat sealed along the overlap section (139) to form a longitudinal seal joint (131) and is heat sealed across the longitudinal seal joint (131) to close the tube (130) with a first transverse seal joint (134) at a first tube end (132). The tube (130) is filled with the substance (S) and is heat sealed across the longitudinal sealing joint (131) to close the tube (130) at a second tube end (133) with a second transverse sealing joint (135). A heat sealable sealing strip (700) is provided. A first segment (701) and a second segment (702) of the sealing strip (700) are respectively arranged at a first triple point section and a second triple point section (171, 172) where the longitudinal sealing joint (131) and the corresponding transverse sealing joint (134, 135) intersect. The segments (701, 702) of the sealing strip (700) seal the respective triple point sections (171, 172) when thermally sealing the respective pipe ends (132, 133) to form the respective transverse seal joints (134, 135). The invention also relates to a package (100) encapsulating a substance (S) and a machine (500) for producing the package (100).
claims:
1.一种用于生产用于包封物质(S)的可回收包装(100)的方法，所述方法包括：
●提供由可回收材料制成并具有两个相对的侧边缘区段(111,112)的平片(110)，
●通过折叠所述平片(110)将所述平片(110)形成为管(130)，使得所述两个侧边缘区段(111,112)在重叠区段(139)处至少部分彼此重叠，
●沿所述重叠区段(139)热密封所述管(130)以形成纵向密封接头(131)，
●跨所述纵向密封接头(131)热密封所述管(130)，以在第一管端部(132)处用第一横向密封接头(134)封闭所述管(130)，●用待包装的物质(S)填充所述管(130)，
●跨所述纵向密封接头(131)热密封所述管(130)，以在相对于待包装的所述物质(S)与所述第一管端部(132)相对的第二管端部(133)处用第二横向密封接头(135)封闭所述管(130)，从而形成包封所述物质(S)的包装(100)，其特征在于所述方法还包括：
●提供可热密封的密封条(700)，使得
○所述密封条(700)的第一片段(701)设置在所述纵向密封接头(131)和所述第一横向密封接头(134)相交的第一三重点区段(171)处，并且
○所述密封条(700)的第二片段(702)设置在所述纵向密封接头(131)和所述第二横向密封接头(135)相交的第二三重点区段(172)处，
其中所述密封条(700)的相应的片段(701,702)在热密封相应的管端部(132,133)时密封相应的三重点区段(171,172)，以形成相应的横向密封接头(134,135)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中在将所述平片(110)形成为管(130)的步骤之前或期间，和/或在热密封所述纵向密封接头(131)的步骤之前或期间，提供所述密封条(700)的所述相应的片段(701,702)。
3.根据权利要求1或权利要求2所述的方法，其中所述密封条(700)的至少一部分、优选地所述第一片段(701)和/或所述第二片段(702)的至少一部分被设置成使得所述相应的片段(701,702)中的每个片段在所述重叠区段(139)处、优选地沿着所述重叠区段(139)的整个长度夹置于所述两个侧边缘区段(111,112)之间。
4.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的方法，其中提供所述相应的片段(701,702)的步骤中的至少一个步骤包括以下步骤：将所述相应的片段(701,702)、优选地所述密封条(700)布置在所述两个侧边缘区段(111,112)之间的所述重叠区段(139)处，使得所述相应的片段(701,702)优选地在热密封所述纵向密封接头(131)的所述步骤之后延伸到相应的三重点区段(171,172)。
5.根据前

title: System and method for forming a compostable capsule for beverages from a sheet having a controlled moisture content
abstract: FIELD: manufacture of a compostable capsule.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to a system and method for manufacturing a compostable capsule for prepared foods. The capsule (900) is made from a sheet (600) made of a biodegradable cellulose-based material. The system (100) comprises a forming line (200) that includes a processing unit (300) for moving the sheet (600) along a direction (TD) of travel through the system (100). The forming line (200) further comprises a moistening unit (400) for moistening a side of the sheet (600) with a moistening agent (401) and a forming unit (800) for forming a portion of the moistened sheet (600) into a three-dimensional shape to form a capsule element (910) capsule element that forms a capsule cavity (911). The forming line (200) further comprises a humidity sensor system (500) for visually registering the humidity level of the section of the moistened sheet (600). The values relating to the moisture level recorded by the moisture sensor system (500) are received by a control unit (700), which is additionally designed to control the moistening unit (400) based on these values. The invention also relates to a method of manufacturing a compostable capsule (900), whereby the moisture level of at least the moistened sheet section (600) is visually recorded and used to control the moistening process of the sheet side (600) accordingly.EFFECT: improvement of the structural integrity and shelf life of the resulting capsule.15 cl, 4 dwg
claims:
1. Система (100) для изготовления компостируемой капсулы (900) для приготавливаемых продуктов из листа (600), выполненного из биоразлагаемого материала на основе целлюлозы, причем система (100) содержит по меньшей мере одну линию (200) формования, которая содержит:
- блок (300) обработки для перемещения листа (600) вдоль направления (TD) перемещения через систему (100);
- блок (400) увлажнения для увлажнения по меньшей мере одной стороны листа (600) увлажнителем (401); и
- блок (800) формования для формования части увлажненного листа (600) в трехмерную форму с образованием элемента (910) капсулы, образующего полость (911) капсулы;
при этом по меньшей мере одна линия (200) формования дополнительно содержит
систему (500) датчиков влажности для визуальной регистрации уровня влажности по меньшей мере секции увлажненного листа (600) и
блок (700) управления, выполненный с возможностью приема значений, относящихся к уровню влажности, регистрируемой системой (500) датчиков влажности, и управления блоком (400) увлажнения на основании этих значений.
2. Система (100) по п. 1, в которой система (500) датчиков влажности содержит оптический прибор (510), предпочтительно камеру и более предпочтительно камеру с высоким разрешением для захвата визуального изображения по меньшей мере секции увлажненного листа (600), представляющего уровень влажности, причем предпочтительно визуальное изображение содержит множество пикселей, при этом более предпочтительно каждое из принятых значений связано с одним или несколькими пикселями.
3. Система (100) по п. 1 или 2, в которой система (500) датчиков влажности содержит источник (520) света, предпочтительно светодиодный источник (521, 522, 523, 524, 525) света, предназначенный для излучения света одной или более определенных длин волн в видимом спектре, причем источник (520) света расположен таким образом, что излучаемый свет (531) направлен на по меньшей мере секцию увлажненного листа (600), чтобы он отражался предпочтительно в направлении оптиче

title: Beverage dispensing unit for machine for preparing and dispensing beverage and machine for preparing and dispensing beverage comprising said dispensing unit
claims:
1.一种用于制备并分配饮料的机器(100)的饮料分配单元(10)，所述饮料分配单元(10)包括：
-喷嘴(12)，所述喷嘴连接到管道(14)，所述饮料和/或用于制作所述饮料的配料在所述管道中流动，
-凹室(16)，所述凹室限定用于保持容器(C)的支座(18)，
通过所述喷嘴(12)分配的所述饮料和/或用于制作所述饮料的所述配料流入所述容器(C)中，
所述凹室(16)包括：
-开口(20)，所述开口用于将所述容器(C)插入所述支座(18)中，
-上部部分(22)，所述喷嘴(12)至少部分地设置在所述上部部分中，
-下部部分(24)，所述下部部分用于支撑所述容器(C)，所述下部部分基本上设置在所述喷嘴(12)下方，
其中所述凹室(16)包括喷嘴保护主体(26)，所述喷嘴保护主体包括：
a)保护壁(28)，所述保护壁设置在所述凹室(16)中并且位于所述喷嘴(12)的下端(30)下方，所述保护壁(28)的形状和尺寸被设定成基本上防止使用者以使所述容器(C)与所述喷嘴(12)接触的方式在所述支座(18)中移动所述容器(C)，并且/或者防止使用者触碰所述喷嘴(12)，
b)饮料分配通道(32)，所述饮料分配通道用于使饮料通过所述保护壁(28)从所述喷嘴(12)流出到所述凹室(16)的所述下部部分(24)，
其中所述保护壁(28)的下部部分(38)包括外表面(40)，所述外表面面向所述凹室(16)的所述下部部分(24)，其中所述外表面(40)包括多个凸起或凹陷元件(42)，所述多个凸起或凹陷元件用于在所述容器(C)的口部(C1)被推压成与所述外表面(40)接触的情况下防止所述容器(C)的所述口部(C1)与所述喷嘴保护主体(26)之间出现紧密接触，从而确保所述容器(C)的过量填充物沿着所述容器(C)的外侧流向所述凹室(16)的所述下部部分(24)而不流向所述喷嘴(12)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的饮料分配单元(10)，其中所述饮料分配单元包括：
-连接构件(34,35)，所述连接构件用于将所述喷嘴保护主体(26)可移除地连接到所述凹室(16)，以便允许从所述凹室(16)移除所述喷嘴保护主体(26)，从而能够周期性地清洁所述喷嘴保护主体(26)。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的饮料分配单元(10)，其中所述饮料分配通道(32)包括用于使所述饮料流出的通孔(36)，所述通孔(36)由所述保护壁(28)的所述下部部分(38)界定。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一

title: Beverage preparation machine with reliable dispensing
abstract: A machine (1) for dispensing a beverage (100) has a beverage processing unit (5) and a beverage outlet (10) in fluid communication with the unit (5). The outlet (10) includes an outlet conduit (11) extending along a flow direction (12) and having a lower conduit part (11a) with a bottom end (13). A bottom dispensing opening (14) is located at the bottom end (13) to dispense beverage (100) from the bottom end (13) to an area (2) for placing a user-recipient (9). Above its bottom end (13), the lower conduit part (11a) has a single lateral dispensing opening (14a) that is configured to dispense beverage (100) above the bottom opening (14) from the lower conduit part (11a) to the placement area (2) when the bottom opening (14) is partly or fully obstructed at the bottom end (13).
claims: Claims <div class="indep-clm" num="1"><seg-main>1. A machine (1) for dispensing a beverage (100) comprises </seg-main><seg-clauses><seg-main>a beverage processing unit (5) and a beverage outlet (10) in fluid communication with the unit (5), the outlet (10) including an outlet conduit (11) extending along a flow direction (12) and having a lower conduit part (11a) with a bottom end (13), a bottom dispensing opening (14) being located at the bottom end (13) to dispense beverage (100) from the bottom end (13) to an area (2) for placing a user-recipient (9), e.g. a cup or a mug, to collect such dispensed beverage (100), optionally the beverage outlet (10) and/or the processing unit (5) being located at least partly in a stationary frame and/or housing (4), for instance: </seg-main><seg-clauses>- the beverage outlet (10) being movable relative to the stationary frame and/or housing </seg-clauses><seg-clauses>(4) between a dispensing position in which the beverage outlet (10) dispenses via the lower conduit part (11a) said beverage (100) to said area (2) and a non-dispensing position in which the beverage outlet (10) prevents dispensing via the lower conduit part (11a) to said area (2), e.g. the beverage outlet (10) directing waste liquid towards a waste collector (3); and/or </seg-clauses><seg-clauses>- the processing unit (5) having a first part (53) and a second part (54) that are relatively movable between a proximate configuration in which they delimit a chamber (55) for containing and processing a beverage ingredient therein and a distant configuration for receiving in the chamber (55) and/or evacuating from the chamber (55) such ingredient, characterised in that above its bottom end (13) the lower conduit part (11a) has a single lateral dispensing opening (14a) that is configured to dispense beverage (100) above the bottom opening (14) from the lower conduit part (11a) to said area (2) for placing a user- recipient (9) when the bottom opening (14) is partly or full

title: confectionery
abstract: The invention relates to a confectionery composition and methods of making the same. In particular, the invention relates to confectionery fillings comprising water, sugar fat, hydrocolloid and protein. Also provided is a process for the manufacture of a confectionery composition.
claims:
1. A confectionery composition comprising:
hydrocolloid in an amount of 0.1wt% to 10wt%, preferably 0.1 to 5 wt%.
protein in an amount of 0.5wt% to 15wt%, preferably, 1.7 to 6.5wt%.
water in an amount of 10wt% to 40wt%, preferably 10 to 20wt%
sugar in an amount of 35wt% to 80wt%, preferably 35 to 67wt%
fat in an amount of 2wt% to 35wt%, wherein the percentages are the weight percentages of the confectionery composition.
2. A confectionery composition according to claim 1, wherein the viscosity of the composition is between 5 Pa.S'1 and 40 Pa.S'1.
3. A confectionery composition according to claims 1 or 2, wherein the sugar comprises a mixture of fructose and glucose.
4. A confectionery composition according to claims 1 to 3, wherein sugar is comprised in an aqueous phase, and from 10wt% to 50wt% of the sugar in the aqueous phase is fructose.
5. A confectionery composition according to claims 1 to 4, wherein sugar is comprised in an aqueous phase, and from 20wt% to 65wt% of the sugar in the aqueous phase is glucose and/or dextrose.
6. A confectionery composition according to any preceding claim,

title: Methylated phloretin analogs as inhibitors of SGLT2
abstract: The present invention relates to compositions and methods for improving metabolic health. In particular, the present disclosure relates to the use of methylated phloretin analogs as sodium-glucose transporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibitors for improving metabolic health.
claims:
1.组合物，所述组合物包含用于SGLT2的抑制的有效量的至少一种甲基化根皮素类似物。
2.根据权利要求1所述的组合物，其中所述甲基化根皮素类似物选自根皮素-4-甲基-醚、4′-O-甲基根皮素、卡洛梅酮和黄卡瓦胡椒素A。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的组合物，其中所述甲基化根皮素类似物由植物或植物提取物获得。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述甲基化根皮素类似物来自未成熟的苹果或橙皮。
5.根据权利要求1至4中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述SGLT2的抑制是在肌肉和/或肾组织中进行的。
6.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的组合物，所述组合物用于治疗和/或预防对其有需要的受试者的与2型糖尿病和/或肥胖相关的病症、障碍或疾病。
7.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的组合物，所述组合物用于治疗和/或预防对其有需要的受试者的与心血管、重量管理、肾脏、肾、脑相关的病症、障碍或疾病。
8.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的组合物，所述组合物用于治疗和/或预防对其有需要的受试者的对SGLT2抑制有应答的病症、障碍或疾病。
9.根据权利要求1至8中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述组合物为食物、饮料或膳食补充剂。
10.根据权利要求1至9中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述组合物还包含药学上可接受的载体。
11.治疗和/或预防对其有需要的受试者的与2型糖尿病和/或肥胖相关的病症、障碍或疾病的方法，所述方法包括施用权利要求1至10中任一项的包含所述的化合物的组合物。
12.治疗和/或预防对其有需要的受试者的对SGLT2抑制有应答的病症、障碍或疾病的方法，所述方法包括施用权利要求1至10中任一项的包含所述的化合物的组合物。
13.药物组合物，所述药物组合物包含作为活性成分的治疗有效量的权利要求1至10中任一项所述的化合物或其药学上可接受的盐或溶剂化物，以及药学上可接受的载体，所述药物组合物用于SGLT2的抑制。
14.抑制SGLT2的体外方法，所述体外方法包括使权利要求1至10中任一项所述的化合物与SGLT2接触并且确定SGLT2的抑制。

title: Compostable POD for beverage preparation
abstract: The invention relates to a pod (100, 200) for preparing a beverage in a beverage production machine, wherein the pod (100, 200) is made of a biodegradable, preferably compostable, material composition and comprises a pod body (110) composed of two half-shells (101, 102) being connected to each other along their respective circumferential flange (140) so as to delimit a chamber (103) for containing a substance (105) for the preparation of the beverage, wherein at least one half-shell comprises in a layered manner:. A primary layer (171) made of a paper-based material,. A secondary layer (172) comprising at least an oxygen barrier function and optionally a water barrier function, and. A, at least partial, tertiary layer (173) comprising a filter function, wherein the primary layer (171) of at least one of the half-shell (101, 102) comprises at least one traversing hole (106), over at least a delivery portion (130) of the half-shell (101, 102), said delivery portion being adapted to interact with external opening elements of the beverage production machine under the effect of rising pressure of the fluid being injected into the pod (100, 200) through an injection portion (120) on the other half-shell (101, 102), to dispense the prepared beverage from the pod (100, 200). The invention also relates to the use of said pod in a beverage production machine.
claims:
Claims
1. A pod (100, 200) for preparing a beverage in a beverage production machine, wherein the pod (100, 200) is made of a biodegradable, preferably compostable, material composition and comprises a pod body (110) composed of two half-shells (101, 102) being connected to each other along their respective circumferential flange (140) so as to delimit a chamber (103) for containing a substance (105) for the preparation of the beverage, wherein at least one half-shell comprises in a layered manner: • A primary layer (171) made of a paper-based material, • A secondary layer (172) comprising at least an oxygen barrier function and/or a water vapor or moisture barrier function, and • A, at least partial, tertiary layer (173) comprising a filter function, wherein the primary layer (171) of at least one of the half-shell (101, 102) comprises at least one traversing hole (106), over at least a delivery portion (130) of the half-shell (101, 102), said delivery portion being adapted to interact with external opening elements of the beverage production machine under the effect of rising pressure of the fluid being injected into the pod (100, 200) through an injection portion (120) on the other half-shell (101, 102), to dispense the prepared beverage from the pod (100, 200).
2. The pod (100,200) according to claim 1, wherein the primary layer (171) comprises between 1 and 150 traversing holes (106) forming a first pattern (108).
3. The pod (100,200) according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the primary layer (171) further comprises at least a non-traversing element, preferably an engraved surface and/or scratch, forming a second pat

title: Coffee beans roasting system checking method
claims:
1. Способ проверки системы обжаривания, содержащей:
- по меньшей мере одно устройство для обжаривания, причем указанное устройство выделяет дым во время нагревания кофейных зерен, и
- по меньшей мере один блок очистки дыма, выполненный с возможностью очистки по меньшей мере части потока дыма, выделяемого по меньшей мере одним устройством для обжаривания, при этом указанный блок очистки дыма содержит по меньшей мере одно съемное фильтрующее устройство,
- устройство перекачивания дыма, выполненное с возможностью направления дыма из устройства для обжаривания в указанное по меньшей мере одно фильтрующее устройство,
причем по меньшей мере один блок очистки дыма содержит по меньшей мере одну пару первого и второго датчиков температуры, при этом первый датчик температуры выполнен с возможностью измерения температуры T1 потока дыма перед указанным по меньшей мере одним съемным фильтрующим устройством, а второй датчик температуры выполнен с возможностью измерения температуры T2 потока дыма после указанного по меньшей мере одного съемного фильтрующего устройства,
причем способ включает в себя стадии, на которых:
- эксплуатируют устройство для обжаривания с получением горячего газа,
- контролируют первую и вторую температуры, измеряемые одной из пар первого и второго датчиков температуры, в течение по меньшей мере времени указанной эксплуатации,
- наблюдают за различием поведения контролируемых температур с течением времени,
- сравнивают указанное наблюдаемое различие поведения с заданным различием поведения, соответствующим наличию указанного по меньшей мере одного съемного фильтрующего устройства между двумя датчиками температуры,
- отображается сигнал тревоги, если наблюдаемое различие поведения отличается от заданного различия поведения.
2. Способ по п. 1, в котором стадия эксплуатации устройства для обжаривания с получением горячего газа представляет собой операцию обжаривания кофейных зерен, операцию предварительного нагрева устройства для обжаривания или операцию иници

Also provided is a process for the manufacture of a confectionery composition.

title: Compositions and methods for diagnosing and treating cardiomyopathy in a feline
abstract: The present invention relates to methods and compositions for diagnosing and enabling treatment of cardiomyopathy (CM) in a feline. In one embodiment, a method of diagnosing CM in a feline can comprise measuring an amount of at least one metabolite from the feline; comparing the amount of the at least one metabolite from the feline to a corresponding predetermined value or a corresponding predetermined range; and diagnosing the feline as preclinical CM, clinical CM, or not having CM, based on the comparison.
claims:
1. A method of diagnosing cardiomyopathy (CM) in a feline, the method comprising: measuring an amount of at least one metabolite from the feline, wherein the at least one metabolite is selected from the group consisting of tauro-beta-muricholate, 1-stearoyl-2-linoleoyl-GPE (18:0/18:2), 1-stearoyl-2-oleoyl-GPE (18: 0/18:1), 1-stearoyl-2-linoleoyl-GPI (18:0/18:2), 1-behenoyl-GPC (22:0), 1-linoleoyl-GPI (18:2), taurodeoxycholic acid 3-sulfate, 1-palmitoyl-2-linoleoyl-GPE (16:0/18:2), asparagine, 1-palmitoyl-2-oleoyl-GPE (16:0/18:1), 1-arachidoyl-GPC (20:0), phosphatidylcholine (18:0/20:2, 20:0/18:2), taurodeoxycholate, glycerol, cystine, C-glycosyltryptophan, cysteine-glutathione disulfide, N-acetylglucosaminylasparagine, N-lactoyl valine, 5-(galactosylhydroxy)-lysine, 3-hydroxymyristate, hydroxyasparagine, guanidinosuccinate, N-lactoyl tyrosine, 1-methylhistidine, glucuronate, ribonate, 1-methylguanidine, N,N-dimethylalanine, 11-dehydrocorticosterone, cortisol, 2R,3R-dihydroxybutyrate, mannitol/sorbitol, n-propanol glucuronide, and mixtures thereof; comparing the amount of the at least one metabolite from the feline to a corresponding predetermined value or a corresponding predetermined range; and diagnosing the feline as preclinical CM, clinical CM, or not having CM, based on the comparison.

title: Paper-based flexible packaging material with high barrier properties and a process to produce it
abstract: The present invention relates generally to the field of polymer dispersion coated, paper-based flexible packaging materials. In particular, the present invention relates to improving the barrier properties of polymer dispersion coated 5 paper-based flexible packaging materials. Embodiments of the present invention relate to a process for improving the barrier properties of polymer dispersion coated paper-based flexible packaging materials comprising the step of applying an Al2O3 coating to at least one surface of the dispersion coated paper-based flexible packaging materials, for example by using atomic layer deposition; and an Al2O3-coated paper material 10 obtainable by such a process.
claims:
1. A process for improving barrier properties of polymer dispersion coated paper-based flexible packaging materials comprising:
applying an Al2O3 coating having a thickness in the range of 8-70 nm, to at least one surface of the polymer dispersion coated paper-based flexible packaging material, wherein the Al2O3 coating is applied to the at least one surface of the polymer dispersion coated paper-based flexible packaging materials by atomic layer deposition at a temperature in the range of 40° C.-80° C. with trimethylaluminum (TMA) and H2O or O2 as precursors,
wherein the process further comprises a plasma pre-treatment of the at least one surface of the polymer dispersion coated paper-based flexible packaging materials before the Al2O3 coating is applied.
2. The process in accordance with claim 1, wherein the Al2O3 coating that is applied to the at least one surface of the polymer dispersion coated paper-based flexible packaging materials has a thickness in the range of 45-55 nm.
3. The process in accordance with claim 1, wherein the Al2O3 coating that is applied to the at least one surface of the polymer dispersion coated paper-based flexible packaging materials has a thickness in the range of 20-30 nm.
4. The process in accordance with claim 1, wherein the polymer dispersion coated paper-based flexible packaging materials has a grammage i

title: Systems and methods for animal health monitoring
abstract: The present disclosure provides systems and methods for animal health monitoring. Load data can be obtained from a plurality of load sensors associated with a platform carrying contained litter thereabove, wherein individual load sensors of the plurality of load sensors are separated from one another and receive pressure input from the platform independent of one another. If the load data is determined or not to be from an animal interaction with the contained litter, an animal behavior property associated with an animal is recognized if a determination is made based on load data that the interaction with the contained litter was due to the animal interaction. The animal behavior property is classified into an animal classified event using a machine learning classifier. A change in the animal classified event is identified as compared to a previously recorded event associated with the animal.
claims:
1. A method of monitoring the health of an animal, under the control of at least one processor, comprising:
obtaining load data from an animal monitoring device including a plurality of load sensors associated with a platform carrying contained litter thereabove, wherein individual load sensors of the plurality of load sensors are separated from one another and receive pressure input from the platform independent of one another;
determining if the load data is from an animal interaction with the contained litter;
recognizing an animal behavior property associated with the animal if determined based on load data that the interaction with the contained litter was due to the animal interaction;
classifying the animal behavior property into an animal classified events using a machine learning classifier, wherein the classifying includes analyzing the load data from the plurality of load sensors at a phase level via a phase separation algorithm to separate the load data into multiple phases while the animal is interacting with the contained litter; and
identifying a change in the animal classified event as compared to a previously recorded event associated with the animal.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein classifying the animal behavior comprises an in box event, a urination event, a defecation event, a non-elimination event, or a combination thereof.
3. The method of claim 1, further comprising correlating the

title: Dispenser of bulk material

title: Apparatus and method of roasting coffee beans
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: inventions group relates to coffee industry. Disclosed is apparatus (1) for roasting coffee beans, comprising: chamber (10) configured to receive coffee beans for roasting, wherein chamber (10) includes opening (13), and a device for roasting coffee beans received into chamber (10), wherein chamber (10) is movable relative to an axis of movement to different positions, wherein said positions include a roasting position which is configured to roast coffee beans received in chamber (10), and a bean discharge position in which chamber (10) is configured to discharge coffee beans through opening (13) from chamber (10) in which same opening (13) defines a direction of access for removing the coffee beans from chamber (10), as well as for supplying coffee beans into chamber (10). Additionally, described is a method for coffee beans roasting with usage of the said apparatus.EFFECT: group of inventions makes it possible to provide for an apparatus that makes the coffee beans roasting method more convenient and safer.15 cl, 14 dwg
claims:

title: Multilayer metallized paper-based packaging material
abstract: The present invention relates to an oxygen-barrier substrate comprising or consisting of a graft copolymer comprising a vinyl alcohol polymer backbone and polypeptide branches. The present invention also relates to a packaging material comprising at least one oxygen-barrier layer comprising or consisting of a graft copolymer comprising a vinyl alcohol polymer backbone and polypeptide branches, in particular a multi-layer metallized paper-based packaging material.
claims:
1. An oxygen-barrier substrate comprising or consisting of a graft copolymer comprising a vinyl alcohol polymer backbone and polypeptide branches.
2. The oxygen-barrier substrate according to claim 1, wherein the vinyl alcohol polymer backbone is polyvinylalcohol (PVOH), ethylene vinyl alcohol (EVOH), butenediol vinyl alcohol co-polymer (BVOH), or a combination thereof, preferably wherein the vinyl alcohol polymer backbone is polyvinylalcohol (PVOH).
3. The oxygen-barrier substrate according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the polypeptide is collagen or a hydrolysed form thereof.
4. The oxygen-barrier substrate according to any preceding claim, wherein the polypeptide branches are coupled to the vinyl alcohol polymer backbone by a linker, optionally wherein the graft copolymer comprises the following formula: 3olypeptide , Linker O
5. The oxygen-barrier substrate according to any preceding claim, wherein the polypeptide branches are coupled to the vinyl alcohol polymer backbone by a polycarboxylic acid or an anhydride thereof, optionally wherein the graft copolymer comprises the following formula:
6. The oxygen-barrier substrate according to any preceding claim, wherein the polypeptide branches are coupled to the vinyl alcohol polymer backbone by: (a) a tricarboxylic acid or an anhydride thereof; optional
