title: Methods of providing and determining effective weight loss diet for dogs
abstract: The present disclosure provides a method of determining the efficacy of a weight loss diet in a canine, the method comprising analyzing a biomarker of a serum or plasma sample from the canine before and after administration of the weight loss diet wherein the biomarker is selected from the group consisting of 3-methylhistidine, 1-methylhistidine, and combinations thereof, and determining that the weight loss diet is effective if the amount of the biomarker has decreased.
claims:
1.一种确定犬类减重饮食功效的方法，所述方法包括：
分析来自所述犬类的第一血清或血浆样品的生物标志物，所述生物标志物选自由以下组成的组：3-甲基组氨酸、1-甲基组氨酸以及它们的组合；
确定所述第一血清或血浆样品中所述生物标志物的量；
在已经对所述犬类施用了所述减重饮食后，分析第二血清或血浆样品的所述生物标志物；
确定所述第二血清或血浆样品中所述生物标志物的量；以及
如果所述第二血清样品或血浆样品中所述生物标志物的所述量比所述第一血清样品中所述生物标志物的所述量已经减少，则确定所述减重饮食是有效的，或如果所述第二血清样品或血浆样品中所述生物标志物的所述量与所述第一血清或血浆样品中所述生物标志物的所述量相比尚未改变或相比增加，则确定所述减重饮食是无效的。
2.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中已经规律地向所述犬类施用所述减重饮食。
3.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中已经向所述犬类施用所述减重饮食至少1个月。
4.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中所述减重包括完全且均衡的宠物食物。
5.根据权利要求1所述的方法，所述方法还包括向所述犬类施用所述减重饮食。
6.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中，当所述减重饮食有效时，所述减重饮食提供选自由以下组成的组的健康益处：保持瘦体重、减重期间最小化瘦体重、体脂肪减少、体重减少、体重增加减少、胰岛素抵抗减少、糖尿病风险降低、前驱糖尿病风险降低、低胆固醇、低葡萄糖、低甘油三酯、低胰岛素、低瘦蛋白、胰岛素敏感性改善、预防前驱糖尿病、延迟前驱糖尿病的发作、治疗前驱糖尿病、预防糖尿病、延迟糖尿病的发作、治疗糖尿病、预防胰岛素抵抗、延迟胰岛素抵抗的发作、治疗胰岛素抵抗、预防超重或肥胖、延迟超重或肥胖的发作、治疗超重或肥胖、促进代谢健康、促进更好的血糖控制、降低慢性炎症和促炎细胞因子、改善自主日间活动、减少日间和夜间躁动、增加饱腹感以及它们的组合。
7.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中，当所述减重饮食无效时，向所述犬类建议不同的减重饮食。
8.一种为犬类提供有效减重饮食的方法，所述方法包括：
分析来自所述犬类的第一血清或血浆样品的生物标志物，所述生物标志物选自由以下组成的组：3-甲基组氨酸、1-甲基组氨酸以及它们的组合；
确定所述第一血清或血浆样品中所述生物标志物的所述量；
在已经对所述犬类施用了所述减重饮食后，分析第二血清或血浆样品的所述生物标

title: Methods of monitoring feeding behaviors of pets
abstract: The present disclosure relates to the monitoring feeding behavior(s) of a pet(s), under the control of at least one processor. An example method includes obtaining load data from a load sensor of a pet bowl while the pet is interacting with contents of the pet bowl. The load sensor can have a sensitivity of +/−50 grams or less and the load data is obtained can occur at a sample rate from 10 samples to 150 samples per second. The example method can also include sequentially grouping the load data in 0.01 second to 5 second time increments, wherein individual time increments include multiple samples, and identifying a feeding behavior occurring within one or more of the time increments based on the load data resulting from the pet interacting with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
claims:
1. A method of monitoring feeding behavior of a pet, under the control of at least one processor, comprising:
obtaining load data from a load sensor of a pet bowl while the pet is interacting with contents of the pet bowl, wherein the load sensor has a sensitivity of +/−50 grams or less and the load data is obtained at a sample rate from 10 samples to 150 samples per second;
sequentially grouping the load data in 0.01 second to 5 second time increments, wherein individual time increments include multiple samples; and
identifying a feeding behavior occurring within one or more of the time increments based on the load data resulting from the pet interacting with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
2. The method of claim 1, further comprising excluding load data in identifying the feeding behavior if determined to be a result of human interaction, a false trigger, or an accidental interaction with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the feeding behavior is a count-based feeding behavior selected from lapping, licking, or biting.
4. The method of claim 3, further comprising characterizing the count-based feeding behavior by counting individual micro-events of the feeding behavior within a single time increment or a time period spanning multiple time increments, wherein the individual micro-events include individual laps, individual licks, or individual bites.

title: Combination for dietary management of gut health
abstract: The present invention provides a combination comprising lactose and human milk oligosaccharides (HMOs) 2'-fucosyllactose (2'-FL), lacto-/V-neotetraose (LNnT), 3- fucosyllactose (3'-FL), at least one of 3'-sialyllactose (3'-SL) or 6'-sialyllactose (6'-SL), and optionally lacto-N-tetraose (LNT) for use in the dietary management of dysbiosis of the gut microbiota in a subject or for use in the dietary management of a disease or disorder associated with metabolism and/or accumulation of BCFA in a subject.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A combination comprising lactose and human milk oligosaccharides (HMOs) 2'- fucosyllactose (2’-FL), lacto-/V-neotetraose (LNnT), 3-fucosyllactose (3’-FL), and at least one of 3’-sialyllactose (3’-SL) or 6’-sialyllactose (6’-SL) for use in (a) the dietary management of dysbiosis of the gut microbiota in a subject; (b) the dietary management of a disease or disorder associated with metabolism and/or accumulation of branched chain fatty acids (BCFA) in a subject; or (c) the reduction of BCFA in a subject.
2. The combination for use according to claim 1 , wherein the composition comprises the HMOs 2’-FL, LNnT, 3’-FL, 3’-SL, 6’-SL, and lacto-N-tetraose (LNT).
3. The combination for use according to claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the combination is for use in the dietary management of dysbiosis of the gut microbiota, and wherein the dysbiosis includes increased production of BCFA, such as isobutyrate, isovalerate, and/or isocaproate.
4. The combination for use according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the combination is for use in the dietary management of dysbiosis of the gut microbiota in a subject, and wherein the dysbiosis of the gut microbiota is associated with an intestinal disorder and/or an extra- intestinal disorder; optionally wherein the intestinal disorder is one or more of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), and coeliac disease and/or wherein the extra-intestinal disorder is one or more of allergy, asthma, atopic dermatitis, metabolic syndrome, cardiovascular disease, ob

title: Large donut-shaped dry kibble for small adult dogs
abstract: Methods for feeding small adult dogs include dispensing a serving of dry kibble to a small adult dog weighing less than about 11 kg, wherein from about 20% to 100% of individual dry kibble pieces of the serving can be donut-shaped and have an average inner-hole diameter from about 3 mm to about 8 mm and are about 8 mm to about 2 cm in average diameter. The dry kibble can also have an average thickness from about 8 mm to about 2 cm.
claims:
1. A method of feeding a small adult dog, comprising dispensing a serving of dry kibble to a small adult dog weighing up to about 11 kg, wherein from about 20% to 100% of individual dry kibble pieces of the serving are donut-shaped having an average inner-hole diameter from about 3 mm to about 8 mm, wherein the individual dry kibble pieces of the serving are about 8 mm to about 2 cm in average diameter and about 8 mm to about 2 cm in average thickness.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the average diameter is from about 1.1 cm to about 2 cm.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the average diameter is from about 1.4 cm to about 2 cm.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the average thickness is from about 1.1 cm to about 1.8 cm.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the dry kibble has a moisture content from about 4 wt% to about 10 wt%.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the dry kibble has a stiffness from about 40 N/mm to about 120 N/mm.
7. The method of claim 1, wherein after dispensing the serving and the small adult dog begins feeding on the dry kibble, from about 45% to about 75% of the first three minutes of feeding on average includes chew time.
8. The method of claim 1, <

title: Beverage capsule system with repeated code
abstract: A system comprising a container for containing precursor material and a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof from said precursor material, the container including: a code arrangement comprising a plurality of code repetitions, each code encoding a binary sequence to at least partially encode preparation information, the machine including: a code reading system to read the code repetitions; a processing unit for processing the precursor material of the container, and; electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on the preparation information, wherein electrical circuitry is configured to: read the code repetitions to obtain the binary sequence for each code; implement a code decoder to determine a number of bit errors associated with the binary sequence, and; determine a recipe based on the binary sequence and the number of bit errors.
claims:
1. A system comprising a container for containing precursor material and a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof from said precursor material,
the container including:
a code arrangement comprising a plurality of code repetitions, each code repetition encoding a binary sequence to at least partially encode preparation information,
the machine including:
a code reading system to read the code repetitions;
a processing unit for processing the precursor material of the container, and;
electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on the preparation information,
wherein electrical circuitry is configured to:
read the code repetitions to obtain the binary sequence for each code repetition;
implement a code decoder to determine a number of bit errors associated with the binary sequence, and;
determine a recipe based on the binary sequence and the number of bit errors.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the electrical circuitry is configured to implement the code decoder to determine an invalid binary sequence if the binary sequence is not associated with a recipe.
3. The system of either of claims 1 or

title: Beverage or foodstuff container and preparation system
abstract: A container for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof, the container including: a storage portion for containing a precursor material, a closing member to close the storage portion and an annular flange-like rim comprising an annular force ring made of a wood pulp-based material, wherein the annular force ring is of essentially S-shaped when seen in transversal cross-section. A set of different containers is also proposed as well as a container system and a system comprising a container and a beverage preparation machine.
claims:
1. A container designed for insertion in and use with a preparation machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof from a precursor material stored in the container by introducing liquid in the container and passing liquid through the precursor material, the container including:
a container body comprising a bottom end and an open end, the container body forming a storage portion for containing the precursor material;
a closing member to close the storage portion at the open end of the container body; and
an annular flange-like rim at least partially made of cellulose pulp-based material, extending outwardly from the container body and connecting the storage portion and the closing member, the rim having at least a flat segment and comprising an annular force ring designed for being engaged by an enclosing member of the preparation machine,
wherein the annular force ring is made of cellulose pulp-based material and is of essentially S-shaped when seen in transversal cross-section, comprising at least:
a first portion linked to the flat segment of the rim, and forming with said flat segment an angle comprised between 2° and 85°; and
a second portion extending from the first portion on the side opposite the flat segment of the rim, said second portion comprising at least a flat and/or curved extension.
2. The container of claim 1, wherein the annular force ring comprises a third portion extending between the flat segment of the flang

title: Composition comprising cinnamaldehyde and zinc to improve swallowing
abstract: Compositions contain an amount of cinnamaldehyde that is orally tolerable, thus avoiding an unpleasant mouth feeling, and also tolerable in the gastrointestinal tract. The amount of cinnamaldehyde is supplemented by zinc, and the combination is effective to promote a swallowing reflex. The composition containing the combination of cinnamaldehyde and zinc can be used in a method to treat dysphagia and/or prevent aspiration pneumonia from dysphagia. In an embodiment, the composition containing cinnamaldehyde is administered to a human. The composition containing cinnamaldehyde may be a medicament, a food product or a supplement to a food product.
claims:
1. A method for promoting a swallowing reflex, the method comprising administering to a patient in need of promotion of the swallowing reflex a composition comprising cinnamaldehyde and zinc,
wherein the cinnamaldehyde is present in the composition at a concentration of about 100 ppm or less, and a cinnamaldehyde:zinc molar ratio in the composition is 1:0.5 to 1:0.005.
2. The method of claim 1 wherein the cinnamaldehyde is present in the composition in an amount that is tolerable to ingest and, in combination with the zinc, effective to promote a swallowing reflex in the patient.
3. The method of claim 2 wherein promotion of the swallowing reflex comprises an effect selected from the group consisting of provoking the swallowing reflex, increasing the ability of the patient to swallow, increasing the efficacy of the swallowing reflex, decreasing a delay in swallowing, and combinations thereof.
4. The method of claim 1 wherein the composition comprises cinnamon essential oil extract that provides at least a portion of the cinnamaldehyde.
5. The method of claim 1 wherein at least a portion of the cinnamaldehyde is selected from the group consisting of isolated cinnamaldehyde and synthesized cinnamaldehyde.
6. The method of claim 1 wherein at least a portion of the zinc is selected from the group

title: Medicaments, compositions and methods for supporting behavioral development
abstract: The present invention relates to one or more human milk oligosaccharides (HMOs) for use in supporting behavioral development in a subject, wherein the one or more HMOs comprise or consist of: (a) lactose-N-difucohexaose I (LNDFHI); and/or (b) 2 '-fucosyllactose (2' FL), 3-fucosyllactose (3FL), lactose difucotetraose (LDFT), lactose-N-fucopentasaccharide II (LNFPII), lactose-N-fucopentasaccharide I (LNFP-I), lactose-N-fucopentasaccharide III (LNFP-III), lactose-N-difucohexaose I (LND-I), monofucosyl-lactose-N-hexaose III (MFLNH-III), lactose-N-fucopentasaccharide V (LNFP-V), lactose-N-neodifucohexaose (LNnDFH) and lactose-N-fucopentasaccharide VI (LNFP-VI), and a method for preparing the same.
claims:
1.在支持受试者的行为发展中使用的一种或多种人乳低聚糖(HMO)，其中所述一种或多种HMO包含以下或由以下组成：(a)乳糖-N-二岩藻六糖I(LNDFHI)；和/或(b)2'-岩藻糖基乳糖(2'FL)、3-岩藻糖基乳糖(3FL)、乳糖二岩藻四糖(LDFT)、乳糖-N-岩藻五糖II(LNFPII)、乳糖-N-岩藻五糖I(LNFP-I)、乳糖-N-岩藻五糖III(LNFP-III)、乳糖-N-二岩藻六糖I(LND-I)、单岩藻糖基-乳糖-N-六糖III(MFLNH-III)、乳糖-N-岩藻五糖V(LNFP-V)、乳糖-N-新二岩藻六糖(LNnDFH)和乳糖-N-岩藻五糖VI(LNFP-VI)。
2.根据权利要求1所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述一种或多种HMO包含LNDFHI或由其组成。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述一种或多种HMO包含以下或由以下组成：2'FL、3FL、LDFT、LNFPII、LNFP-I、LNFP-III、LND-I、MFLNH-III、LNFP-V、LNnDFH和LNFP-VI。
4.根据任一前述权利要求所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述一种或多种HMO通过口服施用进行施用。
5.根据任一前述权利要求所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述一种或多种HMO单独、同时或顺序施用，优选地其中所述一种或多种HMO同时施用。
6.根据任一前述权利要求所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述一种或多种HMO以约0.5g/天至约10g/天的总量施用于所述受试者。
7.根据任一前述权利要求所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述一种或多种HMO呈营养组合物的形式。
8.根据权利要求7所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述营养组合物是婴儿配方食品、较大婴儿配方食品或成长乳，优选地其中所述营养组合物是婴儿配方食品。
9.根据权利要求7或8所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述营养组合物包含约0.5g/L至约10g/L的总量的所述一种或多种HMO。
10.根据任一前述权利要求所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述受试者是婴儿、学步儿童或幼儿，优选地其中所述受试者是婴儿。
11.根据任一前述权利要求所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述受试者的年龄为约12个月或更小、约11个月或更小、约10个月或更小、或约9个月或更小。
12.根据任一前述权利要求所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述一种或多种HMO改善所述受试者的社会情感技能。
13.根据任一前述权利要求所述使用的一种或多种HMO，其中所述一种或多种HMO减少所述受试者的消极情感，优选地其中所述受试者的消极情感通过婴儿行为问卷修订版(IBQ-R)来确定。

title: Apparatus for aerating a pasty product and for mixing with another product
abstract: The invention relates to an apparatus for aerating a pasty product. The apparatus comprises a housing (1) with an inlet (4) for the pasty product to be aerated and an outlet (5) for the aerated product. The apparatus comprises at least a first set of a rotor and a stator (21) and a second set of a rotor and a stator (22). The apparatus further comprises a gas injector (6) for injecting, upstream of the first set of a rotor and a stator (21), a gas into the pasty product to be aerated. The apparatus further comprises an intermediate mixing chamber (7) provided in the housing between the first and the second sets of a rotor and a stator (21, 22). A secondary product introduction means protrudes into the intermediate mixing chamber (7) so as to issue into said intermediate mixing chamber (7). A method for aerating a pasty product is also provided.
claims:
38 CLAIMS
1. An apparatus for aerating a pasty product, the apparatus comprising a housing extending in a longitudinal direction, said housing comprising an inlet for the pasty product to be aerated and an outlet for the aerated product, and, within the housing, at least a first set of a rotor and a stator and a second set of a rotor and a stator, wherein each set of a rotor and a stator has complementary toothed rims oppositely orientated in the longitudinal direction, said apparatus comprising a drive shaft, the rotors of each set of a rotor and a stator being coupled to said drive shaft, said apparatus further comprising a gas injector for injecting, upstream of the first set of a rotor and a stator, a gas into the pasty product to be aerated, wherein the apparatus further comprises an intermediate mixing chamber provided in the housing between the first and the second sets of a rotor and a stator, and a secondary product introduction means which protrudes into the intermediate mixing chamber so as to issue into said intermediate mixing chamber.
2. The apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the secondary product introduction means comprise a fluid injector.
3. The apparatus according to claim 2, wherein the intermediate mixing chamber is a volume free of mechanical parts except for said fluid injector.
4. The apparatus according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the secondary product introduction means forms a secondary pasty product inlet. CA 3055016 Date reçue / Received date 2024-10-1039
5. The apparatus according to any one of claims 1

title: Method for producing milk like products
abstract: A method for producing mammary gland cells and a method of producing a mammalian milk like product, for example a human milk like product comprising generating lactocytes derived from mammalian induced pluripotent stem cells (miPSC), for example human induced pluripotent stem cells (hiPSC), and expressing the mammalian milk like product, for example the human milk like product from lactocytes.
claims:
1. A method of producing a population of mammary gland cells, comprising: i) culturing mammalian induced pluripotent stem cells (miPSCs) in a culture medium comprising bone morphogenic protein 4 (BMP4) and retinoic acid (RA) to generate embryoid bodies (EBs), and ii) growing the EBs to generate a population of mammary cells.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the culturing step i) comprises culturing the miPSCs in MammoCult medium and BMP4, in a 3D-suspension culture system, thereby directing the iPSCs to differentiate towards non-neural ectoderm cells.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the culturing step i) comprises culturing the miPSCs in MammoCult medium and BMP4, in a 3D-suspension culture system, thereby directing the iPSCs to differentiate towards non-neural ectoderm cells.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the growing step ii) comprises growing the formed EBs in a 3D embedding system comprising RA to generate lactocytes.
5-12. (canceled)
13. The method of claim 1, wherein BMP4 is added to the culture medium in a concentration of 5 to 20 ng/ml.
14. The method of claim 1, wherein RA is added to the culture medium in a concentration of 1 μM.
15. The method of claim 1, wherein the EBs express one or more mammary gland positive progenitor-cell markers.

title: Food powder with improved stability and method for preparing same
abstract: The present invention relates to a method for preparing a food powder having improved stability, in particular reduced moisture absorption capacity and reduced moisture absorption stability. The method comprises providing a liquid food composition, drying the liquid food composition, and adding crystalline monosaccharides and/or disaccharides to the food powder. In particular, up to 30% of the monosaccharides and/or disaccharides of the food powder are amorphous and the remainder of the monosaccharides and/or disaccharides of the food powder is crystalline.
claims:
1.制备食品粉末的方法，所述方法包括：
a.提供液体食品组合物，其中所述液体食品组合物包含按液体食品组合物的干重计至多20wt％的单糖和/或二糖，并且还包含不同于单糖和/或二糖的至少一种组分；
b.干燥所述液体食品组合物以获得食品粉末；
c.向所述食品粉末中添加结晶单糖和/或二糖，其中所述食品粉末的所述单糖和/或二糖的至多30％、优选至多10％是无定形的，并且所述食品粉末的单糖和/或二糖的其余部分是结晶的。
2.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中所述液体食品组合物不含单糖和/或二糖。
3.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的方法，其中所述食品粉末不含无定形单糖和/或二糖。
4.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的方法，其中所述食品粉末的总单糖和/或二糖含量为10wt.％至80wt.％，优选10wt.％至70wt.％，更优选10wt.％至60wt.％,甚至更优选20wt.％至60wt.％。
5.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的方法，其中所述液体食品组合物的不同于单糖和/或二糖的所述至少一种组分选自由以下组成的列表：蛋白质、脂肪、乳化剂、盐或其混合物。
6.根据权利要求5所述的方法，其中所述液体食品组合物的所述蛋白质由乳品蛋白质、植物蛋白质或其混合物组成。
7.根据权利要求5或6所述的方法，其中所述脂肪选自由以下组成的列表：植物脂肪、乳脂或其混合物。
8.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的方法，其中所述食品粉末是基于乳品的食品粉末或其基于植物的类似物，优选乳粉或其基于植物的类似物。
9.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的方法，其中步骤a)的所述液体食品组合物通过包括以下步骤的方法制备：
-将至少一种蛋白质成分和任选的盐分散到水性液体中以形成液体食品组合物：
-任选地，将所述液体食品组合物与至少一种脂肪和任选的至少一种乳化剂混合；
-任选地，热处理所述液体食品组合物；
-任选地，将所述液体食品组合物均质化。
10.根据权利要求1至8所述的方法，其中步骤a)的所述液体食品组合物通过包括以下步骤的方法制备：
-提供包含单糖和/或二糖的液体食品组合物；
-通过过滤，优选超滤，去除所述液体食品组合物的部分或全部单糖：

title: Beverage dispensing unit for machine for preparing and dispensing beverage and machine for preparing and dispensing beverage comprising said dispensing unit
abstract: A beverage dispensing unit (10) for dispensing a beverage, the beverage dispensing unit comprising a nozzle (12) and a recess (16) provided with a nozzle protection body (26) comprising: a protection wall (28) for substantially preventing a user from moving a container (C) in contact with the nozzle (12); and a beverage dispensing channel (32). The lower portion (38) of the 5 protective wall (28) comprises a collector tray (44) comprising: a first inner wall (48) having an upper edge (50) defining a through hole (36); and a second inner wall (52) disposed externally with respect to the first inner wall (48).
claims:
1.一种用于制备并分配饮料的机器(100)的饮料分配单元(10)，所述饮料分配单元(10)包括：
-喷嘴(12)，所述喷嘴连接到管道(14)，所述饮料和/或用于制作所述饮料的配料在所述管道中流动，
-凹室(16)，所述凹室限定用于保持容器(C)的支座(18)，
通过所述喷嘴(12)分配的所述饮料和/或用于制作所述饮料的所述配料流入所述容器(C)中，
所述凹室(16)包括：
-开口(20)，所述开口用于将所述容器(C)插入所述支座(18)中，
-上部部分(22)，所述喷嘴(12)至少部分地设置在所述上部部分中，
-下部部分(24)，所述下部部分用于支撑所述容器(C)，所述下部部分基本上设置在所述喷嘴(12)下方，
其中所述凹室(16)包括喷嘴保护主体(26)，所述喷嘴保护主体包括：
a)保护壁(28)，所述保护壁设置在所述凹室(16)中并且位于所述喷嘴(12)的下端(30)下方，所述保护壁(28)的形状和尺寸被设定成基本上防止使用者以使所述容器(C)与所述喷嘴(12)接触的方式在所述支座(18)中移动所述容器(C)，并且/或者防止使用者触碰所述喷嘴(12)，
b)饮料分配通道(32)，所述饮料分配通道用于使饮料通过所述保护壁(28)从所述喷嘴(12)流出到所述凹室(16)的所述下部部分(24)，
其中所述保护壁(28)的下部部分(38)包括收集器托盘(44)，所述收集器托盘面向所述喷嘴(12)并且与所述喷嘴(12)分离，用于收集在所述喷嘴(12)与所述保护壁(28)之间可能出现的任何饮料溢出物，其中所述收集器托盘(44)包括：
-下表面(46)，所述下表面面向所述喷嘴(12)，
-第一内壁(48)，所述第一内壁背离所述内表面(46)、朝向所述喷嘴(12)延伸并且包括界定所述通孔(36)的上边缘(50)，和
第二内壁(52)，所述第二内壁背离所述内表面(46)、朝向所述喷嘴(12)延伸并且相对于所述第一内壁(48)设置在外部。
2.根据权利要求1所述的饮料分配单元(10)，其中所述饮料分配单元包括：
-连接构件(34,35)，所述连接构件用于将所述喷嘴保护主体(26)可移除地连接到所述凹室(16)，以便允许从所述凹室(16)移除所述喷嘴保护主体(26)，从而能够周期性地清洁所述喷嘴保护主体(26)。

title: Multilayer metallized paper-based packaging material
abstract: The present invention relates to a cellulosic substrate comprising or consisting of a cellulose graft copolymer comprising polypeptide branches. The present invention also relates to a packaging material comprising at least one paper layer comprising or consisting of a cellulose graft copolymer comprising polypeptide branches, in particular a multi-layer metallized paper-based packaging material.

title: Cocoa polyphenols and soluble dietary fiber for use in the treatment or prevention disorders associated with an above-normal number of granulocytes in a tissue
abstract: The present invention relates to a composition comprising at least one cocoa polyphenol and soluble dietary fiber for use hi the prevention or treatment of a disorder associated with an above-normal number of granulocytes hi a tissue.
claims:
Claims
1. Composition comprising at least one cocoa polyphenol and at least one fermentable dietary fiber for use in the prevention or treatment of a disorder associated with an above-normal number of granulocytes in a tissue.
2. Composition for use in the prevention or treatment of a disorder associated with an above-normal number of eosinophils according to claim 1, wherein the disorder associated with an above-normal number of granulocytes in a tissue is an eosinophilic gastrointestinal disorder, an allergy, in particular, a food allergy, an gastrointestinal syndrome, allergy associated with aeroallergen including asthma and allergic rhinithis, lung allergic inflammation or skin atopic dermatitis.
3. Composition for use in the prevention or treatment of a disorder associated with an above-normal number of granulocytes according to any of the above claims, wherein the eosinophilic gastrointestinal disorder is caused by a food allergy or aeroallergens.
4. Composition for use in the prevention or treatment of a disorder associated with an above-normal number of eosinophils according to any of the above claims, wherein the eosinophilic gastrointestinal disorder is eosinophilic esophagitis, eosinophilic gastritis, eosinophilic gastroenteritis, or eosinophilic colitis; wherein the eosinophilic gastrointestinal disorder preferably is eosinophilic esophagitis.
5. Composition for use in the prevention or treatment of a disorder associated with an above-normal number of granulocytes according t

title: Extracted concentrated mucilage from OKRA, related compositions such as concentrates and powders, and methods of making and using the OKRA mucilage
abstract: New and innovative compositions contain extracted concentrated mucilage from okra, and methods are disclosed for producing the compositions. At least a portion of the composition can be used in a ready-to-drink (RTD) beverage or as a powder, and can be used to treat individuals with dysphagia. An example method includes at least one step selected from the group consisting of: blanching fresh or frozen whole okra pods; cutting okra into pieces; submerging the okra pieces in water; separating okra mucilage liquid concentrate from the okra pieces by filtration; adding an excipient material; homogenizing a mixture containing the okra mucilage liquid concentrate; heat treating or sterilizing the mixture; and adjusting an okra mucilage concentration in the heat treated or sterilized mixture to reach a relaxation time of at least 10 milliseconds, preferably between 50 milliseconds and 400 milliseconds, and most preferably between 100 milliseconds and 200 milliseconds at 20°C.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A method of producing composition comprising extracted concentrated mucilage from okra, the method comprising at least one step selected from the group consisting of: (i) blanching fresh or frozen whole okra pods; (ii) cutting a plurality of okra pieces from okra pods; (iii) submerging the plurality of okra pieces in water; (iv) separating okra mucilage liquid concentrate from the plurality of okra pieces by filtration under an acting force or pressure selected from a group comprising: (a) a gravitational force, (b) a static pressure, (c) preferably, a centrifugal force, or (d) a combination of the static pressure and the centrifugal force; (v) adding an excipient material to the okra mucilage liquid concentrate; (vi) homogenizing, by stirring, a mixture comprising the okra mucilage liquid concentrate and, optionally, the added excipient material; (vii) heat treating or sterilizing the mixture; and (viii) adjusting, by (a) dilution or (b) evaporation under partial vacuum, an okra mucilage concentration in the heat treated or sterilized mixture to a relaxation time of at least 10 milliseconds, preferably between 50 milliseconds and 400 milliseconds, and most preferably between 100 milliseconds and 200 milliseconds, the relaxation time measured from a filament formed from the mixture in a Capillary Breakup Extensional Rheometer (CaBER) at 20°C.
2. The method of Claim 1, further comprising:

title: Compositions for use in the prevention or treatment of necrotizing enterocolitis in infants or young children born by C-section
abstract: The present invention relates to a composition comprising at least one human milk oligosaccharide and/or a precursor thereof, for use in preventing and/or treating necrotizing enterocolitis in infants or young children born by C-section.
claims:
1. A method for achieving at least one result selected from the group consisting of improving gut protection against microbial and pathogen overgrowth, promoting gut development and maturation, decreasing gut inflammation, and promoting enteral feeding tolerance, in an infant or young child born by C-section, the method comprising:
administering an effective amount of a composition comprising a mixture of human milk oligosaccharides to the infant or young child born by C-section,
the mixture comprising:
2′-fucosyllactose (2FL) that is 60 to 70 wt. % of the mixture of human milk oligosaccharides;
lacto-N-tetraose (LNT) and lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT) that are 20 to 30 wt. % of the mixture of human milk oligosaccharides and in a ratio of LNT:LNnT between 2:1 and 1:1; and
6′ sialyllactose (6SL) that is 10 to 20 wt. % of the mixture of human milk oligosaccharides,
wherein the composition does not contain any galactooligosaccharides (GOS) other than the LNT and the LNnT.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the ratio of LNT:LNnT is between 2:1.2 and 2:1.6.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the ratio of LNT:LNnT is 1.3:1.
4. The method according to claim 1, wherein the infant or young child is a preterm infant bo

title: Mimicking health benefits of physical exercise in cats
abstract: A method of mimicking health benefits of physical exercise in a cat can include administering a high protein diet to a cat, the high protein diet including from about 110% to about 350% of a Recommended Daily Allowance (RD A) of protein for the cat on a daily basis. The high protein diet in this example is sufficient to increase a 12,13-diHOME blood level for an 18-24 hour period per day compared to a baseline blood level without the need for physical exercise.
claims:
19396 CLAIMS What Is Claimed Is:
1. A method of mimicking health benefits of physical exercise in a cat, comprising administering a high protein diet to a cat, the high protein diet including from about 110% to about 350% of a Recommended Daily Allowance (RDA) of protein for the cat on a daily basis, wherein the high protein diet is sufficient to increase a 12,13-diHOME blood level for an 18-24 hour period per day compared to a baseline blood level without the need for physical exercise.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the high protein diet includes from about 150% to about 250% of the RDA of protein and the 12,13-diHOME blood level is increased by at least 2-fold over the 18-24 hour period compared to the baseline blood level.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the 12,13-diHOME blood level is higher over the 18-24 hour period compared to the baseline blood level without the cat engaging in physical exercise.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the RDA of protein for the cat is 26 wt% based on 100% of a MER for the cat, and wherein the high protein diet includes administering a cat food on a daily basis containing from about 30 wt% to about 75 wt% protein calculated based on the 100% of the MER for the cat.
5. The method of claim 4, further comprising administering a decreased caloric intake diet having from about 50% to about 95% of the MER for the cat, wherein the cat food still includes an equivalent of the about 40 wt% to about 75 wt% protein calculated

title: Anti-inflammatory phytonutrients for use in the treatment or prevention of synovitis
abstract: Compositions for treatment or prevention of synovitis contain a therapeutically effective amount of at least one of oleuropein, rutin or curcumin and preferably contain at least oleuropin. Methods for treatment or prevention of synovitis include administering such compositions. The compositions can additionally include one or more of quercetin, hydroxytyrosol or vitamin D.
claims:
1: A method of treating or preventing synovitis, the method comprising administering to an individual having or at risk of the synovitis a composition comprising a therapeutically effective amount of oleuropein, hydroxytyrosol and vitamin D.
2: The method of claim 1, wherein the synovitis is associated with a condition selected from the group consisting of lupus, gout, arthritis and combinations thereof.
3: The method of claim 2, wherein the condition is arthritis that is selected from the group consisting of rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, osteochondritis disease, osteoarthrosis and a combination thereof.
4: The method of claim 1, wherein the composition further comprises at least one of quercetin, rutin, curcumin and combinations thereof.
5: The method of claim 1, wherein the oleuropein is isolated from a plant extract.
6: The method ofclaim 1, wherein the individual is selected from the group consisting of an aging human and an elderly human.
7: The method of claim 1, wherein the composition is administered daily for at least one month.
8: A composition for treating or preventing synovitis, the composition comprising a therapeutically e

title: Capsule system with recognition means and adaptable opening and injection mechanism
abstract: The invention relates to a beverage preparation device (100) for preparing a beverage upon interaction of ingredients provided in a capsule (5) with liquid supplied thereto, the device comprising an injection module (10) comprising a first (1) and a cooperating second enclosing member (2) designed for being moved relatively to each other, the first enclosing member being equipped with capsule opening and injection means (3) for opening a first inlet face (5a) of a capsule (5) and inject liquid into the capsule, the first and second enclosing member (1,2) being designed for being brought into at least a first capsule insertion position for inserting a capsule between the enclosing members (1,2) and a second capsule enclosing position in which the opening and injection means (3) engage the liquid inlet face (5a) of the capsule (5), the device (100) further comprising control means (13) designed for setting at least the capsule enclosing position based on information read from the capsule and/or based on information provided by a user input.
claims:
1. A beverage preparation device for preparing a beverage upon interaction of ingredients provided in a capsule with liquid supplied thereto, the device comprising: an injection module comprising a first and a cooperating second enclosing member designed for being moved relatively to each other, the first enclosing member being equipped with capsule opening and injection means for opening a first inlet face of a capsule and injecting liquid into the capsule, the first and second enclosing member being designed for being brought into at least a first capsule insertion position for inserting a capsule between the enclosing members and a second capsule enclosing position in which the opening and injection means engage the liquid inlet face of the capsule, the device further comprising control means designed for adapting the capsule enclosing position adjusting a distance between the respective first and second enclosing members to the capsule inserted to the device based on information read from the capsule and/or based on information provided by a user input.
2. The device according to claim 1, wherein the control means are designed for adapting the enclosing position during a beverage preparation process with a capsule in the device based on information read from the capsule and/or based on information provided by a user input.
3. The device according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the control means are designed for adapting a penetration depth of the opening and injection means into the capsule at least in the capsule enclosing position. 2019373665   10 Feb 2025

title: Process for the production of a container for the preparation of a beverage in a beverage preparation device and a container obtained by said process
abstract: The present invention concerns a process for producing a container for the preparation of a beverage in a beverage preparation device, comprising the steps of: a. providing a water injection wall (3) of said, b. providing a beverage delivery wall (4) of said container, wherein at least one, preferably both, of said injection and delivery walls (3, 4) has a cup shape, c. placing a beverage ingredient body in said at least one cup shaped wall (4), d. sealing together edge portions (3A, 4A) of said injection and delivery walls (4, 3) in a sealing station, such as to form a chamber (1), wherein said sealing station comprise a housing element having a housing temperature (Th), wherein said body (2) is shaped and dimensioned such as not to completely fill said chamber (1), said process being characterized in that, after the sealing step, the container is cooled to a cooling temperature (Tc) being either: —at least 15° C. lower than the temperature of the housing, or—comprised between −10° C. and +25° C.
claims:

title: Coffee beverage product and method for production thereof
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: inventions group relates to coffee industry. Disclosed is a coffee beverage product containing from 1 wt.% to 25 wt.% of coffee solids; 1–11 wt.% of milk protein; 0.01–3 wt.% of galactose; 0.5–15 wt.% of galactooligosaccharide; 0.01–4.5 wt.% of lactose and 0.01–3 wt.% of glucose; all weight percentage in terms of dry substance. Additionally, one describes a method for production of such a coffee drinking product.EFFECT: group of inventions allows to reduce the quantity of sugar in the product while replacing it with a more useful ingredient, that is galactooligosaccharide, while preserving an acceptable taste, texture and sweetness.8 cl, 3 tbl, 3 ex
claims:
1. Кофейный питьевой продукт, содержащий от 1 до 25 мас.% твёрдых веществ кофе; 1-11 мас.% молочного белка; 0,01-3 мас.% галактозы; 0,5-15 мас.% галактоолигосахарида; 0,01-4,5 мас.% лактозы и 0,01-3 мас.% глюкозы; всё весовое процентное содержание в пересчёте на сухое вещество.
2. Кофейный питьевой продукт по п. 1, содержащий вспенивающий ингредиент.
3. Кофейный питьевой продукт по п. 1 или 2, в котором продукт представляет собой готовый к употреблению продукт или порошкообразный продукт из кофейных смесей.
4. Кофейный питьевой продукт по любому из предшествующих пунктов, в котором твёрдые вещества кофе представляют собой порошкообразный высушенный водный экстракт обжаренного и молотого кофе.
5. Способ получения кофейного питьевого продукта по любому из предшествующих пунктов, включающий стадии обеспечения ферментативно обработанного бета-галактозидазой сухого молока и смешивания упомянутого сухого молока с твёрдыми веществами кофе.
6. Способ по п. 5, в котором ферментативно обработанное бета-галактозидазой молоко содержит 2-5 мас.% лактозы; 10-13 мас.% глюкозы; 1-4 мас.% галактозы и 28-33 мас.% галактоолигосахарида; всё весовое процентное содержание в пересчёте на сухое вещество.
7. Способ по п. 5 или 6, в котором молоко представляет собой цельное молоко или обезжиренное молоко.
8. Способ по любому из пп. 5-7, в котором ферментативно обработанное бета-галактозидазой молоко находится в форме порошка.

title: Large donut-shaped dry kibble for small adult dogs
abstract: Methods for feeding small adult dogs include dispensing a serving of dry kibble to a small adult dog weighing less than about 11 kg, wherein from about 20% to 100% of individual dry kibble pieces of the serving can be donut-shaped and have an average inner-hole diameter from about 3 mm to about 8 mm and are about 8 mm to about 2 cm in average diameter. The dry kibble can also have an average thickness from about 8 mm to about 2 cm.
claims:
1. A method of feeding a small adult dog, comprising dispensing a serving of dry kibble to a small adult dog weighing up to about 11 kg, wherein from about 20% to 100% of individual dry kibble pieces of the serving are donut-shaped having an average inner-hole diameter from about 3 mm to about 8 mm, wherein the individual dry kibble pieces of the serving are about 8 mm to about 2 cm in average diameter and about 8 mm to about 2 cm in average thickness.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the average diameter is from about 1.1 cm to about 2 cm.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the average diameter is from about 1.4 cm to about 2 cm.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the average thickness is from about 1.1 cm to about 1.8 cm.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the dry kibble has a moisture content from about 4 wt % to about 10 wt %.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the dry kibble has a stiffness from about 40 N/mm to about 120 N/mm.
7. The method of claim 1, wherein after dispensing the serving and the small adult dog begins feeding on the dry kibble, from about 45% to about 75% of the first three minutes of feeding on average includes chew time.
8. The method of claim 1,

title: Beverage preparation system
abstract: The invention concerns a beverage production system comprising a pack (10) comprising two holes and a module (1) for producing a beverage from said pack,—said module (1) comprising: a movable fluid processing device (11) to introduce a fluid in said pack and to dispense a beverage from the pack, and. a pack holder assembly (2) comprising a pack chamber (22) and a movable locking device (24) configured to move between:—a first fixing position wherein said locking device interacts with and locks the pack (10) received in the chamber inside the pack holder assembly, and,—a second release position wherein said locking device does not interact with the pack (10) received in the chamber, and said movable locking device (24) comprising two pins (242) configured to fit in the holes (103) of the pack in the first fixing position.
claims:
1. A beverage production system comprising a pack and a module for producing a beverage from said pack,
said pack comprising an ingredient, said ingredient being configured to be mixed with a fluid to produce a beverage,
said pack presenting a plane shape oriented along a plane and comprising two longitudinal plane walls extending along this plane, and
the bottom side of said pack being configured for being openable, and
wherein said pack comprises at least two holes and/or deformable areas,
said module comprising:
a movable fluid processing device configured to cooperate with the bottom of the pack to introduce a fluid in said pack and to dispense a beverage from the pack, and
a pack holder assembly, said pack holder assembly comprising a pack chamber and a movable locking device wherein:
the pack chamber is adapted for receiving said pack through an upper pack inlet and for holding said pack so that the plane of the plane shape is oriented in an essentially vertical position inside the module, and
said chamber presenting a bottom opening configured to enable access of the movable fluid processing device to at least the bottom side of said pack hold in the chamber, and
the movable locking device is configured to move between:
a first fixing position wherein

title: Fermented beverage composition comprising nuts, optionally seeds, and legume
abstract: The invention relates to a fermented plant-based beverage composition comprising nuts, optionally seeds, and legumes, the nuts, optionally seeds and legumes present 25 to 50 wt. % of the total solids in the beverage composition, at least 50 wt. % of the nuts are roasted, preferably least 50 wt. % of the nuts and optionally seeds are roasted, and at least 50 wt. % of the nuts and seeds are milled wholesome nuts and seeds, and wherein the beverage composition being fermented with strains comprising lactic acid bacteria 1) Lactobacillus delbrueckii subsp. bulgaricus and 2) Streptococcus thermophilus, and having a pH of 4.0 to 5.5, preferably a pH of 4.2-4.5. The invention also relates to a process of making such a beverage.
claims:
1. A fermented plant-based beverage composition comprising nuts and legumes, the nuts and legumes present 25 to 50 wt. % of the total solids in the beverage composition, at least 50 wt. % of the nuts are roasted, and at least 50 wt. % of the nuts, and wherein the beverage composition being fermented with strains comprising lactic acid bacteria 1) Lactobacillus delbrueckii subsp. bulgaricus and 2) Streptococcus thermophilus, and having a pH of 4.0 to 5.5, preferably a pH of 4.2-4.5.
2. A fermented beverage composition according to claim 1, comprising 5-20 wt. % total solids (TS).
3. A fermented beverage composition according to claim 1, wherein the fermented beverage composition comprises 0.5-3 wt. % legumes.
4. A fermented beverage composition according to claim 1, wherein the legumes are selected from the group consisting of pea, soy, faba, chickpea and a combination thereof, wherein the legumes are preferably in the form of protein isolates or concentrates.
5. A fermented beverage composition according to claim 1, wherein nuts are present in amounts of 1 to 6 wt. %.
6. A fermented beverage composition according to claim 1, comprising

title: Natural hydrocolloid systems for pet food compositions, pet food compositions comprising same, and preparations thereof
abstract: A natural hydrocolloid system can be used in, e.g., pet food compositions. Another aspect of the present disclosure is pet food compositions comprising such a natural hydrocolloid system, and preparation methods thereof. The hydrocolloid system can use blends of fruit fibers, such as citrus and apple fibers, and/or plant-based polysaccharides, such as psyllium, okra, chia, flaxseed, or seaweed; and can provide a gravy and even a jelly with functionalities comparable to the existing gravies. The blends can replace currently used hydrocolloids and can be used in new recipes with natural and clean labels.
claims:
1. A pet food composition comprising:
a gravy or jelly comprising a hydrocolloid system, the hydrocolloid system comprising a fruit fiber and further comprising a plant-based polysaccharide; and
food chunks dispersed in the gravy or jelly,
wherein the gravy or jelly is from about 55 wt % to about 65 wt % of the pet food composition, and the food chunks are from about 35 wt % to about 45 wt % of the pet food composition,
wherein the hydrocolloid system further comprises a calcium source at a concentration of the calcium source in the gravy or jelly from about 0.1 wt % to about 1 wt %.
2. The pet food composition of 1, wherein the gravy or jelly is about 60 wt % of the pet food composition, and the food chunks are about 40 wt % of the pet food composition.
3. The pet food composition of claim 1, wherein the food chunks comprise an ingredient selected from the group consisting of meat, gluten, a vegetable protein source, and mixtures thereof.
4. The pet food composition of claim 1, wherein the fruit fiber comprises at least one of citrus fiber or apple fiber.
5. The pet food composition of claim 1, wherein the plant-based polysaccharide comprises at least one of psyllium, okra, seaweed, chia, flaxseed, or combinations thereof.

title: Biodegradable capsule with integrated opening means
abstract: FIELD: beverage preparation devices.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to a capsule for preparing a beverage by injecting a fluid into a closed chamber for accommodating a substance for preparing the beverage. Invention also relates to a method of producing capsule (100). Capsule (100) for preparing a beverage comprises body (200) which defines closed chamber (210) for placing a substance for preparing a beverage by injecting a fluid medium into chamber (210). Capsule body (200) comprises retaining wall (220) defining a portion of chamber (210). Capsule (100) further comprises device (300) for opening closed chamber (210). At that, opening device (300) and retaining wall (220) are located relative to each other so that engagement between retaining wall (220) and opening device (300) is performed under action of injected fluid medium pressure, increasing in closed chamber (210), for opening of closed chamber (210). Capsule body (200) with its support wall (220), as well as opening device (300) are made of a biodegradable material.EFFECT: providing the capsule with a self-opening mechanism that is built into the capsule and is made from biodegradable and/or suitable for composting materials, which simplifies and improves recycling of the capsule after use.14 cl, 4 dwg

title: Dietary butyrate for treating or preventing an allergic disorder
abstract: A compound having the formula or combinations thereof, for use in the treatment or prevention of an allergic disorder, wherein R1, R2, R3, R4, R5 and R6 are independently, a long chain fatty acid having between 16 and 20 carbons.
claims:
1. A method of treating or preventing an allergic disorder in a subject, the method comprising administering to the subject an infant formula comprising a compound having the formula or combinations thereof, wherein R1, R2, R3, R4, R5 and R6 are independently, a long chain fatty acid having between 16 and 20 carbons, wherein the infant formula further comprises a protein source, a carbohydrate source and a lipid source.
2. A method of manufacturing an infant formula for treating or preventing an allergic disorder, the method comprising mixing a protein source, a carbohydrate source, a lipid source and a compound having the formula

title: Enhanced molded fiber capsules for food and beverage preparation
abstract: The invention relates to a packaging article (1) comprising a three-dimensional body (2) made of a rigid or semi-rigid moulded fibrous pulp, said body forming compartments for enclosing the product and being adapted to be closed by closing means, characterised in that said body (2) further comprises a reinforcing mesh (7) at least partially embedded in a block of fibrous pulp, said reinforcing mesh (7) being made of a rigid or semi-rigid moulded fibrous pulp. The web (7) comprises a fiber selected from the group consisting of natural plant fibers, animal fibers, biopolymer synthetic fibers or a combination thereof, the fiber being impregnated with a dried water-soluble biopolymer, a dried water-soluble compostable polymer, a dried starch-based solution or a combination thereof, or the fiber being impregnated with a solidified polypeptide.
claims:
1.包装物品(1)，所述包装物品包括由刚性或半刚性模制纤维浆料制成的三维主体(2)，所述主体形成用于包封产品的隔室并且被适配为由封闭装置(5)封闭，其特征在于，所述主体(2)还包括至少部分地嵌入到纤维浆料的块体中的增强刚性网(7)，所述网(7)包含选自以下列表的纤维：天然植物纤维、动物纤维、生物聚合物合成纤维或其组合，所述纤维浸渍有干燥的水溶性生物聚合物、干燥的水溶性可堆肥聚合物、干燥的基于淀粉的溶液或其组合，或所述纤维浸渍有固化的多肽。
2.根据前一权利要求1所述的包装物品(1)，所述包装物品还包括附接到所述纤维浆料主体(2)的内表面的多层膜内衬(3)。
3.根据前述权利要求1或2中任一项所述的包装物品(1)，其中所述内衬(3)从外到内包括：
(i)最外侧聚合物层，所述最外侧聚合物层包含选自以下列表的生物可降解聚合物：聚琥珀酸丁二醇酯(PBSA/bioPBS)、聚己二酸对苯二甲酸丁二醇酯(PBAT)、淀粉、纤维素衍生物、聚乳酸(PLA)、聚羟基烷酸酯(PHA)或其组合，所述最外层具有在10μm与100μm之间的厚度，并且所述第一层具有在10％与800％之间的断裂伸长率、当在150℃下在2.16kg的压力下在10分钟内测量时在2与4之间的熔体流动速率(MFR)，并且所述第一层具有低于80℃的熔点温度，
(ii)第一接合层，所述第一接合层包含生物可降解的改性或官能化的聚烯烃，具有在180℃与230℃之间的熔点温度和在1μm与12μm之间的厚度，
(iii)阻隔层，所述阻隔层包含选自以下列表的聚合物：丁烯二醇乙烯醇共聚物(BVOH)、聚乙烯醇(PVOH)或其组合，并且具有在180℃与230℃之间的熔点温度和在1μm与15μm之间的厚度，
(iv)第二接合层，所述第二接合层包含生物可降解的改性或官能化的聚烯烃，具有在180℃与230℃之间的熔点温度和在1μm与10μm
之间的厚度，
(v)最内侧聚合物层，所述最内侧聚合物层包含选自以下列表的生物可降解聚合物：聚琥珀酸丁二醇酯(PBSA)、聚己二酸对苯二甲酸丁二醇酯(PBAT)、淀粉、纤维素衍生物、聚乳酸
(PLA)、聚羟基烷酸酯(PHA)或其组合，所述第一层具有在
10μm与100μm之间的厚度，并且所述最内层具有在10％与1000％之间的断裂伸长率、当在190℃下在2.16kg的压力下在10分钟内测量时在4与10之间的熔体流动速率(MFR)，并且所述第一层具有在110℃与180℃之间的熔点温度。
4.根据前述权利要求1或2中任一项所述的包装物品(1)，其中所述内衬(3)从外到内包括：

title: Moulded pulp article
abstract: The present invention relates to a method of producing a moulded pulp article (1), the method comprising: a) applying a composite phase (2) to the pulp (3), the composite phase (2) comprising precursor particles (4); b) shaping the pulp (3); and c) converting the composite phase (2) to a ceramic coating (5) by heating the composite phase; and moulded pulp articles.

title: Wet pet food systems
abstract: The present disclosure is drawn to wet pet food systems and methods of packaging wet pet foods. The wet pet food systems include a sealed pouch constructed of a monomaterial of polypropylene and a wet pet food contained within the sealed pouch. The wet pet food can include a member selected from the group consisting of a mousse, a chunk-in-loaf, and chunks-in-gravy. The wet pet food includes an antioxidant including a soy sauce.
claims:
1. A wet pet food system, comprising:
a sealed pouch constructed of a monomaterial of polypropylene; and
a wet pet food contained within the sealed pouch, the wet pet food including a member selected from the group consisting of a mousse, a chunk-in-loaf, and chunks-in-gravy, wherein the wet pet food comprises an antioxidant including a soy sauce.
2. The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the sealed pouch is recyclable.
3. The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the sealed pouch is constructed of a monolayer of polypropylene.
4. The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the sealed pouch is more permeable to oxygen and water than an aluminum barrier pouch.
5. The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the soy sauce is included in the wet pet food at from about 0.1 wt % to about 3 wt % based on a dehydrated soy sauce weight of a total weight of the wet pet food.
6. The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the soy sauce is added to the wet pet food at from about 0.25 wt % to about 2 wt % based on a dehydrated soy sauce weight of a total weight of the wet pet food.
7. The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the wet pet food includes fr

title: Method for roasting coffee beans
abstract: The invention concerns an apparatus for roasting coffee beans comprising : - a vessel (1) to contain coffee beans, - an electrical heating device (13) to heat coffee beans contained in the vessel, - at least one temperature sensor (23) to measure temperature in the vessel, - a control system (180) operable to control the heating device, wherein the control system is configured to : - apply a roasting recipe dedicated to the roasting of partially pre- roasted beans comprising at least a temperature versus time profile by controlling the electrical heating device based on the measure of the temperature sensor, - detect a decrease of the consumption of electrical power of the heating device in function of time, - stop heating if no decrease of the consumption of electrical power happens after a set reference time ti. - continue or stop the electrical heating device depending on the type of identified beans.
claims:
1. An apparatus for roasting coffee beans comprising : - a vessel to contain coffee beans, 5   - an electrical heating device to heat coffee beans contained in the vessel, - at least one temperature sensor to measure temperature in the vessel, - a control system operable to control the heating device, wherein the control system is configured to : - apply a roasting recipe dedicated to the roasting of partially pre-roasted beans comprising 0 at least a temperature versus time profile by controlling at least the electrical heating device based on the measure of the temperature sensor, - detect a decrease of the consumption of electrical power of the heater in function of time, - stop heating if no decrease of the consumption of electrical power happens after a set reference time ti. 5
2. The apparatus according to Claim 1, wherein the control system is configured to measure at least one electrical parameter representative of the consumption of electrical power by the heating device during the time the roasting recipe is applied, :0   
3. The apparatus according to Claim 2, wherein the electrical parameter representative of the consumption of electrical power is the current of the electrical heating device.
4. The apparatus according to any one of Claims 1 to 3, wherein

title: Edible plant-based pastes for preparing dairy analogues
abstract: The invention relates an edible plant-based paste that can be reconstituted into an aqueous liquid to form a plant-based dairy analogue, preferably a plant-based dairy drink analogue. Said edible plant-based paste comprises i) at least one fat component, ii) at least one non-soy grain component having a protein content of less than 28wt.% and iii) at least one protein component having a protein content of more than 30wt.%. The invention also relates to a process for manufacturing such an edible plant-based paste and to a method for preparing a plant-based dairy analogue by reconstituting such an edible plant-based paste in an aqueous liquid.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. An edible plant-based paste which comprises: - at least one fat component, - at least one non-soy grain component having a protein content of less than 28wt.%, - at least one protein component having a protein content of more than 30wt.%, wherein the protein component is different from the non-soy grain component, - optionally, at least one sugar component, preferably sucrose, and - optionally, at least one hydrocolloid.
2. The edible plant-based paste according to claim 1, wherein the non-soy grain component is provided as a non-soy grain flour.
3. The edible plant-based paste according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the non-soy grain component, preferably non-soy grain flour, comes from a grain selected from legumes, nuts, oilseeds, cereals and combination thereof.
4. The edible plant-based paste according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the non-soy grain component, preferably non-soy grain flour, comes from cereal, preferably comes from oat.
5. The edible plant-based paste according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the non-soy grain component, preferably non-soy grain flour, is fully or partially hydrolysed.
6. The edible plant-based paste according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the non-soy grain component has protein content of less than 25wt.%, prefera

title: Method for detecting and/or quantifying mood disorder and/or improvements of the mood disorder status using conjugated bile acids as biomarker and improved methods and compositions thereof
abstract: The present invention relates to the use of glycine-conjugated bile acids as biomarker for detecting and/or quantifying improvements of the mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction of a subject. It also relates to a method for detecting and/or quantifying mood disorder, improvements of the mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction of a subject, in particular for monitoring the progress of an intervention to treat or ameliorate a mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction in a subject, wherein the intervention comprises the administration of a probiotic. It also relates to an improved method to treat or ameliorate a mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction in a subject in need, comprising administering to the subject, an effective amount of a composition combining a probiotic with glycine or derivative thereof.
claims:
1-2. (canceled)
3. Method for detecting and/or quantifying mood disorder, improvements of the mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction of a subject, comprising assessing the level of at least one conjugated bile acid in a body sample obtained from a subject to be tested, and comparing the subject's conjugated bile acid level to a predetermined reference value, wherein: i) an increased level of conjugated bile acid cholic acid (CA) and/or chenodeoxycholic acid (CDCA), in the sample compared to the predetermined reference value and/or ii) a decreased level of conjugated bile acid ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA), in the sample compared to the predetermined reference value, indicates an improvement of the mood disorder status and/or excessive emotional reaction of the subject.
4. The method according to claim 3, wherein the mood disorder is mild to severe.
5. The method according to claim 3, wherein the predetermined reference value was obtained previously from the same subject.
6. The method according to claim 3, wherein the predetermined reference value is based on an average conjugated bile acids level in the same body fluid in a control population.
7. The method according to claim 3, wherein the levels of the biomarkers in the sample and in the reference are determined by mass spectrometry, according to by ultra-performance liquid
