title: Combination of isoflavone source and at least one natural extract for treating, preventing or supporting improvement of cognitive symptoms associated with menopause
abstract: The invention relates to a method for treating or preventing cognitive menopause symptoms. The method comprises administering to a human female suffering from or at risk of the cognitive menopause symptom an effective amount of an isoflavone source in combination with at least one of a natural extract for supporting cognitive performance and a natural extract for promoting calm and alleviating tension. The combination may be administered in a composition further comprising one or more of vitamin B12, vitamin B6, vitamin B complex, iron, magnesium, and/or a freshener/cooling agent. A single or multiple doses of the composition may be administered per day, the multiple doses including a first dose and a second dose. A first dose may be administered to the human female in the morning and a second dose may be administered to the human female at night.
claims:
1.组合物，所述组合物包含异黄酮来源与用于支持认知表现的天然提取物和用于促进平静和减轻紧张的天然提取物中的至少一种的组合。
2.根据权利要求1所述的组合物，其中所述组合物为单位剂型，所述单位剂型包含有效治疗或预防认知性绝经症状的量的所述组合物。
3.根据权利要求1或权利要求2所述的组合物，其中所述组合物是严格素食的。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述异黄酮来源选自大豆提取物、红三叶草提取物及其组合。
5.根据权利要求1至4中任一项所述的组合物，其中用于促进平静和减轻紧张的所述天然提取物选自柠檬香蜂草提取物、春黄菊提取物、茴香提取物、南非醉茄提取物及其组合。
6.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的组合物，其中用于支持认知表现的所述天然提取物选自人参提取物和绿茶提取物。
7.根据权利要求1至6中任一项所述的组合物，所述组合物还包含选自菊粉、胶原、胶原肽、低聚果糖及其组合的附加成分。
8.用于治疗或预防认知性绝经症状的方法，所述方法包括向有需要或处于风险中的人类女性施用有效量的异黄酮来源与用于支持认知表现的天然提取物和用于促进平静和减轻紧张的天然提取物中的至少一种的组合。
9.根据权利要求8所述的方法，其中所述异黄酮来源包括红三叶草提取物。
10.根据权利要求8或权利要求9所述的方法，其中所述组合包含用于支持认知表现的天然提取物，其中所述用于支持认知表现的天然提取物包含人参提取物并且以包含含有至少12mg人参皂苷的量的所述人参提取物的剂量施用于所述有需要或处于风险中的人类女性。
11.根据权利要求8至10中任一项所述的方法，其中所述组合包含用于促进平静和减轻紧张的天然提取物，其中所述用于促进平静和减轻紧张的天然提取物包含柠檬香蜂草提取物并且以包含含有至少18mg迷迭香酸的量的所述柠檬香蜂草提取物的剂量施用于所述有需要或处于风险中的人类女性。
12.根据权利要求8至11中任一项所述的方法，其中所述组合以组合物施用，所述组合物还包含选自维生素B12、维生素B6、镁及其组合的一种或多种维生素和矿物质。
13.根据权利要求8至12中任一项所述的方法，其中所述认知性绝经症状选自潮热、夜间盗汗、睡眠障碍、疲劳、紧张、焦虑、注意力障碍、记忆损害及其组合。
14.根据权利要求8至13中任一项所述的方法，其中所述组合以组合物施用，所述组合物还包含清新剂。
15.根据权利要求8至14中任一项所述的方法，其中每天施用单个剂量的所述组合物。
16.根据权利要求8至15中任一项所述的方法，其中每天施用多个剂量的所述组合物，所述多个剂量包括其中所述组合包含第一异黄酮来源和用于支持认知表现的天然提取物的第一剂量，所述多个剂量还包括其中所述组合包含第二异黄酮来源和用于促进平静和减轻紧张的天然提取物的第二剂量，并且所述第二剂量与

title: Compositions and methods using a combination of oleuropein and fisetin for use in cartilage degeneration
abstract: The present invention relates to use of a composition comprising an effective amount of a combination of oleuropein and/or metabolite thereof and fisetin and/or derivative for maintenance of joint health or prevention or treatment of joint disorders in an individual. In particular, the invention relates to a composition comprising an effective amount of a combination of oleuropein and/or metabolite thereof and fisetin and/or derivative for use to prevent or treat cartilage degeneration in an individual.
claims:
1. Method for use to prevent or treat cartilage degeneration in an individual comprising administering a composition comprising an effective amount of a combination of oleuropein and/or metabolite thereof and fisetin and/or derivative to an individual in need thereof.
2. Method according to claim 1, wherein the metabolite of oleuropein is selected from the group consisting of oleuropein aglycone, hydroxytyrosol, elenolic acid, homovanillyl alcohol, isohomovanillyl alcohol, glucuronidated forms thereof, sulfated forms thereof, derivatives thereof, and mixtures thereof.
3. Method according to claim 1, wherein the metabolite of fisetin is selected from the group consisting of glucuronidated forms thereof, sulfated forms thereof, derivatives and mixtures thereof.
4. Method according to claim 1, further comprising calcium.
5. Method according to claim 1, wherein the composition further comprises at least one compound selected from the group consisting of antioxidants, anti-inflammatory compounds, glycosaminoglycans, prebiotics, fibres, probiotics, fatty acids, enzymes, minerals, trace elements and/or vitamins.
6. Method according to claim 1, wherein the composition is selected from the group consisting of food compositions, dietary supplements, nutritional compositions, oral nutritional supplement, medical food, nutraceuticals, beverages, powdered nutritional products to be reconstituted in water or milk before consumption, food additives, food for special medical purpose (FSMP) medicaments, d

title: Nutritional composition for promoting social development
abstract: The present invention relates to a nutritional composition comprising lactoferrin as an active ingredient for use in promoting social development and/or in promoting social behaviours in a young individual. The present invention further relates to uses and methods for promoting social development and/or for promoting social behaviours in a young individual.
claims:
CLAIMS
1 . A composition comprising lactoferrin as an active ingredient in effective amount for use in promoting social development in a young individual.
2. The composition according to claim 1 , wherein lactoferrin is comprised at amount ranging from at least about 190 ng/pL to at least about 5050 ng/pL.
3. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, for use in promoting behaviours in social interactions, such as play, and/or in response to novelty and/or new situations and/or with new people/strangers in the young individual.
4. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, for use in promoting surgency and/or extraversion in the young individual.
5. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the young individual is an infant, a toddler or a young child, preferably an infant.
6. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein it is administered to the young individual from birth to about 5 years of age, preferably from birth to 18 weeks of age, more preferably during the first 6 weeks of life of the young individual.
7. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein social development is promoted in a young individual from birth to about 5 years of age, preferably from birth to 18 months of age, more preferably from about 2 to abo

title: Manufacturing process and manufacturing line for manufacturing an engraved cellulose-based container
abstract: The invention relates to a manufacturing process for producing a biodegradable, preferably compostable, single-use food and/or beverage containers (1) for use in a beverage production machine, on a single-use container manufacturing line (20), the manufacturing process comprising: a) supplying a cellulose-based container body (2) having an external surface and an outwardly extending peripheral rim (6), b) filing the container body (2) with a food and/or beverage ingredient (10), c) applying a closing element (7) over the container body (2), d) sealing the closing element (7) with the peripheral rim (6) of the container body (2), According to the invention, the manufacturing process further comprises a step of marking (a1) the container body (2) on its external surface by printing and/or by laser engraving, said marking step taking place before the step of filling the container body (step b) with the food and/or beverage ingredient. The invention also relates to a manufacturing line to implement the proposed manufacturing process and to a single-use food and/or beverage containers produced using the proposed manufacturing process.
claims:
Claims
1. Manufacturing process for producing a biodegradable, preferably compostable, single-use food and/or beverage containers (1) for use in a beverage production machine, on a single-use container manufacturing line (20), the manufacturing process comprising: a) supplying a cellulose-based container body (2) having an external surface and an outwardly extending peripheral rim (6), b) filing the container body (2) with a food and/or beverage ingredient (10), c) applying a closing element (7) over the container body (2), d) sealing the closing element (7) with the peripheral rim (6) of the container body (2), characterized in that the manufacturing process further comprises a step of marking (al) the container body (2) on its external surface by printing and/or by laser engraving, said marking step taking place before the step of filling the container body (step b) with the food and/or beverage ingredient.
2. Manufacturing process according to claim 1, wherein during the marking step (al), the container body (2) is marked by printing and/or laser engraving in one or more locations of the container body (2).
3. Manufacturing process according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the closing element of the container (1) is a closing membrane (7a) or a second container body (7b) respectively forming when sealed with the peripheral rim (6) of the container body (2), a capsule (la) or a pod (lb).
4. Manufacturing process according to any one of claims 1 to 3, in which, when the container is a capsule (la),

title: Capsules, systems, and methods for delivering follicular coffee extract
abstract: The present invention relates to a capsule for preparing a follicular coffee extract, the capsule comprising: a substantially rigid capsule body having a peripheral side wall extending around an interior space of the capsule; a base wall covering the interior space at a first end of the sidewall; a flange circumferentially arranged at a second end of the sidewall of the base body; a cover removably attached to the flange and covering the internal space at a second end of the side wall opposite the base wall and tightly enclosing the capsule; and a filter element positioned in the interior space of the capsule between the beverage ingredient and the lid, where the interior space of the capsule is at least partially filled with ground coffee, preferably baked and ground coffee, the particle size distribution D4 of the baked and ground coffee, 3 is 500 [mu] m +/-30 [mu] m and the fraction of fine particles in the roasted and ground coffee is between 2% and 9%. The invention also relates to a system comprising said capsule, to the use of said capsule or said system and to a method for delivering a follicular coffee extract.
claims:
1.用于制备滤泡型咖啡萃取物的胶囊，所述胶囊包括
-大体刚性的胶囊主体，所述胶囊主体具有围绕所述胶囊的内部空间延伸的周向侧壁；
-基壁，所述基壁在所述侧壁的第一端部处覆盖所述内部空间；
-凸缘，所述凸缘在所述胶囊主体的所述侧壁的第二端部处周向地布置；
-盖，所述盖以可移除方式附接到所述凸缘，并且在所述侧壁的与所述基壁相对的第二端部处覆盖所述内部空间并且紧密地封闭所述胶囊；和
-过滤元件，所述过滤元件在所述胶囊的所述内部空间中定位在所述饮料成分与所述盖之间，
其中所述胶囊的所述内部空间至少部分地填充有研磨咖啡，优选地为烘焙并且研磨的咖啡，所述烘焙并且研磨的咖啡的粒度分布D4,3为500微米+/-30微米并且细微粒子在所述烘焙并且研磨的咖啡中的分数为2％和9％之间。
2.根据权利要求1所述的胶囊，其中所述细微粒子具有小于50微米的平均直径。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的胶囊，其中所述胶囊内的所述研磨咖啡的量在4克和5.5克之间。
4.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中所述胶囊中的所述研磨咖啡具有380g/l至450g/l之间的密度。
5.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中对于150mL的咖啡萃取物体积，所述咖啡萃取物在小于40s的流动时间内递送，不考虑可能的后续萃取之间的任何重新启动时间。
6.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中所述胶囊内的所述研磨咖啡在2巴至6巴的压力下萃取。
7.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中所述胶囊在使用前具有5毫巴至100毫巴之间的内部压力。
8.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中包括多个预成形出口开口的承载盘设置在所述盖和所述过滤元件之间。
9.根据权利要求7所述的胶囊，其中所述承载盘包括介于50个和150个之间的出口开口，并且所述承载盘的开口表面比高于4％。
10.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中所述过滤元件具有根据ISO 9237的在600l/m2/s与2500l/m2/s之间的孔隙度，以将细粉保留在所述胶囊内。
11.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中在将所述咖啡萃取物供应至容器之前，所述过滤元件保留来自所述咖啡的脂质部分，优选为油。
12.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中所得的咖啡萃取物中的总固体(TC)低于1.5％，并且优选地在0

title: Syrup binder system for preparing food, and preparation process and use thereof
abstract: The present invention relates to the food field. Specifically, the present invention relates to a syrup binder system for preparing a food containing extruded or puffed cereal and/or nuts, such as compound sachima (complexed sachima), cereal bars, crunchy rice candy or nut bars, etc., a preparation process and use thereof, and a food containing the syrup binder system.
claims:
1. Syrup binder system for food, which binder system comprises a sugar, a polyol, dietary fiber having water holding capacity greater than 8 ml/g, preferably of 8-15 mg/g, and more preferably of 9-14 mg/g, an emulsifier, edible oil, and water.
2. Syrup binder system according to claim 1, further comprising cellulose or a derivative thereof, e.g., cellulose ether, cellulose ester, or cellulose ether ester, preferably cellulose ether, e.g., carboxymethylcellulose or a derivative thereof, e.g., a salt, such as sodium carboxymethylcellulose or calcium carboxymethylcellulose; preferably, the cellulose or the derivative thereof is present in an amount of 0.002-2 wt%, preferably 0.005-1.5 wt % and more preferably 0.011 wt % based on the total weight of the syrup binder system.
3. Syrup binder system according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the polyol is a polyol having 2-5 hydroxy groups, preferably a polyol having 2-5 hydroxy groups and 3-5 carbon atoms, such as dihydric alcohol, e.g., propylene glycol, and trihydric alcohol, e.g. glycerol; preferably, the polyol is present in an amount of 1-25 wt%, preferably 5-20 wt % and more preferably 6-15 wt % based on the total weight of the syrup binder system.
4. Syrup binder system according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the dietary fiber is present in an amount of 0.1-8 wt%, preferably 0.2-6 wt% and more preferably 0.5-5 wt% based on the total weight of the syrup binder system; preferably, the dietary fiber is selected from one or more of citric fiber, soy fiber, potato fiber, and wax gourd fiber. 2020214721  1

title: Foaming liquid creamers for aerosol packaging, and methods of making and using such foaming liquid creamers and aerosol packagings
abstract: A foaming liquid creamer contains water, a lipid, a buffer salt, a stabilizer, and a dairy protein. Optionally the foaming liquid creamer further contains a sugar and/or a flavor. The buffer salt may include at least one of sodium bicarbonate or dipotassium phosphate. The stabilizer may include at least one of carrageenan, carboxymethyl cellulose (CMC), microcrystalline cellulose (MCC), or guar gum. The dairy protein may include at least one of micellar casein or sodium caseinate. The emulsifier may include mono- and di-glycerides. The lipid may include an oil. The foaming liquid creamer may additionally include an emulsifier such as mono- and di- glycerides. Another aspect is an aerosol packaging which includes the foaming liquid creamer in a pressurized container, and the aerosol packaging has an actuator nozzle.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A foaming liquid creamer comprising water, a lipid, a buffer salt, a stabilizer, and a dairy protein.
2. The foaming liquid creamer of claim 1 , further comprising a sugar.
3. The foaming liquid creamer of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the buffer salt comprises at least one of sodium bicarbonate or dipotassium phosphate.
4. The foaming liquid creamer of any of claims 1-3, wherein the stabilizer comprises at least one of carrageenan, carboxymethyl cellulose (CMC), microcrystalline cellulose (MCC), or guar gum.
5. The foaming liquid creamer of any of claims 1-4, wherein the dairy protein comprises at least one of micellar casein or sodium caseinate.
6. The foaming liquid creamer of any of claims 1-5, further comprising an emulsifier.
7. The foaming liquid creamer of claim 6, wherein the emulsifier comprises mono- and di-glycerides.
8. The foaming liquid creamer of any of claims 1-7, wherein the lipid comprises an oil.
9. The foaming liquid creamer of any of claims 1-8, further comprising

title: Capsule for producing beverage
abstract: The present invention relates to a capsule for use in a beverage preparation machine, said capsule containing soluble and/or extractable beverage ingredients, said capsule comprising:-a capsule body (2) defining a chamber (21),-a top membrane (3) closing a top opening and adapted to be punctured for injecting a liquid into the capsule, and-a bottom membrane (4), -a bottom membrane (2) arranged inside the chamber (21) so as to define a dosing chamber between the top membrane (3) and said bottom membrane, and-an opening device (5), the opening device is arranged inside the chamber and is adapted to open the chamber by opposite engagement of the opening device with the bottom membrane (4) during injection of the liquid under the action of an increase in liquid pressure in the dispensing chamber, the bottom membrane being a laminated multilayer material, the invention relates to an opening device (5) comprising a laminated multilayer material comprising, in order:-a layer of vegetable parchment (41), and-an adhesive layer (42), and-a layer of non-woven material (43) comprising fibres wherein said fibres are biodegradable fibres, and wherein the layer of vegetable parchment faces the opening device (5).
claims:
1.一种用于在饮料制备机器中使用的胶囊(1)，所述胶囊包含可溶和/或可提取的饮料配料，
所述胶囊包括：
-胶囊主体(2)，所述胶囊主体限定腔室(21)，
-顶部膜片(3)，所述顶部膜片封闭顶部开口并且适配为被刺破以将液体注入所述胶囊中，和
-底部膜片(4)，所述底部膜片设置在所述腔室(21)内部以便在所述顶部膜片(3)与所述底部膜片之间界定配料腔室，和
-打开装置(5)，所述打开装置设置在所述腔室内部并且被适配为在注入所述液体期间在所述配料腔室中的液体压力增加的作用下通过所述打开装置与所述底部膜片(4)的相对接合来打开所述腔室，
其中所述底部膜片是层压的多层材料，所述层压的多层材料依次包括：
-植物羊皮纸层(41)，和
-粘合层(42)，和
-非织造材料层(43)，所述非织造材料层包括纤维，其中所述纤维是可生物降解纤维，并且
其中所述植物羊皮纸层面对所述打开装置(5)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的胶囊，其中所述非织造材料层的所述可生物降解纤维选自由PLA、PHA(聚羟基链烷酸酯)、PHB(聚(羟基丁酸酯))、PHB(V)(聚(羟基丁酸酯-共-羟基戊酸酯))、PBS(聚(琥珀酸丁二醇酯))、生物聚酯和纤维素纤维诸如棉花、亚麻、木纤维及其组合组成的纤维组。
3.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中所述非织造材料的所述可生物降解纤维包括熔点为至少约100℃的可热密封纤维。
4.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中所述非织造材料的所述纤维仅由聚乳酸(PLA)构成。
5.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中所述非织造材料的克重在5g/m2和100g/m2之间，有利地在20g/m2和40g/m2之间，并且优选地为大约30g/m2。
6.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中所述粘合层(42)是丙烯酸粘合剂。
7.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶囊，其中所述植物羊皮纸(41)的克重在30g/m2和120g/m2之间，有利地在60g/m2和80g/m2之间，并且优选地为大约70g/m2。
8.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的胶

title: Methods of determining a health status of a dog based on one or more biomarkers, and methods of treating a mortality risk identified by the health status
abstract: The present invention relates to a method for determining a mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of a dog; said method comprising determining the level of one or more biomarker(s) in one or more samples obtained from the dog, wherein the one or more biomarker(s) is selected from white blood cell count, serum albumin, serum alkaline phosphatase, serum creatine kinase, haemoglobin, haematocrit, mean corpuscular haemoglobin, serum glucose, mean red cell volume, serum globulin, serum calcium, platelet count, and/or red blood cell count.
claims:
1. A method for determining a mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of a dog; said method comprising determining the level of one or more biomarker(s) in one or more samples obtained from the dog, wherein the one or more biomarker(s) is selected from the group consisting of white blood cell count, serum albumin, serum alkaline phosphatase, serum creatine kinase, haemoglobin, haematocrit, mean corpuscular haemoglobin, serum glucose, mean red cell volume, serum globulin, serum calcium, platelet count, and red blood cell count.
2. The method according to claim 1 wherein the biomarker is white blood cell count.
3. The method according to claim 1 wherein the biomarker is serum albumin.
4. The method according to claim 1 wherein the biomarker is serum alkaline phosphatase.
5. The method according to claim 1 wherein the method comprises measuring each of white blood cell count, serum albumin and serum alkaline phosphatase.
6. The method according to claim 1 wherein the method comprises measuring each of white blood cells count, serum albumin, serum alkaline phosphatase, serum creatine kinase, haemoglobin, haematocrit, mean corpuscular haemoglobin, serum glucose, mean red cell volume, and serum globulin.
7. The method according to claim 1 wherein the one or more sample(s) is a blood sample.

title: Wholesome sugar beet derived product having light colour and improved taste and mouthfeel and method of making thereof
abstract: The invention relates to a method of making a sugar beet derived product, said method comprising the steps of obtaining sugar beet pieces by peeling and cutting sugar beet; heat treating the sugar beet pieces; reducing the size of the sugar beet pieces; forming a sugar beet paste from the sugar beet pieces; and pasteurizing the sugar beet paste.
claims:
1. A method of making a sugar beet derived product, said method comprising the steps of a) Obtaining sugar beet pieces by peeling and cutting sugar beet; b) Heat treating the sugar beet pieces; c) Reducing the size of the sugar beet pieces; d) Forming a sugar beet paste from the sugar beet pieces; and e) Pasteurizing the sugar beet paste.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the sugar beet or sugar beet pieces are soaked in acid solution having a pH between 2 to 5.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the sugar beet pieces are heat treated.
4. The method according to claim 1, wherein the reduction in size of the sugar beet pieces in step c) is performed under an atmosphere comprising over 80%, preferably over 90% nitrogen gas.
5. The method according to claim 1, wherein the sugar beet paste is subjected to a cavitation step.
6. The method according to claim 1, wherein the sugar beet paste is further concentrated until it has a total solids content of 25 to 30%.
7. The method according to claim 1, wherein the sugar beet paste undergoes a crystallization step.
8. The method according to claim 1, wherein the crystallization step comprises w

title: MiRNAs from biological samples as indicators of stress in bovine animals
abstract: The present invention relates to miRNA biomarkers, such as exosome-derived microRNAs, from biological samples as indicators of welfare in bovine animals. In particular, the present invention relates to the identification of heat stress in bovine animals, allowing management measures to be proposed to improve productive animal welfare at individual or veterinary levels.
claims:
1.确定至少一头牛的至少一个福利参数的方法，所述方法包括
i.确定生物样品中调节细胞周期的至少一种miRNA的水平，其中所述miRNA选自SEQ IDNO:94、123、93、84、81、134、85、74、83、113、1、132、112和111或其功能变体，其中所述功能变体分别与SEQ ID NO:94、123、93、84、81、134、85、74、83、113、1、132、112和111具有至少60％的总体序列同一性；以及
ii.将所述至少一种miRNA的水平与参考水平进行比较，其中如果所述选自SEQ ID NO:94、123、93、84、85、74、83、113、1、132、112和111的一种或多种miRNA高于所述参考水平，则所述至少一头牛的至少一个福利参数已经受到损害或受到损害，或者如果所述选自SEQ IDNO:81和134的一种或多种miRNA低于所述参考水平，则所述至少一头牛的至少一个福利参数已经受到损害或受到损害。
2.改善至少一头牛的至少一个福利参数的方法，所述方法包括
i.确定第一生物样品中调节细胞周期的至少一种miRNA的水平，其中所述miRNA选自SEQ ID NO:94、123、93、84、81、134、85、74、83、113、1、132、112和111或其功能变体，其中所述功能变体分别与SEQ ID NO:94、123、93、84、81、134、85、74、83、113、1、132、112和111具有至少60％的序列同一性；
ii.将所述至少一种miRNA的水平与参考水平进行比较，其中如果所述选自SEQ ID NO:94、123、93、84、85、74、83、113、1、132、112和111的一种或多种miRNA高于所述一个或多个参考水平，则所述至少一头牛的至少一个福利参数已经受到损害，或者如果所述选自SEQ IDNO:81和134的一种或多种miRNA低于所述一个或多个参考水平，则所述至少一头牛的至少一个福利参数已经受到损害；
iii.改善所述至少一头牛的福利；
iv.确定第二生物样品中选自SEQ ID NO:94、123、93、84、81、
134、85、74、83、113、1、132、112和111或其功能变体的至少一种miRNA的水平，其中所述功能变体分别与SEQ ID NO:94、123、93、84、81、134、85、74、83、113、1、132、112和111具有至少60％的序列同一性；以及

如果所述第二生物样品中的SEQ ID NO:81或134的水平高于所述第一生物样品中的水平或高于所述参考样品，则所述一头牛的福利已经改善。
3.改善至少一头牛的乳产量、乳质量、肉产量或肉质量中的至少一者的方法，所述方法包括
i.确定第一生物样品中参与调节细胞周期的至少一种miRNA的水平，其中所述miRNA选自SEQ ID NO:94、123、93、84、85、
74、83、113、1、132、112和111或其功

title: Toilet sand composition
abstract: To provide an improved toilet sand composition which overcomes demerits and drawbacks related to an existing malodor control technique.SOLUTION: Provided are compositions and a method comprising a fragrance and from about 0.5 weight % to about 5.0 weight % of a granular malodor adsorbent which can be used to eliminate malodor in animal waste. The granular malodor absorbent may be granular molecular sieves or granulated activated carbon and has a pore size from about 0.4 nm to about 2.0 nm and a total surface area from about 100 m2/g to about 1500 m2/g.SELECTED DRAWING: None
claims:
【請求項1】
芳香剤と顆粒状悪臭吸着剤とを含む、悪臭制御用の動物用トイレ砂組成物であって、前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、約０．０５重量％～約５．０重量％の量で存在し、かつ約０．４ｎｍ～約２．０ｎｍの孔径及び約１００ｍ ２／ｇ～約１５００ｍ ２／ｇの総表面積を有し、前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、悪臭を実質的に吸着し、前記芳香剤を実質的に放出する、動物用トイレ砂組成物。
【請求項2】
前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、モレキュラーシーブ顆粒及び活性炭顆粒からなる群から選択される、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項3】
前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、約－８～約６０のメッシュサイズを有する、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項4】
前記芳香剤が、約０．０５重量％～約０．４重量％の量で存在する、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項5】
前記芳香剤がカプセル化されていない、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項6】
吸収性基材を更に含む、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項7】
前記吸収性基材が、吸収性コアと前記吸収性コアを取り囲む別個の層とを含む吸収性顆粒を含む、請求項６に記載の組成物。
【請求項8】
前記吸収性基材が粘土を含む、請求項６に記載の組成物。
【請求項9】
前記吸収性基材が、膨潤粘土でコーティングされた非膨潤粘土コアを含む、請求項６に記載の組成物。
【請求項10】
前記吸収性基材が、膨潤粘土でコーティングされた膨張パーライトコアを含む、請求項６に記載の組成物。
【請求項11】
前記膨潤粘土がナトリウムベントナイトである、請求項９又は１０に記載の組成物。
【請求項12】
前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、前記芳香剤よりも悪臭に対してより高い親和性を有する、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項13】
前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、前記悪臭の少なくとも２５％を吸着する

title: A recyclable packaging with barrier to oxygen and moisture
abstract: The present invention is directed to a packaging item (1) comprising: (i) at least one packaging body (2) having a tubular shape and closed at one of its extremities (4) by a permanent bottom wall (5), to define at least one compartment for packaging contents, and at least one dispensing opening (6) configured to allow the packaged contents to be dispensed from said packaging item (1), said packaging body (2) and bottom wall (5) being made of a multilayer oxygen and moisture barrier laminate comprising a cellulosic support layer, and (ii) a removable closure element (7) being made of an oxygen and moisture barrier laminate comprising a paper layer.
claims:
1. A packaging item (1) comprising: (i) at least one packaging body (2) having a tubular shape and closed at one of its extremities (4) by a permanent bottom wall (5), to define at least one compartment for packaging contents, and at least one dispensing opening (6) configured to allow the packaged contents to be dispensed from said packaging item (1), said packaging body (2) and bottom wall (5) being made of a multilayer oxygen and moisture barrier laminate comprising a cellulosic support layer, and organic and/or inorganic barrier layer(s), the cellulosic support layer of the body (2) having a grammage comprised between 120 and 600 g/m2, said multilayer laminate having a cellulose content higher than 90%, preferably higher than 95%, more preferably higher than 99%, such that the Oxygen Transmission Rate (OTR) is below 1, preferably below 0.5 cm3/m2/day measured at 23°C and 50% relative humidity (RH), and the Water Vapour Transmission rate (WVTR) is below 1, preferably below 0.5 g/m2/day measured at 23°C and 85% RH, (ii) a removable closure element (7) being made of an oxygen and moisture barrier laminate comprising a paper layer, at least one organic and/or inorganic barrier layer, the paper layer having a grammage comprised between 30 and 120 g/m2, and a cellulose content higher than 90%, preferably higher than 95%, more preferably higher than 99%, and such that the Oxygen Transmission Rate (OTR) is below 1, preferably below 0.5 cm3/m2/day measured at 23°C and 50% relative humidity (RH), and the Water Vapour Transmission rate (WVTR) is below 1, preferably below 0.5 g/m2/day measured at 23°C and 85% RH.
2. A packaging item (1) according to claim 1, wherein said removable closure element (7) comprises a pull tab (8) to facilitate manual removal from the pa

title: Transparent cellulosic packaging
abstract: The invention is directed to a three-dimensional food packaging (100) having a packaging interior (V) and being made of a cellulosic fibrous material (200). At least a portion (111) of the food packaging (100) delimiting at least part of the packaging interior (V) is impregnated with a polymer (300) such that the impregnated portion (111) has a light transmittance above 60% for visible light.
claims:
1. A three-dimensional food packaging made of a cellulosic fibrous material and defining a packaging interior, wherein at least a portion of the food packaging defining at least part of the packaging interior is impregnated with a polymer such that the impregnated portion has a light transmittance above 60% for visible light.
2. The three-dimensional food packaging according to claim 1, wherein the impregnated portion has a light transmittance above 65% for visible light.
3. The three-dimensional food packaging according to claim 1, wherein the polymer is a food grade material, is biodegradable and has a refractive index similar or identical to the cellulosic fibrous material.
4. The three-dimensional food packaging according to claim 1, wherein the polymer is selected from the group consisting of Polyolefin, Polyacrylate, Polycaprolactone, Polyester, Polyalcohol, Polyhydroxyalkanoate, thermoplastic starch, cellulose derivative, Epoxy resin, and combinations thereof.
5. The three-dimensional food packaging according to claim 1, wherein the impregnated portion comprises a concentration of the polymer that is continuous along at least one of its extension directions.
6. The three-dimensional food packaging according to claim 1, wherein the impregnated portion comprises at least one sealing portion having a concentration of the polymer that allows for s

title: Mixture of HMOS and bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism
abstract: The present invention relates to a composition comprising a Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism and a mixture of human milk oligosaccharides (HMOs) consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2'-FL), difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), and 3'-sialyllactose (3SL), and optionally lacto-N-fucopentaose I (LNFP-I), 3- fucosyllactose (3-FL) and/or lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT), wherein the Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism has an Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI) of at least 98% with CNCM I-5942. The invention also relates to the use of the composition for preventing, reducing the risk of and/or treating an infection in a subject. The invention also provides the composition for use in promoting a long-term immune benefit in a subject, preventing and/or reducing the risk of allergen sensitisation, preventing and/or reducing the risk of developing a respiratory condition in a subject, and/or preventing and/or reducing the risk of developing asthma in a subject.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A composition comprising a Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism and aHMO mixture consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2’-FL), difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), and 3'-sialyllactose (3SL), and optionally lacto-N-fucopentaose I (LNFP-I), 3-fucosyllactose (3-FL) and/or lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT), wherein theBifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism has an Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI)of at least 98% with the B. longum transitional strain deposited under deposit number CNCMI-5942 and/or has at least one identifying characteristic of the B. longum transitional straindeposited under deposit number CNCM I-5942.
2. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the Bifidobacterium longum transitionalmicroorganism: (i) is capable of metabolizing the HMO(s); (ii) preferentially utilizes 3-FL over 2’-FL; and/or (iii) is capable of metabolizing a glycan substrate selected from inulin or arabinan.
3. The composition according to claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the Bifidobacterium longumtransitional microorganism has an Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI) of at least 99%,preferably at least 99.9%, with the Bifidobacterium longum strain deposited with the CNCMunder deposit number CNCM I-5942.
4. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein thecomposition further comprises Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis.
5. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wher

title: Diagnosing heart disease and degenerative mitral valve disease in canine
abstract: FIELD: biotechnology; veterinary science.SUBSTANCE: disclosed is a method for diagnosing early degenerative mitral valve disease in a canine, including measurement of normalized relative number of faecal bacteria using microbiome, including specified genera and species of bacteria; calculating a dysbiosis index based on faecal bacteria; determining that the canine has a heart disease if the dysbiosis index exceeds −1.0 (embodiments).EFFECT: inventions provide longer life of diseased dogs due to early diagnosis of heart disease in an animal.13 cl, 5 tbl, 1 ex
claims:
1. Способ диагностики заболевания сердца у животного из семейства собачьих, а именно ранней стадии дегенеративного заболевания митрального клапана, включающий:
измерение нормализованной относительной численности фекальных бактерий, включаяFaecalibacterium,Turicibacter,Streptococcus,E. Coli,Blautia, FusobacteriumиC. hiranonis;
вычисление индекса дисбиоза на основе фекальных бактерий; и
определение того, что животное из семейства собачьих имеет заболевание сердца, если индекс дисбиоза превышает -1,0.
2. Способ по п. 1, дополнительно включающий определение того, что животное из семейства собачьих имеет раннюю стадию дегенеративного заболевания митрального клапана, когда индекс дисбиоза составляет от -1 до 0,5.
3. Способ по п. 2, дополнительно включающий определение того, что ранняя стадия дегенеративного заболевания митрального клапана представляет собой стадию B1, когда индекс дисбиоза составляет от -1 до -0,25.
4. Способ по п. 2, дополнительно включающий определение того, что ранняя стадия дегенеративного заболевания митрального клапана представляет собой стадию B2, когда индекс дисбиоза составляет от -0,25 до 0,5.
5. Способ по п. 1, дополнительно включающий определение того, что животное из семейства собачьих имеет застойную сердечную недостаточность, когда индекс дисбиоза превышает 0,5.
6. Способ диагностики ранней стадии дегенеративного заболевания митрального клапана у животного из семейства собачьих, включающий:
измерение нормализованной относительной численности биомаркера, выбранного из группы, состоящей изCatenibacterium mitsuokai,Butyricicoccus pullicaecorum,Bacteroides coprocola,Bacteroides plebeius,Allobaculum stercoricanisили их комбинаций; и
определение того, что животное из семейства собачьих имеет раннюю стадию дегенеративного заболевания митрального клапана, если нормализованная относительная численностьCatenibacterium mitsuokaiсоставляет от 0,3 до 3, нормализованная относительная численностьButyricicoccus pullicaecorumсоставляет от 0,14 до 0,35, норм

title: Bio-based polymer beverage capsules
Methods of oral immunotherapy
abstract: The present disclosure relates to improved oral immunotherapy methods for treating food allergies, and particularly peanut allergy. Biomarkers, such as a level of peanut-specific IgE and/or peanut-specific IgG4s are used by the methods described herein. Such methods include a method of treating a subject for a peanut allergy, methods of assessing the suitability of a treatment for a peanut allergy, a method of evaluating a symptom in a subject during the course of treatment of a peanut allergy, a method of monitoring treatment for a peanut allergy in a subject, a method of reducing the risk or incidence of an adverse event in a subject receiving treatment for a peanut allergy, a method of adjusting a dose of an allergenic peanut composition, and a method of assessing a likelihood of an allergic reaction that requires administration of epinephrine to a subject receiving treatment for a peanut allergy.
claims:
1. A method of reducing the risk or incidence of an adverse event in a subject receiving treatment for a peanut allergy, comprising:
measuring a level of peanut-specific IgEs and a level of peanut-specific IgG4s in the subject;
measuring a ratio of the peanut-specific IgEs to the peanut-specific IgG4s; and
administering a reduced dose, delaying the administration of a dose, or delaying administration of an increase of a dose of an allergenic peanut composition if the level of peanut-specific IgEs is above a predetermined threshold, and if the ratio of the peanut-specific IgEs to the peanut-specific IgG4s increases during treatment compared to an earlier measurement during treatment or within 7 days of the start of treatment.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the treatment is oral immunotherapy.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the predetermined threshold of the peanut-specific IgEs is 100 KU/L.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the adverse event is an allergic reaction.
5. The method of claim 1, comprising administering the dose to the subject.
6. A method of monitoring treatment for a peanut allergy in a subject, comprising:
measuring a level of peanut-specific IgEs and

title: Symbiotic culture of bacteria and yeast for production of water kefir
abstract: The present Invention relates to a beverage composition, preferably a fermented beverage composition, comprising gluconic acid and lactic acid, wherein the concentration ratio of gluconic acid to lactic acid is greater than 1, preferably between 2 to 10.
claims:
1. A beverage composition comprising gluconic acid and lactic acid, wherein the concentration ratio of gluconic acid to lactic acid is greater than 1.
2. The beverage composition according to claim 1, wherein the beverage composition further comprises ethanol, wherein the ethanol is present at a concentration less than 10 g/L.
3. The beverage composition according to claim 1, wherein the beverage composition further comprises sugar, wherein the sugar is present at a concentration less than 50 g/L.
4. The beverage composition according to claim 1, wherein the beverage composition further comprises 2-phenylethanol, 3-methlylbutanol, and 3-methylbutanal at a combined concentration of greater than 3 mg/L.
5. A beverage composition according to claim 1, wherein the beverage composition comprises Zymomonas mobilis cells.
6-8. (canceled)
9. The beverage composition according to claim 1 wherein the beverage composition comprises fewer than 10 species of bacteria and yeast.
10. A starter culture for preparing a fermented beverage composition, wherein said starter culture comprises a. Zymomonas mobilis; and b. lactic acid bacteria, for example Liquorilactobacillus hordei; and c. Saccharomyces, for example Saccharomy

title: Multi-layer metallized paper-based packaging material
abstract: The invention relates to a multilayer metallized paper-based packaging material (1) comprising, from its outer side to its inner side:-a paper layer (2) having a grammage in the range of 30 g/m2 to 120 g/m2; -at least one organic barrier layer (3) of a polymer selected from the list of polyvinyl alcohol (PVOH), ethylene-vinyl alcohol (EVOH), butenediol-vinyl alcohol copolymer (BVOH) or combinations thereof in an amount of from 0.5 g/m2 to 20 g/m2; -at least one inorganic barrier layer (4) selected from the list of: a metal, a metalloid or a combination thereof, the inorganic layer having a thickness of between 1 nm and 100 nm; and-at least one organic heat seal layer (5) made of an acrylic or methacrylic polymer grafted with at least one type of ionomer, the heat seal layer being applied in an amount of between 2 g/m2 and 20 g/m2.
claims:
1.多层金属化纸基包装材料(1)，所述多层金属化纸基包装材料从其外侧到其内侧包括：
-纸层(2)，所述纸层具有在30g/m2至120g/m2范围内的克重，
-至少一个聚合物的有机阻隔层(3)，所述聚合物选自以下项的列表：聚乙烯醇(PVOH)、乙烯-乙烯醇(EVOH)、丁烯二醇
-乙烯醇共聚物(BVOH)或它们的组合，其量为0.5g/m2至20g/m2，优选地其量为1g/m2至10g/m2，更优选地其量为2g/m2至8g/m2，
-至少一个无机阻隔层(4)，所述至少一个无机阻隔层选自以下项的列表：金属、准金属或它们的组合，所述无机层具有介于1nm与100nm之间的厚度，和
-至少一个有机热封层(5)，所述至少一个有机热封层由丙烯酸或甲基丙烯酸聚合物与至少一种类型的离聚物接枝制成，所述热封层(5)以介于2g/m2与20g/m2之间的量，优选地以介于4g/m2与9g/m2之间的量施加。
2.根据权利要求1所述的多层金属化纸基包装材料(1)，其中所述无机层包含选自以下项的列表的金属或准金属：铝、氧化铝(AlOx)或氧化硅(SiOx)，所述金属和/或准金属通过真空沉积或转移金属化沉积。
3.根据前述权利要求1或2中任一项所述的多层金属化纸基包装材料(1)，其中接枝到所述丙烯酸或甲基丙烯酸聚合物上的所述离聚物是钠离聚物。
4.根据前述权利要求1至3中任一项所述的多层金属化纸基包装材料(1)，其中与离聚物接枝的所述丙烯酸或甲基丙烯酸聚合物具有介于85g/mol与90g/mol之间的分子量。
5.根据前述权利要求1至4中任一项所述的多层金属化纸基包装材料(1)，其中所述有机层中的每个有机层通过水性分散体或通过水溶液沉积而沉积到相邻层上。
6.根据前述权利要求5所述的多层金属化纸基包装材料(1)，其中所述有机阻隔层(3)通过水溶液沉积而沉积，并且所述有机热封层(5)通过水性分散体涂布而沉积。
7.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的多层金属化纸基包装材料(1)，其中所述纸层(2)在其外表面上覆盖有油墨层(6)。
8.根据前述权利要求7所述的多层金属化纸基包装材料(1)，其中优选地所述油墨层选自以下项的列表：水基油墨、无溶剂油墨或它们的组合。
9.根据前述权利要求7或8中任一项所述的多层金属化纸基包装材料(1)，其中所述纸层或所述油墨层在其外表面上被最外面的罩印清漆(OPV)层(7)覆盖。
10.根据前述权利要求9所述的多层金属化纸基包装材料(1)，其中所述最外面的罩印清漆层(7)是苯乙烯丙烯酸清漆。
11.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的多层金属化纸基包装材料(1)，其中所述包装材料具有低于0.5g/m2/天的水蒸气透过率(WVTR)(在23℃、85％相对湿

title: Beverage dispenser with powder container
abstract: The invention concerns a beverage preparation machine (100) for preparing a beverage from a beverage ingredient powder, said machine comprising:—at least one container (1, 1a, 1b, 1c, 1d) configured for storing a beverage ingredient powder and comprising a powder outlet (11, 11a, 11b, 11c, 11d) for dispensing at least one dose of said beverage ingredient powder, and—a rotating device (2) to rotate said at least one container (1) around a rotational axis (XX′), wherein said rotational axis is inclined with respect to vertical and said rotational axis is positioned externally to said at least one container.
claims:
1. Beverage preparation machine for preparing a beverage from a beverage ingredient powder, the machine comprising:
at least one container configured for storing a beverage ingredient powder and comprising a powder outlet for dispensing at least one dose of the beverage ingredient powder, and
a rotating device to rotate the at least one container around a rotational axis,
wherein the rotational axis is inclined with respect to vertical and the rotational axis is positioned externally to the at least one container.
2. Beverage preparation machine according to claim 1, wherein the rotational axis is inclined with respect to vertical according to an angle of at least 15° with respect to vertical, and at most 90°.
3. Beverage preparation machine according to claim 1, wherein the internal wall of the container presents a shape and/or an internal movable element configured to agitate powder during rotation of the container around the rotational axis.
4. Beverage preparation machine according to claim 1, wherein the machine comprises at least one dosing device configured to cooperate with the powder outlet of the at least one container.
5. Beverage preparation machine according to claim 1, wherein the machine comprises several containers and all the containers are configured to rotate around one common rotational

title: Compositions and methods for diagnosing and/or treating chronic kidney disease
abstract: Compositions and methods diagnose and/or treat chronic kidney disease (CKD) using one or more feline circulating proteins as markers for early-stage CKD. A method of diagnosing chronic kidney disease (CKD) in a feline can include measuring an amount of each of at least one circulating protein from the feline. The at least one circulating protein is one or more of adiponectin (ADIPOQ), cathelicidin (CAMP), kinesin-like protein (KIF12), plasma retinol-binding protein (RBP4), Ig-like domain-containing protein (ZKSCAN1), coagulation factor X (F10), fibronectin (FN1) and mixtures thereof. The method also includes performing comparison of the amount of each of the at least one circulating protein from the feline to a corresponding predetermined value or a corresponding predetermined range. The method also includes diagnosing the feline as having early-stage CKD or not having early-stage CKD, based on the comparison.
claims:
1. A method of diagnosing chronic kidney disease (CKD) in a feline, the method comprising:
measuring an amount of each of at least one circulating protein from the feline, wherein the at least one circulating protein is selected from the group consisting of adiponectin (ADIPOQ), cathelicidin (CAMP), kinesin-like protein (KIF12), plasma retinol-binding protein (RBP4), Ig-like domain-containing protein (ZKSCAN1), coagulation factor X (F10), fibronectin (FN1) and mixtures thereof;
performing comparison of the amount of each of the at least one circulating protein from the feline to a corresponding predetermined value or a corresponding predetermined range; and
diagnosing the feline as having early-stage CKD or not having early-stage CKD, based on the comparison.
2. The method of claim 1, comprising obtaining a sample of at least one of serum or plasma from the feline, wherein the measuring of the amount of each of the at least one circulating protein is performed on the sample of at least one of serum or plasma.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the measuring and the comparison uses at least two of the circulating proteins selected from the group consisting of adiponectin (ADIPOQ), cathelicidin (CAMP), kinesin-like protein (KIF12), plasma retinol-binding protein (RBP4), Ig-like domain-containing protein (ZKSCAN1), coagulation factor X (F10), fibronectin (FN1) and mixtures thereof.

title: Compositions and methods to potentiate musculoskeletal effect of one or more anabolic amino acids
abstract: A method of potentiating musculoskeletal effect of one or more anabolic amino acids in an individual in need thereof can include administering to the individual in need thereof a composition containing the one or more anabolic amino acids, the composition also containing one or more autophagy-inducing compounds in a total amount effective for the composition to be at least neutral regarding autophagy. In another aspect, a method of overcoming one or more negative effects of one or more anabolic amino acids by preventing degenerative processes related to loss of autophagy can include administering to an individual in need thereof a composition containing the one or more anabolic amino acids, the composition further containing the one or more autophagy-inducing compounds in a total amount effective for the composition to be at least neutral regarding autophagy.
claims:
1. A composition comprising one or more anabolic amino acids, the composition further comprising one or more autophagy-inducing compounds selected from the group consisting of thymol, carvacrol, spermidine, urolithin, rapamycin, Torin1, valproic acid, polyphenols, caffeine, L-type calcium channel inhibitors, ketones, 4,4’-dimethoxychalcone and mixtures thereof, in a total amount effective for the composition to be at least neutral regarding autophagy for use in an individual in need thereof for potentiating musculoskeletal effect of one or more anabolic amino acids of the individual.
2. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the one or more anabolic amino acids are selected from the group consisting of Leucine, Isoleucine, Arginine, Glutamine, Citrulline and mixtures thereof.
3. The composition according to claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the one or more anabolic amino acids comprise at least one of Leucine, Arginine or Glutamine, in an amount effective to activate mTOR in the individual.
4. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the composition induces autophagy in skeletal muscle.
5. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the individual is an ageing individual.
6. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the individual has sarcopenia or frailty or is at risk of developing sarcopenia or frailty, optionally wherein the

title: Compositions and methods using a combination of curcumin and an omega-3 fatty acid for cellular energy
Beverage machine with an ergonomic user-interface
abstract: A machine (1) for preparing and dispensing a beverage (2) comprises : - a main body (10) containing a unit (11, 12, 13, 14, 15) for preparing said beverage (2) to be dispensed via an outlet (21) to an external user-recipient (3) at a user-recipient placement location (30); - an auxiliary body (20) that is movable relative to the main body (10) inwards into the main body (10) into a retracted position and outwards from the main body (10) into a deployed position; - a control unit (16) for controlling the preparation unit (11, 12, 13, 14, 15) to supply said beverage (2) to the outlet (21); and - a user-interface (17, 17') connected to the control unit (16). The user-interface (17, 17') is located on the auxiliary body (20) and is movable therewith.
claims:

title: Pectin emulsion hydrocolloid-based gel composition for a confectionery product
abstract: The invention relates to a hydrocolloid-based gel composition for a confectionery product, said composition comprising 0.5 – 3.5 wt% pectin, wherein the pectin is equal or greater than 50% methylesterified; 5 – 20 wt% oil or melted fat; 0 – 0.15 wt% divalent ions, preferably calcium or magnesium ions; not less than 55 wt% sugars, preferably sucrose, maltose, glucose syrup, and/or maltodextrin; water; and wherein the composition has a pH not greater than pH 4.5, preferably a pH between 2.0 to 4.5.
claims:
Claims
1. A hydrocolloid-based gel composition for a confectionery product, said composition comprising 0.5 - 3.5 wt% pectin, wherein the pectin is equal or greater than 50% methylesterified; 5 - 20 wt% oil or melted fat; 0 - 0.15 wt% divalent ions, preferably calcium or magnesium ions; not less than 55 wt% sugars, preferably sucrose, maltose, glucose syrup, and/or maltodextrin; Water; and wherein the composition has a pH not greater than pH 4.5, preferably a pH between 2.0 to 4.5.
2. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the pectin equal or greater than 60% methylesterified, most preferably equal or greater than 70% methylesterified.
3. The composition according to any one of claims 1 and 2, wherein the composition comprises between 1.5 to 3.5 wt% pectin, or between 1.5 to 2.5 wt% pectin.
4. The composition according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the pectin comprises between 15 to 80% galacturonic acid.
5. The composition according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the composition comprises between 10 to 20 wt% oil or melted fat.
6. The composition according to any one of claims 1 to 5, wherein the pectin is citrus pectin or a mixture of citrus pectin and apple pectin.

title: Nutritional composition for inducing a feeling of satiety, a better sleep and/or limiting nocturnal awaking in infants or young children
abstract: The invention relates to a nutritional composition for infants and young children comprising proteins, carbohydrates and lipids, wherein said proteins comprise ionic complexes of lactoferrin with acid milk proteins, said complexes having a negative charge at the pH of the infant formula. The nutritional composition is used for providing a satiety feeling and/or a better sleep and/or limiting nocturnal awaking in infants or young children.
claims:
1. A nutritional composition for infants or young children comprising proteins, carbohydrates and lipids, wherein said proteins comprise ionic complexes of lactoferrin with acid milk proteins, said complexes having a negative charge at the 5 pH of the infant formula; wherein said acid milk proteins are selected from the group consisting of alphalactalbumin (ALAC), beta-lactoglobulin (BLG), whey protein isolate (WPI), whey protein concentrate (WPC), whey protein hydrolysate, casein, and combinations thereof, and 0          wherein in said ionic complexes, the weight ratio of lactoferrin to acid milk proteins ranges from 1:0.25 to 1:3, in particular 1: 1,1:1.5 or 1: 2.
2. The composition of claim 1, wherein said proteins comprise a mixture of whey protein and casein, wherein the ratio of whey protein to casein is between 50:50 and 80:20. 5   
3. The composition of claim 1 or 2, wherein the whey protein is enriched with alpha lactalbumin (ALAC).
4. The composition of any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the ALAC content in the whey protein is at least 10% by weight, preferably at least 14% by weight, more preferably at least 20 % to 50% by weight. 20   
5. The composition of any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein lactoferrin

title: Beverage capsule system with code area and code-free area
abstract: A system comprises a container for containing precursor material and a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof from said precursor material. The container has a code to at least partially encode preparation information. The machine includes: a code reading system to read the code; a processing unit for processing the precursor material of the container; and electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on the preparation information. The electrical circuitry is configured to: read the code to obtain a code read; determine a characteristic of a neighbouring non-code portion in proximity of a code portion of the code read; correct an associated characteristic of the code portion based on the determined characteristic of the neighbouring non-code portion to account for variations of the characteristic in the non-code portion.
claims:
1. A system comprising a container for containing precursor material and a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof from said precursor material,
the container including:
a code to at least partially encode preparation information,
the machine including:
a code reading system to read the code;
a processing unit for processing the precursor material of the container; and
electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on the preparation information,
wherein electrical circuitry is configured to:
read the code to obtain a code read;
determine a characteristic of a neighbouring non-code portion in proximity of a code portion of the code read;
correct an associated characteristic of the code portion based on the determined characteristic of the neighbouring non-code portion to account for variations of the characteristic in the non-code portion.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the code is arranged on an encoding line and:
reading of the code comprises reading along the encoding line to obtain the code read;
determine a characteristic of a

title: Complex coacervates of lactoferrin and osteopontin
abstract: The present invention relates to a complex coacervate comprising lactoferrin and osteopontin, processes of producing the same and composition comprising the same. Moreover, the present invention relates to complexes comprising lactoferrin and osteopontin in the treatment and/or prevention of metabolic diseases and/or inflammatory diseases. Moreover, the present invention relates to complexes comprising lactoferrin and osteopontin for promoting bone development, growth, strength and/or healing, or preventing and/or treating a bone disease.
claims:
1. A method for use in promoting bone development, growth, strength and/or healing in a subject, or preventing and/or treating a bone disease in a subject comprising administering to a subject in need a complex coacervate comprising lactoferrin and osteopontin.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the complex coacervate comprises protein in an amount of 5 to 50% w/w.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the complex coacervate comprises water in an amount of 50 to 95% w/w.
4. The method according to any claim 1, wherein the complex coacervate has a diameter of at least 500 nm in the shortest dimension.
5. The method according to any claim 1, wherein the complex coacervate has a zeta potential in the range of −15 and +15 mV.
6. The method according to claim 1, wherein the complex coacervate is administered in the form of a composition.
7. The method according to claim 6, wherein the composition is selected from the group consisting of food compositions, pet food compositions, drinks, nutritional formulas and nutraceuticals.
8. The method according to claim 6, wherein the composition is in a form selected from the group consi

title: A beverage capsule opener
abstract: The present invention relates to a capsule opener (1, 100) for emptying solid and/or liquid contents of an extracted beverage capsule. The capsule (2) comprises a body (4) forming a compartment containing the contents and a lid for closing said compartment. The capsule opener (1, 100) comprises a bottom portion (10, 110) and a storage compartment (20, 120). The bottom portion (10, 110) includes a bottom portion housing with at least one cutting protrusion (12, 112, 115). The at least one protrusion (12) is arranged for piercing through and opening the lid. The storage compartment (20, 120) is configured to receive the solid and/or liquid contents from the capsule (2). The storage compartment (20, 120) is arranged below the at least one protrusion (12).
claims:
1. A capsule opener (1, 100) for emptying solid and/or liquid contents of an extracted beverage capsule, the capsule (2) comprising a body (4) forming a compartment containing the contents and a lid for closing said compartment, the capsule opener (1, 100) comprising: a bottom portion (10, 110) including a bottom portion housing with at least one protrusion (12), the at least one protrusion (12) being arranged for piercing through and opening the lid, and a storage compartment (20, 120) for receiving the solid and/or liquid contents from the capsule (2), wherein the storage compartment (20, 120) is arranged below the at least one protrusion (12).
2. The capsule opener (1, 100) of claim 1, wherein the bottom portion (10, 110) comprises a sieve (114) and wherein the sieve (114) is arranged between the storage compartment (20, 120) and the at least one protrusion (12, 112 115),
3. The capsule opener (1, 100) of claim 2, wherein the sieve (114) has mesh openings of at least 3 mm in width, length and/or diameter.
4. The capsule opener (100) of any one of the preceding claims, the capsule opener (100) further comprising a capsule holder (130); wherein the capsule holder (130) includes a holding ring (131) configured to hold a flange (4) of the capsule (2) against the bottom portion (110).
5. The capsule opener (1, 100) of any one of the preceding claims, wherein bottom portion (10, 110) comprises a manual gripping portion (121).

title: Agents and methods for increasing stem cell function
abstract: Use of a urolithin for increasing stem cell function in a population of haematopoietic stem and/or progenitor cells (HSPCs).
claims:
1. A method of increasing haematopoietic stem cell function in a subject, the method comprising administering a urolithin to the subject, wherein the haematopoietic 5 stem cell function comprises engraftment.
2. A method of treating or preventing leukopenia and/or thrombocytopenia; in a subject in need thereof, the method comprising administering a urolithin to the subject in need thereof. 10
3. The method according to claim 2, wherein the urolithin is in the form of a pharmaceutical or nutritional composition, optionally in the form of a food product, food supplement, nutraceutical, food for special medical purpose (FSMP), nutritional supplement, dairy-based drink, low-volume liquid supplement or meal replacement 15 beverage.
4. A method of increasing haematopoietic stem cell function in a subject comprising contacting an isolated population of haematopoietic stem and/or progenitor cells (HSPCs) with a urolithin, and administering the population of HSPCs to the subject in 20 need thereof, wherein the stem cell function comprises engraftment.
5. A method of treating or preventing leukopenia and/or thrombocytopenia; and/or treating or preventing cancer in a subject comprising contacting a population of haematopoietic stem and/or progenitor cells (HSPCs) with a urolithin, and 25 administering the population of HSPCs to the subject in need thereof.
6. The method according to any one of claims 2-5, wherein the urolithin i

title: Device for preparing and dispensing beverages with an improved arrangement of the dispensing nozzle
abstract: The invention concerns a machine (10) for preparing and dispensing beverages comprising a water supply apparatus (20) and an additive substances feeding apparatus (24) arranged within an housing chamber defined in the main casing (12) of the machine (10), and a beverage preparation apparatus (18) comprising a nozzle (28) and an alcove (64), wherein a door (16) is hinged to the main casing (12) and is configured to close the housing chamber in the machine (10) operating configuration, and wherein all the water delivery pipes (22) of the water supply apparatus (20) and all the additive substances delivering pipes (26) of the additive substances feeding apparatus (24) are hydraulically connected to the nozzle (28), which is designed for mixing water with said additive substances, so as to obtain the beverage, and for delivering the beverage, wherein the nozzle (28) is fixed to the alcove (64) to ensure easy access to the apparatuses of the machine (10) arranged within the housing chamber when the door (16) is open.
claims:
1. A machine for preparing and dispensing beverages comprising:
a main casing, able to define a housing chamber of a plurality of apparatuses of the machine and provided with at least one opening which defines a door compartment to said housing chamber;
at least one door, which is provided with an outer surface and an inner surface oriented towards said housing chamber, wherein said door is hinged to said main casing at a hinging axis and is configured to close said housing chamber in the machine operating configuration;
at least one beverage preparation apparatus, which is designed for preparing and dispensing beverages;
at least one water supply apparatus, which is provided with one or more water delivering pipes to said beverage preparation apparatus; and
at least one additive substances feeding apparatus, which is provided with one or more additive substances delivering pipes to said beverage preparation apparatus;
wherein said beverage preparation apparatus comprises:
at least one mixing and dispensing nozzle; and
at least one alcove, which is obtained on said door and which defines a seat open on the outer surface of said door to hold at least one container into which the beverage dispensed through said nozzle flows;
wherein the water supply apparatus and said additive substances feeding apparatus are arranged within said housing chamber and all the water delivery pipes and all the addit

title: High protein tablet
abstract: The invention relates to a high protein tablet, and in particular an easily dispersible firm tablet, which has a high protein content.
claims:
Claims
1. A firm protein tablet comprising: 8 to 25% by weight of a binder, based on the total weight of the tablet; and 40 to 92% by weight of a protein, based on the total weight of the tablet, wherein the tablet has a dispersion time of less than 180 seconds in 200 ml of water at a temperature of 90°C.
2. A firm protein tablet for dispersion in water comprising: 8 to 25% by weight of a binder, based on the total weight of the tablet; and 40 to 92% by weight of a protein, based on the total weight of the tablet, wherein the protein powder has a defined dissolution behaviour, measured by dispersing ca. 0.1 gram the protein powder in 120 ml water at 25 °C; measuring the initial D[4,3] value and nine further D[4,3] values at 8 second intervals after the initial value, and identifying the highest D[4,3] value from the nine further D[4,3] values, wherein the protein powder has an initial D[4,3] value of 1-1,000 pm, and the percentage change between the initial D[4,3] value and the highest D[4,3] value is from -10% to +100%.
3. The firm protein tablet of claim 1 or claim 2 comprising 10 to 20% by weight of a binder, based on the total weight of the tablet.
4. The firm protein tablet of any one of claims 1 to 3, comprising 45 to 80% by weight of a protein, based on the total weight of the tablet.
5. The firm protein tablet of any one of claims 1 to 3, comprising 60 to 75% by weight of a protein, based on the total weight of the tablet.

title: Methods for the improvement and maintenance of weight loss
abstract: A nutritional composition for use in a weight loss dietary intervention or maintenance of weight, particularly following a dietary intervention, preferably a low caloric diet intervention. The nutritional composition contains one or more amino acids, or combinations thereof, selected from the group consisting of: proline, histidine, glycine, and/or hydroxyproline, that can be used to help the weight loss in obese subjects that are resistant to weight loss by caloric restricted dietary interventions alone. In addition, the nutritional composition can be used to help maintain the weight loss, particularly after dietary intervention.
claims:
1: A method for weight loss in a subject having an obesity-related disorder selected from the group consisting of diabetes, stroke, high cholesterol, cardiovascular disease, insulin resistance, coronary heart disease, hypertension, fatty liver, and combinations thereof, the method comprising administering to the subject a nutritional composition comprising at least one amino acid selected from the group consisting of proline, histidine, glycine, and hydroxyproline.
2: The method according to claim 1, wherein the method comprises a low caloric intervention.
3: The method according to claim 2, wherein the low caloric dietary intervention is between 600 kcal/day and 1500 kcal/day for up to 12 weeks for the subject.
4: The method according to claim 1, wherein the nutritional composition comprises at least proline.
5: The method according to claim 1, wherein the nutritional composition comprises at least proline and histidine.
6: The method according to claim 1, wherein the nutritional composition comprises at least proline, histidine and glycine.
7: The method according to claim 1, wherein the nutritional composition comprises proline, histidine, glycine and hydroxyproline.
8: The m

title: Container for use with a beverage and/or food preparation device, system, use and methods of encoding and reading information on preparation
abstract: FIELD: kitchen equipment.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to electrically controlled systems for the preparation of a beverage or a food product, by means of which a beverage or a food product is obtained from a portion capsule. Container is configured to accommodate precursor material for use with a device for preparing a beverage and/or a food product. Container includes a machine-readable code storing preparation information for use in the preparation process performed by said device, the code comprising a plurality of elements, wherein the code elements are arranged in a circumferential direction for sequential reading during the container rotation about the rotation axis relative to the code reader. Code is arranged in the form of a plurality of directly adjacent discrete positions, and the absence or presence of the primary element in the discrete position codes the preparation information, wherein the boundary elements are located on a boundary between two or more adjacent primary elements and/or on a boundary between two or more adjacent absences of primary elements, and the boundary elements have reflective properties different from the primary element or the absence of the primary element.EFFECT: accuracy of determining code.18 cl, 16 dwg
claims:
1. Контейнер, выполненный с возможностью размещения материала-предшественника для применения с устройством для приготовления напитка и/или продукта питания, причем контейнер включает код, при этом код содержит множество элементов,
причем код расположен в виде множества непосредственно смежных дискретных позиций с отсутствием или присутствием первичного элемента в дискретной позиции,
при этом граничные элементы расположены на границе между двумя или более смежными первичными элементами и/или на границе между двумя или более смежными отсутствиями первичных элементов,
и граничные элементы имеют отражающие свойства, отличные от первичного элемента и/или отсутствия первичного элемента,
причем дискретные позиции и граничные элементы кода расположены по окружности для последовательного считывания при вращении контейнера вокруг оси вращения относительно считывателя кода.
2. Контейнер по п. 1, в котором граничные элементы расположены только на границе между двумя или более смежными первичными элементами и/или на границе между двумя или более смежными отсутствиями первичных элементов, так что граница между первичным элементом и отсутствием первичного элемента не содержит граничного элемента, и граничные элементы полностью разделяют смежные первичные элементы и/или смежные отсутствия первичных элементов.
3. Контейнер по любому из пп. 1 или 2, в котором граничный элемент не кодирует информацию о приготовлении.
4. Контейнер по любому предшествующему пункту, в котором граничные элементы имеют:
имеют среднюю длину дуги менее 50%, или 40%, или 30%, или 25% и более 5%, или 10%, или 15% от средней длины дуги дискретной позиции.
5. Контейнер по любому предшествующему пункту, в котором:
дискретные позиции имеют среднюю длину дуги 2,6 градуса ± 20%, или 10%, или 5%;
и граничные элементы имеют среднюю длину дуги 0,5 или 0,44 градуса ± 5%, или 10%, или 20%.
6. Контейнер по любому предшествующему пункту, в котором граничные элементы выполнены с возможностью быть видимыми для считывателя ко

title: Beverage preparation device with thermally optimised architecture
abstract: A method prepares a beverage from a capsule in a machine, the capsule containing a flavouring ingredient. The method includes: placing the capsule into a receiving space; bringing a holder and a cover from an open position into a closed position; delivering water conditioned by a thermal conditioner into an inlet of the cover, the thermal conditioner forming a conditioner cavity that defines or contains the cover; preparing the beverage by mixing the flavouring ingredient in the capsule with the water conditioned by the thermal conditioner; delivering the beverage via an outlet arrangement; and collecting the delivered beverage on a collecting surface of the thermal conditioner.
claims:
1: A method of preparing a beverage from a capsule in a machine, the capsule containing a flavouring ingredient, the method comprising:
placing the capsule into a receiving space;
bringing a holder and a cover from an open position into a closed position;
delivering water conditioned by a thermal conditioner into an inlet of the cover, the thermal conditioner forming a conditioner cavity that defines or contains the cover;
preparing the beverage by mixing the flavouring ingredient in the capsule with the water conditioned by the thermal conditioner;
delivering the beverage via an outlet arrangement; and
collecting the delivered beverage on a collecting surface of the thermal conditioner.
2: The method of claim 1, wherein at least one of the holder and the cover is connected to a driver that is arranged to drive the at least one of the holder and the cover in rotation when the holder and the cover are in the closed position.
3: The method of claim 1, further comprising guiding the beverage from the collecting surface of the thermal conditioner to a dispensing area configured to receive a user-receptacle for collecting the beverage from the machine.
4: The method of claim 1, further comprising guiding the beverage from the c

title: Co-extraction method for preparing stable oil body solution from seed material and grain bran
Nutritional composition for improving social-emotional development
abstract: The present invention relates to a combination of DHA, ARA, iron, folic acid, Vitamin B12 and phospholipids and to a nutritional composition comprising such a combination for use in improving social-emotional skills and/or in promoting mood, social and joy-related behaviours in an infant, a toddler or a young child. The present invention also relates to a synthetic nutritional composition comprising DHA, ARA, iron, folic acid, Vitamin B12 and phospholipids in specific amounts. The present invention further relates to uses and methods for improving social-emotional skills and/or for promoting mood, social and joy-related behaviours in an infant, a toddler or a young child.
claims:
1. A combination of DHA, ARA, iron, folic acid, Vitamin B12 and phospholipids for use in improving social-emotional skills and/or in promoting mood and joy behaviour in an infant, a toddler or a young child.
2. A combination for use according to claim 1, wherein the phospholipids are sphingomyelin, phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylinositol, phosphatidylserine and phosphatidylethanolamine.
3. A combination for use according to claims 1 or 2 wherein the phospholipids are phosphatidylcholine,          phosphatidylinositol,          phosphatidylserine,
5 phosphatidylethanolamine and sphingomyelin and wherein such phospholipids are comprised at respective amounts ranging from 25 to 35 % w/w phosphatidylcholine based on total phospholipids, amounts ranging from 5 to 15% w/w phosphatidylinositol on total phospholipids, amounts ranging from 5 to 10% w/w phosphatidylserine on total phospholipids, amounts ranging from 21 to 30 % io w/w phosphatidylethanolamine on total phospholipids and amounts ranging from 20 to 30% w/w sphingomyelin on total phospholipids.
4. A combination for use according to anyone of claims 1 to 3 a c social fear, in particular for improving inhibited approaches and/or distress in social situations that involves novelty/uncertainty in an infant older than 12 months, a toddler or a 15 young child.
5. A combination for use according to anyone of claims 1 to 3 for promoting high intensity pleasure, in particular pleasure and enjoyment related to high stimulus intensity, rate, complexity, novelty and incongruity, and for reducing sadness, in part

title: Bulk distributor
abstract: The invention relates to a bulk dispenser (1) for dispensing a flowable product, such as a food product, in particular coffee beans. The bulk dispenser (1) comprises: a receiving receptacle (10) having a receiving area (11) for receiving at least a bottom portion (161) of a package (160) containing a flowable product; a cutting element (20) having a cutting edge (21) for cutting the bottom portion (161); and a cutting actuator (40, 60) for actuating the cutting element (21) in order to move the cutting edge (21) in the piercing direction between a retracted position, in which the cutting edge (21) is retracted from the receiving region (11), and an extended position, in which the cutting edge (21) is extended from the receiving region (11). The cutting edge (21) protrudes into the receiving area (11) so as to enter the bottom portion (161) when the package (160) is received in the receiving area (11); and moving along a defined trajectory wherein the cutting edge (21) is in or towards the extended position to cut a bottom opening (162) in the bottom portion (161) when the bottom portion (161) is received in the receiving socket (10). The bulk dispenser (1) further comprises a locking element (80) for locking the package (161) in the receiving socket (10) at least in a direction parallel to the piercing direction; a dispensing opening (90) for allowing the flowable product to flow out of the package (161) by gravity through the bottom opening (162) cut into the bottom portion (161); and a dispenser element (91) for controlling the flow of the flowable product through the dispensing opening (90) out of the dispenser (1).
claims:
1.一种散装分配器(1)，所述散装分配器包括：
·接收插口(10)，所述接收插口具有用于接收容纳可流动的产品的包装(160)的至少底部部分(161)的接收区域(11)；
·切割元件(20)，所述切割元件具有用于切割所述底部部分(161)的切割刃(21)；
·切割致动器(40,60)，所述切割致动器用于致动所述切割元件(21)以使所述切割刃(21)
○沿着穿刺方向在回缩位置与伸出位置之间移动，在所述回缩
位置中，所述切割刃(21)从所述接收区域(11)回缩，在所述伸出位置中，所述切割刃(21)突出到所述接收区域(11)中以便当所述包装(160)被接收在所述接收区域(11)中时进入所述底部部分(161)；以及
○沿着限定的轨迹移动，其中所述切割刃(21)处于所述伸出
位置中或朝向所述伸出位置移动，以当所述底部部分(161)被接收在所述接收插口(10)中时在所述底部部分中切割底部开口(162)；
·锁紧元件(80)，所述锁紧元件用于至少在平行于所述穿刺方向的方向上将所述包装(161)锁定在所述接收插口(10)中；
·分配开口(90)，所述分配开口用于允许所述可流动的产品依靠重力穿过切入所述底部部分(161)中的所述底部开口(162)流出所述包装(161)；和
·分配器元件(91)，所述分配器元件用于控制所述可流动的产品流动穿过所述分配开口(90)、流出所述分配器(1)的流动。
2.根据权利要求1所述的散装分配器(1)，其中所述分配开口(90)被所述切割元件(20)包围和/或所述切割刃(21)的所述轨迹包围。
3.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的散装分配器(1)，其中在所述接收插口(10)的顶视图中，所述轨迹沿循二维路径，优选地为圆的弧段，并且更优选地为具有角度α<360°、甚至更优选地α<355°、最优选地在345°<α<355°之间的圆的弧段。
4.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的散装分配器(1)，其中所述切割致动器被构造用于以组合运动、优选地以螺线运动或以螺旋运动来致动所述切割元件(21)，以使所述切割刃(21)至少部分地同时沿着所述穿刺方向以及沿着所述轨迹移动。
5.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的散装分配器(1)，其中所述切割致动器包括：
·穿刺致动器(40)，所述穿刺致动器用于致动所述切割元件(20)以使所述切割刃(21)沿着所述穿刺方向移动；和
