title: Sustained release melatonin compositions
abstract: The present invention relates to a composition comprising melatonin encapsulated within a calcium alginate hydrogel. It further provides an orally administrable dosage form comprising such a composition held within a gel, wherein the gel is formed using starch as a gelling agent. Processes to produce these compositions, as well as their use in therapy, are also disclosed.
claims:
1. A composition comprising melatonin encapsulated within a calcium alginate hydrogel, and optionally further comprising additional melatonin that is not encapsulated by the calcium.
2. A composition according to claim 1, wherein the weight ratio of melatonin to calcium alginate hydrogel is from 5:95 to 15:85.
3. A composition according to claim 2, wherein the weight ratio of melatonin to calcium alginate hydrogel is about 10:90
4. A composition according to any one of claims 1 to 3, comprising from 4 to 10 wt % water based on the total weight of the composition.
5. A composition according to claim 4, comprising from 6 to 8 wt % water based on the total weight of the composition.
6. A composition according to any one of claims 1 to 5, further comprising sodium and lactate ions.
7. An orally administrable dosage form comprising a composition according to any one of claims 1 to 6 held within a gel, wherein the gel is formed using starch as a gelling agent.
8. A dosage form according to claim 7, comprising from 1 to 3 wt % of the composition according to any one of claims 1 to 6 based on the total weight of the dosage form.
9. A dosage form according to claim 7 or claim 8, further compr

title: Low power standby circuit
abstract: Standby circuit for an electric appliance, the standby circuit comprising: an AC power input for connection to an AC power source, for example to the mains; an AC power output for connection to a control circuit of an electric appliance; a control circuit power line connecting the AC power input to the AC power output, the control circuit power line comprising a control circuit power switch for closing and opening the control circuit power line; a logic device for controlling the control circuit power switch; an auxiliary AC to DC converter connected to the AC power input for supplying DC power to the logic device when the control circuit power line is open; a power-on AC to DC converter connected to the AC power output for supplying DC power to the logic device when the control circuit power line is closed; one or more passive and/or active input components for sensing an input of a user of said electric appliance and generating a corresponding signal; wherein the logic device is configured to receive the signal from the one or more passive and/or active input components, and to control the control circuit power switch based on this signal. Electric appliance comprising such a standby circuit and method for bringing such an appliance from its standby mode to its operative mode.
claims:
1. A standby circuit for an electric appliance, the standby circuit comprising:
an alternating current (AC) power input for connection to an AC power source,
an AC power output for connection to a control circuit of an electric appliance,
a control circuit power line connecting the AC power input to the AC power output, the control circuit power line comprising a control circuit power switch for closing and opening the control circuit power line;
a logic device for controlling the control circuit power switch;
an auxiliary AC to direct current (DC) converter connected to the AC power input for supplying DC power to the logic device when the control circuit power line is open;
a power-on AC to DC converter connected to the AC power output for supplying DC power to the logic device when the control circuit power line is closed;
one or more passive and/or active input components for sensing an input of a user of the electric appliance and generating a corresponding signal; and
the logic device is configured to receive the corresponding signal from the one or more passive and/or active input components, and to control the control circuit power switch based on the corresponding signal,
wherein the standby circuit further comprises a communication interface for communicating with the control circuit of the electric appliance when the control circuit is powered on, wherein the communication interface

title: Emulsion comprising vitamin d or its derivatives having improved stability
claims:
1. An emulsion comprising:
between 0.0000002% and 0.1% by weight of vitamin D or its derivatives with respect to the total weight of emulsion,
between 0.0001% and 10% by weight of triglyceride with respect to the total weight of emulsion, and
between 0.01% to 50% by weight of hydrocolloid with respect to the total weight of emulsion.
2. The emulsion according to claim 1, wherein the triglyceride is a medium chain triglyceride.
3. The emulsion according to claim 1, wherein the hydrocolloid is selected from the group consisting of polysaccharides including acacia gum, xanthan gum, gelatin, carrageenan gum, gellan gum, karaya gum, larch gum, dextran, chitosan, alginate, hyaluronic acid, guar gum, pectin, cellulose, tara gum, tamarind gum, ghatti gum, curdlan gum, konjac glucomannan, scleroglucan, pullulan, agar, tragacanth gum, Portulaca oleracea gum, galactomannan, pectin, starch or modified starch, cellulose derivative and mixtures thereof.
4. The emulsion according to claim 1, wherein said emulsion further comprises a monoglyceride or its derivatives.
5. The emulsion according to claim 4, wherein the monoglyceride is an unsaturated monoglyceride.
6. The emulsion according to claim 4, wherein

title: Beverage preparation device with device housing and liquid tank made with possibility of disconnection
abstract: FIELD: beverage preparation devices.SUBSTANCE: device includes a device housing enclosing functional elements of the device. Functional elements of the device include circulation tubes for liquid, a pump for liquid transfer, a liquid heater and a cooking chamber for beverage preparation. Device also includes liquid tank made with possibility of disconnection for movement along axis of movement. In the inserted position, the tank is completely functionally inserted inside the device housing so that liquid can be supplied by means of a pump for liquid pumping from the liquid tank through the liquid circulation tubes and through the liquid heater into the cooking chamber for the beverage preparation. Device body includes a first hole and a second hole, which are located on opposite sections of device body wall. When the liquid tank is in the inserted position, the first opening is configured to open a part of the liquid tank such that, as a result of pushing said open part of the liquid tank, the liquid tank moves along the axis of movement and from the inserted position through said second opening. Beverage preparation device additionally includes the first connector located at least partially in the device body and the second connector located at least partially on the liquid tank. In the inserted position of the liquid tank, the first connector and the second connector are connected to each other for supplying liquid from the liquid tank. First connector includes a distal end with a connecting hole. First connector is made so that the connecting hole opens in the direction parallel to the axis of movement.EFFECT: providing a beverage preparation device that is more compact and easier to refill with a liquid.14 cl, 15 dwg
claims:
1. Устройство (1) для приготовления напитков, включающее:
- корпус (2) устройства, охватывающий функциональные элементы (6) устройства, причем функциональные элементы (6) устройства включают в себя по меньшей мере циркуляционные трубки для жидкости, насос для перекачки жидкости, нагреватель жидкости и варочную камеру для приготовления напитка; и
- бак (7) для жидкости, выполненный с возможностью отсоединения для перемещения вдоль оси перемещения, чтобы во вставленном положении бак был полностью функционально вставлен внутрь корпуса (2) устройства так, чтобы обеспечить подачу жидкости с помощью насоса для перекачки жидкости из бака (7) для жидкости по циркуляционным трубкам для жидкости и через нагреватель жидкости в варочную камеру для приготовления напитка для смешивания жидкости с содержащимся в ней ингредиентом напитка для приготовления напитка,
при этом корпус (2) устройства включает в себя первое отверстие (51) и второе отверстие (41), которые расположены на противоположных участках (4, 5) стенки корпуса (2) устройства, и
при этом, когда бак (7) для жидкости находится во вставленном положении, первое отверстие (51) выполнено с возможностью открытия части бака (7) для жидкости таким образом, что в результате проталкивания упомянутой открытой части бака (7) для жидкости бак (7) для жидкости перемещается вдоль оси перемещения и из вставленного положения через упомянутое второе отверстие (41),
при этом устройство (1) для приготовления напитков дополнительно включает в себя первый соединитель (9), расположенный по меньшей мере частично в корпусе (2) устройства, и второй соединитель (10), расположенный по меньшей мере частично на баке (7) для жидкости, причем во вставленном положении бака (7) для жидкости первый соединитель (9) и второй соединитель (10) соединены друг с другом для подачи жидкости из бака (7) для жидкости, при этом первый соединитель (9) включает в себя дистальный конец (91) с соединительным отверстием (93), причем первый соединитель (9) выполнен так,

title: Compositions comprising human milk oligosaccharides for use in a subject to support brain development and/or social-emotional development
abstract: The invention provides a fucosylated human milk oligosaccharide (HMO) for use in improving brain development and/or social-emotional development in a subject, wherein the fucosylated HMO is 3-fucosyllactose (3-FL), and wherein the subject is an infant, a young child or a child.
claims:
Claims
1 . A fucosylated human milk oligosaccharide (HMO) for use in improving brain development and/or social-emotional development in a subject, wherein the fucosylated HMO is 3- fucosyllactose (3-FL), and wherein the subject is an infant, a young child or a child.
2. A nutritional composition comprising a fucosylated HMO for use in improving brain development and/or social-emotional development in a subject, wherein the fucosylated HMO is 3-fucosyllactose (3-FL), and wherein the subject is an infant, a young child or a child.
3. The fucosylated HMO for use according to claim 1 or the nutritional composition for use according to claim 2, wherein the infant is at least 5 months old.
4. The fucosylated HMO for use according to claim 1 or claim 3, or the nutritional composition for use according to claim 2 or claim 3, wherein the improvement in brain development and/or social-emotional development in the subject comprises or consists of an improvement in the development of brain network(s) associated with social-emotional functions.
5. The fucosylated HMO for use according to any one of claims 1 , 3, or 4, or the nutritional composition for use according to any one of claims 2 to 4, wherein improving brain development and/or social-emotional development in the subject comprises or consists of promoting the default mode network (DMN).
6. The nutritional composition for use according to

title: Compositions and methods using a mint concentrate for cellular energy
abstract: Compositions comprising a peppermint concentrate are provided. The compositions can be administered to an individual in need thereof for (i) improving a physiological state linked to metabolic fatigue in one or more cells, and/or (ii) increasing mitochondrial energy and mitochondrial calcium uptake in one or more cells, and/or (iii) enhancing mitochondrial function, and /or (iv) treating or preventing a calcium deficiency / depletion disorder in an individual. Additionally or alternatively, the compositions can be administered for treating or preventing a mitochondria-related disease or a condition associated with altered mitochondrial function in an individual in need thereof or at risk thereof.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A composition comprising a mint concentrate, in an effective amount for use in (i) improving a physiological state linked to metabolic fatigue in one or more cells, and/or (ii) increasing mitochondrial energy and mitochondrial calcium uptake in one or more cells, and/or (iii) enhancing mitochondrial function, and/or (iv) treating or preventing a calcium deficiency / depletion disorder in an individual, wherein the mint concentrate is obtainable or obtained by the process comprising the steps of: a) suspending a mint material in an aqueous liquid to form a mint material suspension, b) blending the mint material suspension to obtain a mint material slurry, c) applying a physical mean on the mint material slurry to separate and obtain a mint concentrate, d) optionally, drying the mint concentrate.
2. The composition for use according to claim 1, wherein at least a portion of the one or more cells are part of at least one body part selected from the group consisting of a liver, a kidney, a brain, and a skeletal muscle.
3. The composition for use according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the physiological state linked to metabolic fatigue comprises muscle fatigue, muscle weakness, lack of vitality, weakness or lack of energy, in particular lack of physical energy.
4. The composition for use according to any one of preceding claims, wherein the effect

title: method
abstract: A method for generating a biological clock including a DNA methylation profile which is suitable for use with at least two different sample types, the method includes: (i) providing a first set of DNA methylation profiles generated from the at least two different sample types from a plurality of subjects; (ii) generating a composite DNA methylation profile from the first set of DNA methylation profiles, wherein the composite DNA methylation profile comprises methylation sites that have a matched status in the different sample types; and (iii) using the composite DNA methylation profile to generate a biological clock using reference DNA methylation profiles from one of the at least two sample types.
claims:
1. A method for generating a biological clock comprising a DNA methylation profile which is suitable for use with at least two different sample types, the method comprising: (i) providing a first set of DNA methylation profiles generated from the at least two different sample types from a plurality of subjects; (ii) generating a composite DNA methylation profile from the first set of DNA methylation profiles, wherein the composite DNA methylation profile comprises methylation sites that have a matched status in the at least two different sample types; (iii) using the composite DNA methylation profile to generate a biological clock using reference DNA methylation profiles from at least of one of the at least two sample types.
2. The method according to claim 1 wherein step (ii) comprises comparing the first set of DNA methylation profiles and: (1) including a methylation site in the composite DNA methylation profile if the methylation site has a matched status in the DNA methylation profiles from the at least two different sample types; and/or (2) excluding a methylation site from the composite DNA methylation profile if the methylation site does not have a matched status in the DNA methylation profiles from the at least two different sample types.
3. The method according to claim 1 wherein a matched DNA methylation site has a substantially identical methylation status in the at least two different sample types.
4. The method according to claim 1 wherein

title: Edible plant-based paste and method for producing edible plant-based paste
abstract: The present invention relates to an edible plant-based paste comprising soybean with good organoleptic properties. In particular, the edible plant-based paste comprises at least 15% by weight of soybean, vegetable oil and hard fat in a weight ratio of 4: 1 to 14: 1, and at least one food grade polyglycerol ester. The invention also relates to a method for producing such an edible plant-based paste.
claims:
1.可食用植物基糊状物，所述可食用植物基糊状物包含：
-至少15重量％的大豆，优选30％的大豆，
-重量比为4：1至14：1的植物油与硬脂肪，其中所述硬脂肪具有80℃或更低的熔点，
-至少一种食品级聚甘油酯，优选聚甘油聚蓖麻油酸酯(PGPR)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的可食用植物基糊状物，所述可食用植物基糊状物还包含不同于大豆的油籽。
3.根据权利要求2所述的可食用植物基糊状物，所述可食用植物基糊状物包含至少10重量％、优选10重量％至70重量％、更优选10重量％至40重量％的不同于大豆的油籽。
4.根据权利要求2或3所述的可食用植物基糊状物，其中所述不同于大豆的油籽选自由以下组成的列表：甜瓜籽、芝麻籽、葵花籽或其混合物。
5.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的可食用植物基糊状物，所述可食用植物基糊状物包含0.5重量％至3.5重量％的食品级聚甘油酯。
6.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的可食用植物基糊状物，所述可食用植物基糊状物不含卵磷脂。
7.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的可食用植物基糊状物，其中所述硬脂肪具有40℃至80℃的熔点。

13.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的可食用植物基糊状物，所述可食用植物基糊状物具有低于200微米的D90粒度。
14.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的可食用植物基糊状物，所述可食用植物基糊状物在20℃和300s-1的剪切速率下具有2000mPa.s至15000mPa.s的粘度。

a)提供大豆、优选完整的大豆的步骤，

title: Roasting apparatus
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to coffee industry. Disclosed is apparatus (10) for roasting coffee beans, comprising housing (4), roasting chamber (1) having lower opening (11) and upper opening (12), air supply working member (2), configured to actuate air inside the roasting chamber through the lower opening of said chamber, heater (3) located under the lower opening of the chamber, collector (6) of smoke and particles configured to collect smoke and particles from upper opening (12) of the roasting chamber, wherein roasting chamber (1) is attached to housing (4) with possibility of removal, wherein lower opening (11) of roasting chamber is combined with opening (41) for outlet of hot air in housing, and upper opening (12) of the roasting chamber is combined with collector (6) of smoke and particles, when the roasting chamber is attached to the housing, system (5) for fixing the chamber for attachment of the roasting chamber to the housing with possibility of removal.EFFECT: invention makes it possible to provide an apparatus for frying with an improved system for fixing the roasting chamber.4 cl, 9 dwg

title: Methods and composition for palatable pet foods

title: Method and device for producing a fiber composite material
Method of determining the health status of a dog
abstract: The present invention provides a method for determining a biological age, mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of a dog; said method comprising: a) determining a biological age, mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of the dog using the level of one or more biomarker(s) in one or more samples obtained from the dog, wherein the one or more biomarker(s) is selected from white blood cell count, serum albumin, serum alkaline phosphatase, serum creatine kinase, haemoglobin, haematocrit, mean corpuscular haemoglobin, serum glucose, mean red cell volume, serum globulin, serum calcium, platelet count, and/or red blood cell count; and b) determining a biological age, mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan for the dog using a DNA methylation profile from the dog.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A method for determining a biological age, mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of a dog; said method comprising using (i) the level of one or more biomarker(s) in one or more samples obtained from the dog, and (ii) a DNA methylation profile from the dog to determine a biological age, mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of the dog; wherein the one or more biomarkers are selected from white blood cell count, serum albumin, serum alkaline phosphatase, serum creatine kinase, haemoglobin, haematocrit, mean corpuscular haemoglobin, serum glucose, mean red cell volume, serum globulin, serum calcium, platelet count, and/or red blood cell count.
2. The method according to claim 1 ; wherein said method comprises: a) determining a biological age, mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of the dog using the level of one or more biomarker(s) in one or more samples obtained from the dog, wherein the one or more biomarker(s) is selected from white blood cell count, serum albumin, serum alkaline phosphatase, serum creatine kinase, haemoglobin, haematocrit, mean corpuscular haemoglobin, serum glucose, mean red cell volume, serum globulin, serum calcium, platelet count, and/or red blood cell count; and b) determining a biological age, mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan for the dog using a DNA methylation profile from the dog.
3. The method according to claim 2 wherein the biological age, mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of the dog determined in step a) and the biological age, mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifes

title: Capsule for the preparation of a beverage
abstract: A biodegradable and/or compostable capsule for use with a beverage preparation machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff thereof is disclosed. The capsule comprises a cup-shaped body and a closing membrane for closing the cup-shaped body, both elements defining a closed cavity for a beverage and/or foodstuff ingredient, preferably roast and ground coffee, and a liner or a coating having barrier function, providing barrier function to the cup-shaped body. The cup-shaped body is made of cellulose-based material, preferably molded pulp-based material and comprises a bottom wall, a tubular lateral side wall, an annular flange connected to the lateral wall for the closing membrane to seal thereon, and an outwardly extending rim portion connected to the annular flange. The annular flange is made of cellulose-based material and comprises a first portion in which the cellulose-based material has a porosity comprised between
claims:
1. 一種與一飲料製備機器(10)一起使用以製備其飲料及/或食物之膠囊，該膠囊係可生物降解及/或可堆肥的，且包括： 一杯形本體(1)及用於閉合該杯形本體(1)之一閉合膜(2)，該杯形本體(1)及該閉合膜(2)界定用於固持一飲料及/或食物成分之一閉合空腔，該飲料及/或食物成分較佳地為烘焙及研磨咖啡；及一本體襯墊(20)或具有障壁功能之一塗層，其為該杯形本體(1)提供障壁功能； 該杯形本體(1)由纖維素基材料製成，較佳地由紙漿基材料製成，且包括一底壁(4)、一管狀側壁(5)、連接至該側壁(5)以供該閉合膜(2)密封於其上之一環形凸緣(3)，及連接至該環形凸緣(3)之一向外延伸之邊緣部分(6)， 其特徵在於 該環形凸緣(3)由纖維素基材料製成，且包括一第一部分(3A)，其中該纖維素基材料具有包括在介於30%與70%之間、較佳地介於50%與70%之間之一孔隙度， 該環形凸緣(3)之該第一部分(3A)與該飲料製備機器(10)之一膠囊圍封構件(9)之一邊緣(8)協作，用於改進在飲料製備期間之密封性。
2. 如請求項1之膠囊，其中該環形凸緣(3)之該第一部分(3A)自該側壁(5)延伸，並且與該膠囊之該側壁(5)及該環形凸緣(3)兩者一體成形。
3. 如請求項1或2中任一項之膠囊，其中該第一部分(3A)在該環形凸緣(3)上延伸包括在介於0.4 mm與0.9 mm之間、較佳地介於0.5 mm與0.75 mm之間之一徑向距離(d1)。
4. 如前述請求項中任一項之膠囊，其中該第一部分(3A)具有包括在介於0.9 mm與1.5 mm之間之一厚度，該厚度大於該側壁(5)之厚度。
5. 如前述請求項中任一項之膠囊，其中該第一部分(3A)具有包括在介於0.2 g/cm3與1 g/cm3之間、較佳地介於0.4 g/cm3與1 g/cm3之間、更佳地介於0.6 g/cm3與1 g/cm3之間、最佳地介於0.8 g/cm3與1 g/cm3之間之該纖維素基材料之一密度。
6. 如前述請求項中任一項之膠囊，其中該環形凸緣(3)進一步包括鄰近該第一部分(3A)並自該第一部分向外延伸之一第二部分(3B)，該第二部分(3B)具有包括在介於0.4 mm與0.8 mm之間、較佳地介於0.5 mm與0.7 mm之間之一厚度，且自該第一部分(3A)開始延伸包括在介於0.5 mm與0.9 mm之間之一徑向距離(d2)。
7. 如請求項6之膠囊，其中該第二部分(3B)具有小於40%之所包括的該纖維素基材料之一孔隙度。
8. 如前述請求項中任一項之膠囊，其中該邊緣部分(6)由纖維素基材料與該環形凸緣(3)一體地製成，且包括一捲曲或彎曲的端部部分(6A)，該捲曲或彎曲的端部部分包括一處理區域(6B)，其中該纖維素基材料具有小於40%、較佳地介於0%至25%之間之一孔隙度。
9. 如請求項8之膠囊，其中該處理區域(6B)係一壓縮區域，較佳地處於一玻璃態。
10. 如請求項6或7中任一項與如請求項8或9中任一項組合之膠囊，其中該處理區域(6B)部分地或完全地延伸至該環形凸緣(3)之該第二部分(3B)上。
11. 如前述請求項中任一項之膠囊，其中該杯形本體(1)由包括至少50%、較佳地範圍自80%至100%之重量百分比之纖維素纖維之纖維素紙漿製成。

title: Paper-plastic container and preparation method thereof
abstract: The invention provides a paper-plastic container and a preparation method thereof. The paper-plastic container provided by the embodiment of the invention comprises the following components in percentage by mass: 55-65% of sugarcane fiber and 35-45% of wood fiber. According to the paper-plastic container disclosed by the embodiment of the invention, the raw materials are renewable, and the paper-plastic container has good degradability, does not pollute the environment and has relatively high mechanical strength.
claims:
1.一种纸塑容器，其特征在于，所述纸塑容器按质量分数计包括：55％至65％的甘蔗纤维及35％至45％的木纤维。
2.根据权利要求1所述的纸塑容器，其特征在于，所述纸塑容器包括：
纸塑杯体，所述纸塑杯体具有一端开口的容置腔，所述容置腔用于容纳目标物；
纸塑外沿，所述纸塑外沿环绕所述纸塑杯体的所述开口的外周设置，且所述纸塑外沿与所述纸塑杯体弯折相连；以及
纸塑凸台，所述纸塑凸台设置于所述纸塑外沿背离所述纸塑杯体的一侧且环绕所述纸塑外沿的外周设置；
其中，所述纸塑杯体、所述纸塑外沿、所述纸塑凸台为一体结构，所述纸塑凸台的厚度大于所述纸塑杯体的厚度，所述纸塑杯体的厚度大于所述纸塑外沿的厚度。
3.根据权利要求1所述的纸塑容器，其特征在于，所述纸塑容器承放100℃的液体时，5000rad/min至8000rad/min的转速进行旋转，可耐受60s至180s的旋转。
4.根据权利要求1所述的纸塑容器，其特征在于，所述纸塑容器采用凹模吸浆，并经定型、热压后制得。
5.一种纸塑容器的制备方法，其特征在于，包括：
提供吸浆模及纸塑浆料，其中，所述纸塑浆料包括甘蔗纤维及木纤维，所述纸塑浆料中，所述甘蔗纤维与所述木纤维的质量比的范围为55:45至65:35；
将所述吸浆模置于所述纸塑浆料中进行吸浆，进行定型后，得到纸塑坯件；以及
对所述纸塑坯件进行热压，得到所述纸塑容器。
6.根据权利要求5所述的纸塑容器的制备方法，其特征在于，所述吸浆模为凹模，所述吸浆模具有凹模腔。
7.根据权利要求6所述的纸塑容器的制备方法，其特征在于，所述吸浆模包括吸浆模体、第一网面及第二网面；所述吸浆模体具有所述凹模腔，所述第一网面及所述第二网面依次层叠设置在围合成所述凹模腔的侧壁的表面，所述吸浆模体具有位于所述凹模腔的且间隔设置的多个第一通孔，所述第一网面具有间隔设置的多个第一网孔，所述第二网面具有间隔设置的多个第二网孔，所述第一通孔的孔径大于所述第一网孔的孔径，所述第一网孔的

title: Method for preparing milk based liquid
abstract: The invention concerns a method for producing a milk-based liquid in a beverage preparation apparatus, said apparatus comprising : - at least one mixing chamber configured for producing a liquid by receiving and mixing a dose of soluble powder with water and by dispensing the reconstituted liquid, wherein the method comprises the steps of : - producing a first part of the milk based liquid by supplying the mixing chamber with a dose of soluble dairy milk powder and water so as to reconstitute a dairy milk and dispensing said first part made of dairy milk, and - producing a second part of the milk based liquid by supplying the mixing chamber with a dose of soluble plant-based milk powder and water so as to reconstitute a plant based milk and dispensing the second part made of plant-based milk, wherein the first and the second parts of the milk based liquid are mixed together to form the final milk based liquid.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. Method for producing a milk based liquid in a beverage preparation apparatus (100, 101 ), said apparatus comprising : - at least one supply of soluble plant-based milk powder or concentrate, - at least one supply of soluble dairy milk powder or concentrate, - a water supply system, - at least one mixing chamber (1 ) configured for producing a liquid by receiving and mixing a dose of soluble powder or concentrate with water and by dispensing the reconstituted liquid, wherein the method comprises the steps of : - producing a first part of the milk based liquid by supplying the mixing chamber with a dose of soluble dairy milk powder or concentrate and water so as to reconstitute a dairy milk and dispensing said first part made of dairy milk, and - producing a second part of the milk based liquid by supplying the mixing chamber with a dose of soluble plant-based milk powder or concentrate and water so as to reconstitute a plant based milk and dispensing the second part made of plant-based milk, wherein the first and the second parts of the milk based liquid are mixed together to form the final milk based liquid.
2. Method according to Claim 1 , wherein the first part of the milk based liquid represents 30 to 70 % in volume of the final milk based liquid, preferably 50 to 70 % in volume.
3. Method according to Claim 1 or 2, wherein : - in a first step, the first part of the milk based liquid is produced and dispensed in a container (10), and - in a second step, the second part of the milk based liquid is produced and dispensed in t

title: Actuator nozzle for aerosol packaging, and methods of making and using such actuator nozzles and aerosol packagings
abstract: An actuator nozzle has a lower portion comprising a base configured to connect to a container, and the base includes a lower orifice. The actuator nozzle also has an upper portion including a tapered section on one side of the upper portion, the tapered section tapers inward as the tapered section extends upward from the lower portion, the upper portion further having a substantially vertical section on an opposite side of the upper portion from the tapered section. The actuator nozzle also has an upper orifice in fluid communication with the lower orifice by an interior channel of the actuator nozzle, the upper orifice angled downward from a top of the tapered section of the upper portion to a top of the substantially vertical section of the upper portion.
claims:
1. An actuator nozzle comprising:
a lower portion comprising a base configured to connect to a container, the base comprising a lower orifice;
an upper portion comprising a tapered section on one side of the upper portion, the tapered section tapers inward as the tapered section extends upward from the lower portion, the upper portion further comprising a substantially vertical section on an opposite side of the upper portion from the tapered section; and
an upper orifice in fluid communication with the lower orifice by an interior channel of the actuator nozzle, the upper orifice angled downward from a top of the tapered section of the upper portion to a top of the substantially vertical section of the upper portion.
2. The actuator nozzle of claim 1, wherein the upper orifice has a shape that is oval or semi-circle and has a maximum width at or adjacent to the top of the tapered section.
3. The actuator nozzle of claim 1, wherein the lower portion of the actuator nozzle is substantially symmetrical throughout an entirety of the height of the lower portion.
4. The actuator nozzle of claim 1, comprising one or more pressure points configured to actuate and/or permit actuation of a valve on which the actuator nozzle is mounted.
5. The actuator nozzle of claim 4, wherein the one or more pressure points are po

title: Device for preparing a beverage, system containing such a device, method of preparation in such a device and use of capsules for preparing a beverage
abstract: FIELD: devices for preparing beverages.SUBSTANCE: group of inventions relates to a device for preparing beverages, to a system containing such a device, to a method of preparation in such a device, and to the use of a capsule for preparing beverages. The device is designed to prepare a beverage from a flavouring ingredient supplied inside a capsule in a processing chamber by mixing it with water and centrifuging them around a processing axis. The device has a manipulation system comprising a first ingredient manipulator and a second ingredient manipulator, which are designed to be movable relative to each other from a capsule transfer configuration to a capsule processing configuration. The manipulation system has a beverage outlet(s) and water supply fitting(s), wherein the outlet(s) and/or fitting(s) are connected to a capsule opening device having an opening edge and an opening direction for the capsule, along which the opening edge and the capsule move relative to each other to open the capsule (5b) with the opening edge. The opening device limits a channel for a fluid medium located in the opening direction behind the opening edge.EFFECT: improved control of the extraction process.35 cl, 14 dwg
claims:
1. Устройство (1) для приготовления напитка (4) из вкусоароматического ингредиента (5a), подаваемого внутри капсулы (5b) в полость (5) обработки, путем смешивания упомянутого ингредиента (5a) с водой (4’) в упомянутой капсуле (5b) и центробежного приведения в движение такого ингредиента (5a) и упомянутой воды (4’) вокруг оси (30’) обработки с образованием упомянутого напитка (4), причем устройство (1) содержит:
- вращающуюся систему (10, 20) манипулирования для ингредиента для удержания упомянутой капсулы (5b) и вращения упомянутого вкусоароматического ингредиента (5a) и воды во время центрифугирования вокруг оси (30’) обработки, причем система (10, 20) манипулирования для ингредиента имеет по меньшей мере одно выходное отверстие (25) для напитка и по меньшей мере один штуцер (24) подвода воды для подачи упомянутой воды (4’) к упомянутому ингредиенту (5a), при этом система (10, 20) имеет первый манипулятор (10) для ингредиента и второй манипулятор (20) для ингредиента, которые выполнены с возможностью перемещения относительно друг друга из
конфигурации передачи ингредиента для приема упомянутого ингредиента (5a) внутри упомянутой капсулы (5b) первым и вторым манипуляторами (10, 20) для ингредиента и/или высвобождения упомянутой капсулы (5b) из первого и второго манипуляторов (10, 20) для ингредиента в
конфигурацию обработки ингредиента для центрифугирования упомянутого ингредиента (5a) и воды (4’) внутри упомянутой капсулы (5b) путем вращения вокруг оси (30’) обработки,
и наоборот; и
- раму и/или корпус (40) устройства, которые неподвижны, когда система (10, 20) манипулирования для ингредиента вращается для центрифугирования, и которые поддерживает систему (10, 20) манипулирования для ингредиента,
причем одно или более из выходного(ых) отверстий (25) для напитка и штуцера(ов) (24) подвода воды связаны с одним или более устройствами (24’, 25’) для открывания капсул;
при этом по меньшей мере одно открывающее устройство (24’, 25’) упомянутого(ых) устройства (устройств)

title: Methods and compositions for increasing energy expenditure using cinnamaldehyde
abstract: Compositions comprise an amount of cinnamaldehyde that is orally tolerable, thus avoiding an unpleasant mouth feeling, and also tolerable in the gastrointestinal tract. The amount of cinnamaldehyde is effective to increase at least one of energy expenditure, sympathetic nervous system activity, or fat oxidation, relative to a composition lacking cinnamaldehyde but otherwise identical. The composition comprising cinnamaldehyde can be used in a method to support weight management or promote weight loss, a method for preventing obesity or overweight, and a method for treating obesity or overweight. In an embodiment, the composition comprising cinnamaldehyde is administered to a human. The composition comprising cinnamaldehyde may be a medicament, a food product or a supplement to a food product.
claims:
1. A method for weight maintenance comprising administering to a mammal in need thereof a composition comprising cinnamaldehyde.
2. The method of Claim 1 wherein the cinnamaldehyde is administered in an amount of about 1.25 mg/kg body weight per day.
3. The method of Claim 1 wherein the cinnamaldehyde is present in the composition in a concentration of 17.48 ppm to 6191.0 ppm.
4. The method of Claim 1 wherein the composition comprising cinnamaldehyde is administered once daily.
5. The method of Claim 1 wherein the composition comprises cinnamon essential oil extract that provides at least a portion of the cinnamaldehyde.
6. The method of Claim 1 wherein at least a portion of the cinnamaldehyde is selected from the group consisting of isolated cinnamaldehyde and synthesized c innamaldehyde.
7.      A method for promoting weight loss comprising administering to a mammal
in need thereof a composition comprising cinnamaldehyde.
8. A method for preventing obesity or overweight comprising administering to a mammal at risk thereof a composition comprising cinnamaldehyde.

title: Liquid foodstuffs comprising beta-glucan, hydrolysate from oat-based material, and related methods
abstract: The present disclosure provides a liquid foodstuff containing a beta-glucan having an average molecular weight of between 400 kDa and 5000 kDa, preferably between 500 kDa and 3000 kDa, and having a shear viscosity of between 0.0001 Pa * s (Pa * s) and 0.3 Pa * s, preferably between 0.001 Pa * s and 0.2 Pa * s, when measured at 25 DEG C at shear rates of 0.1 s <-1 >, 1 s <-1 >, 10 s <-1 > and 100 s <-1 >. The liquid foodstuff preferably has a beta-glucan content of one or more of the following: at least 0.5 g of the beta-glucan per serving; or between 0.1 g and 1 g of the beta-glucan per 100 ml of the liquid foodstuff, preferably at least 0.75 g per portion of the liquid foodstuff; or between 0.35 g and 1.5 g of the beta-glucan per 100 ml of the liquid foodstuff.
claims:
1.液体食料，所述液体食料包含具有介于400kDa与5000kDa之间、优选介于500kDa与3000kDa之间的平均分子量的β-葡聚糖，并且当在25℃在0.1s-1、1s-1、10s-1和100s-1的剪切速率下测量时，所述液体食料具有介于0.0001Pa·s(帕秒)与0.3Pa·s之间、优选介于0.001Pa·s与0.2Pa·s之间的剪切粘度，其中所述液体食料具有以下β-葡聚糖含量：
每份所述液体食料至少0.5g的所述β-葡聚糖；和/或
每100ml所述液体食料介于0.1g与1.5g之间的所述β-葡聚糖。
2.根据权利要求1所述的液体食料，其中所述液体食料还包含乳品成分、植物基乳、谷物、油、乳化剂、稳定剂、甜味剂、调味剂或矿物质中的一者或多者。
3.根据权利要求1所述的液体食料，其中所述液体食料选自由液体饮料和汤组成的组，并且优选为即饮型(RTD)饮料。
4.根据权利要求1所述的液体食料，其中所述液体食料包含来自燕麦基材料的水解产物，所述燕麦基材料包含燕麦、大麦或黑麦中的至少一者，并且所述水解产物包含所述β-葡聚糖的至少一部分。
5.根据权利要求4所述的液体食料，其中所述燕麦基材料包含燕麦麸。
6.根据权利要求4至5中任一项所述的液体食料，其中所述水解产物包含：
淀粉，其量为所述燕麦基材料中的初始淀粉的0干重％至20干重％、优选0重量％至10重量％；和
β-葡聚糖，其量为所述燕麦基材料中的初始β-葡聚糖的70干重％至100干重％、优选80重量％至100重量％。
7.根据权利要求4至6中任一项所述的液体食料，其中所述水解产物通过包括使所述燕麦基材料经受包含α-淀粉酶、任选的蛋白酶和任选的淀粉葡糖苷酶的酶组合物的方法来产生。
8.根据权利要求7所述的液体食料，其中所述方法中的所述酶组合物的量为所述燕麦基材料的0.001重量％至5重量％、优选0.001重量％至2重量％。
9.根据权利要求7至8中任一项所述的液体食料，其中所述酶组合物由所述α-淀粉酶、任选的所述蛋白酶和任选的所述淀粉葡糖苷酶组成。
10.根据权利要求7至9中任一项所述的液体食料，其中所述方法在4℃至95℃、优选50℃至80℃的温度范围下进行，并且持续1分钟至10小时、优选15分钟至4小时。
11.液体食料，所述液体食料用于通过减弱有需要的个体的餐后血糖应答(PGPR)而不引起餐后胰岛素应答的变化来预防或减轻所述个体的与碳水化合物、纤维或糖中的一者或多者的摄取相关的健康问题，其中所述液体食料是根据权利要求1至10中任一项所述的食料。
12.液体食料，所述液体食料用于通过降低有需要的个体的总胆固醇和低密度脂蛋白(LDL)胆固醇的水平、增加纤维摄取、改善血糖调节、促进消化健康和规律性和/或支持体重管理来预防或减轻所述个体的与碳水化合物、纤维或糖中的一者或多者的摄取相关的健康问题，其中所述液体食料是根据权利要求1至10中任一项所述的食料。

title: Compostable pod for beverage preparation
abstract: The invention relates to a pod (100, 200) for preparing a beverage in a beverage production machine, wherein the pod (100, 200) is made of a biodegradable, preferably compostable, material composition and comprises a pod body (110) composed of two half-shells (101, 102) being connected to each other along their respective circumferential flange (140) so as to delimit a chamber (103) for containing a substance (105) for the preparation of the beverage. The at least one half-shell comprises in a layered manner: • A primary layer (171) made of a paper-based material; • A secondary layer (172) with at least an oxygen barrier function and optionally a water barrier function; and • An at least partial, tertiary layer (173) with a filter function, The primary layer of said at least one half-shell (106) comprises at least one non-traversing pre-cut hole and/or scratch forming a pre-cut pattern (108) or scratch's pattern (I, CE) over at least a delivery portion (130) of the half-shell adapted to interact with external opening elements of the beverage production machine, under the effect of rising pressure of the fluid being injected into the pod (100, 200) through an injection portion (120) on the other half-shell (101, 102), to dispense the prepared beverage from the pod (100, 200). The invention also relates to the use of said pod in a beverage production machine.
claims:
1. A pod for preparing a beverage in a beverage production machine, wherein the pod is made of a biodegradable material composition and comprises a pod body composed of two half-shells being connected to each other along their respective circumferential flange so as to define a chamber for containing a substance for the preparation of the beverage, wherein at least one half-shell comprises in a layered manner:
A primary layer made of a paper-based material,
A secondary layer with at least an oxygen barrier function, and
An at least partial tertiary layer with a filter function,
wherein the primary layer of said at least one half-shell comprises at least one non-traversing, pre-cut hole and/or scratch, forming a pre-cut hole's pattern or scratch's pattern, over at least a delivery portion of the half-shell adapted to interact with external opening elements of the beverage production machine, under the effect of rising pressure of the fluid being injected into the pod through an injection portion on the other half-shell, to dispense the prepared beverage from the pod-.
2. The pod according to claim 1, wherein the primary layer is made of stretchable and/or formable paper-based material having an elongation at break of at least 6%.
3. The pod according to claim 1, wherein the primary layer is arranged opposite to the chamber with respect to the secondary layer.
4. The pod according

title: Machine with inclined top face
abstract: A machine (10, 88) for processing a liquid food substance, such as milk or a milk-based substance, is provided. The machine (10, 88) comprises a jug (14) having a container (16) delimiting a food cavity for containing said liquid food substance and optionally a lid, e.g. a removable lid (38), for covering the food cavity, a base (12) forming a seat (52) for removably receiving the container (16), the base (12) having a bottom face (18) configured for placing the machine (10) on an external support surface (82), a top face (20) opposite the bottom face (18), and at least one peripheral side face (22) extending between the bottom face (18) and the top face (20), wherein the at least one peripheral side face (22) includes a front portion (24) configured for facing a user of the machine (10) and a rear portion (36) configured for facing away from the user; wherein a user interface (34) is provided along the top face (20); and wherein a height of the rear portion (26) is greater than a height of the front portion (24) such that the top face (20) is inclined to face the user when processing said liquid food substance.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A machine (10, 88) for processing a liquid food substance,such as milk or a milk-based substance, comprising:- a jug (14) having a container (16) delimiting a food cavityfor containing said liquid food substance and optionally a lid, e.g. a removable lid (38), for covering the food cavity;- a base (12) having one or more walls forming a seat (52) forremovably receiving the container (16); and- the base (12) having a bottom face (18) configured for placingthe machine (10) on an external support surface (82), a top face (20) opposite the bottom face (18), and at least one peripheral side face (22) extending between the bottom face (18) and the top face (20) wherein the at least one peripheral side face (22) includes a front portion (24) configured for facing a user of the machine (10) when processing said liquid food substance and a rear portion (36) configured for facing away from the user when processing said liquid food substance, wherein a user interface (34) is provided along the top face (20) for allowing the user of the machine (10) to interact with the machine (10) when processing said liquid food substance, and wherein a height of the rear portion (26) is greater than a height of the front portion (24) such that the top face (20) is inclined to face the user when processing said liquid food substance.
2. The machine (10, 88) of claim 1, wherein the lid (38) hasan outer lid face (40), and the outer lid face (40) extends flush or substantially flush with the top face (20) when the lid (38) is arranged on the container (16) and the container (16) is received in the seat (52) for processing said liquid food substance.
3. The machine (10, 88) of any preceding claim, wherein

title: Beverage extraction device
A chocolate product comprising a milk analogue product
abstract: The invention relates to a reduced dairy chocolate product, preferably a vegan chocolate product composition comprising a dried plant protein.
claims:
1. A method of making a chocolate product, said method comprising a. Adding plant protein to water to form a plant protein mixture; b Adding sugar, polyol, or one or more polysaccharides or mixtures thereof to the plant protein mixture; c. d. Homogenizing the plant protein mixture; e. Applying a thermal treatment to form a plant-based liquid; f. Spray drying the plant-based liquid to form a plant-based composition; and g. Combining the dry composition with other ingredients to form a chocolate product.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the plant protein is derived from a legume source.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the plant protein is a concentrate or an isolate.
4. The method according to claim 1, wherein step b. involves the addition of a mixture of a sugar and at least one polysaccharide.
5. The method according to claim 1, wherein the sugar is selected from the group consisting of sucrose, fructose, glucose, dextrose, galactose, allulose, maltose, high dextrose equivalent hydrolysed starch syrup, xylose, and combinations thereof.
6. The method according to claim 1, wherein the polyol is selected from the group consisting of sorbitol, mannitol, isomalt, maltitol, lactitol, xylitol, erythritol or glycerol.

title: Beverage pod system with pod holder
abstract: The invention concerns an extraction device for extracting a beverage ingredient by supplying an extraction liquid into a pod, said pod comprising a pod body with a bottom wall and a top lid, said extraction device comprising: —upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts relatively movable, and—a removable pod holder, said holder comprising a pod receiving hole to receive and hold the pod, and—a top insertion section configured for introducing the pod holder in the device and for positioning said holder between the upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts, and wherein the top insertion section is configured to introduce the holder along a vertical direction from the top of the device, and wherein the pod receiving hole and the top insertion section are configured to position the lid of the pod vertically when the removable pod holder is positioned inside the device.
claims:
1. An extraction device for extracting a beverage ingredient by supplying an extraction liquid into a pod,
said pod comprising:
a pod body, said pod body comprising a side wall and a bottom wall defining a chamber, and
a top lid closing the top opening of the pod body,
and
said extraction device comprising:
upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts relatively movable, along a horizontal longitudinal axis between an open position for inserting and removing the pod and a closed position for forming an extraction chamber enclosing the pod during extraction, and
a removable pod holder, said holder comprising a pod receiving hole to receive and hold the pod, and
a top insertion section configured for introducing the pod holder in the device and positioning said holder between the upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts,
wherein the top insertion section is configured to introduce the holder along a vertical direction from the top of the device, and
wherein the pod receiving hole and the top insertion section are configured to position the lid of the pod vertically when the removable pod holder s introduced inside the device.
2. Extraction device according to claim 1, wherein the upstream enclosing part bears an upstream piercing a

title: Syrup binder system for preparing food, and preparation process and use thereof
abstract: The present invention relates to the food field. Specifically, the present invention relates to a syrup binder system for preparing a food containing extruded or puffed cereal and/or nuts, such as compound sachima (complexed sachima), cereal bars, crunchy rice candy or nut bars, etc., a preparation process and use thereof, and a food containing the syrup binder system.
claims:
22 CLAIMS:
1. Syrup binder system for food, said binder system comprising a sugar, a polyol, dietary fiber having water holding capacity greater than 8 ml/g, an emulsifier, edible oil, and water.
2. The syrup binder system according to claim 1, further comprising cellulose or a derivative thereof.
3. The syrup binder system according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the polyol is a polyol having 2-5 hydroxy groups.
4. The syrup binder system according to any one of claims 1-3, wherein the dietary fiber is present in an amount of 0.1-8 wt% based on the total weight of the syrup binder system.
5. The syrup binder system according to any one of claims 1-4, wherein the emulsifier is present in an amount of 0.01-5 wt%.
6. The syrup binder system according to any one of claims 1-5, further capable of comprising one or more of flavouring substances, pigments, edible salts, preservatives, antioxidants, vitamins, minerals, trace elements and nutriments.
7. The syrup binder system according to any one of claims 1-6, a syrup binder having a water activity ranging from 0.3 to 0.7.
8. A process for preparing the syrup binder system according to any one of claims 1-7, comprising: (a) providing a syrup mixture having a Brix value of 80%-90%, wherein the syrup

title: Process of calibration of a roasting apparatus
abstract: The invention concerns process of calibration of a coffee beans roasting apparatus in order to reproduce coffee beans roasting recipes defined with one specific master roasting apparatus, said calibration process comprising the steps of: a—introducing at least one second temporary temperature probe inside the chamber of the roasting apparatus, b—controlling the heating device to reproduce a preset curve R said control being based on the temperature Treg regulated by the at least one first temperature probe, c—during the reproduction of the preset curve Rset, measuring the temperature Tcal in function of time inside the chamber, d—comparing the temperature Tcal@ti with the temperature Tref@ti of a pre-determined calibration curve Rref obtained with the master roasting apparatus (M), said calibration curve Rref representing the temperature Tref measured in the chamber of the specific master apparatus (M) while controlling the heating device of the master apparatus to reproduce said preset curve Rset, e—based on this comparison, calibrating the roasting apparatus by applying a correction, to the temperature Treg regulated by the first temperature probe inside the control system of the roasting apparatus.
claims:
1. Calibration process of a coffee beans roasting apparatus, in order to reproduce coffee beans roasting recipes defined with one specific master roasting apparatus,
said coffee beans roasting apparatus comprising:
a chamber to contain coffee beans,
a heating device configured to supply hot air to the chamber,
at least one first temperature probe to measure the temperature of air supplied by the heating device, said first temperature probe being positioned outside the chamber,
a control system configured to control the heating device and configured to reproduce roasting curves, said roasting curves providing at least a set of points representing the temperature to be applied at discrete successive times ti, respectively, said control of the heating device implementing a feedback loop regulation based on the temperature Treg measured by the at least one first temperature probe,
said calibration process comprising the steps of:
a—introducing at least one second temporary temperature probe inside the chamber of the roasting apparatus to be calibrated or replacing said chamber by a temporary calibration chamber, said temporary calibration chamber comprising at least one second temperature probe,
b—controlling the heating device to reproduce a preset curve Rset, said preset curve providing a series of points representing the temperature Tset@t1, Tset@t2, . . . Tset@tfinal to be applied at preset corresponding successive times t1, t2, . . . , tfinal respecti

title: Packaged paper-based capsules
abstract: The present invention relates to a packaged capsule comprising: (i) a capsule comprising cellulosic fibres, wherein the capsule is surface-coated with a lining which is (a) an inorganic coating; or (b) a natural polymer coating; the capsule is at least partially filled with an edible product suitable for human consumption; and the capsule is sealed with a membrane comprising cellulosic fibres, wherein the membrane is surface-coated with the same lining as the capsule; and (ii) a packaging comprising at least 80% wt of cellulosic fibres based upon the total weight of the packaging, a metallized polymer coating in contact with the cellulosic fibres, and a polymer coating in contact with the metallized polymer coating; wherein the capsule is placed within the packaging; to methods for the manufacture of the packaged capsule, and to a packet comprising a plurality of the packaged capsules.
claims:
Claims
1. A packaged capsule comprising: (i) a capsule comprising cellulosic fibres, wherein the capsule is surface-coated with a lining which is: (a) an inorganic coating; or (b) a natural polymer coating; the capsule is at least partially filled with an edible product suitable for human consumption; and the capsule is sealed with a membrane comprising cellulosic fibres, wherein the membrane is surface-coated with the same lining as the capsule; and (ii) a packaging comprising at least 80% wt of cellulosic fibres based upon the total weight of the packaging, a metallized polymer coating in contact with the cellulosic fibres, and a polymer coating in contact with the metallized polymer coating; wherein the capsule is placed within the packaging.
2. A packaged capsule as claimed in claim 1, wherein the cellulosic fibres in the capsule and/or the membrane are selected from cellulose fibres from wood, jut, bagasse, hemp, straw, bamboo and combinations thereof, preferably cellulose fibres from wood, jut, bagasse, hemp, and combinations thereof.
3. A packaged capsule as claimed in claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the inorganic coating is a polymer from a sol-gel process of a mixture of one or more alkoxy silane monomers and an acid catalyst in water.
4. A packaged capsule as claimed in claim 3, wherein the one or more alkoxy silane monomers are selected from tetraethyl orthosilicate, triethoxy methylsilane, triethoxy(methyl)alkoxy silane, triethoxy(ethyl)alkoxy silane, triethoxy(propyl)alkoxy

title: Composition for use in increasing spermidine production by microbiota
abstract: The present invention relates to compositions comprising at least one source of protein and at least one source of prebiotic for use in increasing spermidine production by the gut microbiota. The composition can be used in preventing and/or treating age-related disorders.
claims:
CLAIMS
1 . A composition comprising at least one source of protein and at least one source of prebiotic for use in increasing spermidine production by the gut microbiota of a subject.
2. The composition as claimed in claim 1 , wherein the source of protein is at least one selected from the group: pulses, grain, nuts, algae, oil crop and/or its press cakes, animal proteins or combination thereof.
3. The composition as claimed in claim 2, wherein pulses are at least one selected from the group comprising faba bean, chick pea, green pea, lentil.
4. The composition as claimed in claim 2, wherein grains are at least one selected from the group comprising rice, oat, quinoa, wheat, barley.
5. The composition as claimed in claim 2, wherein nuts are at least one selected from walnut, almond, pistachio.
6. The composition as claimed in claim 2, wherein algae are at least one selected from seaweed, microalgae.
7. The composition as claimed in claim 2, wherein oil crop and/or its press cakes are selected from soy, canola, peanut, bambara.
8. The composition as claimed in claim 2, wherein animal proteins are at least one selected from milk, egg, seafood, poultry, red meat, white meat.
9.

title: Human milk oligosaccharides for improving gut microbiome and methods for determining gut maturation status
abstract: The present invention provides methods for inducing a formula-fed infant's gut microbiome trajectory to converge with that of a reference gut microbiome trajectory obtained from human milk-fed infants, the methods comprising administering an effective amount of a mixture of human milk oligosaccharides (HMOs) to the formula-fed infant. The present invention also provides methods for determining the gut maturation status of a formula-fed infant, the methods comprising providing a reference gut microbiome trajectory obtained from human milk-fed infants.
claims:
1. A mixture of human milk oligosaccharides (HMOs) for use in inducing a formula-fed infant’s gut microbiome trajectory to converge with that of a reference gut microbiome trajectory obtained from human milk-fed infants, wherein the mixture of HMOs comprises or consists of 2’-fucosyllactose (2’FL), 2’,3-difucosyllactose (diFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 3’-sialyllactose (3’-SL), and 6’-sialyllactose (6’-SL).
2. The mixture of HMOs for use according to claim 1, wherein the mixture of HMOs comprises or consists of: (i) 2’FL in an amount of from about 55 wt% to about 60 wt%; (ii) diFL in an amount of from about 5 wt% to about 7 wt%; (iii) LNT in an amount of from about 18 wt% to about 20 wt%; (iv) 3’-SL in an amount of from about 6 wt% to about 8 wt%; and (v) 6’-SL in an amount of from about 9 wt% to about 11 wt%, based on the total weight of HMOs.
3. The mixture of HMOs for use according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the mixture of HMOs is administered in the form of an infant formula, optionally wherein the mixture of HMOs is administered in the form of a starter infant formula, a follow-up formula, and/or a growing-up milk.
4. The mixture of HMOs for use according to any preceding claim, wherein the mixture of HMOs is administered in the form of: (a) a starter infant formula comprising a total amount of HMOs of from about 0.5 g/L to about 5.0 g/L, from about 1.0 g/L to about 3.0 g/L, or from about 1.5 g/L to about 2.5 g/L, optiona

title: Coffee composition and process
abstract: The present invention relates to a coffee composition with improved aroma and a method of producing a coffee composition wherein two different types of coffee beans are roasted separately.
claims:
1. A coffee composition comprising furfural and (E)-P-damascenone wherein the ratio of concentrations of furfural to (E )-P-damascenone is from 400 to 1000.
2. The coffee composition according to claim 1 comprising 4-ethylguaiacol and 2,3-pentanedione wherein the ratio of concentrations of 2,3-pentanedione to 4-ethylguaiacol is from 5 to 20.
3. The coffee composition according to claim 1 or claim 2 comprising N-caffeoyl-tryptophan and 4-ethylguaiacol wherein the ratio of concentrations of 4-ethylguaiacol to N-caffeoyl-tryptophan is from 1500 to 3000.
4. The coffee composition according to any one of claims 1 to 3 comprising at least 20 wt.% coffee solids originating from Robusta beans as a percentage of total coffee solids.
5. The coffee composition according to any one of claims 1 to 4 comprising at least 45 mg of 2,3-butanedione per kg of soluble coffee solids.
6. A method of producing a coffee composition, the method comprising; a) roasting a first type of green coffee beans to a roast colour of between 60 and 120 CTN; b) roasting a second type of green coffee beans to a roast colour of between 30 and 100 CTN; c) optionally, extracting the roasted beans obtained in step a) and the roasted beans obtained in step b) with water; wherein the roast colour of the roasted beans obtained in step a) is at least 20 CTN higher than the roast colour

title: Beverage or foodstuff preparation system
abstract: A system comprising: a container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof, the container including a plurality of machine-readable codes, each code storing preparation information for use with a preparation process performed by said machine, each code comprising a plurality of units defining a data portion arranged at a predetermined position with respect to a reference portion, the reference portions of adjoining codes arranged to define vertices of a quadrilateral with at least two equal sides; a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof, the machine including: a processing unit for processing precursor material of the container, and; electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on preparation information read from the code, and; a code reading system to read the code of the container by obtaining, with an image capturing device, a digital image of the code which is equal angular quadrilateral in shape; wherein the container and code reading system are configured to obtain the quadrilateral shaped digital image arranged oblique to said quadrilateral defined by the adjoining codes with said digital image to comprise at least two reference portions of the codes.
claims:
1. A system comprising:
a container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof, the container including a plurality of machine-readable codes, each code storing preparation information for use with a preparation process performed by said machine,
each code comprising a plurality of units defining a data portion arranged at a predetermined position with respect to a reference portion, the reference portions of adjoining codes arranged to define vertices of an equal angular quadrilateral with at least two equal sides;
a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof, the machine including:
a processing unit for processing precursor material of the container, and; electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on preparation information read from the code, and;
a code reading system to read the code of the container by obtaining, with an image capturing device, a digital image of the code which is equal angular quadrilateral in shape;
wherein the container and code reading system are configured to obtain the quadrilateral shaped digital image arranged oblique to said quadrilateral defined by the adjoining codes with said digital image to comprise at least two reference portions of the codes, with sides of the quadrilateral shaped digital image angled to the quadrilateral defined by the adjoining codes.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the quad

title: Powdered food emulsion compositions with lentil proteins
abstract: The invention relates to a powdered food emulsion composition. It comprises at least one fat ingredient and a lentil protein ingredient. The lentil protein ingredient is selected from the list consisting of lentil protein concentrate, lentil flour or a mixture thereof. Moreover, the lentil proteins of the lentil protein ingredient are not hydrolysed. The invention also relates to a method for preparing such a powdered food emulsion composition.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A powdered food emulsion composition, which comprises at least one fat ingredient and a lentil protein ingredient, wherein the lentil protein ingredient is selected from the list consisting of lentil protein concentrate, lentil flour or a mixture thereof, and wherein the lentil proteins of the lentil protein ingredient are not hydrolysed.
2. The powdered food emulsion composition according to claim 1, wherein the proteins of the lentil protein ingredient are not hydrolysed.
3. The powdered food emulsion composition according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the proteins of the powdered food emulsion composition are not hydrolysed.
4. The powdered food emulsion composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the lentil protein ingredient is not hydrolysed.
5. The powdered food emulsion composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the proteins of the lentil protein ingredient consist only of lentil proteins.
6. The powdered food emulsion composition according to any one of the preceding claims, which comprises at least 0.5wt% lentil proteins by dry weight, preferably 0.5 to 30wt.% lentil proteins by dry weight.
7. The powdered food emulsion composition according to any one of the preceding claims,

title: Compositions and methods using spermidine to reduce biological age of an adult animal
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A method for reducing the biological age and/or for reducing the rate of increase of the biological age of an adult animal in need, the method comprising: feeding the adult animal a composition comprising an effective amount of spermidine.
2. A method for reducing the biological age of a tissue, organ or physiological system in an adult animal in need, the method comprising feeding the adult animal a composition comprising an effective amount of spermidine.
3. A method according to claim 2, wherein the tissue, organ or physiological system is immune, gastrointestinal, urinary, muscular, cardiovascular, and/or neurological system.
4. A method according to claim 2, wherein the tissue has a deficiency in spermidine.
5. A method according to any of claims 2-4, wherein the tissue is skeletal muscle.
6. A method for treating, preventing, or delaying the onset of an organ disease, or decline of organ function, or condition relating thereto in an adult animal in need, the method comprising feeding the adult animal a composition comprising an effective amount of spermidine.
7. A method according to any preceding claim, wherein the animal in need has an increased biological age compared to its chronological age.

title: Dried animal digest compositions
claims:
1. A dried animal digest composition, comprising dried animal digest particles having an animal fat content of about 16 wt% or less and a moisture content of about 3 wt% or less, wherein the dried animal digest particles have a volume diameter particle size distribution where D10 is from about 20 pm to about 50 pm, D50 is from about 60 pm to about 150 pm, and D90 is from about 160 pm to about 275 pm, and wherein the dried animal digest composition is substantially devoid of silicon dioxide flow aid.
2. The dried animal digest composition of claim 1, wherein the percentage of dried animal digest particles below 30 pm based on volume diameter is from 3% to 20%.
3. The dried animal digest composition of claim 1, wherein the percentage of dried animal digest particles below 45 pm based on volume diameter is from 5% to 25%.
4. The dried animal digest composition of claim 1, wherein a volume mean diameter of the dried animal digest particles is from about 60 pm to about 160 pm.
5. The dried animal digest composition of claim 1, wherein D10 is from about 25 pm to about 40 pm, D50 is from about 75 pm to about 125 pm, D90 is from about 185 pm to about 250 pm, or a combination thereof.
6. The dried animal digest composition of claim 1, wherein the dried animal digest composition is completely devoid of the silicon dioxide flow aid, and is also devoid of chemic

title: Method for cell expansion
abstract: A method for expanding mammalian cells, and products produced by the method, the method comprising dynamically agitating cells in a bioreactor to produce expanded cell cultures.
claims:
1.一种用于在搅拌槽生物反应器中扩增哺乳动物细胞的方法，所述生物反应器包含哺乳动物细胞和细胞培养基，所述方法包括动态搅拌所述生物反应器中的所述细胞以产生扩增的细胞培养物。
2.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中所述动态搅拌包括以在所述扩增的细胞培养物的生产期间改变的搅拌速度搅拌所述细胞。
3.根据权利要求2所述的方法，其中将所述搅拌速度从第一搅拌速度增加至第二搅拌速度。
4.根据权利要求2或3所述的方法，其中所述搅拌速度在150RPM至800RPM范围内。
5.根据权利要求3或4所述的方法，其中所述第一搅拌速度以每小时6.25RPM至20RPM的速率增加至第二搅拌速度。
6.根据权利要求4或5所述的方法，其中所述第一搅拌速度为150RPM至300RPM，并且所述第二搅拌速度为400RPM至500RPM。
7.根据权利要求5所述的方法，其中所述第一搅拌速度为250RPM，并且任选地，所述第二搅拌速度为400RPM。
8.根据权利要求2或3所述的方法，其中搅拌功率在3W/m3至600W/m3的范围内。
9.根据权利要求3或8所述的方法，其中第一搅拌功率以每小时2.35W/m3至23.53W/m3的速率增加至第二搅拌功率。
10.根据权利要求9所述的方法，其中所述第一搅拌速度为3W/m3至32W/m3并且所述第二搅拌速度为70W/m3至150W/m3。
11.根据权利要求10所述的方法，其中所述第一搅拌功率为约18W/m3，并且任选地所述第二搅拌功率为75W/m3。
12.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中所述扩增方法的所述动态搅拌具有3天至30天，任选地5天的持续时间。
13.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中所述搅拌速度从第2天至第3天改变，其中所述扩增方法在第0天启动。
14.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中用于扩增的所述细胞为人细胞，和/或其中用于扩增的所述细胞为干细胞。
15.根据权利要求1至14中任一项所述的方法，其中用于扩增的所述细胞选自以下中的任一者：多能干细胞(PSC)、肌肉干细胞/卫星细胞(MuSC/SC)、脂肪来源的干细胞(ADSC)、脂肪细胞、上皮细胞、间充质干细胞/基质细胞(MSC)、纤维脂肪形成祖细胞(FAPS)、诱导性多能干细胞(iPSC)、母乳干细胞(BMSC)、胚胎样干细胞(ELC-C)、化学诱导性多能干细胞(CiPSC)和化学诱导性全能干细胞(CiTotiSC)，任选地其中用于扩增的所述细胞为iPSC。

title: Compositions and methods for digestive health of felines
abstract: Compositions and methods for providing digestive health benefits to felines comprise the use of a prebiotic fiber blend comprising pumpkin, inulin, and optionally wheat bran aleurone.
claims:
1.用于猫科动物的益生元纤维共混物，所述益生元纤维共混物包含南瓜、菊粉和任选的小麦麸糊粉。
2.根据权利要求1所述的益生元纤维共混物，其中所述南瓜以约20％至约50％的量存在于所述纤维共混物中。
3.根据权利要求1所述的益生元纤维共混物，其中所述菊粉以约10％至约40％的量存在于所述纤维共混物中。
4.根据权利要求1所述的益生元纤维共混物，其中所述纤维共混物包含小麦麸糊粉，并且其中所述小麦麸糊粉以约20％至约50％的量存在于所述纤维共混物中。
5.宠物食物组合物，所述宠物食物组合物包含根据权利要求1所述的益生元纤维共混物。
6.根据权利要求5所述的宠物食物组合物，所述宠物食物组合物还包含蛋白质、碳水化合物、脂肪和防腐剂，其中所述纤维共混物以约0.1％至约10％的量存在于所述宠物食物组合物中。
7.根据权利要求5所述的宠物食物组合物，其中所述南瓜以约0.01％至约5％的量存在于所述宠物食物组合物中，所述菊粉以约0.01％至约5％的量存在于所述宠物食物组合物中，并且所述小麦麸糊粉以约0.01％至约5％的量存在于所述宠物食物组合物中。
8.根据权利要求5所述的宠物食物组合物，其中所述宠物食物组合物为完全且均衡的宠物食物。
9.补充剂，所述补充剂包含根据权利要求1所述的益生元纤维共混物。
10.根据权利要求9所述的补充剂，其中所述纤维共混物以约0.1％至约50％的量存在于所述补充剂中。
11.向猫科动物提供消化健康益处的方法，所述方法包括向所述猫科动物施用益生元纤维共混物，其中所述益生元纤维共混物包含南瓜、菊粉和任选的小麦麸糊粉。
12.根据权利要求11所述的方法，其中将所述益生元纤维共混物定期施用于所述猫科动物。
13.根据权利要求11所述的方法，其中所述益生元纤维共混物作为宠物食物组合物的一部分施用于所述猫科动物。
14.根据权利要求11所述的方法，其中所述消化健康益处选自治疗腹泻、增加粪便质量、增加微生物组多样性、减少炎症、增加有益细菌、减少蛋白质分解代谢产物、减少病原菌、减少餐后葡萄糖波动及其组合。
15.根据权利要求11所述的方法，其中所述南瓜以约20％至约50％的量存在于所述纤维共混物中，其中所述菊粉以约10％至约40％的量存在于所述纤维共混物中，并且其中所述小麦麸糊粉以约20％至约50％的量存在于所述纤维共混物中。

title: Method for manufacturing a compostable pod
abstract: The invention relates to a method for manufacturing a pod (100) for preparing a beverage in a beverage production machine, the machine having opening elements for opening the pod (100) under the effect of rising pressure of fluid being injected into the pod (100). In the method, two formable sheet elements (200) are provided, into one of which an opening (210) is cut. A second sheet material (300) is provided and connected with the respective sheet element (200) at a connection area (230) that circumferentially surrounds the opening (210). The so connected sheet material (300) forms a delivery wall (110) of the pod (100), through which during the beverage preparation process the prepared beverage is dispensed from the pod (100). The two sheet elements (200) are formed into the shape of a half-shell (101, 102), respectively, whereby the connection area (230) is pinched from opposite sides of the sheet element (200) when forming the respective half-shell (101, 102). An injection wall (120) for injecting a fluid into the pod (100) is formed. A substance (105) for the beverage is provided and the two half-shells (101, 102) are connected to form a pod body (130) around the substance (105). Therein, the pod body (130) together with the delivery wall (110) and the injection wall (120) delimit a chamber containing the substance (105). The delivery wall (110) is configured to be opened upon interaction with the opening elements of the beverage production machine under the effect of rising pressure of the fluid being injected into the pod (100).
claims:
1. A method for manufacturing a pod for preparing a beverage in a beverage production machine, comprising the steps of:
providing two sheet elements each being made of a formable material;
cutting an opening into one of the sheet elements;
covering the opening with a sheet material and connecting the sheet material and the respective sheet element at a connection area circumferentially surrounding the opening, the so connected sheet material forming a delivery wall;
forming the two sheet elements into the shape of a half-shell, respectively;
forming an injection wall of the pod for injecting a fluid into the pod;
providing a substance required for the preparation of the beverage;
connecting the two half-shells to form a pod body around the substance to form the pod, the pod body together with the delivery wall and the injection wall defining a chamber containing the substance for preparing the beverage upon interaction of the substance with the fluid injected through the injection wall, and the delivery wall being adapted to be opened upon interaction with opening elements of the beverage production machine under the effect of rising pressure of the fluid being injected into the pod to dispense the prepared beverage from the pod, and
wherein the connection area is pinched from opposite sides of the sheet element when forming the respective half-shell.
2. The method

title: Roasting apparatus calibration system
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: group of inventions relates to coffee industry. Disclosed is a coffee bean roasting system, comprising a coffee bean roasting apparatus, comprising a roasting chamber, a heating device, at least one first temperature sensor for controlling the temperature of air supplied by the heating device, which is located outside the chamber, a control system configured to control the heating device and made with possibility to reproduce frying curves, wherein each of frying curves provides, at least a set of points representing a temperature to be applied at separate successive times ti, respectively, wherein said control of the heating device is based on a temperature Treg, controlled by at least one first temperature sensor, and at least one second temperature sensor configured to be temporarily inserted into the roasting apparatus to measure the temperature inside the roasting chamber, and at least one means configured to create a pressure loss of the hot air flow, while there are no coffee beans in the chamber, for simulating the presence of coffee beans inside the chamber during a roasting operation. Also disclosed is a calibration chamber configured to be introduced instead of a roasting chamber of a roasting apparatus, and a method of calibrating the apparatus for roasting said system for roasting coffee beans.EFFECT: group of inventions enables to ensure identical roasting at the same roasting profile in different roasting apparatuses.19 cl, 13 dwg
claims:
1. Система для обжаривания кофейных зерен, содержащая:
- аппарат для обжаривания кофейных зерен, причем указанный аппарат содержит:
обжарочную камеру, предназначенную для обжаривания кофейных зерен,
- нагревательное устройство для подачи потока горячего воздуха в камеру,
по меньшей мере один первый датчик температуры для регулирования температуры воздуха, подаваемого нагревательным устройством, причем указанный первый датчик температуры расположен за пределами камеры,
систему управления, выполненную с возможностью управления нагревательным устройством и выполненную с возможностью воспроизведения кривых обжаривания, причем каждая из указанных кривых обжаривания обеспечивает, по меньшей мере, набор точек, представляющих температуру, которую нужно применять в отдельные последовательные моменты времени ti соответственно, причем указанное управление нагревательного устройства основано на температуре Treg, регулируемой по меньшей мере одним первым датчиком температуры, и
- по меньшей мере один второй датчик температуры, выполненный с возможностью временного введения внутрь аппарата для обжаривания для измерения температуры внутри обжарочной камеры, и
- по меньшей мере одно средство, выполненное с возможностью создания потери давления потока горячего воздуха, в то время как в камере отсутствуют кофейные зерна, для имитации наличия кофейных зерен внутри камеры во время операции обжаривания.
2. Система для обжаривания кофейных зерен по предшествующему пункту, в которой:
- нагревательное устройство аппарата для обжаривания содержит рабочий орган подачи воздуха и нагреватель, а система управления аппарата для обжаривания выполнена с возможностью управления указанным рабочим органом подачи воздуха для настройки потока воздуха,
и
- средство, выполненное с возможностью создания потери давления потока горячего воздуха, в то время как в камере отсутствуют кофейные зерна, представляет собой рабочий орган подачи воздуха.
3. Система для обжаривания кофейных зерен по п. 1 или 2, в кото

title: Method for dispensing ground coffee
abstract: FIELD: crushing or grinding materials.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to a method for dispensing ground coffee for preparing a coffee beverage. Method includes the following steps: providing device (110) comprising one or more receiving compartments (13, 14) for storing one or different types of roasted coffee beans, one or more dispensers (60, 70) for dispensing coffee beans that are being stored in one or more receiving compartments (13, 14), and mill (30) for receiving coffee beans dispensed by one or more of said dispensers (60, 70), mill (30) being configured to move to different grinding positions for different degrees of grinding, respectively, storing the coffee beans in receiving compartments (13, 14), at least partially covering or at least partially resting on one or more of dosing devices (60, 70), preventing coffee beans from dispensing from receiving compartments (13, 14), setting mill (30) in such a way that mill (30) is in a certain grinding position, dispensing, by means of one or more devices (60, 70), the certain number of coffee beans to be dispensed to mill (30) after mill (30) installation step, and milling, by means of mill (30), said certain number of coffee beans and, thus, dispensing such ground coffee beans until no coffee beans remain in mill (30).EFFECT: proposed invention is aimed at the possibility to produce a balanced coffee beverage with a good taste from an organoleptic point of view as well as ensures an improved automatic coffee beans grinding process for various coffee beverage types without detriment to the quality of the various coffee beverage types.16 cl, 5 dwg
claims:
1. Способ выдачи молотого кофе для приготовления кофейного напитка, включающий следующие стадии:
- обеспечение устройства (110), которое содержит один или более приемных отсеков (13, 14) для хранения одного или разных видов обжаренных кофейных зерен, одно или более устройств (60, 70) дозирования для выдачи кофейных зерен, которые хранятся в одном или более приемных отсеках (13, 14), и мельницу (30) для приема кофейных зерен, выданных одним или более устройствами (60, 70) дозирования, причем мельница (30) выполнена с возможностью перемещения в разные положения помола для разных степеней помола соответственно,
- хранение кофейных зерен в приемных отсеках (13, 14), по меньшей мере частично покрывающими или по меньшей мере частично опирающимися на одно или более устройств (60, 70) дозирования, предотвращая выдачу кофейных зерен из приемных отсеков (13, 14),
- установка мельницы (30) таким образом, чтобы мельница (30) находилась в определенном положении помола,
- выдача с помощью одного или более устройств (60, 70) дозирования определенного количества кофейных зерен в мельницу (30) после стадии установки мельницы (30), и
- помол с помощью мельницы (30) упомянутого определенного количества кофейных зерен и, таким образом, выдача таких молотых кофейных зерен до тех пор, пока в мельнице (30) не останется кофейных зерен.
2. Способ по п. 1, дополнительно включающий стадию перемещения мельницы (30), предпочтительно с помощью приводного блока, например двигателя, в одно из разных положений помола после стадии помола.
3. Способ по п. 1 или 2, в котором мельница (30) содержит два размольных элемента (31, 32), которые разнесены на определенное расстояние и выполнены с возможностью перемещения относительно друг друга, чтобы помолоть поступившие кофейные зерна между двумя размольными элементами (31, 32), и дополнительно включающий стадию изменения упомянутого расстояния, чтобы перемещать размольные элементы (31, 32) и, таким образом, мельницу (30) между разными положениями помола.
