title: Beverage preparation machine with capsule recognition
abstract: Method for training a capsule recognition module of a machine for preparing and dispensing a beverage, comprising feeding capsules of various types to one or more capsule recognition positions, taking a picture of at least part of each capsule fed at the corresponding capsule recognition position, feeding the captured pictures as image data input to a neural network computing device running a neural network computer program, comparing the output of the neural network computer program with an actual sample capsule, feeding back the result of the comparison to the neural network computer program in order for the neural network computer program to adjust the neural network parameters, wherein the training of the capsule recognition module is completed when the result from the comparison is equal to, or above, a desired rate of successful recognition.
claims:
1. A method for training a capsule recognition module of a machine for preparing and dispensing a beverage, wherein said capsule recognition module is configured to recognizes a type of a capsule by capturing an image of said capsule and feeding it as input to a trained neural network computing device, wherein the method comprises: - feeding capsules of various types to one or more capsule recognition positions; - taking a picture of at least part of each capsule fed at the corresponding capsule recognition position; - feeding the captured pictures as image data input to a neural network computing device running a neural network computer program; - comparing the output of the neural network computer program with an actual sample capsule; - feeding back the result of the comparison to the neural network computer program in order for the neural network computer program to adjust the neural network parameters; wherein the training of the capsule recognition module is completed when the result from the comparison is equal to, or above, a desired rate of successful recognition.
2. The method according to the preceding claim, wherein the neural network parameters comprises at least one between weights and biases of one or more synaptic connections of the neural network computer program.
3. The method according to one of the preceding claims, wherein the training of the neural network computer program is performed on a training bench outside the beverage preparation machine.
4. The method accordin

title: Compositions for use in promoting accelerated butyrate production in young children
abstract: The present invention relates to composition comprising 2'-FL for use in promoting accelerated butyrate production in the gut thereby preventing and/or treating a health disorder, and/or promoting a health benefit in young children consuming the composition.
claims:
1. A nutritional composition comprising 2-fucosylactose (2’-FL), for use in promoting accelerated butyrate production in the gut of the young child consuming the nutritional compositionin to prevent and/or treat a health disorder, and/or to promote a health benefit in young childwherein the health disorder is selected from the list consisting of inflammation, infections, allergies, metabolic health disorders such as obesity later in life, type 2 diabetes, insulin resistance, and/or wherein the health benefit is selected from the list consisting of gut maturation, gut brain axis connection, colonic healing especially in case of colitis, anti-cancer effects.
2. A nutritional composition for use according to any of the preceding claims wherein promotion of butyrate production occurs within 4, for example 3, for example 2 or for example 1, weeks from start of consumption of the nutritional composition.
3. A nutritional composition for use according to claim 9, wherein gastrointestinal
4. A nutritional composition for use according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein 2’FL is present in an amount of 0.005 to 8 g/L or 0.004 to 6.8 g/100g of composition on a dry weight basis.
5. A nutritional composition for use according to any of the preceding claims, wherein the nutritional composition comprises human milk oligosaccharides consisting of 2’-FL.

title: Nutritional composition for promoting emotional development
abstract: The present invention relates to a nutritional composition comprising osteopontin as an active ingredient for use in promoting emotional development in a young individual, preferably in an infant. The present invention further relates to uses and methods for promoting emotional development in a young individual, preferably in an infant.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A composition comprising osteopontin as an active ingredient in an effective amount for use in promoting emotional development in a young individual.
2. The composition according to claim 1 , wherein osteopontin is comprised at amount ranging from at least about 50 ng/pL to at least about 900 ng/pL.
3. The composition as claimed in anyone of the preceding claims, for use in promoting regulation of emotions and/or behavior or regulation domain on Infant Behavior Questionnaire- Revised (IBQ-R) scale in a young individual.
4. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the young individual is an infant, a toddler or a young child, preferably an infant.
5. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein it is administered to the young individual from birth to about 5 years of age, preferably from birth to 18 weeks of age, more preferably during first 6 weeks of life of the young individual.
6. The composition according to anyone of the preceding claims, wherein emotional development is promoted in a young individual from birth to about 5 years of age, preferably from birth to 18 months of age, more preferably from about 2 to about 6 months of age, more preferably in about 3 months of age.
7. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims,

title: Attachment for a beverage container
abstract: An attachment for a beverage container may include a cap configured to attach to an opening in the beverage container. The cap includes an opening. The attachment also include a tube passing through the cap. A beverage in the beverage container can flow through the tube and out of the opening in the cap. The attachment also includes a container attached to the tube and configured to hold a liquid. The container includes an opening to allow the liquid to flow from the container into the tube and out of the opening in the cap. The attachment also comprises a restrictor between the opening of the container and the tube, such that the liquid begins to exit the opening in the cap before the beverage begins to exit the opening in the cap.
claims:
1. A beverage dispensing system comprising:
an attachment comprising a cap attached to a beverage container opening in a beverage container, the cap comprising a cap opening and a tube passing through the cap, wherein the cap opening is located proximate to a first end of the tube, and a second end of the tube is located within the beverage container with the cap attached to the beverage container, such that the attachment is configured for a beverage contained in the beverage container to flow through the tube and out of the cap opening, the cap further comprises a liquid container attached to the tube and configured to hold a liquid, the liquid container comprising a liquid container opening to allow the liquid to flow from the container into the tube and out of the cap opening, the cap further comprises a restrictor between the liquid container opening and the tube for controlling and restricting the flow of the liquid from the liquid container into the tube, the cap further comprising a second restrictor within the tube, the restrictor, the second restrictor, and the tube configured such that the liquid begins to exit the cap opening before the beverage begins to exit the cap opening; and
the beverage container comprising the beverage container opening, wherein the attachment is attached to the beverage container opening.
2. An attachment for a beverage container, the attachment comprising:
a cap configured to attach to an opening in the beverage container, the cap comprising an opening;
a tube passing through the cap, wherein the opening in the cap is located proximate to a first end of the tube

title: Nutritional composition and infant formula for promoting brain myelination
abstract: The present invention relates to nutritional compositions and infant formulas that promote brain myelination. More specifically, the present invention relates to nutritional compositions for infants and young children and related health benefits. In particular, the present invention relates to a nutritional composition comprising a vitamin or a mixture thereof for promoting or supporting an optimal myelination trajectory in the brain, such trajectory being close to the trajectory observed in infants fed only with human breast milk (HBM) several months before life.
claims:
1.一种用于婴儿和/或幼儿的营养组合物，所述营养组合物包含维生素或其混合物，用于促进和/或支持脑中的最佳髓鞘形成轨迹。
2.根据权利要求1所述的组合物，其中所述脑中的最佳髓鞘形成轨迹接近于在出生后早期几个月中仅用人类母乳喂养的婴儿中所观察到的髓鞘形成轨迹。
3.根据权利要求1或2中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述组合物促进和/或支持通过最佳的脑和认知功能发育和/或防止神经认知缺陷所表征的健康状态。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的组合物，所述组合物包含高于50mcg/100g的量的叶酸和/或高于0.01mcg/100g的量的维生素B12。
5.根据权利要求1至4中任一项所述的组合物，所述组合物还包含铁。
6.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的组合物，所述组合物还包含DHA。
7.根据权利要求1至6中任一项所述的组合物，所述组合物还包含鞘磷脂。
8.根据权利要求1至7中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述组合物还包含胆碱。
9.权利要求1至8中任一项所述的组合物用于促进和/或支持婴儿或幼儿脑中的最佳髓鞘形成轨迹的用途。
10.权利要求1至8中任一项所述的组合物用于防止婴儿或幼儿脑中未达最佳的髓鞘形成轨迹的用途。
11.用于促进和/或支持婴儿和/或幼儿脑中的最佳髓鞘形成轨迹的方法，所述方法包括给所述婴儿和/或幼儿施用包含叶酸的营养组合物。
12.根据权利要求11所述的方法，其中将权利要求1至8中任一项所述的组合物施用给婴儿和/或幼儿。
13.一种营养组合物，所述营养组合物包含：
高于200mg/kg的量的鞘磷脂；
高于5mg/100g的量的铁；
高于30mg/100g的量的胆碱；
高于30mg/100g的量的DHA；
高于50mcg/100g的量的叶酸；和或高于0.01mcg/100g的量的维生素B12。
14.一种营养组合物，所述营养组合物包含：
在200mg/kg至2g/kg范围内的量的鞘磷脂；
在5mg/100g至40mg/100g范围内的量的铁；
在30mg/100g至1000mg/100g范围内的量的胆碱；
在30mg/100g至300mg/100g范围内的量的DHA；
在50mcg/100g至500mcg/100g范围内的量的叶酸；高于0.1mcg/100g至10mcg/100g的量的维生素B12。

title: Beverage preparation machine
abstract: The invention concerns a beverage preparation machine for preparing a beverage from a beverage ingredient pod, said machine comprising : - an extraction device comprising upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts (1, 2) relatively movable, - a liquid supply system, - a motor (10) to actuate the movement of at least one of the upstream and downstream container enclosing parts (1, 2), wherein the liquid supply system comprises : - a first peristaltic valve (741) to enable the supply of the common connector with water either from a cold tube or from a hot tube, - a second peristaltic valve (742) to enable the supply of a first tube or a second tube with water, and wherein the machine comprises mechanical triggers attached to at least one of the movable pod enclosing parts, said triggers being designed and positioned so as to close or open water paths in the tubes (751, 752, 771, 772) and pod paths according to the movement of at least one of the upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts (1, 2) during the sequence of preparation of a beverage from the pod.

title: Multi-layer metallized paper-based packaging material
abstract: The present invention relates to an oxygen barrier substrate comprising or consisting of a graft copolymer comprising a vinyl alcohol polymer backbone and polypeptide branches. The invention also relates to a packaging material, in particular a multilayer metallized paper-based packaging material, comprising at least one oxygen barrier layer comprising or consisting of a graft copolymer comprising a vinyl alcohol polymer backbone and polypeptide branches.
claims:
1.氧气阻隔基材，所述氧气阻隔基材包含接枝共聚物或由接枝共聚物组成，所述接枝共聚物包含乙烯醇聚合物主链和多肽支链。

title: Beverage preparation machine with capsule recognition
abstract: Machine for preparing and dispensing a beverage, such as tea, coffee, hot chocolate, cold chocolate, milk, soup or baby food, comprising a capsule recognition module for recognizing a capsule inserted in said machine at a capsule recognition position, the capsule recognition module comprising a camera for capturing an image of at least part of said capsule in said capsule recognition position; wherein the capsule recognition module comprises a neural network computing device, said neural network computing device being configured to determine a type of said capsule amongst a plurality of predefined capsule types on the basis of an image of at least part of said capsule captured by said camera.
claims:
1. A machine for preparing and dispensing a beverage, the machine comprising:
an extraction unit configured for extracting a capsule to form the beverage;
a control unit configured for controlling the extraction unit to extract the capsule;
an outlet for dispensing the beverage formed by extracting the capsule to a user-receptacle,
a capsule recognition module for recognizing the capsule inserted in the machine at a capsule recognition position, the capsule recognition module comprising a camera for capturing a digital image of at least part of the capsule in the capsule recognition position; and
the capsule recognition module comprising a light source and a neural network computing device, the neural network computing device being configured to determine a type of the capsule amongst a plurality of predefined capsule types on the basis of the digital image of at least part of the capsule captured by the camera,
wherein lighting from the light source and image capture conditions in the capsule recognition position correspond to training conditions for which the neural network computing device is configured by training to recognize the capsule,
wherein the camera has a fixed position in an enclosure, the enclosure comprising an opening for receiving the capsule, the capsule recognition position arranged in the enclosure, and the light source configured to emit light to the capsule at the capsule recognition position.
2. The machine according t

title: Actuator nozzle for aerosol packaging, and methods of making and using such actuator nozzles and aerosol packagings
abstract: An actuator nozzle has a lower portion comprising a base configured to connect to a container, and the base includes a lower orifice. The actuator nozzle also has an upper portion including a tapered section on one side of the upper portion, the tapered section tapers inward as the tapered section extends upward from the lower portion, the upper portion further having a substantially vertical section on an opposite side of the upper portion from the tapered section. The actuator nozzle also has an upper orifice in fluid communication with the lower orifice by an interior channel of the actuator nozzle, the upper orifice angled downward from a top of the tapered section of the upper portion to a top of the substantially vertical section of the upper portion.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. An actuator nozzle comprising: a lower portion comprising a base configured to connect to a container, the base comprising a lower orifice; an upper portion comprising a tapered section on one side of the upper portion, the tapered section tapers inward as the tapered section extends upward from the lower portion, the upper portion further comprising a substantially vertical section on an opposite side of the upper portion from the tapered section; and an upper orifice in fluid communication with the lower orifice by an interior channel of the actuator nozzle, the upper orifice angled downward from a top of the tapered section of the upper portion to a top of the substantially vertical section of the upper portion.
2. The actuator nozzle of claim 1, wherein the upper orifice has a shape that is oval or semi-circle and has a maximum width at or adjacent to the top of the tapered section.
3. The actuator nozzle of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the lower portion of the actuator nozzle is substantially symmetrical throughout an entirety of the height of the lower portion.
4. The actuator nozzle of any of claims 1-3, comprising one or more pressure points configured to actuate and/or permit actuation of a valve on which the actuator nozzle is mounted.
5. The actuator nozzle of claim 4, wherein the one or more pressure points are positioned on the tapered section of the upper portion.

title: Compositions and methods for dehydrated pet food blends
abstract: The present invention provides compositions and methods relating to dehydrated pet food blends. The dehydrated pet food blend may include from about 15% to about 50% protein, from about 5% to about 40% fat, and from about 5% to about 50% carbohydrate. In addition, the blend may include a semi-wet coarse food, a dry coarse powder, and a dehydrated vegetable.
claims:
1.脱水宠物食品共混物，其包含：
约15％至约50％的蛋白质；
约5％至约40％的脂肪；以及
约5％至约50％的碳水化合物；
其中组合物包含半湿粗磨食物、干粗粉和脱水蔬菜。
2.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述半湿粗磨食物具有约10重量％至约30重量％的水分含量。
3.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述半湿粗磨食物以约10重量％至约50重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。
4.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述干粗粉具有约5重量％至约12重量％的水分含量。
5.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述干粗粉以约40重量％至约90重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。
6.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述脱水蔬菜具有约1重量％至约10重量％的水分含量。
7.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述脱水蔬菜以约5重量％至约30重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。
8.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其还包含抗氧化剂、矿物质或维生素，并且还包含防腐剂。
9.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述半湿粗磨食物涂有动物消化物。
10.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述共混物被配制为完全且营养均衡的宠物食品。
11.用于制造脱水宠物食品共混物的方法，所述方法包括：
挤出半湿粗磨食物；
挤出干粗磨食物；
研磨所述干粗磨食物以形成干粗粉；以及
将所述半湿粗磨食物和所述干粗粉与脱水蔬菜混合以形成所述脱水宠物食品共混物。
12.根据权利要求11所述的方法，其中所述半湿粗磨食物具有约10重量％至约30重量％的水分含量并且以约10重量％至约50重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。
13.根据权利要求11所述的方法，其中所述干粗粉具有约5重量％至约12重量％的水分含量，并且以约40重量％至约90重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。
14.根据权利要求11所述的方法，其中所述脱水蔬菜具有约1重量％至约10重量％的水分含量，并且以约5重量％至约30重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。

title: Capsule and method of producing the same
abstract: A capsule (10) configured for preparing a beverage upon injection of liquid into the capsule (10). The capsule (10) comprises a cup-shaped body (12) including a side wall (14), a top opening (16), and a bottom opening (26). The body (12) has a substantially cylindrical or frusto-conical shape. The body (12) is made of a first multilayer oxygen and/or moisture barrier material (20) comprising a paper or cardboard and an organic and/or inorganic barrier layer. The paper or cardboard has a grammage comprised between 40 and 450 g/m2 and the first material has a cellulose content higher than 30%, preferably higher than 50%, more preferably higher than 90%. The capsule (10) comprises a bottom closure (22) connected to the cup-shaped body (12) to close the bottom opening (26) and a sealing lid (24) connected to the cup-shaped body (12) to close the top opening (16).
claims:
1. A capsule (10) configured for preparing a beverage upon injection of liquid into the capsule (10), the capsule (10) comprising: - a cup-shaped body (12) including a side wall (14), the body (12) having a substantially cylindrical or frusto-conical shape with a top opening (16) and a bottom opening (26), wherein the body (12) is made of a first multilayer oxygen and/or moisture barrier material (20) comprising a paper or cardboard and an organic and/or inorganic barrier layer, the paper or cardboard having a grammage comprised between 40 and 450 g/m2 and the first material having a cellulose content higher than 30%, preferably higher than 50%, more preferably higher than 90%; - a bottom closure (22) connected to the cup-shaped body (12) to close the bottom opening (26) of the cup-shaped body (12); and - a sealing lid (24) connected to the cup-shaped body (12) to close the top opening (16) of the cup-shaped body (12).
2. The capsule (10) according to claim 1, wherein the side wall (14) comprises a top rim or flange (18) surrounding the top opening (16); preferably wherein the top rim or flange (18) is integrally formed with the side wall (14) and/or wherein the top rim or flange (18) extends radially outward and/or away from a longitudinal axis (L) of the capsule (10) from a main section (48) of the side wall (14); and/or wherein the side wall (14) comprises a bottom rim or flange (50) surrounding the bottom opening (26); preferably wherein the bottom rim or flange (50) is integrally formed with the side wall (14) and/or wherein the bottom rim or flange (50) extends radially inward and/or towards a longitudinal axis (L) of the capsule (10) from a main section (48) of the side wall (14).

title: Beverage preparation capsule and method of producing the same
claims:
1. A capsule (10, 32) configured for preparing a beverage upon injection of liquid into the capsule (10, 32), the capsule (10, 32) comprising: - a cup-shaped main body (12) including a bottom wall (14) and a side wall (16), - a sealing lid (18) connected to the side wall (16), wherein the lid (18), the bottom wall (14), and the side wall (16) define a compartment for holding beverage preparation ingredients therein, and - a scoring line (24, 34) extending on the lid (18) and being configured for weakening the lid (18).
2. The capsule (10, 32) of claim 1, wherein the lid (18) has a substantially circular shape and the scoring line (24, 34) has a substantially circular shape adapted to the substantially circular shape of the lid (18).
3. The capsule (10, 32) of claims 1 or 2, wherein the scoring line (24, 34) extends - about 360° around a central point (25) of the lid (18), or - in a range between about 300° and about 360°, preferably in a range between about 310° and about 330° around a central point (25) of the lid (18), or - 330° or less, preferably 310° or less around a central point (25) of the lid (18); - and wherein the scoring line (24, 34) extends along an external periphery of the lid (18) between a central section of the lid and a peripheral rim section of the lid (18), wherein the peripheral rim section is attached to a flange (22) of the side wall (16).

title: Methods and compositions using bifidobacterium longum to treat or prevent depressive symptoms
abstract: Compositions and methods use Bifidobacterium longum NCC3001 (ATCC BAA-999) to treat or prevent a depressive symptom. Prolonged anti-depressive effects can continue after administration of the compositions is ended. Non-limiting examples of a depressive symptom which can be treated or prevented include depressed mood; sadness; anxiety; "empty" feelings; loss of interest or pleasure; irritability; restlessness; changes in appetite or weight; sleep disturbances; lack of or decreased energy; feelings of worthlessness; guilt; helplessness; anger and hostility; difficulty in thinking, concentrating, or making decisions; hopelessness; tiredness; fatigue; memory difficulties; tearfulness; brooding; phobias; excessive worry over physical health; sexual dysfunction; persistent physical symptoms that do not respond to treatment; and combinations thereof. These depressive symptoms can be associated with a depressive state or depressive disorder or can be found sub-clinically or not associated with these depressive states/disorders (e.g., not part of a syndrome or psychiatric disorder).
claims:
1. An edible composition comprising Bifidobacterium longum ATCC BAA-999 for use in a method of supplementing a regimen for treatment of a depressive symptom, the regimen comprising administering to an individual in need thereof a synthetic pharmaceutical compound, comprising administering an edible composition comprising a therapeutically effective amount or a prophylactically effective amount of Bifidobacterium longum ATCC BAA-999 to the individual, wherein the combination of the synthetic pharmaceutical compound and the edible composition treats the depressive symptom.
2. The method of Claim 1, wherein the depressive symptom is a secondary condition caused by an underlying medical condition selected from the group consisting of an endocrine disease, a cardiovascular disease, a pulmonary disease, a cancer, an autoimmune disease and combinations thereof.
3. The method of Claim 2, wherein the underlying medical condition is selected from the group consisting of a thyroid abnormality, a heart attack, a chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and rheumatoid arthritis.
4. The method of any one of Claims 1-3, wherein the composition further comprises an ingredient selected from the group consisting of a fat, a protein, a carbohydrate and combinations thereof.
5. The method of any one of claims Claim 1-4, wherein the composition comprises a prebiotic.
6. The method of Cl

title: Recombinant wild type patatin-2 and mutants thereof
abstract: The invention relates a recombinant wild type patatin-2 or mutant thereof. It also relates to polynucleotide expression vector, host cell and method for producing such recombinant proteins. It also relates to composition and product comprising such recombinant proteins.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A recombinant wild type patatin-2 or mutant thereof which comprises or consists of an amino acid sequence having at least 80% sequence identity to wild type patatin-2.
2. A recombinant wild type patatin-2 or mutant thereof according to claim 1, which has at least 90% sequence identity to wild type patatin-2.
3. A recombinant patatin-2 mutant which comprises or consists of an amino acid sequence having at least 80% sequence identity to wild type patatin-2, and which comprises one or more mutations and/or one or more non-native post-translational modifications (PTMs), wherein said one or more mutations and/or said one or more non-native PTMs reduce or eliminate the lipid acyl hydrolase activity in the recombinant wild type patatin-2 mutant compared to the wild type patatin-2.
4. A recombinant patatin-2 mutant which comprises or consists of an amino acid sequence having at least 80% sequence identity to wild type patatin-2, and which comprises one or more mutations selected from the list consisting of S54A and D193A.
5. A recombinant patatin-2 according to claim 1 or 2 or a recombinant wild type patatin- 2 mutant according to any of claims 1 to 4, wherein the wild type patatin-2 is a wild type patatin-2 of Solanum tuberosum, preferably wild type patatin-2 of Solanum tuberosum consisting of SEQ ID NO:1.
6. A recombinant wild type patatin-2 according to claim 1, 2 or 5 or recombinant patatin- 2 mutant according to any of claims 1 to 5 which does not comprise an amino acid sequence consis

title: Bio-recycling of polyesters into pha
abstract: A method for producing polyhydroxyalkanoate (PHA) from polyester waste is provided. The method includes the steps of: (a) providing a culture broth comprising polyester waste; and (b) cultivating a microbe in the culture broth to produce PHA. The method may utilize a wide variety of monomers and may proceed via a one-step process.
claims:
1. A method for producing polyhydroxyalkanoate (PHA) from polyester waste, the method comprising the steps of: (a) providing a culture broth comprising polyester waste; and (b) cultivating a microbe in the culture broth to produce PHA, wherein the microbe utilises a plurality of polyester monomers from the polyester waste to produce the PHA.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the microbe is from the genus Paracoccus, optionally wherein the microbe is a Paracoccus denitrificans.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the microbe is Paracoccus denitrificans DSM 413, or a derivative thereof, optionally wherein the microbe is Paracoccus denitrificans DSM 413, Paracoccus denitrificans PD1222, Paracoccus denitrificans CNCM 1-5881, Paracoccus denitrificans ATCC 19367, Paracoccus denitrificans ATCC 17741, Paracoccus denitrificans ATCC 13543, Paracoccus denitrificans NCIB 8944, Paracoccus denitrificans NRRL B-3785, Paracoccus denitrificans CCM 982, Paracoccus denitrificans LMD 22.21, Paracoccus denitrificans JCM 21484, Paracoccus denitrificans NBRC 102528, or Paracoccus denitrificans NCCB 22021.
4. The method according to claim 1, wherein the polyester waste comprises two or more polyester monomers selected from the group consisting of succinic acid, lactic acid, ethylene glycol, adipic acid, 6-hydroxycaproic acid, 3-hydroxybutyric acid, 3-hydroxyvaleric acid, and 1,4-butanediol.
5. The method according to claim 1,

title: Beverage or foodstuff preparation system
abstract: A system (2) comprising a container (6) and a machine (4) for preparing a beverage and/ or foodstuff thereof, the container (6) including: a body portion (62) comprising a storage portion (58) for containing a precursor material; a closing member (56) to close the storage portion (62), and; a machine-readable code (44) storing preparation information, the machine (4) including: a code reading system (18) to read the code (44) of the container (6); a processing unit (14) for processing the precursor material of the container (6), and; electrical circuitry (16) to control the processing unit (14) based on the preparation information read from the code (44), the code reading system (18) including a code reader (46) to obtain a digital image of the code (44), and the code reading system (18) includes electrical circuitry (16) to determine from the digital image of the code (44) if the container (6) is in a reading position based on a predetermined condition, and if said condition is met, then the electrical circuitry (16) configured to process the code (44) to extract the preparation information in the reading position.
claims:
1. A system comprising a container and a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff thereof,
the container including:
a body portion comprising a storage portion for containing a precursor material;
a closing member to close the storage portion, and;
a machine-readable code storing preparation information,
the machine including:
a code reading system to read the code of the container;
a processing unit for processing the precursor material of the container, and;
electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on the preparation information read from the code,
the code reading system including a code reader to obtain a digital image of the code,
and the code reading system includes electrical circuitry to determine from the digital image of the code if the container is in a reading position based on a predetermined condition of the digital image of the code,
and if said condition is met, then the electrical circuitry configured to process the code to extract the preparation information in the reading position.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the predetermined condition is based on a geometric property of the code.

title: Coffee brewing equipment
abstract: The invention relates to a fully automatic coffee machine (100) comprising: a brewing chamber (1), an upper piston (2), a lower piston (3) which can be moved within the brewing chamber (1), the brewing chamber and/or the upper piston is relatively movable between a first closed position configured to compact coffee during brewing and a second closed position configured to not compact coffee during brewing; -a pressurized hot water fluid system comprising at least a water supply system (101), a water heating device (104) and a water pump (102), where the system is connected to the water inlet (13) of the coffee extraction unit, where the fluid supply system comprises a pressure bypass valve (107) downstream of the water pump, and where the fluid supply system comprises a pressure bypass valve (107) downstream of the water pump. The predetermined threshold pressure of the fluid dispensed by said pressure bypass valve is adjustable, and wherein the fully automatic coffee machine comprises a control system configured to:-move the brewing chamber and/or the upper piston to the first closed position or the second closed position for brewing coffee powder; and-adjusting a predetermined threshold pressure of the fluid dispensed by the pressure bypass valve to a first predetermined threshold pressure and a second predetermined threshold pressure, respectively, when the brewing chamber and/or the upper piston are moved to the first closed position and the second closed position, respectively.
claims:
1.全自动咖啡机(100)，所述机器包括：
-咖啡提取单元(10)，所述咖啡提取单元包括：
.冲泡腔室(1)，所述冲泡腔室用于接收经烘焙并且研磨的咖啡粉，所述腔室包括上部边缘(12)和底壁(11)，和
.上部活塞(2)，
.所述上部活塞被配置为能够移动穿过所述冲泡腔室的所述上部边缘，并且在所述冲泡腔室内进一步移动以使所述冲泡腔室和所述上部活塞相对移动，和
.进水口(13)，
.液体出口导管(21)，
.下部活塞(3)，所述下部活塞能够在所述冲泡腔室(1)内在以下位置之间移动：
.最低位置，其中，所述下部活塞位于所述冲泡腔室的所述底壁(11)处，和
.最高位置，其中，所述下部活塞位于所述冲泡腔室的所述上部边缘(12)处，
.咖啡渣的排放装置(4)，
.其中，所述冲泡腔室和/或所述上部活塞能够在以下位置之间相对移动：
.打开位置，用于引入经烘焙并且研磨的咖啡粉或排出提取后的经烘焙并且研磨的咖啡粉；和
.至少两个不同的第一关闭位置和第二关闭位置，所述至少两个不同的第一关闭位置和第二关闭位置被配置用于冲泡经烘焙并且研磨的咖啡粉，其中，所述第一关闭位置被配置用于在冲泡期间压实咖啡，并且所述第二关闭位置被配置用于在冲泡期间不压实咖啡，
-加压热水流体系统，所述加压热水流体系统至少包括供水系统(101)、水泵(102)和优选地水加热装置(104)，其中，所述系统连接到所述咖啡提取单元的所述进水口(13)，
其中，所述流体供应系统包括在所述水泵下游的压力旁通阀(107)，并且其中，由所述压力旁通阀分配的所述流体的预先确定的阈值压力是能够调节的，优选地能够由机动致动器(1071)调节，并且
其中，所述全自动咖啡机包括控制系统，所述控制系统被配置为：
-将所述冲泡腔室和/或所述上部活塞移动到所述第一关闭位置或所述第二关闭位置，用于冲泡经烘焙并且研磨的咖啡粉，并且
-当所述冲泡腔室和/或所述上部活塞分别处于所述第一关闭位置和所述第二关闭位置时，将由所述压力旁通阀分配的所述流体的所述预先确定的阈值压力分别调节到第一预先确定的阈值压力和第二预先确定的阈值压力。<

title: Engineered lipase variants
abstract: The present invention provides engineered lipase polypeptides and compositions thereof. The engineered lipase polypeptides have been optimized to provide improved thermostability, protease stability, and stability under a range of pH conditions, including acidic (pH <7) and basic (pH >7) conditions. The invention also relates to the use of compositions comprising the engineered lipase polypeptides for therapeutic and/or nutritional purposes. The present invention also provides polynucleotides encoding the engineered lipase polypeptides, as well as methods for making the engineered polynucleotides and lipase polypeptides.
claims:
1. A recombinant lipase comprising a polypeptide sequence having at least 95%, sequence identity to SEQ ID NO: 868.
2. The recombinant lipase of Claim 1, wherein said polypeptide sequence comprises at least one substitution or substitution set at one or more positions selected from 24, 38, 49, 70, 149, 161, 174, 175, 189, 193, 225, 231, 243, 252, 271, 287, 292, 293, 296, 303, 334, 344, 373, and 385, wherein the amino acid positions of the polypeptide sequence are numbered with reference to SEQ ID NO: 868.
3. The recombinant lipase of any of Claims 1-2, wherein: (i) said recombinant lipase is more thermostable than the lipase of SEQ ID NO: 2; and/or (ii) said recombinant lipase is more stable at acidic pH levels, than the lipase of SEQ ID NO: 2; and/or (iii) said recombinant lipase is more resistant to proteolysis than the lipase of SEQ ID NO: 2; and/or (iv) said recombinant lipase is more active in the presence of at least one bile salt than the lipase of SEQ ID NO: 2.
4. The recombinant lipase of any of Claims 1-3, wherein said recombinant lipase is purified.
5. The recombinant lipase of any of Claims 1-4, wherein said recombinant lipase exhibits at least one improved property selected from: i) enhanced catalytic activity; ii) increased tolerance to acid pH; iii) increased tolerance to pH 3.5; iv) increased tolerance to pH

title: System for multi-ingredient beverage preparation from various container types
abstract: A beverage preparation machine includes a fluid system comprising a fluid source, a pump, a heating element, at least two container holders adapted for receiving ingredient containers, and a control unit for controlling the fluid system to prepare a beverage by mixing fluid with the beverage ingredient contained in the containers to produce a mixed beverage component in each of the containers. The control unit is further arranged to dispense part or whole of the mixed components sequentially or simultaneously to produce the beverage. The container holders differ from one another for holding containers of different sizes and/or types. Separate fluid injection interfaces have different structural and kinematic configurations and are arranged for independently delivering fluid in one of the corresponding ingredient containers. Each interface is connected to the fluid system and adapted to a different container.
claims:
1. A beverage preparation machine comprising a fluid system comprising a fluid source, a fluid pump, a fluid heating element, a first container holder and a second container holder, wherein each of the first and second container holders are adapted for receiving a corresponding first beverage ingredient container and second beverage ingredient container, and
a control unit arranged for controlling the fluid system to prepare a beverage by mixing fluid with the beverage ingredients contained in the first and second beverage ingredient containers to produce a beverage component in each of the first and second beverage ingredient containers and to dispense at least a portion of each of the beverage components of the first and second beverage ingredient containers at least sequentially in a controlled manner to produce the beverage,
wherein the first and second container holders differ from each other for holding the first and second beverage ingredient containers of different sizes and types, and
wherein the beverage preparation machine further comprises a first fluid delivery interface and a second fluid delivery interface which are separate and respectively arranged for independently delivering the fluid in the corresponding first and second beverage ingredient containers, each of the first and second fluid delivery interfaces being connected to the fluid system and being adapted to the different first and second beverage ingredient containers,
wherein the separate first and second fluid delivery interfaces have different structural and kinematic configurations,
wherein the different kinematic configu

title: Cocoa product and method for its production
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: cocoa product is disclosed having a ratio of epicatechin in mas.% to theobromine in mas.% of from 0.2 to 1.2, a ratio of procyanidin C1 in mas.% to theobromine in mas.% of 0.005 to 0.3, and a ratio of procyanidin B2 in mas.% to theobromine in mas.% of 0.04 to 0.3. Its use in the production of a ready-to-drink beverage or powdered beverage or for use in a capsule and/or beverage preparation system and a method for producing this product are also described.EFFECT: product with a natural pleasant taste, colour and aroma, having improved solubility and increased antioxidant properties.13 cl, 3 dwg, 5 tbl, 3 ex
claims:
1. Какао-продукт, имеющий соотношение эпикатехина в мас.% и теобромина в мас.%, составляющее от 0,2 до 1,2, соотношение процианидина C1 в мас.% и теобромина в мас.%, составляющее от 0,005 до 0,3, и соотношение процианидина B2 в мас.% и теобромина в мас.%, составляющее от 0,04 до 0,3.
2. Какао-продукт по п. 1, содержащий от 0,8 мас.% до 4 мас.% эпикатехина.
3. Какао-продукт по п. 1 или 2, содержащий от 0,01 мас.% до 1 мас.% процианидина C1.
4. Какао-продукт по любому из предшествующих пунктов, содержащий от 0,15 мас.% до 1 мас.% процианидина B2.
5. Какао-продукт по любому из предшествующих пунктов, содержащий от 145 мкг/кг до 8000 мкг/кг алкильных и фенильных алкеналей.
6. Какао-продукт по любому из предшествующих пунктов, содержащий от 10 мкг/кг до 1000 мкг/кг 2-изопропил-5-метил-2-гексеналя и от 10 мкг/кг до 1000 мкг/кг 4-метил-2-фенил-2-пентеналя.
7. Какао-продукт по любому из предшествующих пунктов, причём указанный ингредиент находится в форме жидкости, концентрата, экстракта или порошка.
8. Какао-продукт по любому из предшествующих пунктов, который смешивают с обжаренным и молотым кофе, растворимым порошкообразным кофе, экстрактом кофе, молочным продуктом, немолочным или молочным забеливателем, цикорием или их комбинацией.
9. Применение какао-продукта по любому из предшествующих пунктов для получения готового к употреблению напитка или порошкообразного напитка или для использования в капсуле и/или системе для приготовления напитков.
10. Способ получения какао-продукта по пп. 1-8, включающий стадии
a. обеспечения обжаренных и измельченных какао-бобов;
b. получения экстракта из указанных обжаренных и измельченных какао-бобов с использованием воды при температуре от 95°C до 115°C при коэффициенте вытяжки от 2 до 4 в течение 20–40 минут;
c. получения дополнительного экстракта из обжаренных и измельченных какао-бобов со стадии b) с использованием воды при температуре от 160°C до 180°C при коэффициенте вытяжки от 2 до 4 в течение 20–40 минут.
11. Способ по п. 10, доп

title: Diagnosis and treatment of chronic kidney disease in felines
abstract: FIELD: biotechnology.SUBSTANCE: disclosed is a method for diagnosing chronic kidney disease in felines, comprising measuring the absolute value of the representation of faecal bacteria, including Faecalibacterium, Turicibacter, Streptococcus, Bifidobacterium, Bacteroides, Escherichia coli and Clostridium hiranonis; calculating a dysbiosis index based on faecal bacteria; determining that the feline has chronic kidney disease if the dysbiosis index is greater than or equal to 0.5; and a method of treating or delaying the progression of chronic kidney disease in a cat, comprising diagnosing chronic kidney disease (CKD) in a feline and recommending a composition for the feline that treats or delays the progression of CKD in the feline.EFFECT: inventions provide a wider range of methods for diagnosing chronic kidney disease in a cat on the basis of a specific microbiome, including a dysbiosis index.6 cl, 5 tbl, 1 ex
claims:
1. Способ диагностики хронического заболевания почек у животного семейства кошачьих, включающий:
измерение абсолютного значения степени представленности фекальных бактерий, включаяFaecalibacterium,Turicibacter,Streptococcus,Bifidobacterium,Bacteroides,E. coliиC. hiranonis;
вычисление индекса дисбиоза на основе фекальных бактерий; и
определение того, что животное семейства кошачьих имеет хроническое заболевание почек, если индекс дисбиоза превышает или равен 0,5.
2. Способ по п. 1, в котором фекальные бактерии включают в себяBlautia.
3. Способ по п. 1, в котором фекальные бактерии включают в себяFusobacterium.
4. Способ по п. 1, дополнительно включающий определение того, что животное семейства кошачьих имеет раннюю стадию хронического заболевания почек, если индекс дисбиоза составляет от 0,5 до 1,2.
5. Способ по п. 1, дополнительно включающий определение того, что животное семейства кошачьих имеет позднюю стадию хронического заболевания почек, если индекс дисбиоза превышает 1,2.
6. Способ обеспечения лечения или замедления прогрессирования хронического заболевания почек у животного семейства кошачьих, включающий диагностику хронического заболевания почек (CKD) у животного семейства кошачьих по п. 1 и рекомендацию композиции для животного семейства кошачьих, причем композиция лечит или замедляет прогрессирование CKD у животного семейства кошачьих.

title: Methods and devices for improving sleep quality and/or subsequent behavioural outcomes
abstract: An aspect is a method of improving sleep quality and/or subsequent behavioural outcomes. The method includes providing a dietary recommendation by evaluating a parameter of the individual selected from the group consisting of sleep time, gender, age, BMI, PA, glycemic status, food preference, food sensitivity, caloric intake, nutrients, meal glycemic load, time of consumption and combinations thereof, providing a nutritional composition based on the dietary recommendation, and administering the nutritional composition to the individual. The nutritional composition is selected from the group consisting of a first composition comprising alpha-casozepine, a second composition comprising tryptophan, a third composition comprising mulberry leaf extract, and combinations thereof. Another aspect is a non-transitory computer-readable medium storing a program that causes a device to provide a dietary recommendation and order a nutritional composition based on the dietary recommendation. Yet another aspect is a device comprising a non-transitory computer-readable medium disclosed herein.
claims:
1. A method of improving sleep and/or subsequent behavioural outcomes of an individual in need thereof by a device having one or more processors, the method comprising: receiving an input from the individual, wherein the input comprises at least one of sleep quality, gender, age, body mass index, physical activity level, glycemic status, food preference, or food sensitivity, evaluating, by the device, a need of the individual, wherein the need is selected from the group consisting of improving sleep quality, improving falling asleep, improving sleep maintenance, maintaining sleep quality, and combinations thereof, and generating, by the device via an application interface and based on the input from the individual, a nutritional rule and the need of the individual, a recommendation for the individual, wherein the recommendation comprises at least one of a dietary plan comprising at least one of a recipe, a food item, a food product, or a diet tip, a dietary restriction on at least one of food sensitivity, sleep complain, or sleep comorbidity, a diet optimization of at least one of caloric intake, nutrient, meal glycemic load, or time of consumption, or sleep enhancing recommendation.
2. The method of claim 1 further comprising assessing the individual's sleep quality.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the input comprises sleep quality, the method further comprising adopting the recommendation by the individual; and reassessing, by the device, the indivi

title: System for roasting coffee beans
abstract: The invention concerns a system for roasting coffee beans comprising: —a roasting apparatus (1), said apparatus producing smoke, and—a smoke treating unit (2) configured to collect and treat smoke produced by the roasting apparatus, wherein: —the roasting apparatus comprises a smoke outlet (11), and—the smoke treating unit comprises: a smoke inlet (21) configured to cooperate with the smoke outlet of the roasting apparatus, a smoke filtering sub-unit (22) comprising at least an active carbon filter (221), a smoke driver (23) configured to circulate smoke through the smoke treating unit from the smoke collecting device to an outlet (25) of the smoke treating unit, wherein the smoke treating unit (2) comprises an air inlet (24) configured to mix the smoke produced by the roasting apparatus (1) with ambient air before the smoke is circulated through the smoke filtering sub-unit (22).
claims:
1. A system for roasting coffee beans, the system comprising:
a roasting apparatus, the roasting apparatus configured to produce smoke, and
a smoke treating unit configured to collect and treat smoke produced by the roasting apparatus,
wherein:
the roasting apparatus comprises a smoke outlet, and
the smoke treating unit comprises:
a smoke inlet configured to collect smoke,
a smoke filtering sub-unit, and
a smoke driver configured to circulate smoke through the smoke treating unit from the smoke collecting device to an outlet of the smoke treating unit, and
the system comprises an air inlet device configured to mix the smoke produced by the roasting apparatus with ambient air in order to control the temperature of the smoke inside the smoke filtering sub-unit, wherein the air inlet device is positioned at a position that is upstream the smoke filtering sub-unit,
wherein the air inlet device comprises a wall extending between the smoke outlet and the smoke inlet, wherein the wall includes at least one hole.
2. The system according to claim 1 wherein the smoke filtering sub-unit comprises at least an active carbon filter.
3. The system according to claim 2,

title: Aerated confectionery
abstract: The invention relates to a water-based aerated confectionery product and methods of making the same. In particular, the invention relates to stable acidic aqueous mousses comprising aggregated whey protein and sugar. In one aspect, the invention provides a water-based aerated confectionery having a pH less than 5.5 and a water activity less than 0.67, wherein the aerated confectionery comprises 30 wt % to 90 wt % sugar and between 1 wt % to 8 wt % protein. The protein stabilises the water-based aerated confectionery.
claims:
1. A water-based aerated confectionery, wherein the water-based aerated confectionery: has a pH less than 5.5; and has a water activity less than 0.67; and comprises 30 wt % to 90 wt % sugar; comprises between 1 wt % to 8 wt % protein, wherein the protein stabilises the water-based aerated confectionery.
2. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, wherein the confectionery is a mousse or a foam.
3. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, wherein the confectionery has a pH between 2 and 5.
4. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, wherein the protein is aggregated.
5. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, wherein the protein is whey protein.
6. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, wherein the protein is present in an amount at least 2 wt % of the aerated confectionery.
7. A water-based aerated confectionery according to claim 1, comprising sugar at between 40 wt % and 90 wt %, wherein the sugar comprises: at least two different sugars; or an invert

title: Thymol or carvacrol for reducing biological age or rate of increase thereof
abstract: The present disclosure relates generally to compositions and methods for reducing the biological age and/or reducing the rate of biological age increase in an adult animal. More specifically, the present disclosure relates to administering formulations comprising an effective amount of thymol and/or carvacrol, alone or in combination with a dietary regimen such as caloric restriction, elderly diet or low protein diet. The preparation can simultaneously reduce the biological age of tissues, organs or physiological systems in the adult animal in need; or treating, preventing or delaying the onset of organ disease, or the decline of organ function, or a condition associated therewith, in an adult animal in need thereof.
claims:
1.用于降低有需要的成年动物的生物学年龄和/或降低有需要的成年动物的生物学年龄增加速率的方法，所述方法包括：向所述成年动物饲喂包含有效量的百里酚和/或香芹酚的组合物。
2.用于降低有需要的成年动物中的组织、器官或生理系统的生物学年龄的方法，所述方法包括向所述成年动物饲喂包含有效量的百里酚和/或香芹酚的组合物。
3.根据权利要求2所述的方法，其中所述组织、器官或生理系统是免疫、胃肠、泌尿、肌肉、心血管和/或神经系统。
4.根据权利要求2所述的方法，其中所述组织是骨骼肌。
5.用于治疗、预防或延缓有需要的成年动物的器官疾病的发作、或器官功能的衰退、或与其相关的病症的方法，所述方法包括向所述成年动物饲喂包含有效量的百里酚和/或香芹酚的组合物。
6.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中所述有需要的动物具有与其实足年龄相比增加的生物学年龄。
7.根据权利要求3所述的方法，其中所述增加的生物学年龄由所述成年动物的DNA甲基化图谱确定。
8.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中所述动物是衰老的动物。
9.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中所述动物是宠物动物，优选狗或猫。
10.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中所述动物是人。
11.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中所述组合物选自食物组合物、膳食补充剂、营养组合物、营养制品、在食用前用水或乳重构的粉末状营养产品、食品添加剂、药物、饮品、干或湿宠物食品及其组合。
12.根据任一前述权利要求所述的方法，其中所述组合物是以下的一部分；或与以下一起施用：选自热量限制饮食、老年饮食或低蛋白饮食的膳食方案。

title: Prenatal supplement compositions for increasing breastmilk micronutrient levels
abstract: A method increases a level of at least one micronutrient, such as vitamin D and/or zinc, in a subject's breastmilk. The method includes administering to the subject a nutritional composition containing at least one of vitamin D and zinc. The nutritional composition can include one or more of vitamins B<sub>2</sub>, B<sub>6 </sub>or B<sub>12</sub>.
claims:
1. A method for increasing at least one micronutrient level in breastmilk of a subject, the method comprising administering to the subject a nutritional composition comprising:
at least one of vitamin D or zinc.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the nutritional composition is administered to the subject from before pregnancy of the subject.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein the nutritional composition is administered to the subject until the subject gives birth.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the nutritional composition further comprises at least one of:
myo-inositol, probiotics, vitamin B2, vitamin B6, or vitamin B12.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the nutritional composition further comprises at least one of:
folic acid, Fe, Ca, I and beta-carotene.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the nutritional composition comprises vitamin D and zinc.
7. The method of claim 1, wherein the increasing of the at least one micronutrient level is sustained for at least 12 months after the subject gives birth.

title: Microwave oven with redistributing element
claims:
1. A microwave oven for heating a food product, comprising:
two solid state microwave sources configured to generate microwaves;
two microwave emitters configured to emit the microwaves generated by the solid state microwave sources;
a cavity defining a space for receiving the food product, the space being disposed between the microwave emitters; and
at least one redistributing element configured to redistribute the microwaves emitted by at least one of the microwave emitters into the space towards one or more defined target areas within the space.
2. The microwave oven according to claim 1, wherein the cavity is configured such that the microwaves generated by the solid state microwave sources do not resonate within the ISM band in the range of from 902 MHz to 928 MHz.
3. The microwave oven according to claim 1, wherein each redistributing element comprises at least one of a non-metallic material and a microwave transparent material.
4. The microwave oven according to claim 1, wherein each redistributing element is configured to redistribute the emitted microwaves in at least one of a focused manner and a dispersed manner in the space.
5. The microwave oven according to claim 1, wherein each redistributing element comprises a lens.

title: Coffee composition
abstract: Coffee compositions derived from medium and high yield extracts while also having improved taste and fragrance are disclosed. Methods for producing such coffee compositions are also disclosed.
claims:
1.咖啡组合物，包含糠醇、吡啶和一种或多种单糖，其中所述糠醇与所述吡啶的浓度比大于或等于30；并且所述单糖的浓度总和大于或等于18重量％。
2.根据权利要求1所述的咖啡组合物，还包含2-乙基-6-甲基吡嗪、2-乙基-5-甲基吡嗪、2-乙基-3-甲基吡嗪、2,3,5-三甲基吡嗪、2-乙基-3,6-二甲基吡嗪、2-乙基-3,5-二甲基吡嗪和2,3-二乙基-5-甲基吡嗪，其中2-乙基-6-甲基吡嗪、2-乙基-5-甲基吡嗪、2-乙基-3-甲基吡嗪、2,3,5-三甲基吡嗪、2-乙基-3,6-二甲基吡嗪、2-乙基-3,5-二甲基吡嗪和2,3-二乙基-5-甲基吡嗪的绝对含量的总和大于或等于50.0mg/kg所述咖啡组合物的可溶性咖啡固形物。
3.根据权利要求1或2中任一项所述的咖啡组合物，其中所述糠醇的绝对含量大于或等于2,000mg/kg所述咖啡组合物的可溶性咖啡固形物。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的咖啡组合物，还包含一种或多种2-乙酰基噻唑、2-乙酰基吡嗪和2-乙酰基吡啶，其中2-乙酰基噻唑、2-乙酰基吡嗪和2-乙酰基吡啶的绝对含量的总和大于或等于2.70mg/kg所述咖啡组合物的可溶性咖啡固形物。
5.根据权利要求1至4中任一项所述的咖啡组合物，还包含2,3-丁二酮，其中所述糠醇与所述2,3-丁二酮的浓度比大于或等于30。
6.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的咖啡组合物，其中基于所述咖啡组合物的干重，所述单糖包含大于或等于8重量％的量的半乳糖。
7.根据权利要求1至6中任一项所述的咖啡组合物，其中基于所述咖啡组合物的干重，所述单糖包含大于或等于8重量％的量的甘露糖。
8.根据权利要求1至7中任一项所述的咖啡组合物，还包含2-乙酰基吡嗪和(E)-β-大马烯酮，其中2-乙酰基吡嗪与(E)-β-大马烯酮的浓度比大于或等于40。
9.咖啡组合物，包含大于或等于18重量％的量的一种或多种单糖；和
绝对含量大于或等于50.0的一种或多种烷基吡嗪、绝对含量大于或等于2,000的糠醇、或大于或等于2.70的一种或多种N-杂环化合物。
10.根据权利要求9所述的咖啡组合物，包含吡啶，其中所述糠醇与所述吡啶的浓度比大于或等于30。
11.根据权利要求9或10中任一项所述的咖啡组合物，还包含2,3-丁二酮，其中所述糠醇与所述2,3-丁二酮的浓度比大于或等于30。
12.根据权利要求9至11中任一项所述的咖啡组合物，其中基于所述咖啡组合物的干重，所述单糖包含大于或等于8重量％的量的半乳糖。
13.根据权利要求9至12中任一项所述的咖啡组合物，其中基于所述咖啡组合物的干重，所述单糖包含大于或等于8重量％的量的甘露糖。
14.根据权利要求9至13中任一项所述的咖啡组合物，还包含2-乙酰基吡嗪和(E)-β-大马烯酮，其中2-乙酰基吡嗪与(E)-β-大马烯酮的浓度比大于或等于40。

title: Microbiome ingredient combination for lowering uremic toxins in cardiometabolic or neurodegenerative conditions
abstract: The invention relates to composition for use in lowering or avoiding accumulation of uremic toxins in cardiometabolic or neurodegenerative conditions, particularly compositions that comprise a probiotic bacteria, a prebiotic (carbohydrates or fibers), and a lipid.
claims:
1. Composition for use in lowering or avoiding accumulation of uremic toxins in cardiometabolic or neurodegenerative conditions, wherein the composition comprises: (a) a probiotic bacterium, selected from probiotic bacteria - lacking a gene for producing at least one of urea, uric acid, p-cresol, p-cresyl sulfate, indoxyl sulfate, indole, indole acetic acid, indoxyl, trimethylamine, TMAO, dimethylglycine, betaine and/or glutarate ; - lacking at least one bacterial enzyme selected from urease, carnitine monooxygenase & reductase, tryptophanase and/or hydroxyphenylacetate; and/or - expressing at least one bacterial enzyme selected from a-galactosidase, P-galactosidase, glucan 1,4-P-glucosidase, cellulase, P-fructofuranosidase and/or Licheninase; (b) a prebiotic selected from carbohydrates or fibers, wherein the carbohydrate or fiber can be hydrolyzed by at least one bacterial enzyme selected from a-galactosidase, P-galactosidase, glucan 1,4-P-glucosidase, cellulase, P-fructofuranosidase and/or Licheninase; (c) a lipid, selected from a triglyceride, a short chain fatty acid and/or a medium chain fatty acid, wherein the triglyceride comprises, short chain fatty acids, medium chain fatty acids, or a mixture thereof.
2. The composition for use according to claim 1, wherein the probiotic bacterium (a) is selected from at least one of the following a. to k.: a. Bifidobacterium animalis subspecies lactis NCC 2818 (CNCM 1-3446); b. Bifidobacterium longum subspecies infantis NCC 341 (ATCC 15697 (T));

title: Coffee beans roasting and grinding equipment
abstract: FIELD: coffee industry.SUBSTANCE: disclosed is equipment for roasting and grinding coffee beans, comprising roasting device (50) and associated grinding device (60), wherein roasting device (50) is configured to receive coffee beans of a certain type and comprises reading means (53) for identifying characteristics of coffee beans fed into said device, a control unit which configures the roasting profile of the grains in accordance with the characteristics extracted from reading means (53) and/or according to the characteristics of the grains in data base (51) in this control unit, and/or in accordance with the input data entered by the user, wherein roasted coffee beans are distributed in containers (10, 20) for beans, wherein containers (10, 20) for grains contain programmable identification means, wherein parameters of roasted coffee beans of certain type are encoded by encoder (52) in roasting device, wherein grinding device (60) comprises one or more housings for receiving one or more containers (10, 20) for beans, reader (62) for obtaining information on product parameters for roasted coffee beans in one or more containers (10, 20) for grains, control unit configured to adapt the degree of grinding and the number of roasted coffee beans to be fed from coffee beans containers (10, 20), to obtain a certain amount of coffee and/or a certain amount of coffee mixture from each bean container to be ground in accordance with these product parameters and/or in accordance with recipe database (64), and/or in accordance with the input data entered user. Also described is a method of roasting and grinding coffee beans using roasting and grinding equipment and use of such equipment for dispensing a mixture of roasted and ground coffee beans in a certain amount.EFFECT: group of inventions enables to achieve end results for the coffee drink, similar to those obtained using a capsule system.17 cl, 20 dwg

title: Beverage extraction system
abstract: The invention relates to a system comprising an extraction device and a capsule of a beverage preparation machine, where-the capsule comprises a capsule body and a top cover, and-the extraction device comprises:-an upstream capsule enclosing part and a downstream capsule enclosing part, the present invention relates to a capsule extraction device comprising an upstream capsule enclosing member and a downstream capsule enclosing member relatively translatable between an open position for inserting and/or ejecting the capsule and a closed position for forming an extraction chamber enclosing the capsule during extraction, the downstream member comprising a downstream planar piercing arrangement for opening the cover of the capsule, and wherein the body of the pouch and the cover are made of a multi-ply paper material comprising a paper ply coated with at least one plastic ply, and wherein the multi-ply material of the downstream piercing arrangement and the second envelope wall (32) of the pouch is designed to enable progressive piercing of the top cover.
claims:
1.一种系统，所述系统包括饮料制备机器和囊包，所述囊包包含饮料配料、优选烘焙并且研磨的咖啡，
其中所述囊包(3)包括第一包封壁和第二包封壁(31,31',32)，所述第一囊包包封壁和所述第二囊包包封壁限定用于包封所述饮料配料(33)的腔室，并且
其中所述囊包的所述第一囊包包封壁和所述第二囊包包封壁由多层纸材料制成，所述多层纸材料包括组装在一起的至少一个纸层(A)和至少一个塑料层(B)、优选可堆肥塑料层，并且
其中所述多层纸材料被取向成使得至少一个塑料层面向所述囊包的所述腔室的内部部分，
并且
其中所述饮料制备机器包括用于从所述囊包提取饮料的提取装置，并且所述提取装置包括：
-上游囊包包封部件(1)和下游囊包包封部件(2)，所述上游囊包包封部件和所述下游囊包包封部件能够在用于插入和/或弹出所述囊包(3)的打开位置和用于在提取期间形成包封所述囊包的提取室(5)的闭合位置之间相对移动，
-所述上游部件(2)承载：
·用于打开所述囊包的所述第一包封壁(31)的上游刺穿排布结构(22)，和
·液体注入器(25)，
-所述下游部件(1)包括用于打开所述囊包的所述第二包封壁(32)的下游刺穿排布结构(12)，所述下游刺穿排布结构包括板(121)，其中：
·所述板的转向所述囊包的所述第二壁的表面包括从所述表面凸出的打开元件(122)，并且
·所述板包括穿孔，用以排出从该打开的第二壁分配的该饮料，
并且
其中在制备饮料期间，所述提取装置被构造为：
-在第一步骤中，在所述上游囊包包封部件(1)和所述下游囊包包封部件(2)之间包封所述囊包(3)，以及
-然后，在第二步骤中，通过所述液体注入器(23)将液体引入所包封的囊包(3)内部，
其中所述下游刺穿排布结构的所述打开元件(122)和所述囊包的所述第二包封壁(32)的多层材料被设计成使得：
-在所述第一步骤中，所述打开元件(122)仅部分地刺穿所述多层纸材料，使得面向所述囊包的所述腔室的所述内部部分的至少所述塑料层不被刺穿，并且
-在所

title: Compositions and methods using at least one glycine or derivative thereof, at least one N-acetylcysteine or derivative thereof, and at least one nicotinamide riboside or NAD+ precursor
abstract: A composition can treat or prevent at least one physical state selected from the group consisting of oxidative stress, a condition associated with oxidative stress, a reduced level of glutathione, and a condition associated with a reduced level of glutathione. The composition contains an effective amount of a combination of at least one glycine or functional derivative thereof, at least one N-acetylcysteine or functional derivative thereof, and at least one nicotinamide riboside or NAD precursor. The composition can be orally administered, for example as one or more of a food product, a food for special medical purposes (FSMP), a nutritional supplement, a ready to drink formula, a dairy-based drink, a low-volume liquid supplement, powder formats for liquid reconstitution or a meal replacement beverage.20 25 20 84 81 24 J ul 2 02 5 A B S T R A C T A c o m p o s i t i o n c a n t r e a t o r p r e v e n t a t l e a s t o n e p h y s i c a l s t a t e s e l e c t e d f r o m t h e g r o u p 2 0 2 5 2 0 8 4 8 1 2 4 J u l 2 0 2 5 c o n s i s t i n g o f o x i d a t i v e s t r e s s , a c o n d i t i o n a s s o c i a t e d w i t h o x i d a t i v e s t r e s s , a r e d u c e d l e v e l o f g l u t a t h i o n e , a n d a c o n d i t i o n a s s o c i a t e d w i t h a r e d u c e d l e v e l o f g l u t a t h i o n e . T h e c o m p o s i t i o n c o n t a i n s a n e f f e c t i v e a m o u n t o f a c o m b i n a t i o n o f a t l e a s t o n e g l y c i n e o r f u n c t i o n a l d e r i v a t i v e t h e r e o f , a t l e a s t o n e N - a c e t y l c y s t e i n e o r f u n c t i o n a l d e r i v a t i v e t h e r e o f , a n d a t l e a s t o n e n i c o t i n a m i d e r i b o s i d e o r N A D p r e c u r s o r . T h e c o m p o s i t i o n c a n b e o r a l l y a d m i n i s t e r e d , f o r e x a m p l e a s o n e o r m o r e o f a f o o d p r o d u c t , a f o o d f o r s p e c i a l m e d i c a l p u r p o s e s ( F S M P ) , a n u t r i t i o n a l s u p p l e m e n t , a r e a d y t o d r i n k f o r m u l a , a d a i r y - b a s e d d r i n k , a l o w - v o l u m e l i q u i d s u p p l e m e n t , p o w d e r f o r m a t s f o r l i q u i d r e c o n s t i t u t i o n o r a m e a l r e p l a c e m e n t b e v e r a g e .
claims:
1. A method of treating, reducing incidence of, or reducing severity of at least one condition selected from the group consisting of metabolic syndrome, age-related decline in metabolic regulation, and muscle indications, the method comprising administering to an individual in need thereof or at risk thereof an effective amount of a combination of at least one glycine or functional derivative thereof, at least one N-acetylcysteine or functional derivative thereof, and at least one nicotinamide riboside or NAD+ precursor.
2. The method of Claim 1, wherein the at least one glycine or functional derivative thereof is selected from the group consisting of L-glycine, L-glycine ethyl ester, D-Allylglycine; N-[Bis(methylthio)methylene]glycine methyl ester; Boc-allyl-Gly-OH (dicyclo hexylammonium)         salt;         Boc-D-Chg-OH;         Boc-Chg-OH; (R)-N-Boc-(2'-chlorophenyl)glycine; Boc-L-cyclopropylglycine; Boc-L-cyclopropylglycine; (R)-N-Boc-4-fluorophenylglycine; Boc-D-propargylglycine; Boc-(S)-3-thienylglycine; Boc-(R)-3-thienylglycine; D-a-Cyclohexylglycine; L-a-Cyclopropylglycine; N-(2-fluorophenyl)-N-(methylsulfonyl)glycine; N-(4-fluorophenyl)-N-(methylsulfonyl)glycine; Fmoc-N-(2,4-dimethoxybenzyl)-Gly-OH; N-(2-Furoyl)glycine; L-a-Neopentylglycine; D-Propargylglycine; sarcosine; Z-a-Phosphonoglycine trimethyl ester, and mixtures thereof
3. The method of Claim 1, wherein the combination is administered orally.
4. The method of Claim 1, wherein the combination is administered in a composition selected from th

title: Use of breast milk oligosaccharides in nutritional compositions for improving bone tissue development and/or bone strength
abstract: FIELD: chemistry.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to the use of a composition comprising a mixture of oligosaccharides containing a combination of sialylated oligosaccharides of 3'-sialyllactose (3'-SL) and 6'-sialyllactose (6'-SL), a combination of fucosylated oligosaccharides of 2'-fucosyllactose (2'FL) and difucosyllactose (diFL) and a combination of N-acetylated oligosaccharides of lacto-N-tetraose (LNT) and lacto-N-neotetrose (LNnT), as an artificial nutrient for improving bone strength in a human or domestic animal being tested. Human test subject is preferentially a child, an infant or a toddler.EFFECT: using the invention enables providing higher strength of bone tissue, particularly reducing cortical porosity.1 cl, 6 dwg, 1 ex
claims:
1. Применение композиции, включающей смесь олигосахаридов, содержащую:
комбинацию сиалилированных олигосахаридов 3’-сиалиллактозы (3’-SL) и 6’-сиалиллактозы (6’-SL),
комбинацию фукозилированных олигосахаридов 2’-фукозиллактозы (2’FL) и дифукозиллактозы (diFL) и
комбинацию N-ацетилированных олигосахаридов лакто-N-тетраозы (LNT) и лакто-N-неотетраозы (LNnT),
в качестве искусственного питательного вещества для улучшения прочности костной ткани у испытуемого-человека или домашнего животного.
2. Применение композиции по п. 1, причём испытуемый-человек представляет собой ребёнка, младенца или начинающего ходить ребёнка.
3. Применение композиции по п. 1 или 2, в которой смесь олигосахаридов включает:
- от 10 до 35 мас.%, предпочтительно от 10 до 30 мас.%, более предпочтительно от 10 до 25 мас.% относительно общей массы смеси олигосахаридов указанных сиалилированных олигосахаридов,
- от 30 до 80 мас.%, предпочтительно от 40 до 80 мас.%, более предпочтительно от 50 до 70 мас.% относительно общей массы смеси олигосахаридов указанных фукозилированных олигосахаридов и
- от 10 до 35 мас.%, предпочтительно от 15 до 30 мас.%, более предпочтительно от 15 до 20 мас.% относительно общей массы смеси олигосахаридов указанных N-ацетилированных олигосахаридов.
4. Применение композиции по любому из пп. 1-3, причём улучшение прочности костной ткани включает по меньшей мере один из следующих физиологических процессов: приобретение костной массы, оптимизация пиковой костной массы, стимулирование образования костной ткани, стимулирование анаболизма костной ткани, повышение минеральной плотности и микроархитектуры костной ткани, модулирование биомеханических свойств костной ткани, модулирование соотношения образования костной ткани и/или резорбции костной ткани, содействие регенерации костной ткани во время заживления переломов, регулирование процесса резорбции костной ткани.
5. Применение композиции по любому из пп. 1-4 для повышения минеральной плотности костной ткани (BMD), содержания минер

title: Sealing device for container
abstract: FIELD: packaging.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to a sealing means for a container and a system containing a container with said sealing means. The closure (1) for a container comprises a first part (2); a second part (3) designed to be movable relative to the first part (2) in order to move between a closed state, in which the opening (21) of the closure (1) is closed, and an open state, in which the opening (21) is not closed; and a tamper-evident element (5) which, on the one hand, is connected to the second part (3) by means of a fragile connection (51) and which, on the other hand, is designed to be held relative to the first part (2) in such a way that when the second part (3) is moved relative to the first part (2) from the closed state to the open state, the brittle connection (51) is broken by the opening movement. The tamper-evident element (5) is designed to be activated to break the fragile connection (51) independently of the movement of the second part (3) relative to the first part (2) by the opening movement, and the sealing means (1) additionally comprises a retaining device (22) located on the first part (2) and designed to be able to fix the opening control element (5) to the first part (2) after breaking the fragile connection (51). The retaining device prevents the loss of the opening control element.EFFECT: tamper-evident element can be recycled, for example, together with other parts of the closure and/or with the main packaging material (such as a container) in the same recycling stream.17 cl, 28 dwg
claims:
1. Укупорочное средство (1) для контейнера, содержащее:
первую часть (2),
вторую часть (3), выполненную с возможностью перемещения относительно первой части (2) для перемещения между закрытым состоянием, в котором отверстие (21) укупорочного средства (1) закрыто, и открытым состоянием, в котором отверстие (21) не закрыто, и
элемент (5) контроля вскрытия, соединенный со второй частью (3) посредством хрупкого соединения (51) и выполненный с возможностью удерживания относительно первой части (2) таким образом, что при перемещении второй части (3) относительно первой части (2) из закрытого состояния в открытое состояние происходит разрыв хрупкого соединения (51) за счет открывающего движения,
причем элемент (5) контроля вскрытия выполнен с возможностью приведения в действие для разрыва хрупкого соединения (51) независимо от перемещения второй части (3) относительно первой части (2) за счет открывающего движения,
при этом укупорочное средство (1) дополнительно содержит удерживающее устройство (22), расположенное на первой части (2) и выполненное с возможностью фиксации элемента (5) контроля вскрытия с первой частью (2) после разрыва хрупкого соединения (51),
при этом элемент (5) контроля вскрытия по меньшей мере частично выполнен в виде кнопки, например нажимной кнопки, и выполнен с возможностью нажатия для приведения в действие, и
при этом укупорочное средство частично или полностью изготовлено из материала, выбранного из следующей группы: пищевые культуры, обрезки древесины, восстановленное масло, растительное масло, отходы или остатки, использованное кулинарное масло, животный жир из отходов пищевой промышленности, отходы и остатки переработки растительного масла, рыбий жир из отходов рыбопереработки, техническое кукурузное масло и их комбинации.
2. Укупорочное средство (1) по п. 1, в котором удерживающее устройство (22) выполнено с возможностью удерживания элемента (5) контроля вскрытия относительно первой части (2), когда вторая часть (3) перемещается относительно п

title: Food composition comprising one or more coated food particles
abstract: A method of preparing a food composition comprising one or more coated food particles is disclosed. The method comprises the step of providing one or more food particles. The method further comprises the step of coating each of the food particles with a carbohydrate. This results in a food composition comprising one or more food particles coated with a crystalline carbohydrate layer. The crystalline carbohydrate layer comprises at least 95% crystalline carbohydrate particles and has a closed porosity of less than 10%. A food composition comprising one or more coated food particles and a coated food particle are also disclosed.
claims:
1.制备包含一个或多个包被食品颗粒的食品组合物的方法，所述方法包括以下步骤：
a)提供一个或多个食品颗粒；
b)用碳水化合物对步骤a)的所述食品颗粒中的每个食品颗粒进行包衣以形成包含一个或多个包被食品颗粒的食品组合物，所述一个或多个包被食品颗粒是用结晶碳水化合物层包衣的食品颗粒，
其中所述结晶碳水化合物层包含至少95％的结晶碳水化合物并且具有低于10％的闭合孔隙度。
2.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中所述包衣步骤b)用碳水化合物进行，所述碳水化合物是：
i)至少一种固体结晶碳水化合物，或
ii)至少一种固体结晶碳水化合物和至少一种水合结晶化合物，或
iii)至少一种固体无定形碳水化合物，或
iv)至少一种固体结晶碳水化合物和至少一种固体无定形碳水化合物，或
v)至少一种固体结晶碳水化合物和至少一种固体无定形碳水化合物以及至少一种水合结晶化合物，或
vi)至少一种碳水化合物的液体溶液或悬浮液；
其中所述步骤biii)在包衣之后包括在所述固体无定形碳水化合物的玻璃化转变温度Tg以上进行的热处理步骤和/或增湿步骤以触发碳水化合物颗粒桥接并且将无定形碳水化合物转化成结晶碳水化合物，其中所述增湿步骤之后进行干燥步骤；
其中所述步骤biv)在包衣之后任选地包括在所述固体无定形碳水化合物的所述玻璃化转变温度Tg以上进行的热处理步骤和/或增湿步骤以触发碳水化合物颗粒桥接并且将无定形碳水化合物转化成结晶碳水化合物，其中所述增湿步骤之后进行干燥步骤；
其中所述步骤bv)在包衣之后任选地包括在所述固体无定形碳水化合物的所述玻璃化转变温度Tg以上进行的热处理步骤和/或增湿步骤以触发碳水化合物颗粒桥接并且将无定形碳水化合物转化成结晶碳水化合物；
其中所述步骤bvi)在包衣之后包括干燥步骤，任选地在所述干燥步骤之前进行冷却步骤，以将溶解在所述至少一种碳水化合物的液体溶液或悬浮液中的碳水化合物转化成结晶碳水化合物。
3.根据权利要求2所述的方法，其中所述包衣步骤bi)在包衣之后包括增湿步骤，优选汽蒸，并且任选地之后进行干燥步骤，以触发结晶碳水化合物颗粒桥接。
4.根据权利要求2所述的方法，其中所述包衣步骤bii)在包衣之后包括热处理步骤以触发结晶碳水化合物颗粒桥接。

title: Composition and method for potentiating musculoskeletal effect of one or more anabolic amino acids by using one or more autophagy-inducing amino acids
abstract: To provide a method and a composition for potentiating effect to a musculoskeletal system of one or more anabolic amino acids in an individual which requires potentiating effect to the musculoskeletal system.SOLUTION: A method includes a step of administering a composition comprising one or more anabolic amino acids to an individual, and the composition further comprises one or more amino acids or precursors thereof, which induce autophagy, in a total amount effective to make the composition at least neutral regarding autophagy. One or more amino acids which induce autophagy are selected from a group consisting of glycine, cysteine, proline, glutamic acid, valine, tyrosine, or precursors thereof and a mixture thereof.SELECTED DRAWING: None
claims:
【請求項1】
筋骨格系への作用を増強する必要がある個体において、１種以上の同化アミノ酸の筋骨格系への作用を増強する方法であって、前記１種以上の同化アミノ酸を含む組成物を、前記個体に投与する工程を含み、前記組成物が、オートファジーを誘導する１種以上のアミノ酸又はそれらの前駆体を、前記組成物がオートファジーに関して少なくとも中立となるのに有効な総量で更に含む、方法。
【請求項2】
前記オートファジーを誘導する１種以上のアミノ酸が、グリシン、システイン、プロリン、グルタミン酸、バリン、チロシン、又はこれらの前駆体、及びこれらの混合物からなる群から選択される、請求項１に記載の方法。
【請求項3】
前記前駆体が、セリン、Ｎ－アセチルシステイン（ＮＡＣ）、メチオニンである、請求項１に記載の方法。
【請求項4】
前記１種以上の同化アミノ酸が、ロイシン、イソロイシン、アルギニン、グルタミン、シトルリン、及びこれらの混合物からなる群から選択される、請求項１に記載の方法。
【請求項5】
前記１種以上の同化アミノ酸が、ロイシン、アルギニン、又はグルタミンのうちの少なくとも１種を、前記個体においてｍＴＯＲを活性化するのに有効な量で含む、請求項１に記載の方法。
【請求項6】
前記組成物が、骨格筋においてオートファジーを誘導する、請求項１に記載の方法。
【請求項7】
前記個体が、高齢の個体である、請求項１に記載の方法。
【請求項8】
前記個体が、サルコペニア若しくはフレイルを有する、又はサルコペニア若しくはフレイルを発症するリスクがある、請求項１に記載の方法。
【請求項9】
前記個体が、（ｉ）重篤、（ｉｉ）急性腎傷害、（ｉｉｉ）慢性腎傷害、（ｉｖ）慢性腎疾患による筋量の低下、及び（ｖ）慢性腎疾患による筋機能の低下からなる群から選択される少なくとも１つの状態を有する、請求項１に記載の方法。
【請求項10】
前記個体が、重篤なミオパチーを有する、又は重篤なミオパチーを発症するリスクがある、請求項１に記載の方法。
【請求項11】
前記個体が、がん、慢性閉塞性肺疾患（ＣＯＰＤ）、慢性心不全（ＣＨＦ）、急性腎疾患又は慢性腎疾患（ＣＫＤ）などの慢性疾患に続発する悪液質又は筋消耗を有する、請求項１に記載の方法。
assignee: ソシエテ·デ·プロデュイ·ネスレ·エス·アー

title: Sustained release melatonin compositions
abstract: The present invention relates to a composition comprising melatonin encapsulated within a calcium alginate hydrogel. It further provides an orally administrable dosage form comprising such a composition held within a gel, wherein the gel is formed using starch as a gelling agent. Processes to produce these compositions, as well as their use in therapy, are also disclosed.
claims:
1. An orally administrable dosage form comprising a composition comprising melatonin encapsulated within a calcium alginate hydrogel, wherein the composition is held within a gel, wherein the gel is formed using starch as a gelling agent, and wherein the weight ratio of the melatonin to the calcium alginate hydrogel is from 5:95 to 15:85,
the dosage form further comprising additional melatonin which is not encapsulated within the calcium alginate hydrogel.
2. The dosage form according to claim 1, comprising from 1 to 3 wt % of the composition based on total weight of the dosage form.
3. The dosage form according to claim 1, comprising from 0.01 to 0.03 wt % of the additional melatonin which is not encapsulated within the calcium alginate hydrogel, based on total weight of the dosage form.
4. The dosage form according to claim 1, wherein the starch in the gelling agent comprises potato starch.
5. The dosage form according to claim 1, comprising from 7 to 17 wt % of the starch based on total weight of the dosage form.
6. The dosage form according to claim 1, comprising from 8 to 18 wt % water based on total weight of the dosage form.
7. The dosage form according to claim 1, further comprising

title: Coffee beans roasting system checking method
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: inventions group relates to coffee industry. Method for checking a roasting system is described, said system comprising at least one roasting device, wherein said device produces smoke during coffee beans heating, and at least one smoke purification unit, wherein said smoke purification unit comprises at least one smoke filtering device, at least one collapsible smoke-arresting device configured to collect smoke from the outlet channel of the roasting device, at least one temperature sensor configured to measure a temperature T of the smoke stream within the smoke purification unit, a smoke pumping device configured to remove smoke from the roasting device through said smoke purification unit, during the roasting operation, the method includes the following steps: operating the roasting device to produce a hot gas, monitoring the temperature of the smoke during operation and observing at least one behaviour of the monitored temperature over time, comparing said at least one observed behaviour of the monitored temperature with a predetermined temperature behaviour, corresponding to the presence of a collapsible smoke arresting device inside the smoke purification unit, displaying an alarm signal, if at least one observed behaviour deviates from corresponding predetermined behaviour. Coffee beans roasting system and computer-readable data medium are also disclosed.EFFECT: group of inventions makes it possible to solve the problem of informing the operator that part of the collector air duct of the smoke filter is absent during the roasting operation.14 cl, 5 dwg

title: Code and container of system for preparing a beverage or foodstuff
abstract: A container for a foodstuff or beverage preparation machine, the container for containing beverage or foodstuff preparation material and comprising on a surface thereof a code encoding preparation information, the code comprising a reference portion and a data portion: the reference portion comprising a linear arrangement of at least two reference units defining a reference line r, the data portion comprising at least one data unit, wherein said data unit is arranged on an encoding line D that intersects the reference line r, the data unit occupies any continuous distance d along the encoding line D as a variable to at least partially encode a parameter of the preparation information, whereby said encoding line D is circular and is arranged with a tangent thereto orthogonal the reference line r at said intersection point.
claims:
25 CLAIMS:
1.
