A container for a beverage or foodstuff preparation machine, the container for containing beverage or foodstuff material and comprising a code encoding preparation information, the code comprising a reference portion and a data portion: the reference portion comprising an arrangement of at least two reference units to define virtually a reference line (r); the data portion comprising a data unit, wherein the data unit is arranged on a virtual encoding line (D) that intersects the reference line (r) at an intersection point, the data unit is arranged a distance (d) from said intersection point as a variable to at least partially encode a parameter of the preparation information, whereby said virtual encoding line (D) is circular and is arranged with a tangent thereto orthogonal the reference line (r) at said intersection point, wherein the data unit comprises a first data unit and a second data unit, the first data unit and the second data unit arranged along the virtual encoding line (D) that intersects the reference line (r), the first data line arranged at a first associated distance (d1) from the intersection point along the virtual encoding line (D), and the second data line arranged at a second associated distance (d2) from the intersection point along the virtual encoding line (D), wherein the virtual encoding line (D) is circular or a segment of a circle and is arranged with the tangent thereto orthogonal the reference line (r) at the intersection point, wherein an overall distance (d) is determined as an average d=0.5(d1+d2) of the first associated distance and the second associated distance, and wherein a value of the parameter (Vp) is encoded in the preparation information.
2. The container according to claim 1, wherein the data unit is configured to occupy any continuous distance along

title: Beverage preparation machine
abstract: Beverage preparation machines include a fluid circulation system including a fluid source, a fluid pump, and a fluid circulation conduit; a container holder to receive a corresponding container; and a fluid processing device including a fluid processing body including in turn at least one inlet member for introducing the fluid substance into the container for the preparation of a beverage product by mixing of the fluid substance with an ingredient contained in the container. In further detail, the fluid processing body can include at least one outlet member for dispensing the beverage product from the container and for separately moving the fluid processing device and the container relatively one to another, e.g., between a fluid introduction position (fluid processing body protrudes inside the internal volume of the container), and a beverage dispensing position (fluid processing body at least partially withdrawn from the internal volume of the container).
claims:
1. A beverage preparation machine comprising:
a fluid circulation system for a fluid substance, the fluid circulation system comprising at least one fluid source, at least one fluid pump and at least one fluid circulation conduit;
at least one container holder adapted for receiving a corresponding container; and
at least one fluid processing device which is part of the fluid circulation system and which comprises a fluid processing body comprising in turn at least one inlet member for introducing the fluid substance into the container for the preparation of a beverage product by mixing of the fluid substance with an ingredient contained in the container,
wherein the fluid processing body further comprises at least one outlet member for dispensing the beverage product from the container, wherein at least one movement member is provided for separately moving the at least one fluid processing device and the container relatively one to another between:
a fluid introduction position, wherein the fluid processing body protrudes inside the internal volume of the container for introducing therein the fluid substance, and
a beverage dispensing position, wherein the fluid processing body is at least partially withdrawn from the internal volume of the container to allow dispensing of the beverage product from the container through the at least one outlet member.
2. The beverage preparation machine according to claim 1, characterized in that the fluid processing body i

title: Flexible package for preparation of food or beverage product having rigid part
abstract: FIELD: packaging and storage.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to flexible or semi-flexible closed package (1) for placement of an ingredient for preparation of a food product in a device for preparation of food or drink products. Package comprises: (i) flexible or semi-flexible side walls (2) which form a flattened package body, and (ii) cup-shaped lower part (3) made with possibility of device liquid injection element insertion. Package (1) is formed from whole elongated primary flat sheet (5) of a workpiece made of a flexible material which is U-folded about its transverse axis of symmetry (Lx) and is soldered at its side edges (4) and top edge (34), wherein said bowl-shaped bottom part (3) is a hollow volume having concave bottom side (7) and convex sides (8), and the curvature of the profile of said lower side (7) is identical to the curvature of the profile of each of said lateral sides (8).EFFECT: provision of improved connection to the beverage preparation device in a substantially tight manner.10 cl, 22 dwg
claims:
1. Гибкая или полугибкая закрытая упаковка (1) для размещения ингредиента для приготовления пищевого продукта в устройстве для приготовления пищевых или питьевых продуктов путем смешивания упомянутого ингредиента с жидкостью для смешивания, вводимой в упомянутую упаковку упомянутым устройством, причем упомянутая упаковка (1) содержит:
(i) гибкие или полугибкие боковые стенки (2), которые образуют уплощенный корпус упаковки, и
(ii) чашеобразную нижнюю часть (3), выполненную с возможностью вставки элемента впрыска жидкости устройства,
при этом упаковка (1) образована из цельного удлиненного первичного плоского листа (5) заготовки, изготовленного из гибкого материала, предпочтительно материала на основе волокон, который сложен в U-образной форме вокруг своей поперечной оси симметрии (Lx) и запаян по своим боковым краям (4) и верхнему краю (34), причем упомянутая чашеобразная нижняя часть (3) представляет собой полый объем, имеющий вогнутую нижнюю сторону (7) и выпуклые боковые стороны (8), а кривизна профиля упомянутой нижней стороны (7) идентична кривизне профиля каждой из упомянутых боковых сторон (8).
2. Упаковка (1) по п. 1, в которой упомянутая чашеобразная нижняя часть (3) имеет форму шестигранной призмы, причем упомянутая призма имеет два противоположных вертикальных края (9), выровненных относительно поперечной оси (Lx) упаковки, которые простираются вниз с образованием простирающихся вниз кончиков (10), при этом упомянутые простирающиеся края (9) имеют такую высоту, что для каждого поперечного сечения чашеобразной нижней части (3) при измерении вдоль всей поперечной оси (Lx) упаковки сумма двух высот чашеобразной нижней части плюс ширина ее нижней стороны (7) является постоянной.
3. Упаковка (1) по любому из предшествующих пп. 1 или 2, в которой упомянутый цельный удлиненный первичный плоский лист (3) заготовки изготовлен из материала на основе волокон, покрытого с его внутренней стороны герметизирующим слоем, причем упомянутый слой на основе волокон выбран из

title: Compositions comprising a combination of caffeine and oleuropein or a metabolite thereof and their use for improving muscle function
abstract: A combination of caffeine and at least one of oleuropein or metabolite thereof for use by oral administration to an individual in an amount effective to achieve at least one result that is (i) improved mitochondrial calcium uptake in muscle cells, (ii) improved utilization of calcium in muscle cells, (iii) increased mitochondrial energy in muscle cells, (iv) improvement in at least one of muscle functionality, muscle performance, or muscle strength, (v) decreased muscle fatigue, (vi) increased mobility, and/or (vii) treatment of a muscle disorder linked to calcium depletion or deficiency. The individual can be at least one of an aging subject; an elderly subject; a subject with muscle fatigue or muscle weakness; a subject with impaired mobility; a frail subject; a pre-frail subject; a sarcopenic subject; a subject recovering from pre-frailty, frailty, sarcopenia or impaired mobility; a subject undergoing physical rehabilitation; a sportsman; or a pet.
claims:
1. A method of achieving at least one result selected from the group consisting of (i) improved mitochondrial calcium uptake in muscle cells, (ii) improved utilization of calcium in muscle cells, (iii) increased mitochondrial energy in muscle cells, (iv) improvement in at least one of muscle functionality, muscle performance, or muscle strength, (v) decreased muscle fatigue, (vi) increased mobility and (vii) treatment of a muscle disorder linked to calcium depletion or deficiency, the method comprising orally administering to an individual an effective amount of a combination of caffeine and at least one of oleuropein or metabolite thereof.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the individual is selected from the group consisting of an aging subject; an elderly subject; a subject with muscle fatigue or muscle weakness; a subject with impaired mobility; a frail subject; a pre-frail subject; a sarcopenic subject; a subject recovering from pre-frailty, frailty, sarcopenia or impaired mobility; a subject undergoing physical rehabilitation; a sportsman; and a pet.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein decreasing muscle fatigue is in an individual who participates in exercise, the exercise comprising at least one of 1) resistance exercise, 2) anaerobic or repeated sprint-type exercise, or 3) endurance exercise, the method comprising orally administering to the individual an effective amount of a combination of caffeine and at least one of oleuropein or metabolite thereof.

title: Bottle, method and kit
abstract: A bottle 200, 300 comprising: a first half-bottle shell 100, 303 comprising: - a first molded pulp layer defining a first half-bottle body 102, 302 comprising at least a first securing element 104a, 304a; - a first adhesive layer 313 provided over the interior of the first half-bottle body; and - a first metallization layer 312 provided over the interior of the first adhesive layer; and a second half-bottle shell 307 comprising: - a second molded pulp layer defining a second half-bottle body comprising at least a second securing element 304b; - a second adhesive layer provided over the interior of the second half-bottle body; and - a second metallization layer provided over the interior of the first adhesive layer; wherein the first securing element is complementary to the second securing element; and the first half-bottle shell and the second half-bottle shell are secured together by a first joint 308a between the first securing element and the second securing element.
claims:
Claims
1. A bottle (200, 300) comprising: a first half-bottle shell (100, 303) comprising: - a first molded pulp layer defining a first half-bottle body (102, 302) comprising at least a first securing element (104a, 304a); - a first adhesive layer (313) provided over the interior of the first halfbottle body; and - a first metallization layer (312) provided over the interior of the first adhesive layer; and a second half-bottle shell (307) comprising: - a second molded pulp layer defining a second half-bottle body comprising at least a second securing element (304b); - a second adhesive layer provided over the interior of the second halfbottle body; and - a second metallization layer provided over the interior of the first adhesive layer; wherein the first securing element is complementary to the second securing element; and the first half-bottle shell and the second half-bottle shell are secured together by a first joint (308a) between the first securing element and the second securing element.
2. A bottle to Claim 1, wherein the first joint is does not provide a gap or a flange in a body of the bottle.
3. A bottle to Claim 1 or Claim 2, wherein the first securing element and the second securing element are mutually complementary components of a butt joint, rabbet joint, miter joint, lap joint, dado joint, spline joint, mortise and tenant joint, tongue and groove joint, finger joint, or dovetail joint.

title: Food emulsion compositions with lentil proteins and cereal bran
Compositions comprising at least one n-acetylated and at least one fucosylated oligosaccharide for use in the promotion of digestive capacity in infants and young children
abstract: This invention relates to compositions for use in the promotion of the development and/or of the growth of the surface area of the small intestine and in the associated improvement of the digestive capacity in an infant or in a young child.
claims:
1. A method of promoting the digestive capacity in a child in need thereof, the method comprising administering to the child a growing-up milk comprising at least one N-acetylated oligosaccharide and at least one fucosylated oligosaccharide, wherein the growing-up milk is administered in an effective amount for improving enterohepatic circulation in the child.
2. The method of claim 1, for promoting the capacity to digest fat, liposoluble vitamins, proteins and carbohydrates in the child.
3. The method of claim 1, for promoting the development and/or the growth of the surface area of the small intestine of the child.
4. The method of claim 1, for promoting the increase of the villi length in the small intestine of the child.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the at least one N-acetylated oligosaccharide is selected from the group consisting of lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), para-lacto-N-neohexaose (para-LNnH), disialyllacto-N-tetraose (DSLNT) and combinations thereof.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the at least one N-acetylated oligosaccharide comprises lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT).
7. The method of claim 1, wherein the at least one fucosylated oligosaccharide is selected from the group consisting of 2′-fucosyllactose, 3′fucosyllactose, difucosyllactose, lacto-N-fucopentaose I, lacto-N-fucopentaose II, lacto-N-fucopentaose III, lacto-N-fucopentaose V, lacto-N-fucohexaose, lacto-N-difucohexaose I, fucosyllacto-N-hexaose, fucosyllacto-N-neohexaose I, fucosyllacto-N-neohe

title: Toilet sand composition
abstract: To provide an improved toilet sand composition which overcomes demerits and drawbacks related to an existing malodor control technique.SOLUTION: Provided are compositions and a method comprising a fragrance and from about 0.5 weight % to about 5.0 weight % of a granular malodor adsorbent which can be used to eliminate malodor in animal waste. The granular malodor absorbent may be granular molecular sieves or granulated activated carbon and has a pore size from about 0.4 nm to about 2.0 nm and a total surface area from about 100 m2/g to about 1500 m2/g.SELECTED DRAWING: None
claims:
【請求項1】
芳香剤と顆粒状悪臭吸着剤とを含む、悪臭制御用の動物用トイレ砂組成物であって、前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、約０．０５重量％～約５．０重量％の量で存在し、かつ約０．４ｎｍ～約２．０ｎｍの孔径及び約１００ｍ ２／ｇ～約１５００ｍ ２／ｇの総表面積を有し、前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、悪臭を実質的に吸着し、前記芳香剤を実質的に放出する、動物用トイレ砂組成物。
【請求項2】
前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、モレキュラーシーブ顆粒及び活性炭顆粒からなる群から選択される、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項3】
前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、約－８～約６０のメッシュサイズを有する、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項4】
前記芳香剤が、約０．０５重量％～約０．４重量％の量で存在する、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項5】
前記芳香剤がカプセル化されていない、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項6】
吸収性基材を更に含む、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項7】
前記吸収性基材が、吸収性コアと前記吸収性コアを取り囲む別個の層とを含む吸収性顆粒を含む、請求項６に記載の組成物。
【請求項8】
前記吸収性基材が粘土を含む、請求項６に記載の組成物。
【請求項9】
前記吸収性基材が、膨潤粘土でコーティングされた非膨潤粘土コアを含む、請求項６に記載の組成物。
【請求項10】
前記吸収性基材が、膨潤粘土でコーティングされた膨張パーライトコアを含む、請求項６に記載の組成物。
【請求項11】
前記膨潤粘土がナトリウムベントナイトである、請求項９又は１０に記載の組成物。
【請求項12】
前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、前記芳香剤よりも悪臭に対してより高い親和性を有する、請求項１に記載の組成物。
【請求項13】
前記顆粒状悪臭吸着剤が、前記悪臭の少なくとも２５％を吸着する
assignee: ソシエテ·デ·プロデュイ·ネスレ·エス·アー

title: Aerated confectionary composition
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: proposed aerated confectionary composition is represented by a chocolate composition or a chocolate composite product composition and contains a lipid component in amount of 0.5–10.0 wt.% in terms of the composition. Lipidic component is neither cacao butter, cacao butter substitute, cacao butter substitute or cacao butter equivalent. Lipidic component is vegetable oil which is a fluid medium under ambient conditions. Composition does not include any ingredient produced of a dairy product; the composition has a degree of aeration equal to 5.0%–30.0%. Wherein the chocolate composition means chocolate, a composite product and other related materials that contain cocoa butter, cocoa butter equivalents, cocoa butter substitutes and/or cocoa butter substitutes, and the chocolate composite product composition means chocolate-like analogues, characterized by the presence of cocoa cake.EFFECT: invention is aimed at improving the stability of the matrix of aerated bubbles in a solid product and/or simplifying the extraction procedure from the mould and/or packaging, which also simplifies the manufacture of the product and/or provides more desirable and/or stable organoleptic properties in the final confectionary product.13 cl, 5 ex
claims:
1. Кондитерская аэрированная композиция, которая представляет собой шоколадную композицию или композицию шоколадного составного продукта и содержит липидный компонент в количестве от 0,5 мас.% до 10,0 мас.% в расчёте на композицию, причём липидный компонент не является маслом какао, заменителем масла какао, заместителем масла какао или эквивалентом масла какао, и при этом липидный компонент представляет собой растительное масло, которое представляет собой текучую среду в условиях окружающей среды,
причём композиция не включает никакого ингредиента, полученного из молочного продукта, и при этом композиция имеет степень аэрации от 5,0% до 30,0%,
при этом шоколадная композиция означает шоколад, составной продукт и другие связанные материалы, которые содержат масло какао, эквиваленты масла какао, заменители масла какао и/или заместители масла какао, а композиция шоколадного составного продукта означает шоколадоподобные аналоги, характеризующиеся наличием какао-жмыха.
2. Композиция по п. 1, в которой липидный компонент выбирают из группы, состоящей из подсолнечного масла, рапсового масла, оливкового масла, соевого масла, льняного масла, сафлорового масла, кукурузного масла, хлопкового масла, масла виноградных косточек, ореховых масел, например масла лесного ореха, масла грецкого ореха, конопляного масла, масла из рисовых отрубей, кунжутного масла, арахисового масла, пальмоядрового масла и масел из проросших семян масличных культур, например подсолнечного масла с высоким содержанием олеиновой кислоты 25, рапсового масла с высоким содержанием олеиновой кислоты, пальмового масла с высоким содержанием олеиновой кислоты, соевого масла с высоким содержанием олеиновой кислоты и подсолнечного масла с высоким содержанием стеариновой кислоты, или их комбинаций.
3. Композиция по п. 1 или 2, имеющая степень аэрации от 7,5% до 27,5% или от 10,0% до 25,0%.
4. Композиция по любому из пп. 1–3, содержащая от 1,0 мас.% до 7,5 мас.% липидного компонента.
5. Композиция по любому из пп. 1–4,

title: Method for reducing emissions from manure
abstract: The present invention relates to a method for reducing emissions from manure and improving plant growth, the method comprising adding 0.17 - 0.35 g of calcium cyanamide (CaCN2) per 1 kg manure and adding 1.7 - 3.5 g of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) per 1 kg manure. Furthermore, the invention relates to a manure additive for reducing emissions from manure and improving plant growth comprising H2O2 and biochar. Furthermore, the invention relates to an organic fertilizer comprising manure and the manure additive.
claims:
Claims
1. Method for reducing emissions from manure and improving plant growth, the method comprising adding 0.17 - 0.35 g of calcium cyanamide (CaCN?) per 1 kg manure and adding 1.7 - 3.5 g of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) per 1 kg manure.
2. Method according to any of the preceding claims, the method comprising adding 1.7 - 2.8 g of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) per 1 kg manure.
3. Method according to any of the preceding claims, wherein calcium cyanamide
(CaCIS ) is added in an amount of 0.17 - 0.30 g per 1 kg of manure.
4. Method according to any of the preceding claims, wherein 10 - 60 g of biochar is added per 1 kg manure to manure, preferably 20 - 50 g of biochar per 1 kg manure is added to the manure.
5. Method according to any of the preceding claims, wherein the manure is stored with calcium cyanamide (CaCIS ) and hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) and optionally biochar, or the manure with the calcium cyanamide (CaCIS ) and hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) and optionally biochar is distributed onto fields, preferably by spray irrigation, surface spreading, injection, or broadcasting.
6. Method according to any of the preceding claims, wherein the calcium cyanamide (CaCIS ) and hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) are added to the manure first and mixed thoroughly, and the biochar is added su

title: Beverage preparation machine and method for preparing a beverage product using such a beverage preparation machine
abstract:
The present invention is directed to a beverage preparation machine comprising:
    • a chamber for receiving a capsule carrying a beverage component,
    • a beverage preparation device having:
      • a delivery device for delivering a fluid to the chamber,
      • a first and a second injection element selectively fluidly connectable to the delivery device for injecting a fluid into the chamber,
      • a discharge device having a discharge element for discharging the delivered fluid out of the chamber,
The first injection element protrudes farther into the chamber than the second injection element. The first injection element protrudes farther into the chamber than the discharge element. A region at which the second injection element protrudes into the chamber is located higher than a region at which the discharge element protrudes into the chamber.
claims:
1. Beverage preparation machine comprising: a chamber for receiving a capsule carrying a beverage component, a beverage preparation device having: a delivery device for delivering a fluid to the chamber, a first injection element and a second injection element, the first and second injection elements being selectively fluidly connectable to the delivery device for injecting a fluid into the chamber, respectively, a discharge device having a discharge element for discharging the delivered fluid out of the chamber, the first injection element protrudes farther into the chamber than the second injection element and the first injection element protrudes farther into the chamber than the discharge element, and a region at which the second injection element protrudes into the chamber is located higher than a region at which the discharge element protrudes into the chamber.
2. Beverage preparation machine according to claim 1, wherein the second injection element comprises an outlet opening which is directed towards the discharge element.
3. Beverage preparation machine according to claim 1, wherein a region at which the first injection element protrudes into the chamber is located higher than the region at which the discharge element protrudes into the chamber.
4. Beverage preparation machine according to claim 1, wherein the second injection element protrude(s) into

title: Coffee beans roasting system
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: group of inventions relates to coffee industry. Described is system (100) for roasting coffee beans, comprising the following components: roasting device (1), wherein said device generates smoke, and smoke treatment unit (2) configured to collect and treat smoke generated by the roasting device, wherein the roasting device comprises a smoke discharge channel (11), and the smoke treatment unit comprises the following components: smoke inlet channel (21) configured to collect smoke, smoke filtration sub-unit (22), smoke feed actuator (23), configured to circulate smoke through the smoke treatment unit from the smoke collection device into the treatment unit outlet channel (25) smoke, wherein the system comprises an air supply device (24) configured to mix the smoke generated by roasting device (1) with the ambient air to control the smoke temperature inside the smoke filtration sub-unit (22), wherein said air supply device (24) is located upstream of the smoke filtration subunit (22) and said air supply device (24) comprises the following components: first wall (241) passing between the smoke outlet channel (11) of the roasting device and the smoke inlet channel (21) of the smoke treatment unit, and at least one through hole (240) in the said wall. Invention also discloses the design of the smoke treatment unit (2), which is part of the system, and a method of roasting coffee beans using said system.EFFECT: group of inventions provides the possibility of controlling the temperature of smoke emitted by the frying machine, solving problems of protecting the filter from heated smoke, and providing not too high level of noise.15 cl, 12 dwg
claims:
1. Система (100) для обжаривания кофейных зерен, содержащая следующие компоненты:
- устройство для обжаривания (1), причем указанное устройство вырабатывает дым, и
- блок обработки дыма (2), выполненный с возможностью сбора и обработки дыма, образуемого устройством для обжаривания,
причем:
- устройство для обжаривания содержит канал выпуска дыма (11), и
- блок обработки дыма содержит следующие компоненты:
- канал впуска дыма (21), выполненный с возможностью сбора дыма,
- подблок фильтрации дыма (22),
- рабочий орган подачи дыма (23), выполненный с возможностью циркуляции дыма через блок обработки дыма из устройства для сбора дыма в канал выпуска (25) блока обработки дыма,
причем система содержит устройство подачи воздуха (24), выполненное с возможностью смешивания дыма, образуемого устройством для обжаривания (1), с окружающим воздухом для регулирования температуры дыма внутри подблока фильтрации дыма (22), при этом
указанное устройство подачи воздуха (24) расположено выше по потоку от подблока фильтрации дыма (22) и
указанное устройство подачи воздуха (24) содержит следующие компоненты:
- первую стенку (241), проходящую между каналом выпуска дыма (11) устройства для обжаривания и каналом впуска дыма (21) блока обработки дыма, и
- по меньшей мере одно сквозное отверстие (240) в указанной стенке.
2. Система по п. 1, в которой подблок фильтрации дыма (22) содержит по меньшей мере активный угольный фильтр (221).
3. Система по предшествующему пункту, в которой подблок фильтрации дыма (22) содержит по меньшей мере один дополнительный фильтр (222, 223), причем указанный дополнительный фильтр работает без нагревания.
4. Система по предшествующему пункту, в которой подблок фильтрации дыма (22) содержит последовательно: HEPA-фильтр (222), электростатический осадитель (223) и активный угольный фильтр (221).
5. Система по любому из предшествующих пунктов, в которой устройство подачи воздуха (24) расположено и выполнено с возможностью введения воздуха и дыма в одну и ту же точк

title: Method for determining the distinctive nutritional requirements of a patient
abstract: The present invention relates to a method for determining the distinctive nutritional requirements of a patient with specific nutritional needs and providing a composition meeting the distinctive nutritional requirements of said patient.
claims:
﻿ 30 Claims
1. An in vitro method for determining the distinctive disease related nutritional requirements of a subject suffering from a disease characterized by distinctive nutritional requirements in the diseased subject over a healthy subject comprising the steps: a. Determining in a sample of the subject suffering from the disease a profile of statuses of direct and indirect markers indicating the nutritional profile of said subject, wherein direct markers indicate the amount of a macronutrient or micronutrient, and indirect markers are derived from direct markers, wherein the status of the direct marker is measured by quantifying the direct marker and the status of the indirect marker is measured by quantifying a further marker or markers indicating the status of the direct marker, and wherein the direct and indirect markers comprise threonine, a metabolite of threonine, an essential amino acid other than threonine, and a metabolite of the essential amino acid other than threonine, b. Determining in a sample of the healthy subject a profile of the statuses of the same markers determined in step a, c. Comparing the profiles determined in step a. and b., and thereby determining the distinctive nutritional requirements for nutrients in a patient suffering from the disease, wherein the nutrients are macronutrients and micronutrients, and wherein the disease is inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the macronutrients are selected from the group consisting of proteins, amino acids, fats, and carbohydrates, or wherein the micronutrients are selected from the group of vitamins and elements.
3. The method

title: Methods of making frozen confectionary products and re-using components utilized therein
abstract: A method of dispensing a frozen confectionary product from a dispensing machine. The method can include loading one or more tubes comprising a frozen confectionary or a component of a frozen confectionary from a storage tray onto a serving station located in the dispensing machine; positioning the container in the serving station under the one or more tubes; dispensing the frozen confectionary or component of the frozen confectionary into the container; optionally placing a spoon into the container; and conveying the frozen confectionary product to an outlet located on the dispensing machine. A method of supplying a dispensing machine with frozen confectionaries and/or components of frozen confectionaries is also provided.
claims:
1. A method of dispensing a frozen confectionary product from a dispensing machine, the method comprising:
loading one or more first tubes comprising a composition that is a frozen confectionary from a first storage tray onto a serving station of the dispensing machine, wherein the first storage tray is located in a first storage area of the dispensing machine, and wherein the one or more first tubes are reusable;
positioning a container in a first position in the serving station under the one or more first tubes;
dispensing at least a portion of the frozen confectionary into the container; and
conveying the container comprising the frozen confectionary to an outlet located on the dispensing machine;
the method further comprising:
receiving the first storage tray from a location remote from the dispensing machine;
placing the first storage tray directly into the first storage area;
detecting when contents of one of the one or more first tubes is below a pre-determined threshold; and
moving the one of the one or more first tubes having contents below the pre-determined threshold into an empty tube position in the dispensing machine.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the dispensing of at least a portion of the frozen confectionary into the container comprises:

title: Grinding and extraction apparatus for coffee beans
abstract: The invention relates to a grinding and extraction apparatus for roasted coffee beans comprising a grinding device (60) and an associated extraction device (70); the grinding device (60) comprising one or more housings for receiving one or more beans containers (10, 20) with roasted coffee beans of the same or different types; the grinding device (60) comprising a reader (62) to obtain the information of the product parameters of the roasted coffee beans of the one or more beans containers (10, 20); the grinding device (60) further comprising a control unit configured to adapt the grinding size and the quantity of roasted coffee beans for obtaining a certain coffee blend from each beans container to be grinded according to these product parameters and/or according to a recipes database (64) comprising the beverage information associated to the beverage to be prepared; the grinding device (60) further comprising an encoder (62) to encode the beverage information on programmable identification means (65) on a product holder (61) in the grinding device (60), to where the grinded coffee is sent; the extraction device (70) being configured for receiving the product holder (61) and comprising reading means (72) to identify the beverage information in the said product holder identification means (65), the extraction device (70) further comprising a control unit to extract the beverage according to the beverage information retrieved and/or from the beverage information retrieved from a beverage database in this control unit. Moreover, the invention relates to a method for grinding roasted coffee beans and preparing a beverage from them using a grinding and extraction apparatus as the one described, and also refers to the use of a grinding and extraction apparatus as the one described for delivering a certain beverage from roasted coffee beans.
claims:
1. A grinding and extraction system for roasted coffee beans comprising a grinding device and an associated extraction device;
the grinding device comprising:
one or more housings configured to receive one or more beans containers with roasted coffee beans of the same or different types,
a first reader configured to obtain product parameters of the roasted coffee beans from the one or more beans containers,
a control unit configured to adapt the grinding size and the quantity of roasted coffee beans to obtain a quantity of roasted coffee beans from the one or more beans containers and to cause the grinding device to grind the roasted coffee beans according to these product parameters and/or according to a recipes database comprising the beverage information associated to the beverage to be prepared, and
an encoder configured to encode the product parameters on a programmable identification member on a product holder in the grinding device to which the grinded coffee is dispensed; and
the extraction device being configured to receive the product holder, the extraction device comprising:
a second reader to identify the product parameters in the programmable identification member, and
a control unit configured to cause the extraction device to extract the beverage according to the product parameters retrieved from the product holder and/or beverage information retrieved from a beverage database in this control unit.

title: A nutritional composition comprising metabolites of HMOs to improve the gastrointestinal barrier
abstract: The present invention relates to nutritional compositions comprising metabolites of HMOs to improve the gastrointestinal barrier. In particular, the invention relates to nutritional compositions comprising metabolites of HMOs for infants with impaired microbiota since their microbiota may not be able to metabolize HMOs.
claims:
1. A method of improving the gastrointestinal barrier in an infant (child under the age of 12 months) or a young child (between 1 year and 3 years) or a child (aged from more than 3 years to less than 8 years);
5 the method comprising administering to the infant or young child a nutritional composition comprising metabolites of HMOs; or
the method comprising administering to the child a nutritional composition in the form of a growing-up milk comprising metabolites of HMOs;
wherein the metabolites of HMOs are obtained by fermenting a composition
10 comprising one or more HMOs selected from the group consisting of 2'FL, DiFL, 3'SL, 6'SL, LNT and LNnT in a composition comprising a baby microbiota, wherein metabolites of HMOs are obtained from 0.004-5 g/L of HMOs.
2. Use of a nutritional composition comprising metabolites of HMOs in the
15 manufacture of a medicament for improving the gastrointestinal barrier in an infant (child under the age of 12 months) or a young child (between 1 year and 3 years) or a child (aged from more than 3 years to less than 8 years);
wherein the nutritional composition to be administered to the child is in the form of a growing-up milk;

title: Composition of chocolate product containing mixture of grains and beans (variations), method for obtaining chocolate product composition, mixture of grains and beans, and method for obtaining it
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: composition of the chocolate product contains a mixture of grains and legumes in an amount ranging from 1.0% to 50.0% by weight of the chocolate product. The grains contain more than 20.0% by mass of soluble dry matter based on the total dry matter in the grains, and the legumes contain more than 50% by mass of soluble dry matter based on the total dry matter in the legumes. Moreover, the D90 particle size of both grains and legumes is less than 250 micrometres. A method for obtaining a chocolate product composition, a vegan chocolate product composition obtained by this method, a mixture of grains and legumes for use in a chocolate product composition, and a method for obtaining said mixture of grains and legumes are also proposed.EFFECT: obtaining a chocolate composition with a reduced milk content, which retains its natural nutritional properties and does not produce graininess without losing any nutrients, in particular dietary fibre; this provides a concise composition using only natural ingredients.25 cl, 13 ex
claims:
1. Композиция шоколадного продукта, содержащая композицию, содержащую от 1,0 мас.% до 50,0 мас.% смеси зерновых и бобовых в расчёте на массу шоколадного продукта, причём упомянутые зерновые содержат более 20,0 мас.% растворимого сухого вещества в расчёте на общую массу сухого вещества в зерновых, а бобовые содержат более 50 мас.% растворимого сухого вещества в расчёте на общую массу сухого вещества в бобовых, причём размер частиц D90 как зерновых, так и бобовых составляет менее 250 мкм.
2. Композиция шоколадного продукта по п. 1, в которой упомянутые зерновые и бобовые присутствуют в количествах от 15,0 до 50,0 мас.% зерновых и от 50,0 до 85,0 мас.% бобовых в расчёте на смесь зерновых и бобовых.
3. Композиция шоколадного продукта по пп. 1, 2, которая содержит по меньшей мере 2,0 мас.% зерновых и по меньшей мере 4,0 мас.% бобовых.
4. Композиция шоколадного продукта по пп. 1-3, в которой упомянутые зерновые и бобовые присутствуют в количествах от 15 до 35 мас.% зерновых и от 65 до 85 мас.% бобовых в расчёте на смесь зерновых и бобовых.
5. Композиция шоколадного продукта по пп. 1-4, в которой зерновые представляют собой овес или киноа.
6. Композиция шоколадного продукта по пп. 1-5, в которой бобовые представляют собой нут или чечевицу.
7. Композиция шоколадного продукта по пп. 1-6, содержащая от 5,0 мас.% до 30,0 мас.% смеси зерновых и бобовых, причём зерновые и бобовые присутствуют в количествах от 20 до 35 мас.% зерновых и от 65 до 80 мас.% бобовых в расчёте на смесь зерновых и бобовых.
8. Композиция шоколадного продукта по пп. 1-7, дополнительно включающая семена масличных культур, предпочтительно подсолнечника.
9. Композиция шоколадного продукта по пп. 1-8, в которой размер частиц D90 как зерновых, так и бобовых составляет менее 200 мкм, предпочтительно менее 175 мкм.
10. Композиция шоколадного продукта по пп. 1-9, в которой зерновые содержат от 40 мас.% до 95 мас.% растворимого сухого вещества в расчёте на общую массу сухого вещества в зерновых, предпочтительно от

title: Compositions and methods using a combination of oleuropein and taurine
abstract: Composition comprising a combination of oleuropein or metabolite thereof and taurine or functional derivative thereof are provided. The composition may be an oral nutritional composition, for example a nutritional supplement, an oral nutritional supplement, a food product, a food for special medical purpose (FSMP). The composition can be administered to an individual in need thereof for improving a physiological state linked to metabolic fatigue in one or more cells, (ii) increasing mitochondrial energy and mitochondrial calcium uptake in one or more cells, and (iii) increasing antioxidant capacity, reducing oxidative stress and/or enhancing mitochondrial function, (iv) treating or preventing a calcium deficiency / depletion disorder in an individual. Additionally or alternatively, the method can treat or prevent a mitochondria-related disease or a condition associated with altered mitochondrial function in an individual in need thereof or at risk thereof.
claims:
1. A composition comprising a combination of oleuropein and/or a metabolite thereof and taurine and/or a functional derivative, in a therapeutically effective amount for use in (i) improving a physiological state linked to metabolic fatigue in one or more cells, (ii) increasing mitochondrial energy and mitochondrial calcium uptake in one or more cells, and (iii) increasing antioxidant capacity, reducing oxidative stress and/or enhancing mitochondrial function, (iv) treating or preventing a calcium deficiency / depletion disorder in an individual.
2. The composition for use according to Claim 1, wherein at least a portion of the one or more cells are part of at least one body part selected from the group consisting of a liver, a kidney, a brain, and a skeletal muscle.
3. The composition for use according to Claim 1 or 2, wherein the physiological state linked to metabolic fatigue comprises muscle fatigue or weakness, lack of energy, physical energy, lack of vitality or weakness.
4. The composition for use according to any of Claims 1 to 3, for preventing or treating muscle fatigue from exercise.
5. The composition for use according to any of Claim 1 to 4, wherein the effective amount of a combination of oleuropein and/or a metabolite thereof and taurine and/or a functional derivative is orally administered daily for at least one week.
6. The composition for use accor

title: Mixture of hmos and bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism
abstract: The present invention relates to a composition comprising a        Bifidobacterium longumtransitional microorganism and a mixture of human milk oligosaccharides (HMOs) consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2’-FL), difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), and 3'-sialyllactose (3SL), and 3-fucosyllactose (3-FL) and/or lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT). The invention also relates to the use of the composition for preventing, reducing the risk of and/or treating an infection in a subject. The invention also provides the composition for use in promoting a long-term immune benefit in a subject, preventing and/or reducing the risk of allergen sensitisation, preventing and/or reducing the risk of developing a respiratory condition in a subject, and/or preventing and/or reducing the risk of developing asthma in a subject.
claims:
1.
一種組成物，其包含長雙歧桿菌(
Bifidobacterium longum)過渡微生物及HMO混合物，該HMO混合物由下列所組成：2'-岩藻糖基乳糖(2'-FL)、二岩藻糖基乳糖(DFL)、乳糖-N-四糖(LNT)、6'-唾液酸基乳糖(6SL)及3'-唾液酸基乳糖(3SL)，及可選地3-岩藻糖基乳糖(3-FL)及/或乳糖-N-新四糖(LNnT)。
2.
如請求項1之組成物，其中該長雙歧桿菌過渡微生物： (i)   能夠代謝該（等）HMO； (ii)  優先利用3-FL而非2'-FL； (iii) 能夠代謝選自表1至表3中任一者中所述之群組的聚醣受質；及/或 (iv) 編碼選自表1中所述之群組的一或多種CAZyme，較佳地其中該長雙歧桿菌過渡微生物進一步編碼選自表2及表3之一或多種CAZyme。
3.
如請求項1或請求項2之組成物，其中該長雙歧桿菌過渡微生物與選自由下列所組成之群組中之至少一種長雙歧桿菌菌株具有至少98%之平均核苷酸同一性(Average Nucleotide Identity, ANI)：CNCM I-5683、CNCM I-5684、CNCM I-5685、CNCM I-5686、CNCM I-5687、CMCC-P0001 (ATCC BAA-2753)及其任何組合。
4.
如前述請求項中任一項之組成物，其中該組成物進一步包含長雙歧桿菌嬰兒亞種(
Bifidobacterium longumsubsp.
infantis)及/或乳雙歧桿菌(
Bifidobacterium lactis)。
5.
如請求項4之組成物，其中： (i)   該長雙歧桿菌嬰兒亞種係長雙歧桿菌嬰兒亞種LMG 11588，或與長雙歧桿菌嬰兒亞種LMG 11588具有至少99.9%之平均核苷酸同一性(ANI)；及 (ii)  該乳雙歧桿菌係乳雙歧桿菌CNCM 1-3446，或與乳雙歧桿菌CNCM 1-3446具有至少99.9% ANI之平均核苷酸同一性(ANI)。
6.
如前述請求項中任一項之組成物，其中該HMO混合物由2’-FL、DFL、LNT、6SL及3SL所組成。
7.
如請求項1至5中任一項之組成物，其中該HMO混合物由2’-FL、DFL、LNT、6SL、3SL及3-FL所組成。
8.

title: Use of urolithin in the remission phase of a preceding cancer therapy
abstract: The current invention is directed to the therapeutic use of a composition comprising a therapeutically effective amount of a Urolithin or a precursor thereof, preferably suitable for use in reducing the risk of the recurrence of cancer or tumor formation in a patient in need thereof in the remission phase of a preceding cancer therapy in said patient. The invention is furthermore related to a corresponding composition, its method of preparation and a method of reducing the reducing the risk of the recurrence of cancer or tumor formation in a patient in need thereof in the remission phase after a preceding cancer therapy in said patient, wherein the method comprises the following steps: a) Providing a composition comprising a therapeutically effective amount of a Urolithin or a precursor thereof, the composition preferably being a composition as defined herein above; b) Administering the composition comprising the therapeutically effective amount of a Urolithin or a precursor thereof to the patient in need thereof, wherein the patient is in the remission phase after a preceding cancer therapy; and c) Optionally monitoring the patient regularly on the potential recurrence of the cancer treated in the preceding cancer therapy, preferably by using cancer specific biomarkers, preferably concurrent to administering the composition according to step b), preferably in predefined intervals.
claims:
1. A method for use in reducing the risk of the recurrence of cancer or tumor formation in a patient in need thereof in the remission phase of a preceding cancer therapy in said patient comprising administering a composition comprising a therapeutically effective amount of a Urolithin or a precursor thereof to a patient in need of same.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the patient is a human or non-human mammal.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the patient is an immune-compromised patient.
4. The method according to claim 1, wherein the Urolithin or a precursor thereof is selected from the group consisting of a urolithin, ellagic acid, and an ellagitannin, more preferably is selected from Urolithin A, Urolithin B, Urolithin C or Urolithin D, and a combination thereof.
5. The method according to claim 1, wherein the urolithin is urolithin A, or a combination of Urolithin A with at least one of Urolithin B, Urolithin C or Urolithin D.
6. The method according to claim 1, wherein the urolithin is urolithin A.
7. The method according to claim 1, wherein the urolithin is administered in an amount of about 500 to 2000 mg/day.
8. The method according to claim 1, wherein the administration of the composition comprising a Urolithin starts at day

title: method
abstract: A method for determining a mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of a dog, the method including a) providing a DNA methylation profile from a sample obtained from the dog; and b) determining a mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan for the dog using the DNA methylation profile. The DNA methylation profile contains at least one methylation site as listed in Table 3.
claims:
1. A method for determining a mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of a dog; said method comprising: a) providing a DNA methylation profile from a sample obtained from the dog; and b) determining a mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan for the dog using the DNA methylation profile; wherein the DNA methylation profile comprises at least one methylation site as listed in Table 3.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the determining the mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan for the dog further comprises combining the DNA methylation profile with one or more of the chronological age, breed and/or sex of the dog.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein a lifestyle regime, dietary regime or therapeutic intervention is selected based on a determination that the dog has an increased mortality risk and/or reduced probability of a healthy lifespan compared to its chronological age.
4. The method according to claim 3, wherein the lifestyle regime, dietary regime or therapeutic intervention is a dietary intervention.
5. The method according to claim 4, wherein the dietary intervention is a calorie-restricted diet, a senior diet or a low protein diet.
6. The method according to claim 1, wherein the sample is a blood sample.
7. The method according to claim 1, wherein

title: Beverage pod system with pod recognition
abstract: The invention concerns an extraction device for extracting a beverage ingredient from a pod, said pod (3) comprising a code (34), said device comprising: —upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts (1, 2) relatively movable between an open position for inserting and removing the pod (3) and a closed position and a code reader (71), —a removable pod holder (6), —a top insertion section (4) for introducing the pod holder (6) in the device, —a pod holder stopper (42) to stop the pod holder (6) in an intermediate temporary position inside said path (41), and wherein, in the intermediate temporary position, the pod holder (6) is configured to hold the pod so that the code (34) arranged on the pod faces the code reader (71), and wherein the operation of reading the code by the code reader is triggered by the movement of the pod holder (6) when the pod holder reaches the intermediate temporary position during the introduction of the pod holder in the device.
claims:
1. An extraction device for extracting a beverage ingredient by supplying an extraction liquid into a pod,
said pod comprising:
a pod body, said pod body comprising:
a side wall and a bottom wall defining a chamber, said chamber extending axially between the bottom and a top opening, and
a top lid closing the top opening of the pod body,
a machine-readable code storing preparation information, said code being arranged on the pod, and
said device comprising upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts relatively movable, along a horizontal longitudinal axis between an open position for inserting and removing the pod and a closed position for forming an extraction chamber enclosing the pod during extraction,
said device comprising a code reader,
wherein the device comprises:
a removable pod holder, said holder comprising a pod receiving hole to receive and hold the pod,
a top insertion section configured for introducing the pod holder in the device, said top insertion section comprising a path for guiding the pod holder to an extraction area between the upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts, and
a pod holder stopper to stop the pod holder in an intermediate temporary position inside said path,
wherein, in the intermediate

title: Capsule for producing a beverage
abstract: The invention concerns a capsule for use in a beverage preparation machine, said capsule containing a soluble and/or extractable beverage ingredient, said capsule comprising:—a capsule body (2) defining a chamber (21),—a top membrane (3) closing the top opening, and adapted to be punctured for liquid injection into the capsule, and—a bottom membrane (4), provided inside the chamber (21) so as to delimit between the top membrane (3) and said bottom membrane an ingredient chamber, and—an opening device (5) provided inside the chamber and adapted to open the chamber by relative engagement of said opening device with the bottom membrane (4) under the effect of the liquid pressure increase in the ingredient chamber during injection of said liquid, wherein said opening device (5) is made of a biodegradable material, and said biodegradable material is a polymeric composition, said polymeric composition comprising:—at least one polymer selected from the group consisting of polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHA),—at least one or more nucleants,—at least one or more mineral fillers.
claims:
1. A capsule for use in a beverage preparation machine, said capsule containing a soluble and/or extractable beverage ingredient,
said capsule comprising:
a capsule body defining a chamber,
a top membrane closing the top opening, and adapted to be punctured for liquid injection into the capsule, and
a bottom membrane, provided inside the chamber so as to define between the top membrane and said bottom membrane an ingredient chamber, and
an opening device provided inside the chamber and adapted to open the chamber by relative engagement of said opening device with the bottom membrane under the effect of the liquid pressure increase in the ingredient chamber during injection of said liquid,
wherein said opening device is a moulded piece made of a biodegradable material, and said biodegradable material is a polymeric composition, said polymeric composition comprising:
at least one polymer selected from the group consisting of polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHA),
at least one or more nucleants, and
at least one or more mineral fillers.
2. A capsule according to claim 1, wherein the polymeric composition comprises at least one polyhydroxyalkanoate containing repeating units of formula (I):

title: Composition and method for treating muscle decline associated with renal disease or dysfunction
abstract: A composition comprises at least two ingredients selected from the group consisting of: Fish oil, L-arginine, Vitamin E, Vitamin C, Vitamin B3, Vitamin B5, Vitamin B6, Vitamin B1, Vitamin B2, Folic acid, Biotin, Vitamin B12, and is formulated for use in preventing and/or treating a disease or condition associated with muscle decline in a subject in need thereof. Preferably the subject in need is an individual at risk of or suffering from a renal failure, a renal dysfunction or/and a renal disease, such as chronic kidney disease, protein-energy wasting, end- stage renal disease, kidney failure due to hospitalization in the intensive care unit, acute kidney injury, and the muscle decline is selected from muscle wasting, muscle loss due to kidney failure or dysfunction, muscle decline related to chronic kidney disease, muscle loss due to hospitalization in the intensive care unit during kidney failure, metabolic acidosis during chronic kidney disease, protein-energy wasting or combinations thereof. The method can achieve at least one result that is preventing and/or treating a disease or condition associated with muscle decline in a subject at risk of or suffering from a renal failure, a renal dysfunction or/and a renal disease. The composition and the method may be used for improving the level of at least one amino acid.
claims:
1. A nutritional composition for use in preventing and/or treating a disease or condition associated with muscle decline in a subject in need thereof, comprising at least two ingredients selected from the group consisting of:
Fish oil,
L-arginine,
Vitamin E,
Vitamin C,
Vitamin B3,
Vitamin B5,
Vitamin B6,
Vitamin Bl,
Vitamin B2,
Folic acid,
Biotin,
Vitamin B12.
2. The nutritional composition as claimed in claim 1 wherein it comprises at least two ingredients selected from the group consisting of:
Fish oil in a daily amount ranging from about 100 to about 5000 mg per kg of weight of the subject,
L-arginine in a daily amount ranging from about 100 to about 50000 mg per kg of weight of the subject,
Vitamin E in a daily amount ranging from about 1 to about 80000 mg per kg of weight of the subject,
Vitamin C in a dail

title: method
abstract: The present invention provides a method for determining a mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of a dog; said method comprising a) providing a DNA methylation profile from a sample obtained from the dog; and b) determining a mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan for the dog using the DNA methylation profile; wherein the DNA methylation profile comprises at least one methylation site as listed in Table 3.
claims:
CLAIMS
1 . A method for determining a mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan of a dog, said method comprising: a) providing a DNA methylation profile from a sample obtained from the dog; and b) determining a mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan for the dog using the DNA methylation profile; wherein the DNA methylation profile comprises at least one methylation site as listed in Table 3.
2. A method for determining a biological age of a dog, said method comprising: a) providing a DNA methylation profile from a sample obtained from the dog; and b) determining a biological age for the dog using the DNA methylation profile, wherein the DNA methylation profile is linked to the mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan for the dog and wherein the DNA methylation profile comprises at least one methylation site as listed in Table 3.
3. A method for selecting a lifestyle regime, dietary regime or therapeutic intervention for a dog, the method comprising: a) providing a DNA methylation profile from a sample obtained from the dog; b) determining a mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan for the dog using the DNA methylation profile, wherein the DNA methylation profile comprises at least one methylation site as listed in Table 3; and c) selecting a suitable lifestyle regime, dietary regime or therapeutic intervention for the dog based on the mortality risk and/or probability of a healthy lifespan determined in step b).

title: Cooking auxiliary equipment
abstract: A cooking aid includes: a sheet made of a flexible heat resistant material; a composition layer disposed on at least one surface of the sheet; wherein the sheet is configured to be selectively placed in one of the following configurations: a loading configuration for receiving food to be placed in contact with the layer of composition; a cooking configuration for at least partially surrounding food in contact with the composition layer; the cooking aid also includes a heat resistant fixture that may be configured to hold the sheet in the cooking configuration.
claims:
1.一种烹饪辅助设备，包括：
由柔性耐热材料构成的片材；
设置在所述片材的至少一个面上的组合物层；
其特征在于，所述片材构造成被选择性地置于以下构型中的一种构型：
装料构型，用于接收待与所述组合物层接触放置的食物，和
烹饪构型，用于至少部分地包围与所述组合物层接触的食物；
所述烹饪辅助设备还包括耐热固定装置，所述耐热固定装置被构造成能够将所述片材保持在所述烹饪构型中。
2.根据权利要求1所述的烹饪辅助设备，其特征在于，所述耐热固定装置是独立的并且能够与所述片材分离。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的烹饪辅助设备，其特征在于，所述耐热固定装置包括套筒。
4.根据权利要求3所述的烹饪辅助设备，其特征在于，所述套筒由纸板构成。
5.根据权利要求3所述的烹饪辅助设备，其特征在于，所述套筒包括：
材料条带，其构造成能被折叠或围成环状，用于在所述烹饪构型中环绕所述片材和食物。
6.根据权利要求5所述的烹饪辅助设备，其特征在于，所述材料条带包括凸部和凹部，所述凸部和凹部构造成彼此接合以将所述材料条带保持呈折叠的或环状的布置结构。
7.根据权利要求6所述的烹饪辅助设备，其特征在于，所述凸部包括突片。
8.根据权利要求6或7所述的烹饪辅助设备，其特征在于，所述材料条带包括贯穿该材料条带的厚度的多个开口，所述多个开口之一形成为用于接纳所述凸部的所述凹部。
9.根据权利要求8所述的烹饪辅助设备，其特征在于，所述多个开口的表面积超过所述材料条带的总表面积的20％、30％、40％或50％。

title: Method of roasting coffee beans
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: inventions group relates to coffee industry. Disclosed is a method for roasting coffee beans in roasting system (10) comprising roasting device (1) and smoke purification unit (2) configured to treat smoke, wherein the smoke purification unit comprises electrostatic precipitator (222), which comprises at least one cell (222a, 222b), and wherein said cell comprises ionisation wires (2221), collecting electrodes (2222), repulsive electrodes (2223) and is provided with electric power for supplying high voltage to ionisation wires and at least part of electrodes, wherein during each roasting operation, the method comprises: monitoring the voltage V on the ionisation wires and/or on the electrodes during the roasting operation, if the monitored voltage becomes below a predetermined voltage threshold value V0 during a period Δt of roasting operation time and if said period Δt time exceeds preset threshold value Δt0 time, a cleaning warning signal is displayed. Also disclosed is a coffee bean roasting system and a machine-readable data medium having a computer program stored thereon and containing instructions for enabling said system to implement the described method.EFFECT: group of inventions enables to inform operator in advance on occurrence of failure and on need to clean or carry out maintenance of electrostatic precipitating filter and providing said information in an accurate manner.12 cl, 4 dwg
claims:
1. Способ обжаривания кофейных зерен в системе (10) обжаривания, содержащей:
- устройство (1) для обжаривания, и
- блок (2) очистки дыма, выполненный с возможностью обработки дыма, образуемого устройством для обжаривания, причем указанный блок очистки дыма содержит по меньшей мере электростатический осадитель (222),
при этом указанный электростатический осадитель содержит по меньшей мере одну ячейку (222a, 222b), и
при этом указанная ячейка содержит ионизационные провода (2221), собирающие электроды (2222) и отталкивающие электроды (2223), и
при этом указанная ячейка снабжается электроэнергией для подачи высокого напряжения на ионизационные провода и по меньшей мере часть электродов,
причем во время каждой операции обжаривания, выполняемой в устройстве для обжаривания, способ включает стадии, на которых:
- контролируют напряжение V на ионизационных проводах и/или на электродах на протяжении операции обжаривания,
- если контролируемое напряжение становится ниже заданного порогового значения V0 напряжения в течение периода Δt времени операции обжаривания и
- если указанный период Δt времени превышает заданное пороговое значение Δt0 времени, то отображается предупреждающий сигнал об очистке.
2. Способ по п. 1, в котором заданное пороговое значение V0 напряжения ниже 100 В.
3. Способ по п. 1 или 2, в котором продолжительность заданного порогового значения Δt0 времени зависит от степени обжарки, получаемой во время операции обжаривания, и/или типа зерен, обжариваемых во время операции обжаривания.
4. Способ по любому из предшествующих пунктов, в котором продолжительность заданного порогового значения Δt0 времени зависит от количества операций обжаривания, выполненных с момента последней операции очистки электростатического осадителя.
5. Способ по любому из предшествующих пунктов, в котором продолжительность заданного порогового значения Δt0 времени меняется в ходе операции обжаривания.
6. Способ по любому из предшествующих пунктов, в котором заданное пороговое значение Δ

title: Mixture of HMOs and bifidobacteria
abstract: The invention relates to a composition for infants or young children comprising at least one probiotic bacterial strain, said probiotic bacterial strain being bifidobacteria and a prebiotic 5 mixture of human milk oligosaccharides consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2FL), lactodifucotetraose/difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), 3'- sialyllactose (3SL) and optionally 3-fucosyllactose (3FL) that can be useful for (i) preventing and/or treating bacterial infections; (ii) modulating the microbiota; and/or iii) preventing and/or treating allergy in an infant or a young child. 10 20 25 21 08 37 31 J ul 2 02 5 A B S T R A C T T h e i n v e n t i o n r e l a t e s t o a c o m p o s i t i o n f o r i n f a n t s o r y o u n g c h i l d r e n c o m p r i s i n g a t l e a s t o n e 2 0 2 5 2 1 0 8 3 7 3 1 J u l 2 0 2 5 p r o b i o t i c b a c t e r i a l s t r a i n , s a i d p r o b i o t i c b a c t e r i a l s t r a i n b e i n g b i f i d o b a c t e r i a a n d a p r e b i o t i c 5 m i x t u r e o f h u m a n m i l k o l i g o s a c c h a r i d e s c o n s i s t i n g o f 2 ' - f u c o s y l l a c t o s e ( 2 F L ) , l a c t o d i f u c o t e t r a o s e / d i f u c o s y l l a c t o s e ( D F L ) , l a c t o - N - t e t r a o s e ( L N T ) , 6 ' - s i a l y l l a c t o s e ( 6 S L ) , 3 ' - s i a l y l l a c t o s e ( 3 S L ) a n d o p t i o n a l l y 3 - f u c o s y l l a c t o s e ( 3 F L ) t h a t c a n b e u s e f u l f o r ( i ) p r e v e n t i n g a n d / o r t r e a t i n g b a c t e r i a l i n f e c t i o n s ; ( i i ) m o d u l a t i n g t h e m i c r o b i o t a ; a n d / o r i i i ) p r e v e n t i n g a n d / o r t r e a t i n g a l l e r g y i n a n i n f a n t o r a y o u n g c h i l d . 1 0
claims:

A composition for infants or young children comprising at least one probiotic bacterial strain, said probiotic bacterial strain being bifidobacteria, and a prebiotic oligosaccharides mixture consisting of 2'-fucosy I lactose (2FL), lactodifucotetraose/difucosyllactose (DFL), 5 lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), and 3'-sialyllactose (3SL) and optionally 3-fucosyllactose (3FL); wherein the bifidobacteria comprises Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis or combination of Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis and Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis., wherein at least one of the bifidobacteria is Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis LMG 11588 10 or a strain having an Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI) of at least 99.9% with this strain.

title: Bioconversion of oleuropein
abstract: To provide a composition for the treatment and prevention of a condition selected from the group consisting of (i) loss of bone or cartilage metabolism balance, (ii) loss of bone or cartilage health, (iii) loss of mobility, (iv) synovitis, and (v) combinations thereof.SOLUTION: A composition comprises oleuropein and at least one probiotic or enzyme, wherein the at least one probiotic or enzyme has β-glycosidase activity, esterase activity, or both β-glycosidase activity and esterase activity.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 2

title: Oral dosage form with a gastro resistant capsule shell
abstract: The present invention relates to a gastro resistant capsule comprising one or more proteases. wherein the capsule shell comprises a water-soluble film forming polymer and a water-soluble enteric polymer. The present invention also relates to methods of manufacturing the gastro resistant capsules and uses thereof.
claims:
1. A gastro resistant capsule comprising one or more proteases, wherein the capsule shell comprises: (i) hydroxypropyl methylcellulose (HPMC), in an amount of from about 65 wt % to about 97 wt %; and (ii) pectin, in an amount of from about 3 wt % to about 30 wt %.
2. The gastro resistant capsule according to claim 1, wherein the pectin has: (i) a degree of esterification of from about 15% to about 40%; (ii) a degree of amidation of from about 0% to about 25%; and/or (iii) a molecular weight of from about 20 kDa to about 1000 kDa, from about 40 kDa to about 400 kDa, or from about 50 kDa to about 200 kDa.
3. The gastro resistant capsule according to claim 1, wherein the one or more proteases are selected from the group consisting of: bromelain, trypsin, papain, pancreatin, chymotrypsin, serratiopeptidase, ficain, nattokinase, and any combination thereof.
4. The gastro resistant capsule according to claim 1, wherein the gastro resistant capsule comprises the one or more proteases in a total amount of: from about 50 mg to about 1000 mg.
5. The gastro resistant capsule according to claim 1, wherein the gastro resistant capsule comprises one or more flavonoid.
6. The gastro resistant capsule according to claim 1, wherein the gastro resistant capsule comprises one or more fl

title: Controlled heat-induced protein aggregation for mouthfeel improvement of low fat dairy creams
abstract: The present invention relates to a low fat dairy cream product, wherein said product is an emulsion having (a) between 1 to 5 wt%, preferably 2 to 4 wt% dairy protein; (b) between 5 to 20 wt%, preferably 10 to 18 wt% fat; (c) between 0.002 to 0.3 wt% mineral salts, for example between 0.03 to 0.3 wt% sodium chloride and/or between 0.002 to 0.02 wt% calcium chloride; (d) optionally between 0.1 to 3 wt%food additive, preferably hydrocolloid, and (e) between 70 to 90 wt% water; wherein said dairy protein is contributed by (i) skimmed milk powder or milk protein concentrate or micellar casein;
claims:
1. A low fat dairy cream product, wherein said product is an emulsion having (a) between 1 to 5 wt%, preferably 2 to 4 wt% dairy protein; (b) between 5 to 20 wt%, preferably 10 to 18 wt% fat; (c) between 0.002 to 0.3 wt% mineral salts, for example between 0.03 to 0.3 wt% sodium chloride and/or between 0.002 to 0.02 wt% calcium chloride; (d) optionally between 0.1 to 3 wt% food additive, preferably hydrocolloid, and (e) between 70 to 90 wt% water; wherein said dairy protein is contributed by (i) skimmed milk powder or milk protein concentrate or micellar casein; and (ii) whey protein isolate.
2. The product according to claim 1, wherein skimmed milk powder or milk protein concentrate or micellar casein contributes between 50 to 90 wt% of the dairy protein in the emulsion, preferably 60 to 80%, and wherein whey protein isolate contributes between 10 to 50 wt% of the dairy protein in the emulsion, preferably 20 to 40%.
3. The product according to any one of claims 1 and 2, wherein the emulsion has a ratio of micellar casein to whey protein between 20:80 to 80:20, preferably about 60:40.
4. The product according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the skimmed milk powder is low or medium heat skimmed milk powder, preferably low heat skimmed milk powder.
5. The product according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein

title: Handling of beverage
abstract: A system (10,20) for processing and handling a liquid food substance, comprises: a processing device (20) that has a processing cavity (21) in which the liquid food substance is processed (21), the processing cavity (21) having an opening (22) that is configured so that the liquid food substance is removable from the processing cavity (21) via the opening (22); and a handling arrangement (10) that is configured to handle the liquid food substance when the liquid food substance is collected in an external user-recipient, such as a cup or a mug, after its processing in the processing cavity (21). The handling arrangement (10) is seizable by a human hand. The handling arrangement (10) is separate from the processing device (20) and from the external user-recipient and is freely movable relative thereto. When seized and operated by the human hand, the handling arrangement (10) is configured: to withdraw such liquid food substance upon processing from the processing cavity (21) and to deliver it into the external user-recipient; and/or to shape such processed liquid food substance upon collection in the external user-recipient.
