title: Drinkable infant compositions
abstract: A drinkable infant composition comprising two or more food allergens wherein one of said food allergens is milk protein.
claims:
1. A drinkable infant composition comprising two or more food allergens from different foods wherein one of said food allergens is milk protein, wherein the composition has undergone pasteurisation at a temperature between 61.9°C and 72°C for between 15 and 45 minutes.
2. The drinkable infant composition according to claim 1, wherein the composition is reconstituted with water prior to ingestion.
3. The drinkable infant composition according to claim 1 wherein the composition is in a ready to drink form.
4. The drinkable infant composition according to any one of the preceding claims wherein the food allergens are selected from the group consisting of: egg protein, wheat protein, soya protein, peanut protein, tree nut protein, fish protein, crustacean protein, shellfish protein, and sesame protein.
5. The drinkable infant composition according to claim 4 wherein the composition comprises three or more of said food allergens, or four or more of said food allergens, or five or more of said food allergens, or six or more of said food allergens, or seven or more of said food allergens, or eight or more of said food allergens, or nine or more of said food allergens or all of said food allergens.
6. The drinkable infant composition according to claim 4 or 5 wherein the composition comprises milk protein and egg protein.

title: Beverage mixing device, beverage preparation device and method for preparing a beverage product
claims:
1. Beverage mixing device comprising a mixing body defining a mixing chamber,
at least one or a plurality of fluid inlets for supplying a fluid into the mixing chamber,
a discharge opening to discharge a liquid from the mixing chamber,
a sealing element being moveably provided between a closed position for closing the discharge opening and an open position for releasing the discharge opening to allow the liquid in the mixing chamber be discharged via the discharge opening, and
an evacuation outlet for evacuating the mixing chamber by additional fluid introduced into the mixing chamber via the at least one or the plurality of fluid inlets when the discharge opening is closed by the sealing element.
2. Beverage mixing device according to claim 1, wherein, in the open position, the sealing element seals the evacuation outlet from the mixing chamber.
3. Beverage mixing device according to claim 2, wherein the sealing element is configured such that it closes the evacuation outlet-when being in the open position and releases the evacuation outlet when being in the closed position.
4. Beverage mixing device according to claim 1, wherein the evacuation outlet is provided at a vertically moveable pipe/tube section carrying the sealing element to be moveable between the open and closed position.

title: Reduced nicotinamideribosides for the treatment/prevention of liver disease
claims:
1. Use of reduced nicotinamide riboside in the manufacture of a medicament for preventing and/or treating liver diseases or conditions selected from the group consisting of: nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), alcoholic fatty liver disease, hepatic steatosis, cirrhosis and/or recovery and regeneration after liver injury, transplantation or surgery, diseases and conditions associated with hepatitis A,B,C,D and E, infectious mononucleosis (Epstein Barr virus) and/or hemochromatosis, by increasing intracellular NAD+ in a subject in need thereof, wherein the reduced nicotinamide riboside is 1,4-dihydro-1-beta-D-ribofuranosyl-3-pyridinecarboxamide.
2. Use according to claim 1, wherein said medicament is for the prevention and/or treatment of liver diseases or conditions selected from the group consisting of: non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), alcoholic fatty liver disease, hepatic steatosis, cirrhosis and/or recovery and regeneration after liver injury, transplantation or surgery.
3. Use according to claim 1, wherein said medicament is for the prevention and/or treatment of liver diseases and conditions associated with hepatitis A,B,C,D and E, infectious mononucleosis (Epstein Barr virus) and/or hemochromatosis.
4. Use according to claim 1, wherein said medicament is to enhance regeneration and recovery of liver tissue after injury, trauma or liver transplantation surgery.
5.Use according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the subject is a

title: Container for beverage or foodstuff preparation machine
abstract: A container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff, the container comprising: a body portion having a storage portion for storage of the precursor material and a separate flange portion, wherein a cavity of the storage portion is formed from an extensible paper-based sheet material by drawing to wrinkling portions in a drawn state, and the flange portion includes connecting members connected to the wrinkling portions to retain the drawn state and the connecting members are arranged as individual flaps that extend from a periphery of the storage portion into the storage portion in a depth direction.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff, the container comprising: a body portion having a storage portion for storage of the precursor material and a separate flange portion, wherein a cavity of the storage portion is formed from an extensible paper-based sheet material by drawing to wrinkling portions in a drawn state, and the flange portion includes connecting members connected to the wrinkling portions to retain the drawn state and the connecting members are arranged as individual flaps that extend from a periphery of the storage portion into the storage portion in a depth direction.
2. The container of claim 1 , wherein an entire periphery of the storage portion comprises the wrinkling portions and the wrinkling portions extend from the periphery to at least 80% of the depth of the storage portion.
3. The container of any preceding claim, wherein the cavity is entirely formed by drawing without individual flaps.
4. The container of any preceding claim, wherein the storage portion is drawn directly from a blank.
5. The container of any preceding claim, wherein the cavity of the storage portion is hemispherical.
6. The container of any preceding claim, wherein the paper-based material of the storage portion has a thickness of less than 60 - 150 m

title: Powdered thickener maintaining its extensional properties when reconstituted and for promoting safe swallowing by individuals with dysphagia
abstract: A thickening powder promotes safe swallowing of a nutritional product by an individual with dysphagia and can be used in methods of treating dysphagia, promoting safe swallowing of a nutritional product, and mitigating a risk of aspiration during swallowing of a nutritional product. The powder contains beta-glucan and at least one carrier ingredient in an amount that is neutral toward or enhances the extensional properties of the nutritional product. The at least one carrier ingredient can be one or more of maltodextrin, isomaltulose, sucrose or lactose. The powder can be diluted in a diluent to form an aqueous solution that is at least a portion of a nutritional product and to improve the cohesiveness of the nutritional product. Preferably, the resultant nutritional product has a shear viscosity greater than 200 mPas and up to about 2,000 mPas, preferably greater than 200 mPas and up to about 500 mPas, more preferably 250 mPas to about 450 mPas, most preferably 250 mPas to about 400 mPas, when measured at a shear rate of 50 s<sup>−1 </sup>at a temperature of 20° C.
claims:
1. A method of treating a swallowing disorder or mitigating a risk of aspiration during swallowing in an individual having the swallowing disorder, the method comprising orally administering to the individual a nutritional product in which at least a portion thereof is made by diluting a thickening powder comprising a beta-glucan and at least one carrier ingredient in a weight ratio of about 10:1 to about 300:1 with a diluent to form an aqueous solution, wherein the weight ratio of diluent:thickening powder is from 50:1 to 100:1, wherein the diluting the thickening powder comprises diluting a unit dosage form of the thickening powder that is an amount effective for administration of the nutritional product to an individual who suffers from dysphagia to achieve at least one of (i) supplemental nutrition, (ii) hydration and (ii) replacement of one or more full meals, the nutritional product comprising an amount of the aqueous solution that is neutral toward or enhances extensional properties of the nutritional product and provides to the nutritional product a shear viscosity greater than 200 mPas and up to about 2,000 mPas at a shear rate of 50 s−1 at 20° C., wherein the at least one carrier ingredient comprises isomaltulose.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the shear viscosity provided by the aqueous solution to the nutritional product is greater than 200 mPas and up to about 500 mPas when measured at a shear rate of 50 s−1.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the amount of the aqueous solution in the nutritional product provides to t

title: Dispensing device for flowable solid food product and dispensing system for flowable solid food product
abstract: The utility model relates to a distribution device (1) for flowable solid food, which comprises a control unit and a temperature sensing unit (41), the control unit is operatively connected to a distribution unit (31) to control the distribution of the flowable solid food to a user container, and the temperature sensing unit is operatively connected to the control unit to control the distribution of the flowable solid food to the user container. The control unit (31) is connected to the dispensing opening (131) and is arranged to detect a sensed temperature relating to the temperature at the dispensing opening (131) or the temperature of the user container or the temperature of the contents of the user container, where the control unit activates the dispensing unit (31) only when the sensed temperature is below or equal to a predetermined dispensing value. The utility model further relates to a distribution system for the flowable solid food.
claims:
1.一种用于可流动固体食品的分配装置(1)，其特征在于，所述分配装置(1)包括：
-储器(11)，所述储器(11)能够储存所述可流动固体食品或支承装有所述可流动固体食品的罐；
-用于用户容器的支承托盘(21)；
-分配单元(31)，所述分配单元(31)能够操作性地连接到所述储器(11)，并且具有分配口(131)以将所述可流动固体食品分配到所述用户容器中；
-控制单元，所述控制单元操作性地连接到所述分配单元(31)，以控制将所述可流动固体食品分配和分份到所述用户容器中；
其中，所述分配装置(1)还包括温度感测单元(41)，所述温度感测单元(41)操作性地连接到所述控制单元，并且布置成检测与所述分配口(131)处的温度或所述用户容器的温度或所述用户容器的内容物的温度有关的感测温度，以及
其中，只有当所述感测温度低于或等于预定的分配值时，所述控制单元才启动所述分配单元(31)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的用于可流动固体食品的分配装置(1)，其特征在于，所述温度感测单元(41)包括红外温度传感器。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的用于可流动固体食品的分配装置(1)，其特征在于，所述分配口(131)能够相对于所述支承托盘(21)从关闭位置移动到打开位置或者从打开位置移动到关闭位置，其中在所述关闭位置，所述可流动固体食品的分配被阻止，而在所述打开位置，所述可流动固体食品的分配被允许，以及
其中，只有当所述感测温度低于所述预定的分配值时，所述控制单元才启动所述分配口(131)移动到所述打开位置。
4.根据权利要求1或2所述的用于可流动固体食品的分配装置(1)，其特征在于，所述分配装置(1)还包括一个或多个风扇单元，所述风扇单元操作性地连接到所述控制单元，并且布置成置换所述分配口(131)处的空气和/或蒸气，以及
其中，只有当所述感测温度高于所述预定的分配值时，所述控制单元才启动所述风扇单元。
5.根据权利要求4所述的用于可流动固体食品的分配装置(1)，其特征在于，所述分配装置(1)包括两个风扇单元，其中第一风扇单元(51)布置在所述分配口(131)处，以便通过向所述分配口(131)吹送空气来置换空气和/或蒸气。
6.根据权利要求5所述的用

title: Beverage or food preparation system
abstract: The present disclosure provides a system (2) comprising a container (6) and a machine (4) for preparing a beverage and/or food product, the container (6) comprising: a body portion (62) having a storage portion (58) for containing a precursor material; a closure member (56) to close the storage portion (58); a machine-readable code (44) storing preparation information, said code (44) being arranged on the closure member (56), the machine (4) comprising: a code reading system (18) to read the code (44) of the container (6); a processing unit (14) for processing the precursor material of the container (6); and electrical circuitry (16) to control the processing unit (14) based on the preparation information read from the code (44), where the code reading system (18) comprises a code reader (46) and a positioning mechanism (110) to translate the container (6) and the code reader (46) relative to each other along an axis from a holding position to a reading position, the container (6) has a holding position in which the container (6) is separated from a read head of the code reader (46) and the code (44) is aligned with the code reader (46) along the axis, and a reading position in which the code (44) of the container (6) is in contact with the read head.
claims:
1.一种系统，所述系统包括容器以及用于制备饮料和/或食品的机器，
所述容器包括：
主体部分，所述主体部分具有用于容纳前体材料的储存部分；
闭合构件，所述闭合构件用以闭合所述储存部分；
机器可读光学代码，所述代码存储制备信息，并且所述代码布置在所述闭合构件上，
所述机器包括：
代码读取系统，所述代码读取系统用以读取所述容器的所述光学代码；
处理单元，所述处理单元用于处理所述容器的所述前体材料；和
电气电路系统，所述电气电路系统用以基于从所述代码读取的所述制备信息来控制所述处理单元，
其中所述代码读取系统包括代码读取器和定位机构，所述定位机构用以使所述容器和所述代码读取器相对于彼此沿着轴线从保持位置平移到读取位置，在所述保持位置，所述容器与所述代码读取器的读取头分开并且所述代码沿所述轴线与所述代码读取器对准，在所述读取位置，所述容器的所述代码与所述读取头接触，并且与所述保持位置相比，所述闭合构件呈现相对更均匀的表面以用于读取所述代码。
2.根据权利要求1所述的系统，其中所述机器包括引导部分，所述引导部分被布置为经由重力将被插入所述引导部分中的所述容器从插入位置引导到所述保持位置以及引导到所述处理单元。
3.根据权利要求2所述的系统，其中所述处理单元包括容器保持部分和闭合部分，所述容器保持部分和所述闭合部分能够在深度方向上在容器接收位置与容器处理位置之间移动，其中所述闭合部分包括在所述深度方向上从所述闭合构件延伸的腔体。
4.根据权利要求2或3中任一项所述的系统，其中所述读取头相对于所述引导部分布置成使得容器能够行进通过所述引导部分到达所述保持位置和/或从所述保持位置到达所述处理单元而不接触所述读取头。
5.根据任一前述权利要求所述的系统，其中所述定位机构被配置成在所述代码读取器静止的情况下使所述容器从所述保持位置平移到所述读取位置。
6.根据权利要求4所述的系统，当从属于权利要求2或3时，其中通过经由按压元件施加到所述容器的所述储存部分的基部的按压力来使所述容器平移，所述按压元件能够独立于所述引导部分致动。
7.根据权利要求5或6中任一项所述的系统，其中所述主体部分包括凸缘部分，所述凸缘部分将所述容器的所述储存部分和所述闭合构件互连，并且所述机器的所述引导部分被布置为引导所述凸缘部分，
其中所述引导部分包括用以接合所述凸缘的正面的正面接合部分，以及用以接合所述凸缘的背面的背面接合部分，
所述正面接合部分和所述背面接

title: Mixture of hmos and b. infantis
abstract: The invention provides a composition for use in preventing and/or treating a viral infection in a subject, wherein the composition comprises Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis and a HMO mixture consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2FL), difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), 3'-sialyllactose (3SL), and lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT), and optionally 3-fucosyllactose (3FL). The invention also provides the composition for use in preventing and/or reducing the risk of allergen sensitisation, preventing and/or reducing the risk of developing a respiratory condition in a subject, and/or preventing and/or reducing the risk of developing asthma in a subject.
claims:
1. A composition for use in preventing and/or treating a viral infection in a subject, wherein the composition comprises Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis and a HMO mixture consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2FL), difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), 3'-sialyllactose (3SL), and lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT), and optionally 3-fucosyllactose (3FL).
2. A composition for use in i) preventing and/or reducing the risk of allergen sensitisation in the respiratory tract and/or ii) preventing and/or reducing the risk of developing a respiratory condition in a subject, wherein the composition comprises Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis and a HMO mixture consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2FL), difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), 3'-sialyllactose (3SL), and lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT), and optionally 3-fucosyllactose (3FL), and wherein the respiratory condition is a chronic inflammatory disease of the respiratory tract or an allergic respiratory tract disease.
3. A composition for use in preventing and/or reducing the risk of developing asthma in a subject, wherein the composition comprises Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis and a HMO mixture consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2FL), difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), 3'-sialyllactose (3SL), and lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT), and optionally 3-fucosyllactose (3FL).
4. The composition for use according any one of claims 1-3, wherein the HMO mixture consis

title: Beverage preparation with a flexible outlet valve
abstract: A machine (1) is provided for preparing a beverage (4) from a flavouring ingredient (5a) in a processing cavity (5) by mixing the ingredient (5a) with water (4′) and centrifugally driving the ingredient (5a) and the water (4′) about a processing axis (30′). The machine (1) has a centrifugal valve (30) associated with a beverage passage (26) for controlling the flow and/or the pressure of the beverage (4) along the passage (26). The valve (30) includes a valve part (31,310,311) having first and second inertia bodies (31;310,311) that have first and second centres of inertia, respectively, that are off-set relative to the processing axis (30′) to move by rotation the valve part (31,310,311) to control the beverage flow and/or pressure. The first and second inertia bodies (31;310,311) move the valve part (31,310,311) when the ingredient (5a) and water (4′) are rotated at first and second rotational speeds, respectively. The first and second rotational speeds are different.
claims:
1. A machine for preparing a beverage from a flavouring ingredient in a processing cavity, such as a cavity for holding said ingredient supplied within a capsule, by mixing said ingredient with water and centrifugally driving such ingredient and said water about a processing axis to form said beverage, such machine comprising:
a rotatable ingredient handling system for holding and rotating said flavouring ingredient and water during centrifugation about the processing axis, the ingredient handling system having at least one beverage outlet and at least one water inlet for supplying said water to said ingredient, optionally the system having a first ingredient handler and a second ingredient handler that are movable one relative to the other from:
an ingredient transfer configuration for receiving said ingredient by the first and second capsule handlers and/or releasing said ingredient from the first and second ingredient handlers; to
an ingredient processing configuration for centrifuging said ingredient and water by rotation about the processing axis; and
a beverage passage, the passage being configured to guide said beverage from the outlet towards a beverage dispensing outlet;
a centrifugal valve associated with the beverage passage for controlling the flow and/or the pressure of said beverage along the beverage passage, the valve being configured to increase and reduce, such as allow and interrupt, a beverage flow and/or beverage pressure at a valve portion of the passage; and
a machine frame and/or housing which is stationary when the ingredient handling syst

title: Nutritional composition comprising 6′SL and LNT in combination to improve the gastrointestinal barrier function
abstract: The present invention relates to nutritional compositions comprising 6′-sialyllactose (6′SL) and lacto-N-tetraose (LNT) for use in improving the gastrointestinal barrier. In particular, the present invention relates to improving gut barrier function in an infant, a young child or children aged above 3 years to 8 years.
claims:
1. A method of improving a gastrointestinal barrier in an infant, young child or child, the method comprising administering a nutritional composition comprising 6′-sialyllactose (6′SL) and lacto-N-tetraose (LNT) to the infant, young child or child, wherein the improving the gastrointestinal barrier comprises at least one of improving barrier structure and/or improving barrier protection, wherein the nutritional composition has at least one formulation that is: (i) the nutritional composition does not contain DFL and does not contain 3-FL, and/or (ii) the nutritional composition does not contain LNnT, and/or (iii) the nutritional composition does not contain 3′-SL.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the improving the gastrointestinal barrier further comprises improving recovery of integrity of the gastrointestinal barrier.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the method is further for at least one of improving strength of the gastrointestinal barrier, improving the gastrointestinal barrier resistance, reducing disease susceptibility, reducing severity of symptoms upon inflammatory challenge of gastrointestinal mucosa and/or reducing the gastrointestinal barrier permeability.
4. The method according to claim 3, wherein the reducing the gastrointestinal barrier permeability comprises reducing at least one of pathogens, allergens and/or toxic compounds migrating from gut into body through intestinal barrier in the infant, young child or

title: Coffee beans roasting system checking method
claims:
1. Способ проверки системы обжаривания, включающей:
- по меньшей мере одно устройство для обжаривания, причем указанное устройство производит дым во время нагревания кофейных зерен, и
- по меньшей мере один блок очистки дыма, выполненный с возможностью обработки по меньшей мере части потока дыма, образуемого по меньшей мере одним устройством для обжаривания, причем указанный блок очистки дыма содержит по меньшей мере одно съемное фильтрующее устройство,
- рабочий орган подачи дыма, выполненный с возможностью перекачивания дыма из устройства для обжаривания к указанному по меньшей мере одному фильтрующему устройству,
причем по меньшей мере один блок очистки дыма содержит по меньшей мере один расположенный ниже по потоку датчик давления, причем указанный расположенный ниже по потоку датчик давления выполнен с возможностью измерения давления ниже по потоку указанного по меньшей мере одного съемного фильтрующего устройства,
при этом способ включает стадии:
- работы по меньшей мере рабочего органа подачи дыма для перекачивания газа через блок фильтрации дыма,
- измерения давления Р на датчике давления за съемным фильтрующим устройством,
- расчета падения давления ΔP = P - Pref по сравнению с эталонным давлением Pref,
- сравнения указанного падения давления ΔP с заданным пороговым значением ΔP0, соответствующим наличию указанного по меньшей мере одного съемного фильтрующего устройства перед датчиком давления,
- если указанное падение давления ΔP ниже указанного заданного порога ΔP0, то отображение аварийного сигнала.
2. Способ по п. 1, в котором съемное фильтрующее устройство является очищаемым, одноразовым или способным к регенерации, предпочтительно состоящее из: металлического сита, электростатического осадителя, НЕРА-фильтра, бумажного фильтра, хлопкового фильтра, тканевого фильтр, фильтра из адсорбирующего материала и их комбинации.
3. Способ по любому из предшествующих пунктов, в котором эталонное давление Pref представляет собой давление окружающей среды или заданн

title: Egg protein formulations and methods of manufacture thereof
abstract: The present technology relates generally to formulations comprising egg white protein, methods of manufacturing egg protein formulations and uses for egg protein formulations. In particular, several embodiments are directed to egg protein formulations for oral administration in immunotherapy of subjects affected by egg allergies.
claims:
1. A method of treating of an egg allergy by oral immunotherapy, the method comprising administering a composition comprising dried egg white protein powder comprising egg white protein to an allergic individual having the egg allergy, wherein the composition comprises: a) about 0.1 wt. % to 90 wt. % of the egg white protein; b) about 40-90 wt. % of one or more diluent; c) about 1-30 wt. % of one or more filling agent; d) about 0.01-10 wt. % of one or more lubricant and/or glidant; and e) a capsule shell or sachet.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein a level of the egg white protein in the egg white protein powder is stable in the composition for about 3, 6, 9, 11 or 36 months.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein a concentration of one or more of ovomucoid, ovalbumin, and lysozyme proteins are stable for about 3, 6, 9, or 11 or 36 months in the composition.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the egg white protein is about 0.1 wt. % to about 21 wt. % of the composition.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the egg white protein is about 0.1% of the composition.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the composition is housed by a capsule or sachet, and the capsule or sachet comprises an amount of the composition comprising about 0.2 mg to about 1000 mg of the egg white protein in the capsule or sachet.

title: Instant sintered three-dimensional shapes
abstract: The present invention relates to instant beverage or food shapes. In particular, the present invention relates to sintered three-dimensional shapes comprising flavoured ingredient and amorphous carbohydrates for making a cold or hot beverage. It also relates to a method for producing the shapes thereof.
claims:
Claims
1. Sintered three-dimensional shape comprising from 1 to 85 wt. % of at least one flavoured ingredient, from 15 to 99 wt. % of at least one amorphous carbohydrate, wherein the shape has an envelope density comprised between 0.5 and 0.8 g/cm3measured with a GeoPyc density meter.
2. Sintered three-dimensional shape according to claim 1, wherein the sintered three- dimensional shape comprises from 15 to 90 wt. % of at least one amorphous carbohydrate, preferably from 20 to 70 wt%.
3. Sintered three-dimensional shape according to claims 1 or 2, wherein the amorphous carbohydrates originates from an ingredient selected in the group consisting of milk powder, whey powder, malt extract powder, glucose syrup powder, maltodextrin, amorphous sugars, dried syrups powder extracted from plants, dried cereal or pseudo cereal syrups powder obtained by hydrolyis or mixtures thereof.
4. Sintered three-dimensional shape according to any of the preceding claims, wherein the sintered three-dimensional shape comprises from 5 to 50 wt. % of at least one flavoured ingredient, preferably from 10 to 40 wt%, more preferably from 15 to 35 wt%.
5. Sintered three-dimensional shape according to any of the preceding claims, wherein the flavoured ingredient is a powder ingredient selected from the group consisting of cocoa powder, vegetable powder, fruit powder, nuts powder, seed powder, cereal powder, powdered flavours and mixtures thereof.
6. Sintered three

title: Method of roasting coffee beans
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: inventions group relates to coffee industry. Disclosed is a method for roasting coffee beans in roasting system (10) comprising roasting device (2) and smoke purification unit (3), wherein said smoke purification unit comprises at least one filtering device (221, 222, 223) configured to filter particulate matter or volatile organic compounds, wherein said filtering device is configured to retain a predetermined maximum amount of particulate matter or VOC, wherein for each roasting operation carried out in the roasting device, the method includes the following steps: obtaining directly or indirectly data on the number of grains and the degree of roasting, determining the amount of solid particles or VOC held in said filtering device (221, 222, 223) during said roasting operation, based on said obtained number of roasted grains and said obtained degree of roasting, determining the total amount of specific particles or VOC held in said filtering device (221, 222, 223) during all roasting operations, estimating the number of roasting operations that can still be carried out until said total number is equal to a predetermined maximum amount of solid particles or VOCs that can be retained by the filtering device. Also disclosed is a system for roasting coffee beans indoors and a computer-readable data medium containing instructions for performing the coffee beans roasting method.EFFECT: group of inventions makes it possible to inform the operator performing frying in advance about the cleaning moment so that the operator could plan the cleaning moment, while avoiding an unnecessary cleaning operation at the too early stage or the cleaning operation at the too late stage.14 cl, 3 dwg
claims:
1. Способ обжаривания кофейных зерен в системе (10) обжаривания, содержащей:
- устройство (2) для обжаривания, и
- блок (3) очистки дыма, выполненный с возможностью очистки дыма, выделяемого устройством для обжаривания, причем указанный блок очистки дыма содержит по меньшей мере одно устройство (221, 222, 223) фильтрации, выполненное с возможностью фильтрации твердых частиц или летучих органических соединений (ЛОС), при этом указанное устройство фильтрации выполнено с возможностью удержания заранее определенного максимального количества твердых частиц или ЛОС,
причем при каждой операции обжаривания, реализуемой в устройстве для обжаривания, способ включает стадии:
- получения непосредственно или опосредованно данных о количестве зерен, обжаренных во время указанной операции обжаривания, и степени обжаривания, примененной к зернам во время указанной операции обжаривания,
- определения количества твердых частиц или ЛОС, удерживаемых в указанном устройстве (221, 222, 223) фильтрации во время указанной операции обжаривания, на основе указанного полученного количества обжаренных зерен и указанной полученной степени обжаривания,
- определения общего количества особых частиц или ЛОС, удерживаемых в указанном устройстве (221, 222, 223) фильтрации во время всех операций обжаривания, реализованных с момента последней операции очистки устройства фильтрации,
- оценки количества операций обжаривания, которые все еще могут быть реализованы, пока указанное общее количество не сравняется с заранее определенным максимальным количеством твердых частиц или ЛОС, которые могут быть удержаны устройством фильтрации.
2. Способ по п. 1, в котором блок (3) очистки дыма содержит по меньшей мере одно устройство фильтрации из следующего списка: высокоэффективный фильтр-аккумулятор (223) твердых частиц, металлический фильтр (223), электростатический осадитель (222), фильтр (221) с активированным углем.
3. Способ по любому из предшествующих пунктов, включающий стадии:
- получения типа зерен, обжа

title: Beverage capsule system with code and bit error correction
abstract: A system has a container for containing precursor material and a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof from said precursor material The container has a code to at least partially encode preparation information. The machine includes: a code reading system to read the code; a processing unit for processing the precursor material of the container; and electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on the preparation information. The electrical circuitry is configured to: read the code to obtain a code read; determine a characteristic of a neighbouring non-code portion in proximity of a code portion of the code read; correct an associated characteristic of the code portion based on the determined characteristic of the neighbouring non-code portion to account for variations of the characteristic in the non-code portion.
claims:
1. A system comprising a container for containing precursor material and a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof from said precursor material,
the container including:
a code encoding a binary sequence to at least partially encode preparation information,
the machine including:
a code reading system to read the code;
a processing unit for processing the precursor material of the container; and
electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on the preparation information,
wherein the electrical circuitry is configured to:
read the code to obtain the binary sequence;
implement an error-correcting code decoder with error correction of the binary sequence to correct single bit errors in the sequence; and
identify a recipe that is associated with the corrected binary sequence.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the electrical circuitry is configured with the error-correcting code decoder to decode the binary sequence in a first forward order and in a second reverse order to account for an unknown rotational position of the code.
3. The system of either of claims 1 or 2, wherein

title: Packaging item and packaged food product
abstract: The present invention relates to a packaging item comprising a cylindrical container made of a multilayer oxygen and moisture barrier laminate comprising a cardboard and an organic or inorganic barrier layer The container has a dispensing opening. The packaging item further comprises at least one sleeve element with at least one sleeve element peripheral wall, the sleeve element being configured to be slid over at least a top end portion of the container peripheral wall and being made of a multilayer oxygen and moisture barrier laminate comprising a cardboard and an organic or inorganic barrier layer. The packaging item further comprises at least one base element with at least one base element peripheral wall, the base element at least partially enclosing and preferably immovably attached to a bottom end portion of the container peripheral wall. The present invention further relates to a packaged food product.

title: Use of nutritional composition containing sialyllactose for treating and/or preventing low attention and/or excessive impulsivity
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: disclosed is use of a nutritional composition containing sialyllactose for preventing low attention and excessive impulsivity in an infant or a young child. Said nutritional composition is an infant formula, an initial infant formula, a mixture for fed children, infant formula for premature babies, an enriching agent, a breast milk enricher, a infant formula, a milk formula for children from 1 to 3 years old or a grain-based infant composition, and the nutritional composition contains 6'-sialyllactose (6'-SL) in amount of 50 mg to 50,000 mg per liter of the nutritional composition, preferably from 60 mg to 2000 mg per liter of the nutritional composition, more preferably from 80 mg to 1000 mg per liter of the nutritional composition and most preferably from 87.5 mg to 735 mg per liter of the nutritional composition.EFFECT: invention is aimed at preventing low attention and excessive impulsivity in an infant or a young child.3 cl, 7 dwg, 1 tbl
claims:
1. Применение питательной композиции, содержащей сиалиллактозу, для предотвращения пониженного внимания и избыточной импульсивности у младенца или ребёнка младшего возраста, причём питательная композиция представляет собой детскую смесь, начальную детскую смесь, смесь для прикармливаемых детей, детскую смесь для недоношенных детей, обогатитель, обогатитель грудного молока, смесь для детского питания, молочную смесь для детей от 1 до 3 лет или детскую композицию на зерновой основе, и при этом питательная композиция содержит 6'-сиалиллактозу (6'-SL) в количестве от 50 мг до 50 000 мг на литр питательной композиции, предпочтительно от 60 мг до 2000 мг на литр питательной композиции, более предпочтительно от 80 мг до 1000 мг на литр питательной композиции и наиболее предпочтительно от 87,5 мг до 735 мг на литр питательной композиции.
2. Применение по п. 1, причём внимание выбрано из группы, состоящей из устойчивого внимания, разделённого внимания и комбинации любого из вышеперечисленного, и предпочтительно при этом внимание представляет собой устойчивое внимание.
3. Применение по п. 1 или 2, причём указанный младенец или ребёнок младшего возраста нуждается в повышении внимания и снижении импульсивности.

title: Engineered lipase variants
Emulsion gels
abstract: To provide emulsion gels, and food products comprising the same, for nourishing a subject having dysphagia, chewing difficulties, swallowing difficulties, an increased risk of aspiration, or an increased risk of choking.SOLUTION: There is provided an emulsion gel comprising 320 kcal/100 g to 480 kcal/100 g energy, wherein the emulsion gel comprises an E471 emulsifier and an E472 emulsifier, and wherein the ratio of the total weight of E471 emulsifier to the total weight of E472 emulsifier is from about 1.8:1.0 to about 1.0:1.0.SELECTED DRAWING: None
claims:
【請求項1】
３２０ｋｃａｌ／１００ｇ～４８０ｋｃａｌ／１００ｇのエネルギーを含むエマルションゲルであって、前記エマルションゲルがＥ４７１乳化剤及びＥ４７２乳化剤を含み、Ｅ４７１乳化剤の合計重量の、Ｅ４７２乳化剤の合計重量に対する比が約１．８：１．０～約１．０：１．０である、エマルションゲル。
【請求項2】
少なくとも約４００ｋｃａｌ／１００ｇを含むエマルションゲルであって、前記エマルションゲルがＥ４７１乳化剤及びＥ４７２乳化剤を含み、Ｅ４７１乳化剤の合計重量の、Ｅ４７２乳化剤の合計重量に対する比が約１．８：１．０～約１．０：１．０である、エマルションゲル。
【請求項3】
（ａ）合計量が約１．０ｗｔ％～約１．８ｗｔ％、約１．１ｗｔ％～約１．７ｗｔ％、若しくは約１．２ｗｔ％～約１．６ｗｔ％である乳化剤、
（ｂ）合計量が約０．５ｗｔ％～約１．２ｗｔ％、約０．６ｗｔ％～約１．１ｗｔ％、若しくは約０．７ｗｔ％～約１．０ｗｔ％であるＥ４７１乳化剤、及び／又は
（ｃ）合計量が約０．３ｗｔ％～約０．９ｗｔ％、約０．４ｗｔ％～約０．８ｗｔ％、若しくは約０．５ｗｔ％～約０．７ｗｔ％であるＥ４７２乳化剤
を含む、請求項１又は２に記載のエマルションゲル。
【請求項4】
Ｅ４７１乳化剤の合計重量の、Ｅ４７２乳化剤の合計重量に対する比が、約１．７：１．０～約１．１：１．０、約１．６：１．０～約１．２：１．０、又は約１．５：１．０～約１．３：１．０であり、任意選択で、Ｅ４７１乳化剤の合計重量の、Ｅ４７２乳化剤の合計重量に対する比が約７：５である、請求項１～３のいずれか一項に記載のエマルションゲル。
【請求項5】
（ａ）合計量が約６．０ｗｔ％～約１４．０ｗｔ％、約７．０ｗｔ％～約１３．０ｗｔ％、若しくは約８．０ｗｔ％～約１２．０ｗｔ％であるタンパク質であって、任意選択で、大豆タンパク質、空豆タンパク質、エンドウ豆タンパク質、米タンパク質、及びオート麦タンパク質などの植物タンパク質、並びに／若しくはカゼイン及び乳清などの乳タンパク質から選択されるタンパク質、

assignee: ソシエテ·デ·プロデュイ·ネスレ·エス·アー

title: Methods of monitoring feeding behaviors of pets
abstract: The present disclosure relates to the monitoring feeding behavior(s) of a pet(s), under the control of at least one processor. An example method includes obtaining load data from a load sensor of a pet bowl while the pet is interacting with contents of the pet bowl. The load sensor can have a sensitivity of +/−50 grams or less and the load data is obtained can occur at a sample rate from 10 samples to 150 samples per second. The example method can also include sequentially grouping the load data in 0.01 second to 5 second time increments, wherein individual time increments include multiple samples, and identifying a feeding behavior occurring within one or more of the time increments based on the load data resulting from the pet interacting with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
claims:
1. A method of monitoring feeding behavior of a pet, under the control of at least one processor, comprising:
obtaining load data from a load sensor of a pet bowl while the pet is interacting with contents of the pet bowl, wherein the load sensor has a sensitivity of +/−50 grams or less and the load data is obtained at a sample rate from 10 samples to 150 samples per second;
sequentially grouping the load data in 0.01 second to 5 second time increments, wherein individual time increments include multiple samples; and
identifying a feeding behavior occurring within one or more of the time increments based on the load data resulting from the pet interacting with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
2. The method of claim 1, further comprising excluding load data in identifying the feeding behavior if determined to be a result of human interaction, a false trigger, or an accidental interaction with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the feeding behavior is a count-based feeding behavior selected from lapping, licking, or biting.
4. The method of claim 3, further comprising characterizing the count-based feeding behavior by counting individual micro-events of the feeding behavior within a single time increment or a time period spanning multiple time increments, wherein the individual micro-events include individual laps, individual licks, or individual bites.

title: Nutritional composition for promoting emotional development
abstract: The present invention relates to a combination comprising osteopontin and lactoferrin in effective amount for use in promoting social-emotional development in a young individual. The present invention further relates to compositions and methods for promoting social-emotional development in a young individual, preferably in an infant.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A combination comprising osteopontin and lactoferrin in effective amount for use in promoting social-emotional development in a young individual.
2. The combination according to claim 1 , wherein it comprises osteopontin in amount ranging from about 50 ng/pL to about 900 ng/pL, and lactoferrin in amount ranging from about 190 ng/pL to about 5050 ng/pL.
3. The combination according to any one of the preceding claims, for use in promoting surgency and/or extraversion, regulation of emotions and/or behavior, and/or regulation domain on Infant Behavior Questionnaire-Revised (IBQ-R) scale in a young individual.
4. The combination any one of the preceding claims, wherein the young individual is an infant, a toddler or a young child, preferably an infant.
5. The combination according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein it is administered to the young individual from birth to about 5 years of age, preferably from birth to 18 weeks of age, more preferably during the first 12 weeks of life of the young individual.
6. The combination according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein social- emotional development is promoted in a young individual from birth to about 5 years of age, preferably from birth to 18 months of age, more preferably from about 2 to about 6 months of age, more preferably in about 3 months of age.

title: Enteral nutrition container cap and methods of making and using same
abstract: A package closure system may include a lid and a package outlet having a first connection unit, the lid configured to be removably connected to the package outlet using the first connection unit and including a second connection unit. The top cap may be configured to be removably connected to the cover using a second connection unit. A method for providing a nutritional composition from a container to the intestinal tract may include: removing a top cap from a cap configured to direct the nutritional composition through a channel within the cap, the cap removably connected to the container; sealingly connecting the cap to the intestinal tract; and applying pressure to the container to direct the nutritional composition from the container through the channel and into the intestinal tract.
claims:
1.一种包装件封闭系统，所述包装件封闭系统包括：
可变形的包装件[131]，所述包装件容置营养组合物[132]；和
盖[10]，所述盖包括上部部分和下部部分，所述上部部分用于连接到肠道饲管，所述下部部分用于连接到所述包装件，其中，所述上部部分配置成连接到连接器。
2.根据权利要求1所述的包装件封闭系统，其中，连接螺纹[13]从所述上部部分延伸并且配置成附接到所述连接器。
3.根据权利要求2所述的包装件封闭系统，还包括顶部罩帽[70]，所述顶部罩帽配置成封闭所述包装件。
4.根据权利要求3所述的包装件封闭系统，其中，所述顶部罩帽配置成使得其能从所述上部部分按扣掉。
5.根据权利要求4所述的包装件封闭系统，其中，所述顶部罩帽是在顶部罩帽和上部部分的界面处具有弱化部分的单个单元。

title: System for the preparation of a packaged food composition
abstract: The present invention relates to a system for the preparation of a packaged food composition, wherein the system comprises a collecting unit, a weighing unit, a mixing unit, a filling unit, transferring units and a control unit.
claims:
1. An automatic system for a preparation of a packaged food composition, the system comprising:
a collecting unit for collecting food ingredients in primary containers;
a primary transferring unit for transferring the primary containers with the food ingredients from the collecting unit to a weighing unit;
a weighing unit for weighing and dispensing food ingredients from the primary containers into secondary containers;
a secondary transferring unit for transferring the secondary containers with the weighed food ingredients to a mixing unit;
a mixing unit for mixing the weighed food ingredients;
a tertiary transferring unit for transferring the mixed weighed food ingredients to a filling unit;
a filling unit for filling the mixed weighed food ingredients into packages;
a control unit; and
wherein the control unit controls and directs the collecting unit, the weighing unit, the mixing unit, the filling unit, and the primary, secondary and tertiary transferring units in such a way as to compose, mix and pack a food composition starting from the food ingredients present in the primary containers according to a composition recipe stored in the control unit in an electronic form to result in the packaged food composition,
wherein the secondary transferring unit is an automated guided vehicle, and

title: Capsule system with recognition means and adaptable opening and injection mechanism
claims:

title: Cardboard packaging material suitable for recycling and comprising metallised barrier layer applied by transferring metallisation
abstract: FIELD: packaging and storage.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to the field of paper-based packaging materials and relates to the structure of a barrier multilayer material having high barrier properties and suitable for secondary processing in secondary paper pulp flow, and carton package for beverages made from it. Paper-based packing material structure is made in the form of a single sheet and contains the following layers from its outer surface to its inner surface: (i) at least one layer of polymer dispersion coating, said coating having thickness of 1 mcm to 10 mcm, (ii) a semi-rigid or rigid cardboard having density of 120 g/m2 to 500 g/m2, (iii) a layer of solvent-free adhesive or water-based adhesive having thickness of 1 mcm to 10 mcm, (iv) at least one protective coating layer with thickness of 1 mcm to 10 mcm, (v) an aluminium layer having an equivalent optical density of 2–5, or aluminium oxide, or silicon oxide, deposited using a physical or chemical vapour deposition method or by metallization transfer, (vi) a parting coating with thickness of 0.1 mcm to 4 mcm, (vii) at least one layer of a water-resistant sealing polyolefin coating with thickness of 10 mcm to 50 mcm, wherein the total content of fibres in said structure is from 90% to 96% by weight.EFFECT: invention provides a packaging material which enables to make packages using existing moulding methods, which also have high barrier properties and a shape suitable for warehousing and transportation, which can be recycled together with other paper packaging such as old corrugated cardboard boxes (OCC) or mixed paper wastes, and to do so generally in a paper recycling stream, as well as having high abrasion resistance, and especially such, in which metal layer is not damaged by mechanical stress during storage, transportation or use of packaging material.6 cl, 1 dwg
claims:
1. Структура (1) барьерного многослойного упаковочного материала на основе бумаги, сформированная в виде полужесткого или жесткого единого листа и содержащая от ее наружной поверхности до внутренней поверхности следующие слои:
(i) по меньшей мере один слой (8) полимерного дисперсионного покрытия, выбранного из списка: сополимер этилена и акриловой кислоты или метакриловой кислоты, винилацетат, стиролакрилат, акриловый полимер, модифицированный поливиниловый спирт, этилацетат, полигидроксиалканоат (PHA) и их сополимеры, полиуретан (PU), полибутиленадипат-терефталат (PBAT), полибутиленсукцинат (PBS), поли(бутиленсукцинат-со-адипат) (PBSA), полимолочная кислота (PLA) или любая их смесь с минеральным наполнителем или без него, причем указанное покрытие имеет толщину от 1 до 10 мкм,
(ii) полужесткий или жесткий картон (7), имеющий плотность от 120 г/м<sup>2</sup>до 500 г/м<sup>2</sup>,
(iii) слой (6) не содержащего растворителей клея или клея на водной основе, выбранного из следующего списка: поливинилацетат (PVAc), полиуретан (PU), акриловый полимер, поливиниловый спирт (PVOH), этиленвиниловый спирт (EVOH), сополимер бутендиола и винилового спирта (BVOH), клей на основе крахмала или их смесь, причем указанный клеевой слой имеет толщину от 1 мкм до 10 мкм,
(iv) по меньшей мере один слой (5) защитного покрытия, выбранного из следующего списка: поливиниловый спирт (PVOH), этиленэтилакрилат (EEA) или полиуретан (PU), причем указанное защитное покрытие имеет толщину от 1 мкм до 10 мкм,
(v) слой (4) алюминия, имеющий эквивалентную оптическую плотность 2-5, или оксид алюминия, или оксид кремния, наносимые с применением способа физического или химического осаждения из паровой фазы или с помощью переноса металлизации,
(vi) разделительное покрытие (3), выбранное из следующего списка: винилхлорид, акриловый полимер, полиуретан (PU), нитроцеллюлоза или их смесь, причем указанное разделительное покрытие имеет толщину от 0,1 мкм до 4 мкм,
(vii) по меньшей мере один слой (2) устойчиво

title: A method for producing a compound comprising a polyhydroxyalcanoate and cellulose
abstract: Process for manufacturing a biodegradable compound, said process comprising the steps of, in order: (i) providing an extruder with at least one rotating screw, at least two feeding units suitable for being fed with ingredients, and an extruder die, (ii) feeding the first feeding unit with a PHA polymer and maleic anhydride (MA), (iii) feeding the second feeding unit with cellulosic fibres, (iv) rotating the screw to mix the PHA and maleic anhydride ingredients and graft said maleic anhydride onto said PHA molecules to form PHA grafted with MA (“PHA-g-MA”) in an amount of 1 to 10%, preferably 1 to 3% of the total content of PHA, and then mixing said PHA-g-MA with cellulosic fibres to form a molten compound of PHA-g-MA and cellulosic fibres, (v) passing said molten compound through said extruder die and shaping said extruded compound into different compound formats.
claims:

<seg-clauses>(i) providing an extruder comprising a heater, at least one rotating screw, at least two feeding units suitable for being fed with ingredients, and an extruder die, the temperature of said extruder being set between 130° C. and 190° C.,</seg-clauses>
<seg-clauses>(ii) feeding the first feeding unit with a PHA polymer and maleic anhydride (MA), wherein the ratio of maleic anhydride to PHA is comprised between 0.1 and 10,</seg-clauses>
<seg-clauses><seg-main>(iii) feeding the second feeding unit with cellulosic fibres, said cellulosic fibres being hardwood cellulose fibres having a length of 15 μm to 150 μm, and having a density of at least </seg-main><seg-clauses>1.0 g/cm3,</seg-clauses></seg-clauses>

<seg-clauses>(v) passing said molten compound through said extruder die, and shaping said extruded compound into, a product selected from the group consisting of:</seg-clauses>

title: Container for beverage or foodstuff preparation machine
abstract: A container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff, the container comprising: a body portion having a storage portion for storage of the precursor material and a separate flange portion coupled to the storage portion, and; a separate stiffening ring arranged connected to the flange portion to stiffen a periphery of the flange portion.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff, the container comprising: a body portion having a storage portion for storage of the precursor material and a separate flange portion coupled to the storage portion, and; a separate stiffening ring arranged connected to the flange portion to stiffen a periphery of the flange portion.
2. The container of any preceding claim, wherein the stiffening ring is adhesively bonded to the flange portion by a heat activated lacquer applied to the flange portion.
3. The container of any preceding claim, wherein the stiffening ring is connected to an upper surface of the flange portion, wherein the upper surface faces away from the storage portion.
4. The container of any preceding claim, comprising a liner member, which is: arranged to line an interior of the storage portion; arranged over an upper face of the flange portion that faces away from the storage portion and not over an opposed lower face that faces the storage portion. arranged over the stiffening ring, and is arranged to bond the stiffening ring to the flange portion.
5. The container of claim 4, wherein the liner member extends around the stiffening ring and to the upper surface of the flange portion at a periphery of the flange portion.

title: Systems and methods for providing individualized nutritional recommendations for intermittent fasting
abstract: Systems and methods provide individualized nutritional recommendations before, during and/or after an intermittent fasting (IF) diet. In several embodiments, the individualized nutritional recommendations are diets, menus and recipes for before, during and/or alter an intermittent fasting (IF) diet. In several embodiments, the nutritional recommendations are delivered by a computer-implemented system. In several embodiments, the individual is administered and/or consumes nutrients according to the nutritional recommendations, for example calcium, preferably one or more calcium salts, such as calcium acetate, calcium carbonate, calcium chloride, calcium citrate, calcium gluconate, calcium lactate or mixtures thereof; and/or a fiber supplement, preferably those containing one or more of wheat dextrin, methylcellulose, psyllium husk, polycarbophil, guar fiber, glucomannan or β-glucans.
claims:
1. (canceled)
2. The method according to claim 11, wherein the recommendations comprise diet recommendations, menu recommendations and recipe recommendations.
3-4. (canceled)
5. The method according to claim 11, wherein the intermittent fasting (IF) diet is a time-restricted feeding (TRF) regimen or an alternate day fasting (ADF) regimen.
6. The method according to claim 11, wherein the nutritional recommendations are determined by a process comprising generating a rule for each of a plurality of nutrients or ingredients, the rule generated by defining one or more of a desired lower bound of the rule, a desired upper bound of the rule, an absolute minimum for the rule, an absolute maximum for the rule, a weight for lower bound of the rule, or a weight for upper bound of the rule; the process further comprising generating a goal for each of the plurality of nutrients or ingredients, the goal is maximizing the amount of the corresponding nutrient or ingredient or minimizing the amount of the corresponding nutrient or ingredient.
7. The method according to claim 11, wherein the nutritional recommendations are determined using a database of meal items and pre-created meals, wherein the pre-created meals each comprise one or more of the meal items which form an entire meal, and each of the pre-created meals are associated with summary nutrition information for the entire meal; and the process of determining the nutritional recommendations comprises generating a variable for each of the pre-created meals which

title: Methods and devices for heating or cooling viscous materials
abstract: Methods and devices heat or cool viscous materials, such as meat emulsions useful for producing food and other products. The devices have a heat exchanger including a first plate, a second plate attached to the first plate, and a first spacer and a second spacer arranged between the first plate and the second plate. The first plate, the second plate, the first spacer, and the second spacer define at least one temperature controlled passage for a product to pass through the heat exchanger.

title: Fluidic food composition based on condensed milk and pectin
abstract: The present invention relates to a fluidic food composition comprising: between 20 and 50 wt% of a condensed milk; between 0.5 and 2.0 wt% of pectin; and aqueous phase, wherein said fluidic food composition has a pH less than 4.5, preferably between 3 and 4.2, more preferably between 3.5 and 4.0. The present invention also relates to a method of making said fluidic food composition and use of said fluidic food composition.
claims:
Claims
1 . A fluidic food composition comprising: - between 20 and 50 wt% of a condensed milk; - between 0.5 and 2.0 wt% of pectin; and - aqueous phase, wherein said fluidic food composition has a pH less than 4.5, preferably between 3 and 4.2, more preferably between 3.5 and 4.0.
2. The fluidic food composition according to claim 1 , wherein the condensed milk comprises between 5 and 60 wt% of sugar, between 0.2 and 9 wt% of fat or oil, and between 5 and 8 wt% of protein based on the entire content of the condensed milk.
3. The fluidic food composition according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the aqueous phase comprises any of water, a vegetable puree, a fruit puree and the combination thereof.
4. The fluidic food composition according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein viscosity of the fluidic food composition measured at 25 °C at a shear rate of 10 s-1is between 100 and 100,000 mPa s.
5. The fluidic food composition according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein a protein content of the fluidic food composition is between 2 and 5 wt%.
6. The fluidic food composition according to claim 5, wherein the protein content of the fluidic food composition is based only on the protein content of the condensed milk.
7. The fluidic food composition according to any one of c

title: Extracting arrangement of a beverage extraction device
abstract: The invention concerns an extracting arrangement (121), for extracting a beverage from a pod comprising a beverage ingredient, comprising a plurality of opening elements (122) rising from at least one piercing surface (123), facing in use an enclosing wall (11) of the pod (10) to open, and a plurality of traversing holes, to evacuate the beverage dispensed from the opened enclosing wall (11), wherein each of the opening elements (122) presents an outlet opening (122'') cooperating with the traversing holes and/or a tip end (122'), wherein the extracting arrangement (121) further comprises a fitting hollow element (124) having a first end (124'), coupled to the extracting surface (123), smaller than an opposite second end (124''), and an inner lateral surface (124''') having a non-planar shape so as the inner lateral surface (124''') together with the extracting surface (123) substantially match with the non-planar enclosing wall (11) of the pod (10) to open.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. Extracting arrangement (121) for extracting a beverage from a pod (10) containing a beverage ingredient, preferably roast and ground coffee, the extracting arrangement (121) comprising a plurality of opening elements (122) rising from at least one extracting surface (123), facing in use a non-planar enclosing wall (11) of the pod (10) to open, and a plurality of traversing holes, to evacuate the beverage dispensed from the opened enclosing wall (11), wherein each of the opening elements (122) presents an outlet opening (122”) cooperating with the traversing holes and/or a tip end (122’), wherein the extracting arrangement (121) further comprises a fitting hollow element (124) having a first end (124’), coupled to the extracting surface (123), and an opposite second end (124”), wherein the first end (124’) and the second end (124”) are circular and the diameter of the first end (124’) is smaller than the diameter of the second end (124”), wherein the fitting hollow element (124) is provided with an inner lateral surface (124’”) connecting the first end (124’) to the second end (124”) and having a non-planar shape so as the inner lateral surface (124’”) together with the extracting surface (123) substantially match with the non-planar enclosing wall (11 ) of the pod (10) to open , and wherein the inner lateral surface (124’”) is provided with two or more discontinuities in the non-planar shape to define a different portion of the inner lateral surface (124’”) at each discontinuity.
2. Extracting arrangement (121) according to claim 1 , wherein the inner lateral surface (124’”) is a curved surface or a stepped surface.
3. Extracting arrangement (121) according to claim 1 or 2, wherein

title: Machine for dispensing beverages with foam
abstract: A machine (1) for dispensing a beverage (100) comprises a beverage processing unit (5) and a beverage outlet (10) in fluid communication with the unit (5). The beverage outlet (10) has: a collection cavity (10a) delimited by a bottom (10b) and (a) sidewall(s) (10c) which are configured to collect beverage (100) from the beverage processing unit (5); a bottom dispensing opening or edge (14) configured to dispense beverage (100) from the outlet (10) to an area (2) for placing a user-recipient (9) to collect such dispensed beverage (100); and a beverage transfer channel (10a') that fluidically connects the collection cavity (10a) to the bottom dispensing opening or edge (14) and that is configured to guide beverage (100) between the collection cavity (10a) and the bottom dispensing opening or edge (14). The beverage transfer channel (10a') extends along a direction of flow (F) from the collection cavity (10a) around at least part of the sidewall (10c) of the collection cavity (10a) to the bottom dispensing opening or edge (14).

title: Aerated confection
abstract: The present invention relates to a water-based aerated confectionery product for use as a filling composition in chocolate or chocolate-like products and a method of making the same.
claims:
1.甜食组合物，所述甜食组合物包含填充有基于水的充气甜食填充物的巧克力或巧克力类似物甜食，其中所述基于水的充气甜食填充物：
具有大于或等于5.6的pH；并且
具有小于0.67的水活度；并且
包含30重量%至90重量%的糖；
包含1重量%至8重量%之间的蛋白质，
其中所述蛋白质使所述基于水的充气甜食稳定，并且所述蛋白质已经热变性，并且所述基于水的充气甜食被部分或完全包围或包裹在巧克力或巧克力类似物中。
2.根据权利要求1所述的甜食组合物，其中所述基于水的充气甜食填充物具有5.6至10.0或6.0至8.0的pH。
3.根据任一项前述权利要求所述的甜食组合物，其中所述蛋白质是乳清蛋白。
4.根据任一项前述权利要求所述的甜食组合物，其中所述蛋白质以所述基于水的充气甜食填充物的至少2重量%、任选地至少2重量%、至少2.2重量%、至少3重量%或至少3.3重量%的量存在。
5.根据任一项前述权利要求所述的甜食组合物，其中在所述基于水的充气甜食填充物中，所述糖包含以下项或由其组成：
至少两种不同的糖；或
具有10%至70%、10%至65%、20%至60%或40%至60%的糖转化百分比的转化糖。
6.根据任一项前述权利要求所述的甜食组合物，其中在所述基于水的充气甜食填充物中存在至少两种糖，其中所述糖中的一种是果糖，所述果糖形成总糖含量的至少10重量%。
7.根据任一项前述权利要求所述的甜食组合物，其中在所述基于水的充气甜食填充物中，20重量%至65重量%的所述糖是葡萄糖和/或右旋糖。
8.根据任一项前述权利要求所述的甜食组合物，其中10重量%至50重量%的所述糖是果糖。
9.根据任一项前述权利要求所述的甜食组合物，所述甜食组合物包含40重量%至90重量%的糖。
10.根据任一项前述权利要求所述的甜食组合物，其中所述基于水的充气甜食填充物的所述水活度大于0.45且不大于0.64或不大于0.59。
11.根据任一项前述权利要求所述的甜食组合物，其中所述基于水的充气甜食填充物具有60%至200%、更优选60%至160%的膨胀度。
12.根据任一项前述权利要求所述的甜食组合物，其中将所述基于水的充气甜食填充物充气到小于0.8gr/cm3的体积密度。

title: Home-compostable pod for beverage preparation
abstract: The invention relates to a home-compostable pod (100, 1000) for preparing a beverage in a beverage production machine. The pod (100, 1000) comprises a pod body (110) being composed of two connected half-shells (101, 102) that delimit a chamber (103) for containing a substance (105) for the beverage. The pod (100, 1000) comprises an injection wall (120), through which a fluid for preparing the beverage is injected into the chamber (103). The pod (100, 1000) comprises a delivery wall (130) for dispensing the prepared beverage from the pod (100, 1000) in the beverage preparation. The delivery wall (130) is connected to the pod body (110) and adapted to be opened upon interaction with opening elements of the beverage production machine under the effect of rising pressure of the injected fluid. The delivery wall (130) has a multi-layered structure (300), which comprises at least one primary layer (310) made of a cellulose-based material (311) or a regenerated cellulose material (312), and a secondary layer (320) with an oxygen barrier function. Alternatively, the delivery wall (130) can be provided as a multi-layered structure (300) that comprises a primary layer (3100) having the oxygen barrier function. For this, the primary layer (3100) is made of parchment paper or a compostable biopolymer. The invention also relates to a use of anyone of these pods (100, 1000) for preparing a beverage in a beverage production machine that has a pod holder with opening elements.
claims:
1. A pod for preparing a beverage in a beverage production machine, wherein the pod is made of a home-compostable material composition and comprises:
a pod body being composed of two half-shells being connected to each other so as to define a chamber for containing a substance for the preparation of the beverage,
an injection wall for injecting a fluid in the chamber for preparing the beverage upon interaction of the fluid with the substance; and
a delivery wall being connected to the pod body to close the chamber, the delivery wall being adapted to be opened upon interaction with external opening elements under the effect of rising pressure of the fluid being injected into the pod to dispense the prepared beverage from the pod,
wherein the delivery wall has a multi-layered structure comprising:
at least one primary layer made of a cellulose-based material or a regenerated cellulose material, and
a secondary layer with an oxygen barrier function.
2. The pod according to claim 1, wherein the primary layer comprises a cellulose fiber material.
3. The pod according to claim 1, wherein the secondary layer comprises a coating.
4. The pod according to claim 3, wherein the coating is applied onto the primary layer.

title: Food powder comprising a fluid gel
abstract: The invention relates to a food powder. The food powder comprises a carrier matrix, and a dried fluid gel. The dried fluid gel comprises particles formed of polysaccharide-based hydrocolloid and optionally, a cation. The invention also relates to a process for preparing such food powder and, food product, beverage and food supplement comprising such food powder.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A food powder which comprises:- a carrier matrix, and,- a dried fluid gel comprising particles formed of polysaccharide-based hydrocolloidand optionally, a cation.
2. A food powder according to claim 1, wherein the food powder comprises 40 to 99 wt%,preferably 75 to 99wt% carrier matrix by dry weight.
3. A food powder according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the carrier matrix is carbohydrate-based carrier matrix, preferably maltodextrin.
4. A food powder according to claim 3, wherein the maltodextrin is having a dextroseequivalent (DE) of at least 15, more preferably of 15 to 30, most preferably of 21.
5. A food powder according to any one of the preceding claims, which comprises from0.5 to 30wt.%, preferably from 0.5wt.% to 20wt.%, more preferably 0.9 to 17wt.%, even more preferably from 0.9 to 7wt%, even more preferably from 0.9 to 5.5wt.%, even more preferably 0.9 to 2.5wt.% polysaccharide-based hydrocolloid by dry weight.
6. A food powder according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein thepolysaccharide-based hydrocolloid is selected from the list consisting of acacia gum, agar, alginate, carrageenan, cellulose, carboxymethylcellulose, colloidalmicrocrystalline cellulose (colloidal MCC), curdlan, furcellaran, gelatin, gellan, guar gum, konjac, locust bean gum, pectin, tamarind seed gum, tara gum, tragacanth gum xanthan gum, or a mixture thereof.

title: Compositions and methods using a combination of oleuropein and taurine for use in prevention or treatment of joint disorders
abstract: The present invention relates to use of a composition comprising an effective amount of a combination of oleuropein and/or metabolite thereof and taurine and/or functional derivative for maintenance of joint health or prevention or treatment of joint disorders in an individual. In particular, the invention relates to a composition comprising an effective amount of a combination of oleuropein and/or metabolite thereof and taurine and/or functional derivative for use to prevent or treat cartilage degeneration in an individual.
claims:
1. Composition comprising an effective amount of a combination of oleuropein and/or metabolite thereof and taurine and/or functional derivative for use to prevent or treat cartilage degeneration in an individual.
2. The composition for use according to Claim 1, wherein the metabolite of oleuropein is selected from the group consisting of oleuropein aglycone, hydroxytyrosol, elenolic acid, homovanillyl alcohol, isohomovanillyl alcohol, glucuronidated forms thereof, sulfated forms thereof, derivatives thereof, and mixtures thereof.
3. The composition for use according to Claim 1 or 2, wherein the functional derivative of taurine is selected from the group consisting of Taurolidine, taurultam, taurinamide and l,4,5-oxathiazinane-4,4-dioxide, 4-(2-hydroxyethyl)- 1 - piperazineethanesulfonic acid, N-acyltaurine, acetylhomotaurine, N,N- diacetylsalicyloxyethyltaurine, acylmethyltaurine, homotaurine and hypotaurine.
4. The composition for use according to any of Claim 1 to 3, further comprising calcium.
5. The composition for use according to any of Claim 1 to 4, wherein the composition further comprises at least one compound selected from the group consisting of antioxidants, anti-inflammatory compounds, glycosaminoglycans, prebiotics, fibres, probiotics, fatty acids, enzymes, minerals, trace elements and/or vitamins.
6. The composition for use according to any of Claim 1 to 5, wherein the composition is selected from the group consisting of food compositions, dietary supple

title: Agents, compositions, and methods for supporting behavioural development
abstract: The present invention relates to one or more human milk oligosaccharides (HMOs) for use in supporting behavioural development in a subject, wherein the one or more HMOs comprise or consist of: (a) lacto-N-difucohexaose I (LNDFHI); and/or (b) 2'-fucosyllactose (2'FL), 3- fucosyllactose (3FL), lactodifucotetraose (LDFT), lacto-N-fucopentaose II (LNFPII), lacto-N- fucopentaose I (LNFP-I), lacto-N-fucopentaose III (LNFP-III), lacto-N-difucohexaose I (LND- I), monofucosyl-lacto-N-hexaose III (MFLNH-III), lacto-N-fucopentaose V (LNFP-V), lacto-N- neodifucohexaose (LNnDFH) and lacto-N-fucopentaose VI (LNFP-VI).
claims:
1. One or more human milk oligosaccharides (HMOs) for use in supporting behavioural development in a subject, wherein the one or more HMOs comprise or consist of: (a) lacto-/V-difucohexaose I (LNDFHI); and/or (b) 2’-fucosyllactose (2’FL), 3-fucosyllactose (3FL), lactodifucotetraose (LDFT), lacto-/V-fucopentaose II (LNFPII), lacto-/V-fucopentaose I (LNFP-I), lacto-/V-fucopentaose III (LNFP-III), lacto-N-difucohexaose I (LND-I), monofucosyl-lacto-N-hexaose III (MFLNH-III), lacto-/V-fucopentaose V (LNFP-V), lacto-N-neodifucohexaose (LNnDFH) and lacto-/V-fucopentaose VI (LNFP-VI).
2. The one or more HMOs for use according to claim 1, wherein the one or more HMOs comprise or consist of LNDFHI.
3. The one or more HMOs for use according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the one or more HMOs comprise or consist of 2’FL, 3FL, LDFT, LNFPII, LNFP-I, LNFP-III, LND-I, MFLNH-III, LNFP-V, LNnDFH and LNFP-VI.
4. The one or more HMOs for use according to any preceding claim, wherein the one or more HMOs are administered by oral administration.
5. The one or more HMOs for use according to any preceding claim, wherein the one or more HMOs are administered separately, simultaneously or sequentially, preferably wherein the one or more HMOs are administered simultaneously.
6. The one or more HMOs for use according to any preceding claim, wherein the one or more HMOs are administ

title: Method for heating a preform and corresponding method for forming a container
abstract: A method for heating a preform (1) comprising a body portion (4) extending along a longitudinal axis (A1). The method comprises the following steps: —introducing the preform (1) into a heating apparatus (5) comprising an array of infrared emitters (50) arranged in multiple columns (Cj) and rows (Ri); —setting power levels of the infrared emitters (50) so as to divide said array into subsets of columns (SCn); and—heating the preform while translating it in a direction parallel to the rows (Ri), and simultaneously rotating it around its longitudinal axis, the rotation and translation speeds, and the power levels of the infrared emitters (50) being set so that the power levels of the subsets of columns (SCn) facing zones (42) of the body portion extending longitudinally are different from the power levels of the subsets of columns facing the rest of the body portion, said zones extending relative to one another in a polygonal array.
claims:
1. A method for heating a preform for manufacturing a polygonal bottle from the preform, the preform comprising an open neck portion at a first end, a closed base portion at a second end, and a body portion extending along a longitudinal axis between the neck portion and the base portion, the method comprising the following steps:
introducing the preform into a heating apparatus comprising an array of infrared emitters arranged in multiple columns and multiple rows, the preform and the array being disposed such that the longitudinal axis and the columns of the array of infrared emitters are parallel or directed obliquely with respect to each other;
orienting angularly the preform at an input angular position by rotating the preform around the longitudinal axis;
setting power levels of the infrared emitters so as to divide the array of infrared emitters into subsets of columns, each subset of columns generating heat at a different power level from an adjacent subset of columns;
heating the preform with the array of infrared emitters while translating the preform in a direction parallel to the rows of the array at a translation speed, and simultaneously rotating the preform around the longitudinal axis in front of the infrared emitters at a rotation speed, and
the rotation speed, the translation speed, the input angular position, and the power levels of the infrared emitters being set so that the power levels of the subsets of columns facing at least three zones of the body portion extending longitudinally are different from the power levels of the subsets of columns facing the rest of the body portion

title: Nutritional composition comprising a lentil product
