title: Bottle for carbonated beverages having an improved petaloid base
abstract: A bottle for holding a carbonated beverage comprising a body and a base having a substantially hemispherical underlying geometrical form (S1) extending from the lower end of the body. The base comprising a petaloid foot formation having axial symmetry around the longitudinal axis (X) of the bottle and formed from a plurality of feet projecting downwards from the underlying geometrical form (S1 ) with valleys separating adjacent pairs of feet. Each valley having a bottom line (81) following substantially the underlying geometrical form (S1). The ratio between a maximum foot depth (F) being the maximum normal distance from the underlying geometrical form (S1 ) to a surface of a foot (S2) and a sitting radius being the radius of the largest circle formed by the points of contact with the feet and a flat surface (9) when the bottle is stood vertically on the flat surface, is 0.5 ±0.01.
claims:
1. A bottle (1) for holding a carbonated beverage comprising: a body (5); a base (6) extending from the lower end of the body (5), the base having a substantially hemispherical underlying geometrical form (S1), the base comprising: a plurality of feet (7) projecting downwards from the underlying geometrical form (S1); valleys (8) separating adjacent pairs of feet (7), each valley (8) having a bottom line (81) following substantially the underlying geometrical form (S1); the feet and valleys together forming a petaloid foot formation having axial symmetry around the longitudinal axis (X) of the bottle; a maximum foot depth (F) being the maximum normal distance from the underlying geometrical form (S1) to a surface of a foot (S2); a sitting radius (S) being the radius of the largest circle formed by the points of contact (10) with the feet and a flat surface (9) when the bottle is stood vertically on the flat surface; characterized in that the ratio between the maximum foot depth and the sitting radius is 0.5 ±0.01.
2. The bottle of claim 1 wherein the minimum radius of curvature of any part of the base (6) is 6.5 mm. 12
3. The bottle of claim 1 wherein the minimum radius of curvature of an

title: Capsule for the preparation of a beverage
abstract: A capsule for the preparation of a beverage in a beverage preparation device (10), comprising: a cup-shaped body (1), a cover (2) for closing the cup-shaped body (1), and an annular flange (3) for the cover (2) to seal thereon: wherein the cup-shaped body (1) comprises: a bottom wall (4), a tubular lateral wall (5) and the flange (3); wherein the bottom wall (4) comprises: at least a fluid injection portion (7), suitable for being pierced by a piercing member (12) of the beverage preparation device (10), and at least a surrounding portion (13A, 13B) surrounding said first fluid injection portion (7); wherein the cup-shaped body (1) comprises a cellulose pulp layer (14) made of cellulose pulp, and an oxygen barrier liner (15); wherein the stiffness of the cellulose pulp layer (14) of said fluid injection portion (7) is greater than the stiffness of the cellulose pulp layer (14) of said surrounding portion (13A, 13B); wherein said cellulose pulp layer (14) of the fluid injection portion (7) comprises ultrasonically stiffened cellulose pulp, and wherein the density of the ultrasonically stiffened cellulose pulp of the fluid injection portion (7) is increased with respect to the density of the cellulose pulp of said surrounding portion (13A, 13B).
claims:
1. A capsule for the preparation of a beverage in a beverage preparation device, comprising: a cup-shaped body, a cover for closing the cup-shaped body, and an annular flange for the cover to seal thereon;
wherein the cup-shaped body comprises: a bottom wall, a tubular lateral wall and the flange;
wherein the bottom wall comprises: at least a fluid injection portion, suitable for being pierced by a piercing member of the beverage preparation device, and at least a surrounding portion surrounding said first fluid injection portion;
wherein the cup-shaped body comprises a cellulose pulp layer made of cellulose pulp, and an oxygen barrier liner;
the stiffness of the cellulose pulp layer of said fluid injection portion is greater than the stiffness of the cellulose pulp layer of said surrounding portion,
said cellulose pulp layer of the fluid injection portion comprises ultrasonically stiffened cellulose pulp, and
wherein the density of the ultrasonically stiffened cellulose pulp of the fluid injection portion is increased with respect to the density of the cellulose pulp of said surrounding portion.
2. The capsule according to claim 1, wherein the difference between the density D1 of the fluid injection portion and the density D2 of the surrounding portions is a value comprised between 0.1% of D1 and 20% of D1, that is:
0.1% D1≤(D1−D2)≤20% D1.

title: Pet foods comprising gravy topping comprising methylcellulose and methods of making such pet foods
abstract: The invention relates to a system for preparing a multi-layered pet food comprising a container loading station, a first filler for dispensing a first layer comprising a first edible composition into the container, a heating unit comprising a heat source; a second filler for dispensing a second layer comprising a second edible composition into the container and on top of the first layer; a lid setting station; and a weighing station for weighing the container comprising the first layer and the second layer
claims:
1. A system for preparing a multi-layered pet food comprising: a container loading station; a first filler for dispensing a first layer comprising a first edible composition into the container; a heating unit comprising a heat source; a second filler for dispensing a second layer comprising a second edible composition into the container and on top of the first layer; lid setting station; a weighing station for weighing the container comprising the first layer and the second layer.
2. The system of Claim 1, wherein the heat source is an infrared heat source.
3. The system of Claim 1, wherein the system is a continuous production line
4. The system of Claim 1, further comprising a steamer or retorting station.
5. The system of Claim 1, further comprising a second weighing station positioned after the filling of the first layer and before the filling of the second layer.
6. The system of claim 1, wherein the heating unit is configured to heat the first edible composition in the container from a first temperature of about 10°C to about 26°C to a second temperature of about 30°C to about 70°C, wherein the first edible composition is a gravy.
7. The system of Claim 2, wherein the infrared heat source is configured to heat

title: Compositions comprising osteopontin (OPN)
abstract: The present invention relates to compositions comprising osteopontin (OPN) for the treatment and/or prevention of viral infections in mammals, such as humans, in particular infants, young children and pre-schoolers.
claims:
1. A method for the treatment and/or prevention of a viral infection in a mammal comprising administering a composition comprising osteopontin (OPN) to the mammal.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein said viral infection is a viral respiratory infection.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein said viral infection causes a disease selected from the group consisting of bronchitis, bronchiolitis and pneumonia.
4. (canceled)
5. The method according to claim 1, wherein the mammal has symptoms associated with the viral infection selected from the group consisting of irritation in the lungs, congestion in the lungs, excessive mucus production, fever, cough, wheezing, breathlessness, abdominal cramps, diarrhoea and vomiting.
6. The method according to claim 5, wherein symptoms associated with a viral infection are symptoms which are caused by the viral infection.
7. The method according to claim 1, wherein said infection is caused by respiratory syncytial virus (RSV).
8. The method according to claim 1, wherein said infection is caused by respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) and wherein said disease is bronchiolitis.
9. The method according to claim 1, wherein said mammal is a human.

title: Lactobacillus acidophilus to increase agmatine production by microbiota
abstract: Disclosed are probiotics, compositions and methods for producing agmatine using microbiota; and more particularly, isolated probiotics, compositions comprising the isolated probiotics, and methods for increasing production of agmatine and/or polyamines in the gastrointestinal tact of a subject, which provides to the subject certain health benefits, such as pain relief, antiaging effects, neuroprotective and antidepressant effects, improved vasodilatation and metabolic health, improved cellular health, decreased age-related memory loss, and/or longevity. The isolated probiotic is capable of colonizing and surviving in the gastrointestinal tract of the subject and capable of converting arginine to agmatine in the gastrointestinal tract of the subject.
claims:
1. A method for improving pain relief, antiaging effects, neuroprotective and antidepressant effects, improved vasodilatation and metabolic health, improved cellular health, and longevity, and/or reducing age-related memory loss of a subject in need thereof, the method comprising administering to the subject an effective amount of a composition comprising an isolated probiotic and arginine to increase production of agmatine in a gastrointestinal tract of the subject.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the isolated probiotic comprises a Lactobacillus acidophilus strain.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the isolated probiotic comprises a bacterial strain having at least 90%, preferably at least 95% sequence identity to a strain selected from the group consisting of Lactobacillus acidophilus NCC 2628 (CNCM I-2453), Lactobacillus acidophilus NCC 2766 (CNCM I-3848), Lactobacillus acidophilus NCC 2775 (CNCM I-3851), and Lactobacillus acidophilus NCC 2619 (ATCC 700396).
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the composition further comprises an ingredient selected from the group consisting of a starch source, a protein source, a prebiotic source, lipid source, vitamins, sugars, salt, spices, seasonings, minerals, flavoring agents, and combinations thereof.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the isolated probiotic comprises a Lactobacillus acidophilus strain selected from the group consisting of Lactobacillus acidophilus N

title: Prebiotics for treating and/or preventing vitamin k2 deficiency
abstract: The present invention relates to a prebiotic agent for use in treating and/or preventing vitamin K2 deficiency in a subject. The present invention relates to the use of a prebiotic agent to promote vitamin K2 production in the gut of a subject.

title: Manufacturing line for manufacturing a compostable pod for brewing products and system for measuring and regulating the relative humidity of a biodegradable paper-based material
abstract: A manufacturing line for manufacturing a compostable pod for brewing products, the pod made of two complementary portions. The manufacturing line includes at least one shaping line for shaping the complementary portions, and the shaping line includes: a handling unit for handling the sheet of biodegradable paper-based material with gas barrier biodegradable polymer; a humidifying unit for moistening at least one side of the sheet of biodegradable paper-based material; an optional pre-drying unit for drying, at least partially, the at least one side of the sheet of biodegradable paper-based material; a forming unit for shaping the sheet of biodegradable paper-based material into one of the complementary portions; and a drying unit for drying the at least one side of the sheet of biodegradable paper-based material forming one of the complementary portions.
claims:
1: A manufacturing line for manufacturing a compostable pod for brewing products, the compostable pod being made of complementary first and second half-shells respectively made from first and second sheets of biodegradable paper-based material, each sheet of biodegradable paper-based material including an inner side and an external side; the manufacturing line comprising:
a first shaping line configured for shaping the first half-shell and a second shaping line configured for shaping the second half-shell, each of the first and second shaping lines comprising:
a pre-drying unit configured for drying, at least, and at least partially, the external side of the sheet of biodegradable paper-based material;
a forming unit configured for shaping the sheet of biodegradable paper-based material into the half-shell having an internal side corresponding to the internal side of the sheet of biodegradable paper-based material and an external side corresponding to the external side of the sheet of biodegradable paper-based material;
a drying unit configured for drying the external side and/or the internal side of the half-shell; and
at least one humidity sensor for sensing a level of relative humidity of the biodegradable paper-based material forming the compostable pod at the external side of the compostable pod, the at least one humidity sensor being positioned before or after one of the pre-drying unit, the forming unit, and the drying unit.
2: A manufacturing line for manufacturing a compostable pod for brewing products, the compost

title: Infant nutritional composition for use in the enhancement of pancreatic maturation and insulin biosynthesis
abstract: This invention relates to nutritional compositions comprising at least one fucosylated oligosaccharide, preferably 2FL, for use in enhancing the pancreatic development and/or pancreatic maturation of infants, and/or the enhancement of the insulin biosynthesis and/or the prevention of metabolic disorder or associated diseases and/or glucose management during the nutritional intervention or later in life. The composition can be an infant formula. The composition can also comprise at least one N-acetylated oligosaccharide, preferably LnNT.
claims:
2019389456  19 Feb 2025 CLAIMS :
1.    A method of enhancing the pancreatic development and/or pancreatic
maturation of an infant or young child,
wherein the method comprises administering to the infant or young child a nutritional composition comprising at least one fucosylated oligosaccharide, wherein said infant or young child is a subject in need and/or is at risk of underdevelopment of pancreas and/or is born preterm and/or suffering from intrauterine-growth retardation (IUGR) and/or born with low birth weight (LBW), very-low-birth-weight (VLBW), or extremely-low-birth-weight (ELBW).
2.    The method of claim 1 wherein said at least one fucosylated
oligosaccharide is present in the composition in a total amount of between 0.053 g/L of the composition, and/or in a total amount of between 0.007-0.45 g/100g of composition on a dry weight basis.
3.    The method of claim 2 wherein said at least one fucosylated
oligosaccharide is present in the composition in a total amount of at least 0.2g/L or at least 0.5g/L of the composition and/or in a total amount of at least 0.03g/100g or at least 0.075g/100g of composition on a dry weight basis.
4.    The method of any one of the preceding claims wherein said fucosylated
oligosaccharide is 2FL.

title: Dairy product analogues comprising vinegar
abstract: Dairy product analogues with improved sensory properties are disclosed. The dairy product analogues comprise plant proteins and vinegar. Processes for preparing such dairy product analogues are also disclosed.

title: Beverage or foodstuff preparation system
abstract: A container for use with a beverage or foodstuff preparation machine, the container comprising: a storage portion for containing a precursor material; a code storing preparation information used by said machine to process the precursor material, the code readable by a code reading system of the machine, which comprises: a lighting system to project an emission of greater than 700 nm or 800 nm to the code, and a camera system for obtaining a digital image of the code operating with a wavelength of above or 700 nm or 800 nm, the code is arranged to absorb and/or reflect the emission for capturing in a digital image by said camera system, and; an information carrier layer comprising container information that is visible in visible wavelengths, and has comparatively low absorbance and/or reflectivity to said emission, wherein the information carrier layer is arranged in operative proximity to the code layer to conceal the code.
claims:
1. A container for use with a beverage or foodstuff preparation machine, the container comprising:
a storage portion for containing a precursor material;
a code for storing preparation information used by said machine to process the precursor material, the code configured to be readable by a code reading system of the machine, which comprises: a lighting system to project an emission of greater than 700 nm or 800 nm to the code, and a camera system for obtaining a digital image of the code operating with a wavelength of above or 700 nm or 800 nm, the code is arranged to absorb and/or reflect the emission for capturing in a digital image by said camera system, and;
an information carrier layer comprising container information that is visible in visible wavelengths and configured to be readable by a user, and has comparatively low absorbance and/or reflectivity to said emission,
wherein the information carrier layer is arranged in operative proximity to the code layer so that a positional arrangement of the information carrying layer and code is such that the code is concealed or partly concealed by the information carrying layer, reducing the visibility of the code in the visible wavelengths compared to the code being present without the information carrying layer.
2. The container of claim 1, wherein the information carrier layer has an absorbance to the emission of less than 20% and a reflectivity of less than 30% to said emission.
3. The container of either of claims 1 or 2, wherein:

title: Dietary butyric acid compounds for treatment or prevention of allergic diseases
abstract: Compounds or combinations thereof having the formula: # imgabs0 # wherein R1, R2, R3, R4, R5 and R6 are independently long chain fatty acids having 16 to 20 carbons for use in the treatment or prevention of allergic diseases.
claims:
1.用于治疗或预防变态反应性疾病的具有下式的化合物或其组合：
其中R1、R2、R3、R4、R5和R6独立地为具有16至20个碳的长链脂肪酸。
2.用于治疗或预防变态反应性疾病的包含具有下式的化合物或其组合的组合物：
其中R1、R2、R3、R4、R5和R6独立地为具有16至20个碳的长链脂肪酸。

4.根据权利要求2或权利要求3所述用于所述用途的组合物，其中所述具有式(1)的化合物、所述具有式(2)的化合物、所述具有式(3)的化合物和所述具有式(4)的化合物占所述组合物中总甘油三酯的至少50重量％、60重量％、70重量％、80重量％、90重量％、95重量％或99重量％。
5.根据权利要求1所述用于所述用途的组合物，所述组合物包含所述具有式(4)的化合物作为所述组合物中主要的含丁酸结构部分的甘油三酯，其中所述具有式(4)的化合物占所述组合物中含丁酸结构部分的甘油三酯的至少20重量％、至少30重量％、至少40重量％、至少50重量％、或至少60重量％、至少70重量％、至少80重量％或至少90重量％。

7.根据权利要求2至6中任一项所述用于所述用途的组合物，其中甘油三丁酸酯占所述组合物中总甘油三酯的小于10重量％，优选地小于8重量％，更优选地占所述组合物中总甘油三酯的小于5重量％。
8.根据权利要求2至7中任一项所述用于所述用途的组合物，其中所述组合物还包含维生素A和/或膳食纤维。
9.根据权利要求2至8中任一项所述用于所述用途的组合物，其中所述组合物是营养组合物，优选地其中所述营养组合物是膳食补充剂、婴儿配方食品、较大婴儿配方食品、饮料或宠物护理产品。
10.根据权利要求1所述用于所述用途的化合物或其组合，或根据权利要求2至9中任一项所述用于所述用途的组合物，其中R1、R2、R3、R4、R5和/或R6为不饱和脂肪酸，优选地为单不饱和的。

title: Beverage preparation machine with manually operated pump with flow control means
abstract: The invention relates to a beverage preparation machine (20) for providing a pressurized liquid to a dose of beverage ingredients (10) such as a coffee capsule, the machine comprising a pressurizing liquid chamber (1) designed for being filled with a predefined amount of liquid upon operation of a liquid pump (2) connected to a liquid reservoir (3) of the machine, a potential energy accumulator (4) that is associated to the pressurizing liquid chamber (1) and which is designed for being brought into a charged position upon filling of the pressurizing liquid chamber (1), a brewing chamber (5) for receiving the dose of beverage ingredients (10) and which is designed for being selectively brought in fluid communication with the pressurizing liquid chamber (1), the machine (20) further comprising flow control means (6a,6b) designed for regulating the amount of liquid conveyed from the liquid pump (2) into the pressurizing liquid chamber (1) depending on an operating position of the potential energy accumulator (4) and/or on the pressure of liquid in the pressurizing chamber (1).

title: Promoting butyrate-producing bacteria in the gut microbiome
abstract: The present invention relates to a bifidogenic prebiotic for use in promoting butyrate-producing bacteria in the gut microbiome of an infant or young child; wherein the bifidogenic prebiotic is administered to the infant prior to about 12 months of age; and the butyrate-producing bacteria are promoted in the gut microbiome of the infant or young child between about 1 and 5 years of age.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A bifidogenic prebiotic for use in promoting butyrate-producing bacteria in the gut microbiome of an infant or young child; wherein the bifidogenic prebiotic is administered to the infant prior to about 12 months of age; and the butyrate-producing bacteria are promoted in the gut microbiome of the infant or young child between about 1 and 5 years of age.
2. A Bifidobacterium microorganism for use in promoting butyrate-producing bacteria in the gut microbiome of an infant or young child; wherein the Bifidobacterium is administered to the infant prior to about 12 months of age; and the butyrate-producing bacteria are promoted in the gut microbiome of the infant or young child between about 1 and 5 years of age.
3. A combination of a bifidogenic prebiotic and a Bifidobacterium microorganism for use in promoting butyrate-producing bacteria in the gut microbiome of an infant or young child wherein the combination is administered to the infant prior to about 12 months of age; and the butyrate-producing bacteria are promoted in the gut microbiome of the infant or young child between about 1 and 5 years of age.
4. A bifidogenic prebiotic, Bifidobacterium microorganism or a combination for use according to any preceding claim wherein levels of butyrate are increased in the gut microbiome of the infant or young child between about 1 and 5 years of age.
5. A bifidogenic prebiotic, Bifidobacterium microorganism or a combination for use according to any preceding claim wherein

title: Structured confectionery product
abstract: The present invention relates to a filled confectionery product comprising a cocoa-based shell and backing layer surrounding a fat-based confectionery filling, wherein the filled confectionery product has a total saturated fat content less than 6% and a total sugar content of less than 3.4%; and wherein the combined saturated fat content of the shell and backing layer comprise greater than 50% of the total saturated fat fraction in the filled confectionery product.
claims:
Claims
1 A filled confectionery product comprising a cocoa-based shell and backing layer surrounding a fat-based confectionery filling, wherein the filled confectionery product has a total saturated fat content less than 6% and a total sugar content of less than 3.4%; and wherein the combined saturated fat content of the shell and backing layer comprise greater than 50% of the total saturated fat fraction in the filled confectionery product.
2 The filled confectionery product according to claim 1 , wherein the combined saturated fat content of the shell and backing layer comprise more than 75% of the total saturated fat fraction in the filled confectionery product.
3 The filled confectionery product according to any one of claims 1 and 2, wherein the shell has a saturated fat content of not less than 10%, preferably between 10 to 15%, when expressed as a percentage by weight of shell.
4 The filled confectionery product according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the backing layer has a saturated fat content of not less than 5%, preferably between 5 to 10%, when expressed as a percentage by weight of backing layer.
5 The filled confectionery product according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the filling has a saturated fat content of not more than 3%, when expressed as a percentage by weight of filling.
6 The filled confectionery product according to any one of claims 1 to 5, wherein the filling comprises not less t

title: Method of roasting coffee beans
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: group of inventions relates to coffee industry. Disclosed is a method of roasting coffee beans in a room, comprising obtaining, when performing at least one roasting operation, the required roasting input data for said at least one roasting operation with said required input data, obtaining access to information on a room and a roasting device for coffee beans, as well as before initiating at least one roasting operation: determining the concentration of each contaminant formed in the room during said at least one roasting operation, for each pollutant comparing a certain concentration of said pollutant formed in the room, with concentration of said pollutant permitted in accordance with local health and safety standards and depending on whether the concentration of each pollutant is lower or higher than the permitted concentration, performing at least or displaying a hazard warning. Also disclosed is a system for roasting coffee beans in a room and a machine-readable data medium containing instructions for controlling and implementing the method of roasting coffee beans.EFFECT: group of inventions enables to predict and ensure safe operation of the roasting system in a room in accordance with health and safety standards.20 cl, 8 dwg
claims:
1. Способ обжаривания кофейных зерен в помещении (100) с использованием системы (10) обжаривания, причем упомянутая система обжаривания содержит:
- устройство (2) для обжаривания, и
при этом при реализации по меньшей мере одной операции обжаривания упомянутый способ включает в себя следующие стадии:
- получение требуемых входных данных обжаривания для упомянутой по меньшей мере одной операции обжаривания, при этом упомянутые требуемые входные данные определяют по меньшей мере:
тип обжариваемых кофейных зерен,
количество обжариваемых кофейных зерен за одну операцию обжаривания или в течение периода времени,
степень обжаривания, применимую для зерен,
и
- получение доступа к:
- информации о помещении, причем упомянутая информация о помещении включает в себя по меньшей мере: местные нормы в области здравоохранения и безопасности, объем помещения и интенсивность вентиляции упомянутого помещения,
- информации об устройстве для обжаривания кофейных зерен, причем упомянутая информация об устройстве для обжаривания включает в себя по меньшей мере количество каждого загрязняющего вещества, вырабатываемого устройством для обжаривания в процессе обжаривания конкретного количества кофейных зерен определенного типа до определенной степени обжаривания,
и
- перед инициированием по меньшей мере одной операции обжаривания:
определение концентрации каждого загрязняющего вещества, образующегося в помещении во время упомянутой по меньшей мере одной операции обжаривания, из полученных требуемых входных данных обжаривания и доступной информации об устройстве для обжаривания кофейных зерен и помещении,
для каждого загрязняющего вещества сравнение определенной концентрации упомянутого загрязняющего вещества, образующегося в помещении, с концентрацией упомянутого загрязняющего вещества, разрешенной в соответствии с местными нормами в области здравоохранения и безопасности,
выполнение по меньшей мере одной операции обжаривания, если для каждого загрязняющего вещества определенная концентрация

title: System and method for manufacturing a compostable pod for beverage preparation from a paper-based material
abstract: The invention relates to a system (100) for manufacturing a compostable pod (900) for brewing products. Therein, the pod (900) is made from a sheet (600) made of a biodegradable cellulose-based material. The system (100) comprises at least one shaping line (200), which comprises a handling unit (300) for transferring the sheet (600) along a transfer direction (TD) through the system (100). The shaping line (200) further comprises a humidifying unit (400) for moistening at least one side of the sheet (600) with a moistening agent (401), and a forming unit (800) for shaping a part of the moistened sheet (600) into a three-dimensional shape to form a pod element (910), which defines a pod cavity (911). The part (642) is located between opposite, with respect to the transfer direction (TD), lateral side edge sections (631, 632) of the sheet (600). The shaping line (200) comprises further a lateral drying unit (500) arranged to dry the opposite lateral side edge sections (631, 632) of the moistened sheet (641), while keeping at least the part (642) to be shaped moistened. Therein, the lateral drying unit (500) is arranged downstream of the humidifying unit (400) and upstream of the forming unit (800). The invention also relates to a method for manufacturing a compostable pod (900), wherein, before shaping the part (642) of the moistened sheet (641), said opposite lateral side edge sections (631, 632) of the moistened sheet (641) are dried while at least the part (642) to be shaped is kept moistened.
claims:
1. System (100) for manufacturing a compostable pod (900) for brewing products from a sheet (600) made of a cellulose-based material, preferably biodegradable, the system (100) comprising at least one shaping line (200), which comprises: • a handling unit (300) for transferring the sheet (600) along a transfer direction (TD) through the system (100); • a humidifying unit (400) for moistening at least one side of the sheet (600) with a moistening agent (401); and • a forming unit (800) for shaping a part (642) of the moistened sheet (641), which part (642) is located between opposite, with respect to the transfer direction (TD), lateral side edge sections (631, 632) of the sheet (600), into a three-dimensional shape to form a pod element (910) defining a pod cavity (911); wherein the at least one shaping line (200) further comprises: • a lateral drying unit (500) arranged to dry the opposite lateral side edge sections (631,632) of the moistened sheet (641), while keeping at least the part (642) to be shaped moistened, downstream of the humidifying unit (400) and upstream of the forming unit (800).
2. System (100) according to claim 1, wherein the handling unit (300) comprises clamping elements (310), and wherein the clamping elements (310) are configured to clamp the sheet (600), with respect to the transfer direction (TD), at the opposite lateral side edge sections (631, 632) of the sheet (600).
3. System (100) according to claim 2, wherein the clamping elements (310) are movable along the transfer direction (TD), and wherein the cl

title: Beverage or food preparation system
abstract: A container for use with a beverage or food preparation machine, the container comprising: a storage portion for containing a precursor material; a code storing preparation information used by the machine to process the precursor material, the code being readable by a code reading system of the machine, the code reading system comprising: an illumination system for projecting emitted light to the code; and a camera system for obtaining a digital image of a code, the code being arranged to overlap with the precursor material; and a support layer supporting the code, the support layer being at least partially light transmissive to emitted light from the illumination system, where the code comprises a reflective layer configured to reflect the emitted light before the emitted light is transmitted to the support layer, and the precursor material is arranged to absorb the emitted light.
claims:
1.一种用于与饮料或食品制备机器一起使用的容器，所述容器包括：
储存部分，所述储存部分用于容纳前体材料；
代码，所述代码用于存储由所述机器用来处理所述前体材料的制备信息，所述代码被配置为能够由所述机器的代码读取系统读取，所述代码读取系统包括照明系统，所述照明系统用于将发射光投射到所述代码，所述代码被布置成与所述前体材料重叠，使得来自所述照明系统的发射光投射到所述前体材料中；
所述代码包括被配置为反射所述发射光的反射层，
所述容器进一步包括支撑所述代码的支撑层，所述支撑层由对来自所述照明系统的所述发射光至少部分透明的材料制成，
其中所述反射层被配置为在所述发射光被透射到支撑层之前反射所述发射光，并且所述前体材料被布置成吸收所述发射光。
2.根据权利要求1所述的容器，其中，所述前体材料能够吸收来自所述照明系统的所述发射光的至少60％。
3.根据权利要求1或2中任一项所述的容器，其中：所述前体材料包括研磨咖啡。
4.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中，所述反射层被配置为漫反射所述发射光，对所述发射光的反射率为至少70％。
5.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中，所述反射层由不包含炭黑的一种或多种油墨形成，并且所述前体材料包含炭黑。
6.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中，光源的所述发射光具有大于700nm或800nm的波长，并且相机系统被布置成感测所述波长的光。
7.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中，所述容器的包括所述支撑层和所述代码的部分被配置为当每个穿透器受到大于5N至15N的力时能够被一个或多个穿透器穿透，每个穿透器具有成70度至30度的尖端。
8.根据权利要求7所述的容器，其中，所述支撑层具有50微米至150微米的厚度。
9.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中：

title: Fermented verbena beverage
A process for preparing a meat analogue product
abstract: The present invention relates to a process for preparing a meat analogue product comprising a textured plant protein, water, a binder, an oil-soluble flavor, an aqueous-soluble flavor and optionally a colorant, wherein the oil-based flavor is encapsulated with a vegetable fat and wherein the vegetable fat has a solid fat content in the range of 30 to 90 wt % (based on the weight of total fat) at a temperature of 30° C.
claims:
1. A process for the preparation of a meat analogue product comprising a textured plant protein, water, a binder, an oil-soluble flavor, an aqueous-soluble flavor comprising the steps of: a) mixing the textured plant protein with water; b) adding the binder, and the aqueous-soluble flavor to the mix of step a); c) encapsulation of the oil-soluble flavor with a vegetable fat and adding the encapsulated flavor after step b) and further mix; and wherein the the encapsulated flavor has a particle size between 10 to 500 microns and wherein the vegetable fat has a solid fat content in the range of 30 to 90 wt % (based on the weight of total fat) at a temperature of 30° C.
2. The process for the preparation of a meat analogue product according to claim 1, which does not comprise an ingredient from an animal origin.
3. The process for the preparation of a meat analogue product according to claim 1, wherein the textured plant protein is selected from the group consisting of soy bean protein, pea protein, lentil protein, lupin bean protein, wheat gluten, and a combination thereof.
4. The process for the preparation of a meat analogue product according to claim 1, wherein the textured plant protein is in an amount of between 5 to 70 wt % (weight percent of the total composition).
5. The process for the preparation of a meat analogue product according to claim 1, wherein the meat analogue product is a

title: Process for an instant oil fried noodle
abstract: The present invention relates to a process for the production of an instant oil fried noodle. The oil used for frying the instant noodle comprises the fatty acids C16:0 in the range of 1 to 25 wt% (based on weight of total fat) and C18:1 in the range of 60 to 90 wt% (based on weight of total fat) and C18:2 in the range of 0.1 to 20 wt% (based on weight of total fat).
claims:
1.    A process for the production of an instant fried noodle comprising flour, Kansui 5              salts, oil, and optionally wheat gluten, the process comprising the steps of: a) Mixing the flour and other dry ingredients with the Kansui salts to form an uniform dough; b) Sheeting and slitting the dough to obtain noodle strands; c) Steaming the noodle strands from step b); 0                 d) Optionally seasoning; e) Cutting and folding the noodle strands from steps c) or d); f) Pre-drying to remove moisture before frying; g) Frying in the oil; h) Cooling, 15              wherein the oil comprises the fatty acids C16:0 in the range of 1 to 25 wt% based on weight of total fat and C18:1 in the range of 60 to 90 wt% based on weight of total fat and C18:2 in the range of 0.1 to 20 wt% based on weight of total fat, wherein the oil is a high oleic sunflower oil and wherein the kansui salts are dissolved in water to obtain a kansui solution and wherein the kansui solution 20              comprises a mixture of 3 to 7wt% of alkaline salts selected from the group of sodium carbonate, potassium carbonate and sodium phosphate based on the total amount of the solution in 93 to 97wt% of water based on the total amount of the solution. 25      
2.      A process for the production of an instant fried noodle as claimed in claim 1,

title: Molded pulp cover
abstract: The present invention relates to a removable lid (100) for closing an opening (211) of a container (210) for containing a food product (220) in an attachment direction (190), whereby the container (210) has a circumferential rim portion (212) surrounding the opening (211). The cover (100) is composed of two or more separate cover parts (101, 102) which are each integrally made by molding pulp and which are complementary to each other to form the cover (100). The lid (100) comprises: a closure portion (110) for covering the container opening (211); a skirt portion (120) extending from the cap portion (110) to circumferentially define, with the cap portion (110), a receiving space (105) for receiving the rim portion (212) inside the cap (100) when the opening (211) is closed with the cap (100); and a fastening structure (140) for providing a profile-closed and/or force-closed connection. The fastening structure (140) projects laterally from a lateral inner side (121) of the skirt portion (120) in a direction transverse to the attachment direction (190) towards and into the receiving space (105). Wherein at least two of the cover parts (101, 102) each comprise at least one section of the fastening structure (140). The invention also relates to a system (200) for storing a food product (220), comprising said removable lid (100) and a container (210) for a food product.
claims:
1.一种可移除盖（100），所述可移除盖用于在附接方向（190）上封闭用于容纳食物产品（220）的容器（210）的开口（211），所述容器（210）具有围绕所述开口（211）的周向边沿部分（212），
其中所述盖（100）由两个或更多个单独的且连接的盖部件（101, 102）组成，所述两个或更多个单独的且连接的盖部件分别通过模制纸浆一体地制成并且彼此互补以形成所述盖（100），
其中所述盖（100）包括：
-封盖部分（110），所述封盖部分具有用于覆盖所述容器（210）的所述开口（211）的上表面（111），
-裙部部分（120），所述裙部部分从所述封盖部分（110）延伸以与所述封盖部分（110）一起周向地界定接纳空间（105），所述接纳空间用于在利用所述盖（100）封闭所述开口（211）时在所述盖（100）内侧接纳所述边沿部分（212），和
-紧固结构（140），所述紧固结构用于提供外形封闭和/或力封闭连接，其中所述紧固结构（140）从所述裙部部分（120）的侧向内侧（121）在横向于所述附接方向（190）的方向上朝向所述接纳空间（105）侧向突出并进入所述接纳空间中，
其中所述盖部件（101, 102）中的至少两个盖部件各自包括所述紧固结构（140）的至少一个区段。
2.根据权利要求1所述的盖（100），其中所述盖（100）包括至少一个分型线和/或分型面（180），所述至少一个分型线和/或分型面至少部分地在邻接的盖部件（101, 102）之间延伸和/或穿过单独的盖部件（101, 102）之间的物理边界，并且
其中优选地，所述分型线和/或分型面（180）与所述上表面（111）的中心相交，或者与所述封盖部分（110）和所述裙部部分（120）的至少一个区段相交，并且/或者
其中优选地，所述分型面（180）界定所述盖部件（101, 102）中的每个盖部件，使得相应的盖部件（101, 102）在垂直于所述分型面（180）的方向上的任何横截面包括在界定所述接纳空间（105）的内侧上的几何结构，而没有底切或负拔模角。
3.根据权利要求1或权利要求2所述的盖（100），其中所述紧固结构（140）包括一个或多个紧固元件（141），诸如内螺纹和/或卡扣配合连接器，其中优选地，所述盖部件（101, 102）中的每个盖部件包括所述紧固元件（141）中的至少一个紧固元件或一个区段，并且
其中所述紧固元件（141）沿着所述裙部部分（120）的周向部分地或间歇地延伸，并且/或者
其中所述紧固元件（141）优选地围绕所述裙部部分（120）的周向均匀地分布，并且/或者
其中所述紧固元件（141）作为一个或多个相对的对设置在所述侧向内侧（121）上，所述一个或多个相对的对相对于所述接纳空间（105）布置在相对侧上和/或优选地相对于所述分型线和/或分型面（180）布置在相对侧上。
4.根据前述权利

title: Adaptive service unit of a beverage machine
abstract: A machine (1) for preparing a beverage has: a body (1′) comprising a seat (4) and a beverage processing line (1″, 1″′) extending from a liquid inlet (1″) to a beverage dispenser (1″′); and a service unit (10) that is removably received in or on the seat (4) and that comprises a foot part (11) and a recipient part (12) removably received in or on the foot part (11) so as to be supported thereby. The foot part (11) has a bottom face (11′) configured to rest on an external horizontal support surface (100) when the service unit (10) is removed from the seat (4). When the recipient part (12) is received in or on the foot part (11), the recipient part (12) is movable relative to the foot part (11) from a first stable position when the service unit (10) rests on the external horizontal support surface (100) to a second stable position when the service unit (10) is received in or on the seat (4), and vice versa.
claims:
1. A machine for preparing a beverage, the machine comprising: a body comprising a seat and a beverage processing line extending from a liquid inlet to a beverage dispenser; and a service unit configured to be removably received in the seat, wherein the service unit comprises a first part and a second removably received in the first part so as to be supported thereby, the first part having a bottom face such that, when the service unit is not received in the seat, the first part is configured to rest on an external horizontal support surface, and wherein the second configured to store un-used beverage ingredient, beverage liquid, cleaning fluid to be supplied to the beverage processing line, used beverage ingredient, waste beverage liquid, or used cleaning fluid collected from the beverage processing line, wherein, when the second part is received in the first part, the second part is movable relative to the first part between a first position when the service unit rests on the external horizontal support surface and a second position when the service unit is received the seat, the first and second positions being different.
2. The machine of claim 1, wherein the second part is moved into: the first position by gravity force onto the part and/or a biasing element; and/or the second position by mechanical resistance of the seat when the second part is urged against a body part delimiting the seat while the service unit is being moved into the seat.
3. The machine of claim 1, wherein, when the first part of the service unit rests on the extern

title: Polymorphs and compositions comprising same
abstract: Provided herein are crystalline forms of D-beta-hydroxybutyrate (D-BHB) and composition comprising one or more crystalline forms of D-BHB.
claims:

title: Mixture of hmos and bifidobacteria
abstract: The invention relates to a composition for infants or young children comprising at least one probiotic bacterial strain, said probiotic bacterial strain being bifidobacteria and a prebiotic mixture of human milk oligosaccharides consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2FL), lactodifucotetraose/difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), 3'- sialyllactose (SSL) and optionally 3-fucosyllactose (3FL) that can be useful for (i) preventing and/or treating bacterial infections; (ii) modulating the microbiota; and/or iii) preventing and/or treating allergy in an infant or a young child.
claims:
1. A composition for infants or young children comprising at least one probiotic bacterial strain, said probiotic bacterial strain being bifidobacteria, and a prebiotic oligosaccharides mixture consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2FL), lactodifucotetraose/difucosyllactose (DFL), 5 lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), and 3'-sialyllactose (3SL) and optionally 3-fucosyllactose (3FL);
wherein the bifidobacteria comprises Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis or combination of Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis and Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis;
wherein at least one of the bifidobacteria is Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis LMG 11588 .0 or a strain having an Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI) of at least 99.9% with this strain.
2. The composition of claim 1, wherein the bifidobacteria comprises Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis and the prebiotic oligosaccharides mixture consists of 2'-fucosyllactose (2FL), lactodifucotetraose/difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), and .5 3'-sialyllactose (3SL).
3. The composition of claim 1, wherein the bifidobacteria is a combination of Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis and Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis and the prebiotic oligosaccharides mixture consists of 2'-fucosyllactose (2FL), :o lactodifucotetraose/difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), and 3’-sialyllactose (3SL).
4. The composition of any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein

title: Method for determining the distinctive nutritional requirements of a patient
abstract: The present invention relates to a method for determining the distinctive nutritional requirements of a patient with specific nutritional needs and providing a composition meeting the distinctive nutritional requirements of said patient.
claims:
﻿ 30 Claims
1. An in vitro method for determining the distinctive disease related nutritional requirements of a subject suffering from a disease characterized by distinctive nutritional requirements in the diseased subject over a healthy subject comprising the steps: a. Determining in a sample of the subject suffering from the disease a profile of statuses of direct and indirect markers indicating the nutritional profile of said subject, wherein direct markers indicate the amount of a macronutrient or micronutrient, and indirect markers are derived from direct markers, wherein the status of the direct marker is measured by quantifying the direct marker and the status of the indirect marker is measured by quantifying a further marker or markers indicating the status of the direct marker, and wherein the direct and indirect markers comprise threonine, a metabolite of threonine, an essential amino acid other than threonine, and a metabolite of the essential amino acid other than threonine, b. Determining in a sample of the healthy subject a profile of the statuses of the same markers determined in step a, c. Comparing the profiles determined in step a. and b., and thereby determining the distinctive nutritional requirements for nutrients in a patient suffering from the disease, wherein the nutrients are macronutrients and micronutrients, and wherein the disease is inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the macronutrients are selected from the group consisting of proteins, amino acids, fats, and carbohydrates, or wherein the micronutrients are selected from the group of vitamins and elements.
3. The method

title: Peanut oral immunotherapy with maintenance dose
abstract: The present disclosure relates to improved oral immunotherapy methods for treating peanut allergy. The disclosure provides methods for treating a subject for a peanut allergy by an oral immunotherapy comprising an up-dosing phase and a maintenance phase. In certain embodiments, the methods comprise non-daily administration to the subject of a maintenance phase dose. In certain embodiments, the methods comprise administering a maintenance phase dose for more than 24 weeks. In other embodiments, the disclosure provides methods for reducing the risk of an allergic adverse event in a subject receiving an oral immunotherapy dosage therapy.
claims:
1. A method of treating a subject for a peanut allergy by an oral immunotherapy comprising an up-dosing phase and a maintenance phase, the method comprising: (a) administering to the subject the up-dosing phase; (b) administering to the subject a maintenance phase dose for more than 24 weeks; (c) testing the subject for a highest tolerated peanut protein dose by an oral food challenge; (d) selecting a subject for additional maintenance phase dosing based on the subject tolerating a maximum dose of less than 1,000 mg peanut protein; and (e) continuing to administer to the selected subject the maintenance phase dose; wherein the maintenance phase dose comprises 300 mg of peanut protein.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the maintenance phase dose is administered to the selected subject for at least 4 additional weeks.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the selecting a subject for additional maintenance phase dosing is further based on the subject tolerating a cumulative dose of less than 4,043 mg of peanut protein.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the maintenance phase dose comprises 300 mg or more of peanut protein.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the subject is 12 months old or older.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the subject is 4 years old or older.

title: Compostable pod for beverage preparation
abstract: said delivery portion being adapted to interact with external opening elements of the beverage production machine under the effect of rising pressure of the fluid being injected into the pod
claims:
1. 一種用於在飲料生產機器中製備飲料的囊包(100, 200)，其中該囊包(100, 200)係由生物可降解材料組成物，較佳地可堆肥材料組成物製成，且該囊包包括囊包本體(110)，該囊包本體由兩個半殼(101, 102)組成，該兩個半殼沿著其等各別周向凸緣(140)彼此連接以定界用於含有用於製備該飲料之物質(105)的腔室(103)，其中至少一個半殼以分層方式包括： ●     一級層(171)，其由紙基材料製成， ●     二級層(172)，其包括至少一氧障壁功能及/或水蒸汽或濕氣障壁功能，及 ●    至少部分三級層(173)，其包括過濾器功能， 其中該半殼(101, 102)之至少一者的該一級層(171)包括在該半殼(101, 102)之至少一遞送部分(130)上的至少一個貫穿孔(106)，該遞送部分經調適以在該流體通過另一半殼(101, 102)上的注入部分(120)注入至該囊包(100, 200)中的上升壓力的影響下與該飲料生產機器之外部開啟元件相互作用，以施配來自該囊包(100, 200)之經製備飲料。
2. 如請求項1之囊包(100, 200)，其中該一級層(171)包括形成第一圖案(108)之介於1個與150個之間的貫穿孔(106)。
3. 如請求項1或2之囊包(100, 200)，其中該一級層(171)進一步包括至少一不貫穿元件，較佳地一刻印表面及/或刻痕，其形成第二圖案(I, CE)。
4. 如前述請求項中任一項之囊包(100, 200)，其中該第一及/或第二圖案(108, I, CE)將呈標誌、商標、產品名稱、區別符號、裝飾元素、或其組合之形式的獨特資訊(I)及/或一或多個編碼元素(CE)形成或表示至在該遞送部分(130)之位置處及可選地在該注入部分(120)之位置處的該一級層(171)之外部表面上。
5. 如前述請求項中任一項之囊包(100, 200)，其中該一級層(171)係由生物可降解紙基材料，較佳地可堆肥紙基材料製成，其係選自包括紙、超級壓光紙(supercalendered paper)、濾紙、及其組合的群組，且具有包括在50 g/m 2與200 g/m 2之間，較佳地在80 g/m 2與120 g/m 2之間的克數。
6. 如前述請求項中任一項之囊包(100,200)，其中該一級層(171)係由可拉伸及/或可成形的紙基材料製成，其具有至少6%的斷裂伸長率。
7. 如前述請求項中任一項之囊包(100,200)，其中該一級層(171)係相對於該二級層(172)而與該腔室(103)對向配置，且該三級層(173)係相對於該二級層(172)而面向該腔室(103)配置。
8. 如前述請求項中任一項之囊包(100, 200)，其中該二級層(172)係生物可降解，較佳地可堆肥，且包括連續塗層或多層可堆肥膜結構， 其中較佳地，該塗層或該多層可堆肥塑膠結構包括以下之一或多者： -      聚乳酸衍生聚合物(Polylactic acid derived polymer, PLA)層、 -      聚丁二酸丁二醇酯(Polybutylene succinate, PBS)層、 -      聚己二酸對苯二甲酸丁二酯(Polybutylene adipate terephthalate, PBAT)層、 -      聚羥基烷酸酯(Polyhydroxy alkanoate, PHA)層、 -      聚己內酯(Polycaprolactone, PCL)層、或 -      其任何組合。

title: Beverage or foodstuff preparation system
abstract: A container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof, the container including a machine-readable code storing preparation information for use with a preparation process performed by said machine, the code comprising: a reference portion (R) to locate the code; a data portion (D) to store the preparation information, wherein data portion includes first and second partially overlapping predetermined positions, which encode three conditions as: an absence of a data unit at both positions; a presence of a data unit at the first position and an absence of a data unit at the second position, and; a presence of a data unit at the second position and an absence of a data unit at the first position.

title: Use of milk protein fractions as a source of osteopontin
abstract: The present invention relates to the use of specific milk protein fractions as a source of osteopontin, and to the use of said milk protein fractions to optimise the osteopontin concentration in a synthetic nutritional composition for an infant or child. The invention further relates to the use of said synthetic nutritional composition for an infant or child to support and/or optimise growth and development, immune response, galactose metabolism and cytoskeleton remodeling. The invention also relates to a low-protein synthetic nutritional composition for an infant or child comprising the milk protein fractions.
claims:
1. A method for producing a milk protein fraction as a source of osteopontin (OPN) in a synthetic nutritional composition for an infant or child comprising: i) providing a liquid lactic raw material ii) decationization of the liquid lactic raw material, such that the pH has a value of 1 to 4.5, iii) bringing the said liquid into contact with a weak anionic resin of hydrophobic matrix, predominantly in alkaline form up to a stabilized pH, iv) separation of the resin and the liquid product which is recovered, v) desorption of CGMP from the resin, vi) performing at least one ultrafiltration step, and vii) collecting the permeate and/or retentate fraction rich in OPN.
2. Method of claim 1, wherein the steps v-vi is performed under pH ranging from 4 to 8.
3. Method of claim 2, wherein the ion balance is further modified by calcium or phosphate addition.
4. Method of claim 1, wherein the ultrafiltration step is performed using membrane size between preferably 30 to 100 KDa.
5. Method of claim 1, wherein said milk protein is added to said composition in an effective amount sufficient to ensure that said synthetic nutritional composition has a final concentration of osteopontin in a range found in human breast milk.
6. A method for providing nutrition to an infant or child comprising admin

title: Heat-treated beverage containing fluid gel
abstract: The present invention relates to a heat-treated beverage containing a fluid gel comprising particles formed from gellan gum and a divalent cation, in particular calcium. The fluid gel beverage is surprisingly thermally stable and maintains suspension properties after heat treatment including UHT (ultra-high temperature) heat treatment.
claims:
1.包含流体凝胶的热处理饮料，所述流体凝胶包含由结冷胶和二价阳离子形成的颗粒，其中基于所述饮料的总重量，所述二价阳离子以0.001重量％至0.1重量％存在。
2.根据权利要求1所述的热处理饮料，其中包含由结冷胶和所述二价阳离子形成的颗粒的所述流体凝胶在热处理之前和之后都存在。
3.根据权利要求1或权利要求2所述的热处理饮料，其中基于所述饮料的所述总重量，所述饮料中结冷胶的量为0.05重量％至0.5重量％，优选地0.05重量％至0.11重量％。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的热处理饮料，其中所述流体凝胶中由结冷胶和二价阳离子形成的所述颗粒具有10μm至1000μm、诸如20μm至500μm、优选地30μm至100μm的粒度。
5.根据权利要求1至4中任一项所述的热处理饮料，其中所述饮料具有至少4、优选地4至7的pH。
6.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的热处理饮料，其中所述饮料具有在0.1 1/s的剪切速率下测量的在100mPa.s至15,000mPa.s、诸如1,000mPa.s至10,000mPa.s范围内的粘度。
7.根据权利要求1至6中任一项所述的热处理饮料，其中所述饮料具有在100 1/s的剪切速率下测量的在1mPa.s至1000mPa.s、诸如10mPa.s至1000mPa.s范围内的粘度。
8.根据权利要求1至7中任一项所述的热处理饮料，其中所述饮料具有如在实施例中根据BRUCE方案测量的4Pa至75Pa、优选地20Pa至60Pa的PhiTau。
9.根据权利要求1至8中任一项所述的热处理饮料，其中所述流体凝胶颗粒完全由结冷胶和所述二价阳离子组成。
10.根据权利要求1至9中任一项所述的热处理饮料，其中所述二价阳离子为二价金属阳离子。
11.根据权利要求10所述的热处理饮料，其中所述二价金属阳离子选自钙、镁、锌或它们的混合物，优选地，所述二价金属阳离子为钙(Ca2+)。
12.生产包含流体凝胶的热处理饮料的方法，所述方法包括以下步骤：
·提供包含结冷胶、二价阳离子和水性液体的加热饮料混合物，其中基于所述饮料的总重量，所述饮料混合物包含0.001重量％至0.1重量％的二价阳离子，
·在剪切所述加热饮料混合物的同时进行冷却，以形成包含流体凝胶的冷却饮料，所述流体凝胶包含由所述结冷胶和所述二价阳离子形成的颗粒，
·对包含流体凝胶的所述冷却饮料进行热处理，以获得包含流体凝胶的热处理饮料。
13.根据权利要求12所述的方法，其中所述热处理步骤涉及在80℃至145℃、优选地100℃至140℃且甚至更优选地120℃至140℃的温度下加热所述饮料混合物。

title: Compositions for use in improving stool consistency or frequency in infants or young children
abstract: The present invention relates to a nutritional composition comprising at least one fucosylated oligosaccharide for use in preventing and/or treating constipation and/or in improving stool consistency/frequency in an infant or a young child.
claims:
1. Nutritional composition comprising at least one fucosylated oligosaccharide for use in preventing and/or treating constipation and/or in improving stool consistency/frequency in an infant or a young child.
2. Nutritional composition comprising at least one fucosylated oligosaccharide for use in preventing and/or treating flatulence, bloating, colics and/or gut discomfort in an infant or a young child, and wherein the fucosylated oligosaccharide(s) is/are in a total amount of 0.8-1.5 g/L of the composition and/or in a total amount of 0.55-1.05 g/100g of composition on a dry weight basis.
3. Nutritional composition according to any one of the preceding claims wherein the fucosylated oligosaccharide is selected from the list consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose, 3'fucosyllactose, difucosyllactose, lacto-N-fucopentaose I, lacto-N-fucopentaose II, lacto-N-fucopentaose III, lacto-N-fucopentaose V, lacto-N-fucohexaose, lacto-N-difucohexaose I, fucosyllacto-N-hexaose, fucosyllacto-N-neohexaose I, fucosyllacto-N-neohexaose II, difucosyllacto-N-hexaose I, difucosyllacto-N-neohexaose I, difucosyllacto-N-neohexaose II, fucosyl-para-Lacto-N-hexaose, and any combination thereof.
4. Nutritional composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the fucosylated oligosaccharide comprises a 2' fucosyl-epitope.
5. Nutritional composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the fucosylated oligosaccharide is 2'-fucosy

title: Handling of food processor
abstract: A machine (1) for processing a liquid food substance includes a jug (20) that has a container (21) and a handle (31,32,33) for holding the jug by an adult human hand (40). The container (21) delimits a food cavity (21') for containing the food substance. The handle (31,32,33) has a connection member (31) projecting from the container (21) and a substantially elongated upright gripping member (32) that is connected to the connection member (31) at a distance from the container (21). The gripping member (32) has an upper portion (32a) that is above the connection member (31) and a lower portion (32b) that is below the connection member (31). The upper portion (32a) is configured to support a thumb (41) of the hand (40) and delimits with the connection member (31) an upper seat (31a) for accommodating an index finger (42) of the hand (40). The handle (31,32,33) has a confinement member (33) that extends: substantially uprightly between the container (21) and the lower portion (32b) of the gripping member (32); and downwardly from the connection member (31) or from close thereto. The confinement member (33) and the lower portion (32b) and the connection member (31) delimit a lower seat (31b) for accommodating a portion of a middle finger (43) of the hand (40).

title: Methods of monitoring feeding behaviors of pets
abstract: The present disclosure relates to the monitoring feeding behavior(s) of a pet(s), under the control of at least one processor. An example system includes a pet bowl comprising a load sensor configured to obtain load data while the pet is interacting with contents of the pet bowl. The load sensor can have a sensitivity of +/−50 grams or less and the load data can occur at a sample rate from 10 samples to 150 samples per second. The system also includes a processor configured to sequentially group the load data in 0.01 second to 5 second time increments. The individual time increments can include multiple samples. The processor can also identify a feeding behavior occurring within one or more of the time increments based on the load data resulting from the pet interacting with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
claims:
1. A system for monitoring feeding behavior of a pet, comprising:
a pet bowl comprising a load sensor configured to obtain load data while the pet is interacting with contents of the pet bowl, wherein the load sensor has a sensitivity of +/−50 grams or less and the load data is obtained at a sample rate from 10 samples to 150 samples per second;
a processor configured to sequentially group the load data in 0.01 second to 5 second time increments, wherein individual time increments include multiple samples; and
the processor further configured to identify a feeding behavior occurring within one or more of the time increments based on the load data resulting from the pet interacting with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the processor is further configured to exclude load data in identifying the feeding behavior if determined to be a result of human interaction, a false trigger, or an accidental interaction with the pet bowl or the contents of the pet bowl.
3. The system of claim 1, wherein the feeding behavior is a count-based feeding behavior selected from lapping, licking, or biting.
4. The system of claim 3, wherein the processor is further configured to characterize the count-based feeding behavior by counting individual micro-events of the feeding behavior within a single time increment or a time period spanning multiple time increments, wherein the individual micr

title: Beverage pod system with pod catcher
abstract: The invention concerns a device for extracting a beverage ingredient by supplying an extraction liquid into in a pod, and comprising: —upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts (1, 2) relatively translatable between an open position for inserting and/or ejecting the pod (3) and a closed position for forming an extraction chamber (5) enclosing the pod during extraction, —an insertion section (4) for inserting the pod in the device, said insertion section being designed to position the pod with the lid facing the downstream piercing arrangement (12), and —a pod holder (11), said pod holder being attached to said peripheral area (13) of the downstream part and said pod holder being movable between a receiving position and a retracted position, wherein the retaining and positioning elements (11a, 11b) move from the receiving position to the retracted position along diverging directions.
claims:
1. A device for extracting a beverage ingredient by supplying an extraction liquid such as heated water into a pod,
said pod comprising:
a pod body, said pod body comprising:
a side wall and a bottom wall defining a chamber, said chamber extending axially between the bottom and a top opening,
a circumferential annular flange projecting radially outward from the top opening, said flange comprising a top surface opposite to the chamber with respect to the opening,
said pod body containing a beverage ingredient,
a top lid attached to the top surface of the circumferential flange, said top lid closing the top opening of the pod body,
and
