title: Microbiome ingredient combination for lowering uremic toxins in cardiometabolic or neurodegenerative conditions
abstract: The invention relates to composition for use in lowering or avoiding accumulation of uremic toxins in cardiometabolic or neurodegenerative conditions, particularly compositions that comprise a probiotic bacteria, a prebiotic (carbohydrates or fibers), and a lipid.
claims:
1. Composition for use in lowering or avoiding accumulation of uremic toxins in cardiometabolic or neurodegenerative conditions, wherein the composition comprises: (a) a probiotic bacterium, selected from probiotic bacteria - lacking a gene for producing at least one of urea, uric acid, p-cresol, p-cresyl sulfate, indoxyl sulfate, indole, indole acetic acid, indoxyl, trimethylamine, TMAO, dimethylglycine, betaine and/or glutarate ; - lacking at least one bacterial enzyme selected from urease, carnitine monooxygenase & reductase, tryptophanase and/or hydroxyphenylacetate; and/or - expressing at least one bacterial enzyme selected from a-galactosidase, P-galactosidase, glucan 1,4-P-glucosidase, cellulase, P-fructofuranosidase and/or Licheninase; (b) a prebiotic selected from carbohydrates or fibers, wherein the carbohydrate or fiber can be hydrolyzed by at least one bacterial enzyme selected from a-galactosidase, P-galactosidase, glucan 1,4-P-glucosidase, cellulase, P-fructofuranosidase and/or Licheninase; (c) a lipid, selected from a triglyceride, a short chain fatty acid and/or a medium chain fatty acid, wherein the triglyceride comprises, short chain fatty acids, medium chain fatty acids, or a mixture thereof.
2. The composition for use according to claim 1, wherein the probiotic bacterium (a) is selected from at least one of the following a. to k.: a. Bifidobacterium animalis subspecies lactis NCC 2818 (CNCM 1-3446); b. Bifidobacterium longum subspecies infantis NCC 341 (ATCC 15697 (T));

title: Process for a legume based dried instant noodle
abstract: The present invention relates to a process for the production of a legume based dried instant noodle. In particularly the invention relates to a process for the production of a legume based dried instant noodle using roasted legume flour selected from the group of chickpea splits, lentil splits, or a combination thereof, and cereal flour and starch and wheat gluten.
claims:
1. A process for the production of a legume based dried instant noodle comprising legume flour, cereal flour, Kansui salts, starch and wheat gluten, the process comprising the steps of: a) Roasting legume splits selected from the group of chickpea splits, lentil splits, or a combination thereof and milling the roasted legume splits to obtain roasted legume flour or roasting legume flour selected from the group of chickpea flour, lentil flour, or a combination thereof to obtain roasted legume flour; b) Mixing the roasted legume flour, cereal flour, starch, wheat gluten and optionally other dry ingredients with the Kansui salts and water to form a dough; c) Sheeting and slitting the dough to obtain noodle strands; d) Steaming the noodle strands from step c); e) Cutting the noodle strands from step d) and optionally folding; f) Frying the noodle strands from step e) in oil or air drying the noodle strands from step e); g) Cooling.
2. A process for the production of a legume based dried instant noodle as claimed in claim 1, comprising 10 to 60wt% of legume flour (by weight of the total composition), 5 to 70wt% of cereal flour (by weight of the total composition), 0.2 to 3.5wt% of Kansui salts (by weight of the total composition), 0.5 to 10wt% of wheat gluten (by weight of the total composition), 1 to 20wt% of starch (by weight of the total composition).
3. A process for the production of a legume based dried instant noodle in any one of claims 1 to 2, wherein the legume based dried instant noodle has a ratio betwe

title: Extensively hydrolysed infant formula
abstract: An extensively hydrolysed infant formula (eHF) containing protein, carbohydrate and fat. The eHF includes about 2.4 g or less of the protein per 100 kcal. The eHF contains no medium chain triglycerides (MCTs). The eHF may further include 2′-fucosyllactose (2′FL) and/or lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT). The eHF may be suitable for infants with cow's milk protein allergy.
claims:
1: An extensively hydrolysed infant formula (eHF) suitable for infants with cow's milk protein allergy, the eHF comprising protein, carbohydrate and fat, wherein the eHF comprises about 2.4 g or less protein per 100 kcal, wherein the eHF comprises no medium chain triglycerides (MCTs) and wherein the eHF comprises 2′-fucosyllactose (2′FL) and/or lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT).
2: The eHF according to claim 1, wherein the eHF comprises 0.5-3 g/L of the 2′FL.
3: The eHF according to claim 1, wherein the eHF comprises 0.2-1 g/L of the LNnT.
4: The eHF according to claim 1, wherein the eHF comprises about 1.8 g to about 2.4 g of the protein per 100 kcal.
5: The eHF according to claim 1, at least about 95% by weight of peptides in the eHF have a molecular mass of less than about 3000 Da.
6: The eHF according to claim 1, wherein at least about 85% by weight of peptides in the eHF have a molecular weight of less than about 1200 Da.
7: The eHF according to claim 1, wherein at least about 45% by weight of peptides in the eHF are di- and tri-peptides.
8: The eHF according to claim 1, wherein at least about 45% by weight of peptides in the eHF have a molecular weight of between 240 and 600 Da.

title: Method for preparing a beverage or liquid food and system using brewing centrifugal force
abstract: A method and system for preparing a beverage or liquid from a food substance contained in a filtering receptacle by passing water through the substance using brewing centrifugal forces. The method includes feeding water into the receptacle, and driving the receptacle in centrifugal rotation to force water to flow through the substance in a centrifugal flow path to the outlet of the receptacle. The system includes equipment necessary to carry out the method. The receptacle is a sealed capsule which is opened for water to be introduced into the capsule, contains a predetermined dose of food substance and is discarded after use.
claims:
1. A method for preparing a beverage or liquid food from a predetermined dose of a substance contained in a filtering capsule, the method comprising:
inserting the filtering capsule into a capsule holder of a preparation device, the capsule holder connected to a central rotating rod supported by a support;
passing water through the substance in the filtering capsule using centrifugal forces to force water to flow through the substance in the filtering capsule in a centrifugal flow path to form the beverage or liquid food and direct the beverage or liquid food through at least one peripheral outlet of the filtering capsule; and
collecting the beverage or liquid food in a collecting chamber of the support, the collecting chamber is heated by heating elements associated with the collecting chamber,
wherein a lid of the capsule holder is associated with an upper bearing of the preparation device, the lid is associated to the upper bearing along a hollow rotating rod above the central rotating rod and configured for entry of the water into the filtering capsule through a conduit traversing the hollow rotating rod.
2. The method of claim 1, further comprising draining the beverage or liquid food from the collecting chamber through a collecting tube extending from the collecting chamber.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein the collecting tube is inclined downward from the collecting chamber, and the method further comprises directing the beverage or liquid food toward a us

title: Beverage or food preparation system
abstract: A system comprising: a container for containing a precursor material, the container for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or a food product or a precursor thereof, the container comprising a plurality of machine-readable codes, each code storing preparation information for use with a preparation process performed by the machine, each code comprising a plurality of units, a plurality of cells defining a data portion arranged at a predetermined position relative to a reference portion, the reference portion of an adjacent code being arranged to define a vertex of a quadrangle having at least two equilateral sides; a machine for preparing a beverage and/or food product or a precursor thereof, the machine comprising: a processing unit for processing a precursor material of the container; and electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on preparation information read from the code; and a code reading system for reading the code of the container by obtaining a digital image of the code in the shape of an equiangular quadrangle with an image capture device; wherein the container and the code reading system are configured to obtain a digital image of the quadrilateral shape, the digital image of the quadrilateral shape being arranged obliquely to the quadrilateral defined by the adjacent code having the digital image to include at least two reference portions of the code.
claims:
1.一种系统，所述系统包括：
用于容纳前体材料的容器，所述容器用于与用于制备饮料和/或食品或其前体的机器一起使用，所述容器包括多个机器可读代码，每个代码存储与由所述机器执行的制备过程一起使用的制备信息，
每个代码包括多个单元，所述多个单元限定相对于参考部分被布置在预先确定的位置处的数据部分，相邻代码的所述参考部分被布置成限定具有至少两条等边的等角四边形的顶点；
用于制备饮料和/或食品或者其前体的机器，所述机器包括：
处理单元，所述处理单元用于处理所述容器的前体材料；和电气电路系统，所述电气电路系统用以基于从所述代码读取的制备信息来控制所述处理单元；和
代码读取系统，所述代码读取系统用于通过利用图像捕获装置获得形状为等角四边形的所述代码的数字图像来读取所述容器的所述代码；
其中所述容器和代码读取系统被配置为获得所述四边形形状的数字图像，所述四边形形状的数字图像被布置成倾斜于由具有所述数字图像的所述相邻代码限定的所述四边形，以包括所述代码的至少两个参考部分，所述四边形形状的数字图像的边与由所述相邻代码限定的所述四边形成角度。
2.根据权利要求1所述的系统，其中由所述代码限定的所述四边形的边长小于所述数字图像的所述四边形形状的滑动长度。
3.根据权利要求1或2中任一项所述的系统，其中所述代码中的每个代码被布置在正方形平面内并且所述代码被布置成彼此相邻。
4.根据权利要求3所述的系统，其中代码的顶点被三个或两个其他代码相邻。
5.根据权利要求3或4中任一项所述的系统，其中所述数字图像的所述四边形形状的边长是所述代码的边长的至少两倍。
6.根据任一前述权利要求所述的系统，其中所述倾斜布置包括由与所述数字图像的所述四边形形状成45度布置的所述代码限定的所述四边形。
7.根据任一前述权利要求所述的系统，其中所述电气电路系统被配置为使用所述至少两个参考部分定位所述数字图像中的至少一个数据部分。
8.根据任一前述权利要求所述的系统，其中所述数字图像的所述四边形和由所述代码限定的所述四边形被配置为使得如果彼此对准，则仅单个参考部分可被布置在所述数字图像中。
9.根据任一前述权利要求所述的系统，其中由所述相邻代码限定的所述四边形被布置成倾斜于所述容器的边缘，其中所述代码读取系统被配置为用于在获得所述数字图像时进行对准。
10.一种用于制备饮料和/或食品或其前体的机器，所述机器包括：代码读取系统，所述代码读取系统用以读取容器的代码；处理单元，所述处理单元用于处理所述容器的前体材料；

title: Beverage preparation system
abstract: The invention concerns a beverage production system comprising a module (1) for producing a beverage from a pack (10). The pack can include a bottom side (101) with an area (104) configured for being openable. The openable area can be made of a flexible material. Module (1) can include a pack holder assembly (2), a fluid processing device (11) designed to open the openable area (104) of the pack, and an actuating device (12) to move said fluid processing device (11) and said pack (10) one to the other. The pack holder assembly (2) can include a movable locking device (24) to position the pack (10) inside the pack chamber (22) when a beverage is prepared, and the bottom part of the pack (10) can include at least two fixing means (103) of a hole or a deformable area. The movable locking device (24) can include at least two positioning means (242), each being configured to move inside at least one respective hole (103) of the pack hold in the chamber, or to move inside at least one respective deformable area (103) of the pack hold in the chamber and to fit in the resulting deformed area.
claims:
1-11. (canceled)
12. A pack containing a beverage ingredient and configured for preparing a beverage by injection of fluid therein, wherein:
the beverage ingredient is a water soluble, dilutable or infusible beverage ingredient, said pack presents:
a plane shape, said plane shape being oriented along a plane vertically oriented during beverage production, and
a bottom side comprising an area configured for being openable, said openable area being made of a flexible material, and
the bottom part of the pack comprises at least two fixing members, said fixing members being a hole or a deformable area, said two fixing members being positioned around the openable area of the bottom side of the pack, and each of the holes and/or deformable areas of the pack encompasses one circular fixing areas, and
the distance between the centres of said circular fixing areas being at most 52 mm.
13. A pack according to claim 12, wherein the openable area is made of a stretchable material.
14. A pack according to claim 12, wherein the stretchable material is selected from the group consisting of: polyethylene (PE), polypropylene (PP), polylactide (PLA), polyhydroxyalcanoates (PHA), polybutylene adipate terepthalate (PBAT), polybutylene succinate (PBS), polyvinyl alcohol (PVOH), starch-based polymers, a polymer comprising food-grade oxygen and/or moisture scaveng

title: Methods for providing health benefits in animals
abstract: The present disclosure provides methods and compositions for treating glomerular hyperfiltration, reducing glycogen storage in tissues, or reducing uremic toxins in an animal, comprising orally administering a composition comprising medium chain triglycerides, eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA), docosahexaenoic acid (DHA), arginine, antioxidants, and B vitamins to the animal.
claims:
1. A method for treating glomerular hyperfiltration, reducing glycogen storage in tissues, or reduce uremic toxins in an animal, the method comprising orally administering a composition comprising medium chain triglycerides, eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA), docosahexaenoic acid (DHA), arginine, antioxidants, and B vitamins to the animal.
2. The method of Claim 1, wherein the B vitamins include niacin, pantothenate, pyridoxine, thiamine, riboflavin, biotin, folic acid, and cobalamin.
3. The method of Claim 2, wherein the niacin is about 1 to about 30 times of RD A, the pantothenate is about 1 to about 50 times of the RD A, the pyridoxine is about 1 to about 30 times of the RD A, the thiamine is about 1 to about 200 times of the RD A, the riboflavin is about 1 to about 100 times of the RD A, the biotin is about 1 to about 40 times of the RD A, the folic acid is about 1 to about 50 times of the RD A, and the cobalamin is about 1 to about 50 times of the RD A.
4. The method of Claim 1, wherein the medium chain triglycerides are about 0.1 wt% to about 60 wt% of the composition.
5. The method of Claim 1, wherein the medium chain triglycerides are about lwt% to about 20 wt% of the composition

title: Compositions and methods that modulate phosphorus or enzymes in a companion animal
abstract: A specific type of organ health marker in a companion animal can be improved by adjusting the diet of the animal to increase the amount of a compound which positively or negatively modulates the specific type of organ health marker or adjusting the diet of the animal to decrease the amount of a compound which positively or negatively modulates the specific type of organ health marker. The specific type of organ health marker can be one or more of phosphorus, alkaline phosphatase, aspartate aminotransferase, or gamma- glutamyltransferase.
claims: CLAIMS: <div class="indep-clm" num="1"><seg-con>1. title: Compostable top lid structure for a beverage preparation capsule
abstract: The invention relates to a capsule (100) for preparing a beverage in a beverage production machine, the capsule (100) comprising a capsule body (200) delimiting a chamber (250) for containing a beverage substance (500), an injection wall (220) closing the chamber at a first end and a delivery wall (300) closing the chamber (250) at a second end of the capsule body (200). The delivery wall (300) comprises in a layered manner a carrier layer (320) for carrying the subsequent layers, an optional filter layer (310) and a barrier layer (340) applied on the carrier layer (320), the barrier layer (310) providing a preferably bidirectional barrier against moisture and/or gas, the barrier layer (340). As proposed the barrier layer (340) is applied in one or more layers in a total quantity of 0,5 to 10 gsm (g/m2), preferably of 1,5 to 4 gsm (g/m2) and is applied on least one of the carrier layer's surfaces, said surface having a surface roughness lower than 1;3 microns when measured according to ISO 3274. The invention also relates to a system comprising the proposed capsule and to a use of the proposed capsule for preparing a beverage in a beverage production machine
claims:

title: Dietary butyrate and its uses
abstract: To provide a novel method for using butyrate as a food ingredient having improved organoleptic properties.SOLUTION: There are provided a compound having the formula (1), (2), (3) or (4), or combinations thereof, for use in the maintenance of bone health and/or the prevention and/or treatment of bone disorder associated with unbalanced bone catabolism, where R1, R2, R3, R4, R5 and R6 are independently a long chain fatty acid having 16 to 20 carbons.SELECTED DRAWING: None
claims:

【化1】
［式中、Ｒ １、Ｒ ２、Ｒ ３、Ｒ ４、Ｒ ５、及びＲ ６は、独立して、１６～２０個の炭素を有する長鎖脂肪酸である。］
【請求項2】
式（１）を有する化合物と式（２）を有する化合物との組み合わせが使用され、好ましくは、前記組み合わせが、式（１）を有する化合物をトリグリセリド全量の少なくとも１０重量％の量で含み且つ式（２）を有する化合物をトリグリセリド全量の少なくとも１０重量％の量で含む組成物中に存在する、請求項１に記載の使用のための化合物。

式（１）を有する化合物と、式（２）を有する化合物と、式（３）を有する化合物と、式（４）を有する化合物と、の組み合わせが使用された、請求項１、２、又は３に記載の使用のための化合物。

title: Plant based whipping cream
abstract: The present invention relates to an emulsion composition comprising 1 to 5% wt non-fractionated chickpea; 0.25 to 3%<sub>wt </sub>non-fractionated oat; 20.5 to 35%<sub>wt </sub>lipid source; and 50 to 75%<sub>wt </sub>water. Preferred emulsion compositions further comprise non-fractionated lentil. Whipped cream compositions made from the emulsion composition are also provided.
claims:
1. An emulsion composition, said composition comprising a. 1 to 5%wt non-fractionated chickpea; b. 0.25 to 3%wt non-fractionated oat; c. 20.5 to 35%wt lipid source; and d. 50 to 75%wt water.
2. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the composition further comprises 1 to 5%wt non-fractionated lentil.
3. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the composition comprises 0.5 to 1%wt protein.
4. The composition according to claim 2, wherein greater than 90% of the protein is provided by the non-fractionated chickpea, non-fractionated oat, and non-fractionated lentil.
5. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the non-fractionated chickpea is chickpea flour and the non-fractionated oat is hydrolyzed oat flour.
6. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the lipid source is coconut oil.
7. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the composition further comprises an emulsifier selected from the group consisting of a. Monoglyceride, wherein said monoglyceride comprises a minimum 90% of monoglycerides from edible and fully hydrogenated palm oil; b. Lecithin, monoglyceride, and

title: A combination of a source of isoflavones and at least a natural extract for treatment, prevention, or supporting improvement of cognitive symptoms related to menopause
abstract: A method treats or prevents cognitive menopausal symptoms and includes administering, to a human woman having or at risk of the cognitive menopausal symptoms, an effective amount of a combination of a source of isoflavones and at least one of a natural extract for supporting cognitive performance and a natural extract for promoting calmness and reducing stress. The combination may be administered in a composition that further includes one or more of Vitamin B12, Vitamin B6, Vitamin B complex, iron, magnesium, and/or a refreshing/cooling agent. Single or multiple doses of the composition may be administered per day, the multiple doses including a first dose and a second dose. The first dose may be administered to the human woman in the morning, and the second dose may be administered to the human woman in the night.

title: Machine, crushing unit for such a machine and method for preparing a beverage with such a machine
abstract: The preparation machine (1) comprises: - a preparation unit (2) having i) a preparation chamber (6) for receiving the capsule (100) and ii) means for injecting the fluid in the capsule (100) to prepare the beverage, and - a crushing unit (4) having a crushing element (7) movable so as to crush the capsule body (101) such that at least part of the beverage component (103) is released from the cavity (102) after the capsule (100) has been processed in the preparation unit (2).
claims:

Preparation machine (1) for preparing a beverage by injecting a fluid in a capsule (100), the capsule (100) having i) a capsule body (101) defining a cavity (102) and ii) a beverage component (103) contained within the cavity (102), wherein the preparation machine (1) comprises: - a preparation unit (2) having i) a preparation chamber (6) for receiving the capsule (100) and ii) means for injecting the fluid in the capsule (100) to prepare the beverage, and - a crushing unit (4) having a crushing element (7), the crushing element (7) being movable so as to crush the capsule body (101) such that at least part of the beverage component (103) is released from the cavity (102) after the capsule (100) has been processed in the preparation unit (2).
2. Preparation machine (1) according to claim 1, wherein the crushing element (7) includes a crusher or a shredder.
3. Preparation machine (1) according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the crushing element (7) is movable in rotation so as to crush the capsule body (101), the crushing element (7) preferably forming a crushing mill.
4. Preparation machine (1) according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the crushing element (7) comprises at least one crushing tool having a plurality of sharp sections (7.4).

title: Container for beverage or foodstuff preparation machine
abstract: A container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff, the container comprising: a body portion having a storage portion for storage of the precursor material and a separate flange portion, wherein the storage portion is formed from a blank of paper-based material and comprises, in a hemispherical state, a hemispherical shaped cavity formed of flaps which extend in a radial direction, and which directly adjoin each other, the flange portion including connecting members to retain the storage portion in the hemispherical state.
claims:
CLAIMS

A container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff, the container comprising: a body portion having a storage portion for storage of the precursor material and a separate flange portion, wherein the storage portion is formed from a blank of paper-based material and comprises, in a hemispherical state, a hemispherical shaped cavity formed of flaps which extend in a radial direction, and which directly adjoin each other, the flange portion including connecting members to retain the storage portion in the hemispherical state.
2. The container of claim 1 , wherein there at least 8 flaps.

5. The container of any preceding claim, wherein the hemispherical shape is formed by pressing the paper-based material to have a flat or curved base.

title: Heat sterilized high protein compositions with hydrolyzed protein from a continuous process with at least one endopeptidase
abstract: The present invention is directed to a heat sterilized composition comprising: a protein source in an amount of 5 to 20% by weight of the composition, said protein source comprising hydrolyzed protein; wherein the protein source has been treated in a continuous process with at least one endopeptidase, typically for a finite length of time. Furthermore, the invention concerns a heat sterilized high protein composition having low viscosity and being devoid of bitterness, comprising hydrolyzed heat sensitive protein source having a degree of protein hydrolysis in NPN/TN of 20 to 50% and at least one heat inactivated endopeptidase. The present invention is furthermore directed to a continuous process for preparing a heat sterilized composition which comprises a protein source containing hydrolyzed protein, the process comprising the following steps: (i) Providing an aqueous solution of a protein source; (ii) Performing a continuous hydrolysis step wherein the aqueous solution of a protein source is treated with at least one endopeptidase by heating at 40 to 90°C and for a finite length of time of 2 to 20 minutes; (iii) heat inactivation of the endopeptidase. The invention also concerns a method of controlling viscosity and preventing bitter taste of a heat sterilized high protein composition, the method comprising providing an aqueous solution of a protein source and continuously hydrolyzing the aqueous solution of a protein source with at least one endopeptidase prior to heat inactivation of the said endopeptidase. Finally, the invention concerns the use of hydrolyzed protein prepared in a continuous process as described herein by treatment with at least one endopeptidase for a finite length of time, for preparing a heat sterilized composition and/or for controlling the viscosity of a liquid composition, wherein the composition comprises 5 to 20 weight % total protein. The invention also concerns medical uses and treatments applying or using the inventive heat sterilized composition.
claims:
35 Claims 1. Aliquid heat sterilized composition comprising: a protein source in an amount of 5 to 20% byweight of the composition, said protein source comprising hydrolyzed protein; wherein the protein source has been treated in a continuous process with at least one endopeptidase comprising a serine protease by heating at 40 to 9O°Cfor a finite length of time selected from a period of 2 to 20 minutes, wherein the degree of protein hydrolysis in non-protein nitrogen/total nitrogen (NPN/TN) is 20 to 50%, wherein the liquid heat sterilized composition has a viscosity of below875 mPa s at 2O°C/1OO s1.
2. The composition according toclaim1wherein the protein sourceis selected from a heat sensitive protein from animal or plant origin.

4. The composition according to any one of claims1to3wherein the at least one endopeptidase consists of a serine protease.
5. The composition according to any one of claims1to 4 which is a liquid composition, having a viscosity of below 200 mPas at 2O°C/ioo s1.
6. The composition according to any one of claims1to5 having a protein concentration of up to17 g/mL of the composition.

title: Capsule for the preparation of a beverage
abstract: A capsule for the preparation of a beverage in a beverage preparation machine is disclosed. The capsule comprises a cup-shaped body and a closing membrane for closing the cup-shaped body. The cup-shaped body comprises an annular flange for the closing membrane to seal thereon. At least the cup-shaped body is made of cellulose pulp and comprises: a bottom wall, a tubular lateral wall and the annular flange. The annular flange further comprises a portion having a surface roughness comprised between 27 and 32 microns. This flange portion having specific roughness characteristics cooperates with an edge of a capsule enclosing member of the beverage preparation machine for improving leak tightness during the preparation of the beverage.

title: confectionery
abstract: The present invention relates to milk-based confectionery comprising an oligosaccharide mixture.
claims:
1. A chocolate product comprising: a. a milk product comprising a carbohydrate mixture, wherein the milk product is present in an amount of between 0.5 wt % and 50 wt % of the chocolate product and the milk product comprises between 10 wt % and 90 wt % carbohydrate mixture based on the weight of the milk product, wherein the carbohydrate mixture comprises between 10 wt % and 100 wt % galactooligosaccharide, and b. a polyol present in an amount of between 30 wt % and 65 wt % of the chocolate product.
2. A chocolate product according to claim 1, wherein the polyol is selected from the group comprising isomalt, sorbitol, maltitol, mannitol, xylitol, erythritol, threitiol, arabitol, lactitol, galactitol and hydrogenated starch hydrolysates and mixtures thereof.
3. A chocolate product according to claim 1, wherein the chocolate product comprises between 5 wt % and 22 wt % of the milk product.
4. A chocolate product according to claim 1, wherein the chocolate product comprises between 41 wt % and 56 wt % of the polyol.
5. A chocolate product according to claim 1, wherein from 0 wt % to 15 wt % of the total carbohydrates in the mixture is lactose.
6. A chocolate product according to claim 1, wherein the carbohydrate mixture is a composition expressed as dry matter percentage by weight of the mixture: a. Lactose 0-40%; b. Glucose 0-40%;

title: Aerated confectionery
abstract: The invention relates to a water-based aerated confectionery product used as a filling composition in a chocolate or chocolate-analogue product and methods of making the same.
claims:
1. A confectionery composition comprising a chocolate or chocolate analogue confectionery filled with water-based aerated confectionery filling, wherein the waterbased aerated confectionery filling: has a pH of greater than or equal to 5.6; and has a water activity less than 0.67; and comprises 30wt% to 90wt% sugar; comprises between 1wt% to 8wt% protein, wherein the protein stabilises the water-based aerated confectionery and the protein has been thermally denatured and the water-based aerated confectionery is partly or completely surrounded or encased in chocolate or chocolate analogue.
2. A confectionery composition according to claim 1, wherein the water-based aerated confectionery filling has a pH between 5.6 and 10.0, or between 6.0 and 8.0.
3. A confectionery composition according to any preceding claim, wherein the protein is whey protein.
4. A confectionery composition according to any preceding claim, wherein the protein is present in an amount at least 2wt% of the water-based aerated confectionery filling, optionally at least 2wt%, at least 2.2wt%, at least 3wt% or at least 3.3wt%.

title: Nutritional composition for improving social emotion development
abstract: The present invention relates to combinations of DHA, ARA, iron, folic acid, vitamin B12 and phospholipids, and nutritional compositions comprising such combinations, for use in improving social emotional skills and/or promoting emotional, social and pleasant related behaviors in infants, toddlers or young children. The invention also relates to a synthetic nutritional composition comprising specific amounts of DHA, ARA, iron, folic acid, vitamin B12 and a phospholipid. The invention also relates to uses and methods for improving social emotional skills of infants, toddlers or young children and/or for promoting emotional, social and pleasant related behaviors of infants, toddlers or young children.
claims:
1.DHA、ARA、铁、叶酸、维生素B12和磷脂的组合，所述组合在改善婴儿、学步儿童或幼儿的社会情感技能和/或促进所述婴儿、所述学步儿童或所述幼儿的情绪和愉悦行为中使用。
2.根据权利要求1用于所述用途的组合，其中所述磷脂是鞘磷脂、磷脂酰胆碱、磷脂酰肌醇、磷脂酰丝氨酸和磷脂酰乙醇胺。
3.根据权利要求1或2用于所述用途的组合，其中所述磷脂是磷脂酰胆碱、磷脂酰肌醇、磷脂酰丝氨酸、磷脂酰乙醇胺和鞘磷脂，并且其中此类磷脂分别以下述量被包含：基于总磷脂在25％w/w至35％w/w范围内的磷脂酰胆碱、基于总磷脂在5％w/w至15％w/w范围内的磷脂酰肌醇、基于总磷脂在5％w/w至10％w/w范围内的磷脂酰丝氨酸、基于总磷脂在21％w/w至30％w/w范围内的磷脂酰乙醇胺和基于总磷脂在20％w/w至30％w/w范围内的鞘磷脂。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项用于所述用途的组合，社交恐惧，特别是用于改善大于12个月的婴儿、学步儿童或幼儿在涉及新异性/不确定性的社会情境中的趋近行为抑制和/或痛苦。
5.根据权利要求1至3中任一项用于所述用途的组合，所述组合用于促进高强度愉悦，特别是与高刺激强度、速率、复杂性、新异性和不协调性相关的愉悦和享用乐趣，以及用于减少悲伤，特别是减少与婴儿的痛苦身体状态、客体丧失或不能执行期望动作相关的情绪低落和活动。
6.根据前述权利要求中任一项用于所述用途的组合，其中所述组合在受试者生命的前1个月、3个月、6个月、9个月、12个月、18个月、24个月或36个月期间施用。
7.根据前述权利要求中任一项用于所述用途的组合，其中在12月龄、18月龄、24月龄或36月龄的受试者中改善社会情感技能。
8.根据前述权利要求中任一项用于所述用途的组合，其中在0月龄至18月龄之间，优选在0月龄至12月龄之间的受试者中促进情绪和愉悦行为。
9.营养组合物，所述营养组合物根据权利要求1至10中任一项用于所述用途，所述营养组合物包含根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的DHA、ARA、铁、叶酸、维生素B12和磷脂的组合。
10.根据前述权利要求中任一项用于所述用途的营养组合物，所述营养组合物是合成营养组合物。
11.根据权利要求12用于所述用途的合成营养组合物，其中所述合成营养组合物是婴儿配方食品、1段婴儿配方食品、较大或2段婴儿配方食品、婴孩食物、成长乳、婴儿谷物组合物、强化剂或补充剂。
12.根据权利要求11和12用于所述用途的合成营养组合物，所述合成营养组合物包含量在300mg/kg至820mg/kg范围内的鞘磷脂、量在500mg/kg至1.3g/kg范围内的磷脂酰胆碱、量在400mg/kg至800mg/kg范围内的磷脂酰肌醇、量在200mg/kg至1000mg/kg范围内的磷脂酰丝氨酸、量在250mg/kg至800mg/kg范围内的磷脂酰乙醇胺、量在3.5mg/100g至7mg/100g范围内的铁、量在0.1mcg/100g至10mcg/100范围内的维生素B12、量在110mcg/100g至400mcg/100g范围内的叶酸以及量在30mg/100g至300mg/100g范围内的DHA和ARA。
13.DHA、ARA、铁、叶酸、维生素B12和磷脂的组合，其中所述磷脂是鞘磷脂、磷脂酰胆碱、磷脂酰肌醇、磷脂酰丝氨酸和磷脂酰乙醇胺，并且其中磷脂分别以下述量被包含：基于总磷脂在25％w

title: Method of making package from recyclable material
abstract: FIELD: packing and storage.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to a method of making package (200) for enclosing substance (500). Flat sheet (100) made from recyclable paper material and having two opposite side edge portions (101, 102), is provided and moulded into tube (120) by folding flat sheet (100) so that two side edge sections (101, 102) overlap each other on overlap section (123). Tube (120) is thermally sealed along section (123) of overlap with formation of longitudinal sealing seam (130) and thermally sealed across longitudinal sealing seam (130) to close tube (120) by means of first transverse sealing seam (141) at first end (121) of tube. Tube (120) is filled with substance (500) and thermally sealed across longitudinal sealing seam (130) to close tube (120) by means of second transverse sealing seam (142) at second end (122) of the tube. First and second amounts of glue (300–302) are applied on flat sheet (100) at first and second sections (151, 152) of triple joint, where longitudinal sealing seam (130) and corresponding transverse sealing seams (141, 142), respectively, intersect. Glue (300–302) bonds corresponding section (151, 152) of the triple joint when thermally sealing corresponding end (121, 122) of the tube to form a corresponding transverse sealing seam (141, 142). Invention also relates to package (200) containing substance (500), and device (600) for production of such package (200).EFFECT: thus, it is possible to produce packing with high speed and in completely automated process, as well as without excessive costs for reconfiguration or re-equipment of already existing devices.15 cl, 7 dwg
claims: 1. Способ изготовления упаковки (200) для заключения в ней вещества (500), включающий: обеспечение плоского листа (100), изготовленного из пригодного для вторичной переработки бумажного материала и имеющего два противоположных боковых краевых участка (101, 102), формование плоского листа (100) в трубку (120) путем складывания плоского листа (100) таким образом, чтобы два боковых краевых участка (101, 102) по меньшей мере частично перекрывали друг друга на участке (123) перекрытия, термозапечатывание трубки (120) вдоль участка (123) перекрытия с образованием продольного запечатывающего шва (130), термозапечатывание трубки (120) поперек продольного запечатывающего шва (130) для закрытия трубки (120) с помощью первого поперечного запечатывающего шва (141) на первом конце (121) трубки, наполнение трубки (120) веществом (500), подлежащим упаковыванию, термозапечатывание трубки (120) поперек продольного запечатывающего шва (130) для закрытия трубки (120) с помощью второго поперечного запечатывающего шва (142) на втором конце (122) трубки, противоположном первому концу (121) трубки по отношению к веществу (500), подлежащему упаковыванию, с образованием упаковки (200), заключающей в себе указанное вещество (500), отличающийся тем, что способ дополнительно включает: нанесение первого количества клея (300, 301) на плоский лист (100) на первом участке (151) тройного стыка, на котором пересекаются продольный запечатывающий шов (130) и первый поперечный запечатывающий шов (141), нанесение второго количества клея (300, 302) на плоский лист (100) на втором участке (152) тройного стыка, на

title: Food butyrate
abstract: FIELD: chemistry.SUBSTANCE: present invention relates to use of a compound selected from compounds of formulas (1), (2), (3), (4):or a combination thereof for increasing the concentration of ketones in blood and/or therapy of diseases amenable to treatment by increasing the concentration of ketones in the blood. In formulas (1), (2), (3), (4) R1, R2, R3, R4, R5 and R6 independently represent a long-chain fatty acid having from 16 to 20 carbon atoms.EFFECT: development of a food source of butyrate, having improved organoleptic properties as compared to available products, and potential of high formation of ketones after oral or enteral intake by humans and other mammals.15 cl, 2 dwg, 2 tbl, 6 ex
claims: 1. Применение соединения, выбранного из соединения формулы (1), (2), (3), (4): или их комбинации для повышения концентрации кетонов в крови и/или терапии заболеваний, поддающихся лечению посредством повышения концентрации кетонов в крови, где заболевание выбрано из следующего перечня: нехватка энергии для головного мозга, неврологическое заболевание, мигрень, расстройство памяти, возрастное расстройство памяти, повреждение головного мозга, инсульт, боковой амилоидный склероз, рассеянный склероз, нарушение когнитивных функций, нарушение когнитивных функций после интенсивного лечения, возрастное нарушение когнитивной функции, болезнь Альцгеймера, болезнь Паркинсона, болезнь Хантингсона, наследственные метаболические расстройства (такие как синдром дефицита транспортера глюкозы 1 типа и недостаточность пируватдегидрогеназного комплекса), депрессия, шизофрения, эпилепсия, нарколепсия, неалкогольная жировая дистрофия печени и синдром поликистоза яичников, где R1, R2, R3, R4, R5и R6независимо представляют собой длинноцепочечную жирную кислоту, имеющую от 16 до 20 атомов углерода. 2. Применение по п. 1, в котором используется комбинация соединения формулы (1) и соединения формулы (2), где предпочтительно комбинация присутствует в композиции, содержащей соединение формулы (1) в количестве по меньшей мере 10 масс.% от общего содержания триглицеридов в композиции и соединение формулы (2) в количестве по меньшей мере 10 масс.% от общего содержания триглицеридов в композиции. 3. Применение по п. 1, в котором используется комбинация соединения формулы (1) и соединения формулы (2), где предпочтительно комбинация присутствует в композиции, содержащей соединение формулы (1) в количестве по меньшей мере 10 масс.% от общего содержания триглицеридов, содержащих бутиратный остаток, в композиции и соединение формулы (2) в количестве по меньшей мере 10 масс.%

title: Beverage or foodstuff preparation system
abstract: A system (2) comprising a container (6) and a machine (4) for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff, the container (6) including: a body portion (62) with a storage portion (58) comprising a cavity that extends in a depth direction for containing a precursor material; a closing member (56) to close the storage portion (58); a machine-readable code (44) storing preparation information, said code (44) arranged on the closing member (56), the machine (4) including: a code reading system (18) to read the code (44) of the container (6); a processing unit (14) for processing the precursor material of the container (6), and; electrical circuitry (16) to control the processing unit (14) based on the preparation information read from the code (44), wherein the code reading system (18) includes a code reader (46) and a positioning mechanism (110) to deform the body portion (62) of the container (6) from an undeformed configuration to a deformed configuration, wherein the positioning mechanism (110) is adapted to deform the body portion (62) in the deformed configuration to effect subsequent deformation of the closing member(56) so that it presents a comparatively more uniform surface for reading the code (44).
claims:
1. A system comprising a container and a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff,
the container including:
a body portion with a storage portion comprising a cavity that extends in a depth direction for containing a precursor material;
a closing member to close the storage portion;
a machine-readable code storing preparation information, said code arranged on the closing member,
the machine including:
a code reading system to read the code of the container;
a processing unit for processing the precursor material of the container, and;
electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on the preparation information read from the code,
wherein the code reading system includes a code reader and a positioning mechanism to deform the body portion of the container from an undeformed configuration to a deformed configuration,
wherein the positioning mechanism is adapted to deform the body portion in the deformed configuration to effect subsequent deformation of the closing member so that it presents a comparatively more uniform surface for reading the code.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the body portion of the container comprises a flange portion connecting the storage portion and closing membe

title: Iron-containing green plant material concentrate
abstract: A process for preparing an iron-containing green plant material concentrate is disclosed. The process comprises the steps of suspending a green plant in an aqueous liquid to form a green plant material suspension. The green plant material suspension is then blended, processed through physical mean, and optionally dried. Such an iron-containing green plant material concentrate is also disclosed. In addition, food product, beverage, food supplement, cosmetic composition or pharmaceutical composition comprising such an iron-containing green plant material concentrate and a method for fortifying a food product or beverage with iron are also disclosed.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. Process for preparing an iron-containing green plant material concentrate comprising the steps of: a) suspending a green plant material in an aqueous liquid to form a green plant material suspension, b) blending the green plant material suspension to obtain a green plant material slurry, c) applying a physical mean on the green plant material slurry to separate and obtain an iron-containing green plant material concentrate, d) optionally, drying the iron-containing green plant material concentrate.
2. The process according to claim 1, wherein the step c) is performed through filtration and/or centrifugation and/or decantation and/or heat treatment.
3. The process according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the step c) of applying a physical mean is performed through the steps of: c1) filtering the green plant material slurry to obtain a permeate, c2) optionally, heat-treating the permeate, c3) centrifugating or decanting the permeate to obtain an iron-containing green plant material concentrate.
4. The process according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the green plant material comes from herb or duckweed.
5. The process according to claim 4 wherein the herb is selected from the group consisting of parsley, coriander, mint, thyme, lemon balm, nettle, sage, oregano, rosemary, basil, dill, chervil, savory or a mixture thereof.

title: Beverage preparation system
abstract: There is described a beverage preparation machine comprising a centrifugal brewing unit (2) for preparing a beverage by centrifugation of an ingredient contained in a capsule and mixed with a carrier liquid, the centrifugal brewing unit (2) comprising a centrifugal cell (3) for receiving such a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C); driving means (5) for rotating the centrifugal cell (3); a regulator for regulating a rotation speed of the centrifugal cell (3) by controlling the driving means (5) based on a feedback signal representative of a difference between a desired rotation speed and a measured rotation speed of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) rotated in the centrifugal cell (3); the machine further comprising: liquid supply means (6, 4) for supplying carrier liquid to the centrifugal brewing unit (2); an optical reading arrangement (100) for reading a code on a periphery of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) while the capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) is rotated relative to the optical reading arrangement (100) in the centrifugal cell (3) and generating an output signal representative of the code; wherein the beverage preparation machine is configured to compute the feedback signal using an output signal of the optical reading arrangement (100) representative of at least part of a code of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) read by the optical reading arrangement (100)..
claims:
1. Beverage preparation machine comprising: - a centrifugal brewing unit (2) for preparing a beverage by centrifugation of an ingredient contained in a capsule and mixed with a carrier liquid, said centrifugal brewing unit (2) comprising: - a centrifugal cell (3) for receiving such a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C); - driving means (5) for rotating said centrifugal cell (3); - a regulator for regulating a rotation speed of said centrifugal cell (3) by controlling said driving means (5) based on a feedback signal representative of a difference between a desired rotation speed and a measured rotation speed of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) rotated in said centrifugal cell (3); the beverage preparation machine further comprising: - liquid supply means (6, 4) for supplying carrier liquid to the centrifugal brewing unit (2); - an optical reading arrangement (100) for reading a code on a periphery of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) while said capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) is rotated in said centrifugal cell (3) relative to said optical reading arrangement (100) and generating an output signal representative of said code; wherein said beverage preparation machine is configured to compute said feedback signal using an output signal of said optical reading arrangement (100) representative of at least part of a code of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) read by said optical reading arrangement (100).
2. The beverage preparation machine according to claim 1, wherein the rotation speed of the capsule is regulated using one or more measured bit periods TBit,
3. The beverage preparation machine according to either of claims

title: Decanoic acid and its compositions for use in the prevention and/or treatment of peroxisomal disorders.
abstract: The present invention relates to decanoic acid and compositions comprising the same for treating and/or preventing a peroxisomal disorder.
claims:
1. Decanoic acid for use in treating and/or preventing a peroxisomal disorder.
2. Decanoic acid for use according to claim 1, wherein the peroxisomal disorder is a peroxisome biogenesis disorder (PBD) or a peroxisomal enzyme deficiency (PED), optionally wherein the peroxisomal disorder is a Zellweger spectrum disorder (ZSD); rhizomelic chondriodysplasia punctata (RCDP) type 1; RCDP type 5; x-linked adrenoleukodystrophy (X-ALD); acyl-CoA oxidase deficiency; D-bifunctional protein deficiency; SCPx deficiency; 2-methylacyl-CoA racemace (AMACR) deficiency; Refsum disease; primary hyperoxaluria type 1; RCDP type 2; RCDP type 3; RCDP type 4; ABCD3 deficiency; BAAT deficiency; or Acatalasemia.
3. Decanoic acid for use according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the subject has a defect in a PEX gene or a gene encoding a peroxisomal protein, optionally wherein the subject has a defect in one or more gene selected from: PEX1, PEX2, PEX3, PEX5, PEX6, PEX7, PEX10, PEX11p, PEX12, PEX13, PEX14, PEX16, PEX19, PEX26, ABCD1, ACOX1, HSD17B4, SCP2, AMACR, PHYH, AGXT, GNPAT, AGPS, FAR1, ABCD3, BAAT, and CAT.
4. Decanoic acid for use according to any preceding claim, wherein the decanoic acid is in the form of triglycerides, diacyl-glycerides, monoacyl-glycerides, a pharmaceutically acceptable salt, and/or an ester.
5. Decanoic acid for use according to any preceding claim, wherein the decanoic acid is in the form of a C10 homotriglyceride.

title: Method for preparing a beverage or liquid food and system using brewing centrifugal force
abstract: A method and system for preparing a beverage or liquid from a food substance contained in a filtering receptacle by passing water through the substance using brewing centrifugal forces. The method includes feeding water into the receptacle, and driving the receptacle in centrifugal rotation to force water to flow through the substance in a centrifugal flow path to the outlet of the receptacle. The system includes equipment necessary to carry out the method. The receptacle is a sealed capsule which is opened for water to be introduced into the capsule, contains a predetermined dose of food substance and is discarded after use.
claims:
1: A capsule for preparing a beverage in a centrifugal brewing device from a food substance contained in the capsule by passing water through the substance using centrifugal brewing forces, the capsule comprising: an enclosure containing a predetermined dose of substance, the enclosure comprising a cup-shaped body for holding the food substance, the body having an upper rim, and a lid or membrane for closing the body at the upper rim, the capsule having a flared design the larger side of the flared design proximal the upper rim, the capsule arranged for engaging an external rotational driving means of the centrifugal brewing device at a periphery of the capsule with respect to an axis of rotation of the capsule.
2: The capsule of claim 1, wherein the capsule is configured for rotation at a centrifugal speed of at least 5000 rpm or 7000 rpm or 1000 to 20000 rpm.
3: The capsule of claim 1, wherein the cup-shaped body is formed from aluminium and/or plastic.
4: The capsule of claim 1, wherein lid is welded on upper edges of the body, including by ultrasonic welding.
5: The capsule of claim 1, wherein the cup-shaped body comprises least one recess portion.
6: The capsule of claim 1, wherein the cup-shaped body comprises a roughened portion at the surface of the capsule.

title: Coffee compositions
abstract: Coffee compositions that are derived from medium- and high-yield extracts while also having improved taste and aroma. Processes for producing such coffee compositions are also shown.
claims:
1. A coffee composition comprising furfuryl alcohol; pyridine; and one or more monosaccharides, wherein a ratio of concentrations of the furfurylalcohol to the pyridine is greater than or equal to 30; and a total sum of the concentrations of the one or more monosaccharides is greater than or equal to 18 wt. %.
2. The coffee composition of claim 1 further comprising 2-ethyl-6-methylpyrazine, 2-ethyl-5 methylpyrazine, 2-ethyl-3-methylpyrazine, 2,3,5-trimethylpyrazine, 2-ethyl-3,6 dimethylpyrazine, 2-ethyl-3,5-dimethylpyrazine, and 2,3-diethyl-5-methylpyrazine,
wherein the sum of the absolute content of 2-ethyl-6-methylpyrazine, 2-ethyl-5-methylpyrazine, 2-ethyl-3 methy 1 pyrazine, 2,3,5-trimethy 1 pyrazine, 2-ethy 1-3,6-dimethy 1 pyrazine, 2-ethy 1-3,5 dimethy 1 pyrazine, and 2,3-diethyl-5-methylpyrazine is greater than or equal to 50.0 mg/kg of soluble coffee solids of the coffee composition.
3. The coffee composition of claim 1 wherein the absolute content of the furfuryl alcohol is greater than or equal to 2,000 mg/kg of soluble coffee solids of the coffee composition.
4. The coffee composition of claim 1 further comprising one or more of 2-acethylthiazole, 2-acetylpyrazine, and 2-acetylpyridine,
wherein the sum of the absolute content of 2-acethylthiazole, 2-acetylpyrazine, and 2-acetylpyridine is greater than or equal to 2.70 mg/kg of soluble coffee solids of the coffee composition.

title: Food or beverage product with agglomerated pea protein
abstract: The present invention relates to a method of producing a food or beverage product, in particular to a method for forming agglomerated pea proteins in an ingredient composition. The invention also relates food or beverage product comprising agglomerated pea proteins.
claims:
1. A method of producing a food or beverage product, the method comprising;
providing an aqueous ingredient composition comprising pea protein at a concentration of 1.0 to 6 wt.%;
adding to the ingredient composition 4.0 - 20 mM of divalent cations available to complex the pea protein;
and subsequently heat treating the ingredient composition at a pH of to 6.6 - 7.3 to form agglomerates comprising pea protein wherein the heat treatment is performed at a temperature of 80°C to 125°C for a period of 30 seconds to 20 minutes, or at a temperature of above 125 °C for 3 - 45 seconds.
2. A method according to claim 1 wherein the agglomerates have a D[4,3] mean diameter as measured by laser diffraction of 2 to 50 microns.
3. A method according to claim 1 or 2 wherein the ingredient composition is subjected to homogenization.
4. A method according to any one of claims 1 to 3 wherein the pea protein is a pea protein isolate.
5. A method according to any one of claims 1 to 4 wherein the divalent cations are selected from the group consisting of calcium cations, magnesium cations and combinations thereof.
6. A method according to any one of claims 1 to 5 wherein the divalent cations are provi

title: A nutritional composition comprising a combination of human milk oligosaccharides to improve the gastrointestinal barrier
abstract: The present invention relates to nutritional compositions comprising 2'-Fucosyllactose (2'FL), Di-fucosyllactose (DiFL), Lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), Lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT), 3'-Sialyllactose (3'SL) and 6'-Sialyllactose (6'SL) for use in improving gastrointestinal barrier. In particular, the present invention relates to improving the gastrointestinal barrier in an infant, a young child or children aged above 3 years to 8 years.
claims:
1. A method for improving a gastrointestinal barrier in a subject selected from the group consisting of an infant (child under the age of 12 months),a young child (between 1 year and less than 3 years) and a child (aged from 3 years to 8 years), 5 the method comprising administering a synthetic nutritional composition comprising 2'-Fucosyllactose (2'FL), Di-fucosyllactose (DiFL), Lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), Lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT), 3'-Sialyllactose (3'SL) and 6'-Sialyllactose (6'SL) to the subject, wherein the improving the gastrointestinal barrier comprises improving barrier protection and/or improving barrier structure.
10
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the improving the gastrointestinal barrier further comprises improving barrier maturation, improving barrier function, and/or improving barrier repair.
15
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the improving the gastrointestinal barrier further comprises improving barrier function.
4. The method according to claim 1, wherein the improving barrier protection comprises improving prevention of barrier dysfunction, improving prevention of 20 barrier leakiness, improving protection of tight junction structure, and improving protection of intestinal epithelial lining integrity.

title: Beverage pod system
abstract: The invention concerns an extraction device for extracting a beverage ingredient by supplying an extraction liquid into a pod, said extraction device comprising : - upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts (1, 2), wherein the upstream pod enclosing part (2) is translatable along a horizontal longitudinal axis (XX') between an open position for inserting and removing the pod (3) and a closed position for forming an extraction chamber enclosing the pod during extraction, wherein, in the upstream pod enclosing part (1), the cage (21) comprises a side wall (211) translatable between the open position and the closed position and an end wall (22) movable inside the side wall (211), wherein the side wall (211) and the end wall (22) are actuated by one common motor (10) and a common actuator (8).

title: Nutritional compositions for infants and/or young children
abstract: The present invention relates to nutritional compositions for infants or young children and their health effects. In particular, it relates to nutritional compositions comprising specific oligosaccharides for use to prevent and/or treat infection in an infant or young child, by promote and/or reduce specific microbiota communities in an infant or young child.
claims:
1. Nutritional composition comprising at least one fucosylated oligosaccharide and at least one N-acetylated oligosaccharide, for use to prevent and/or treat infection by promoting in an infant or young child a Community type B and/or by reducing a Community type C, wherein Community type B is defined as a microbiota community comprising at least 80% Bifidobactera (% relative abundance ); Community type C is defined as a microbiota community comprising from 50 to 80% Bifidobacteria (% relative abundance), and further comprising one or more of Firmicutes, Bacteroidetes and/or Proteobacteria; and wherein said promoting or reducing is in comparison to the microbiota in the gut of infants or young children fed predominantly or exclusively with the conventional nutritional composition not comprising said oligosaccharides.
2. Nutritional composition according to claim 1, wherein the use is to prevent and/or treat infection later in life.
3. Nutritional composition for use according to any of the preceding claims wherein the fucosylated oligosaccharide is selected from the group consisting of the fucosylated oligosaccharide is selected from the list consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose, 3'fucosyllactose, difucosyllactose, lacto-N-fucopentaose I, lacto-N-fucopentaose II, lacto-N-fucopentaose III, lacto-N-fucopentaose V, lacto-N-fucohexaose, lacto-N-difucohexaose I, fucosyllacto-N-hexaose, fucosyllacto-N-neohexaose I, fucosyllacto-N-neohexaose II, difucosyllacto-N-hexaose I, difucosyllacto-N-neohexaose I, difucosyllacto-N-neohexaose II, fucosyl-para-Lacto-N-hexaose, and any combination thereof.
4. Nutritional

title: Microporous chocolate material and method for production thereof
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: disclosed microporous chocolate material has a plastic viscosity before aeration according to measurement results according to ICA method 46 (2000) from 0.1 Pa⋅s to 20 Pa⋅s. Said composition has inert gas bubbles dispersed therein. Dispersed bubbles are characterized by average bubble size less than or equal to 100 mcm and mean-square deviation of the bubble size being less than or equal to 60 mcm. Said bubble size parameters are determined by X-ray tomography and/or confocal laser scanning microscopy. Total bubble surface area (TSA) ranges from 0.5 m2 to 1.10 m2 per 100 g of porous chocolate material. Gas bubbles are uniformly distributed in the porous chocolate material with homogeneity index equal to at least 0.8. Additionally, proposed is a method for production of a microporous chocolate material.EFFECT: invention is aimed at improvement of the organoleptic characteristics of the chocolate material, reduction of sugar intensity and simplification of the products manufacture.5 cl, 35 dwg, 2 tbl, 10 ex
claims: 1. Микропористый шоколадный материал с пластической вязкостью до аэрации, которая по результатам измерения по методу 46 ICA (2000) составляет от 0,1 до 20 Па⋅с, где: (i) композиция имеет диспергированные в ней пузырьки инертного газа, причем диспергированные пузырьки характеризуются следующими параметрами: (a) средний размер пузырьков меньше или равен 100 мкм, (b) среднеквадратичное отклонение размера пузырьков меньше или равно 60 мкм; (c) общая площадь поверхности пузырька (TSA) составляет от 0,5 до 1,2 м2на 100 г пористого шоколадного материала; где параметры (a) и (b) определяют рентгеновской томографией и/или конфокальной лазерной сканирующей микроскопией (CLSM); и где (ii) пузырьки газа равномерно распределены в пористом шоколадном материале с индексом однородности по меньшей мере 0,8, причём шоколадный материал представляет собой формованную плитку из молочного шоколада. 2. Микропористый шоколадный материал по п. 1, в котором параметр TSA рассчитывают по уравнению (1): (1), где TSA - общая площадь поверхности пузырька, P - пористость пористого шоколадного материала; mac- масса аэрированной композиции, г; dac- плотность аэрированной композиции, г/см3, и r - радиус пузырька среднего размера, см. 3. Микропористый шоколадный материал по п. 2, в котором Р - пористость пористого шоколадного материала от 11 до 19%. 4. Микропористый шоколадный материал по любому из предшествующих пунктов, который получен способом, включающим следующие стадии: (I) перемешивание шоколадного материала в условиях высокого усилия сдвига, по меньшей мере 200 с-1, при этом этот шоколадный материал обладает пластической вязкостью до аэрации, которая по результатам измерения по методу 46 ICA (2000) составляет от 0,1 до 20 Па⋅с, и (II) прохождение шоколадного материала после стадии (I) через зону впрыска, находящуюся между двумя областями под разным давлением, (III) впрыск инертного газа при

title: Edible oil-in-water (O/W) emulsions comprising pea proteins
abstract: The present invention relates to an edible oil-in-water (o/w) emulsion comprising (a) from 50% to 80% by weight of an aqueous phase, (b) from 20% to 50% by weight of a vegetable lipid phase, and (c) from 0.25% to 1.50% by weight of a vegetable-based protein, based on the total weight of the emulsion, (d) optionally, an acidity regulator, wherein the pea protein constitutes at least 50% by weight of all plant-based proteins present in the emulsion, and wherein the emulsion is substantially free, preferably free, of dairy and animal-derived ingredients. The invention also relates to a whipped cream thereof and to a method for producing an edible o/w emulsion.
claims:
1.可食用水包油(o/w)乳液，基于所述乳液的总重量计，所述乳液包含
(a)50重量％至80重量％的水相，
(b)20重量％至50重量％的植物脂质相，以及
(c)0.25重量％至1.50重量％的植物基蛋白质，
(d)任选的，酸度调节剂，
其中豌豆蛋白质构成所述乳液中存在的所有植物基蛋白质的至少50重量％，并且
其中所述乳液基本上不含、优选不含乳品和动物来源的成分。
2.根据权利要求1所述的乳液，其中豌豆蛋白质是所述乳液中的唯一蛋白质。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的乳液，其中所述乳液基本上不含增稠剂和/或乳化剂和/或除所述植物基蛋白质以外的乳化剂。
4.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的乳液，其中豌豆蛋白质是所述乳液中的唯一蛋白质，并且其中所述乳液基本上不含、优选不含增稠剂和/或稳定剂和/或除所述豌豆蛋白质以外的乳化剂。
5.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的乳液，其中所述植物脂质相包含植物液体油和植物固体脂肪的共混物，优选由所述共混物组成。
6.根据权利要求5所述的乳液，其中所述共混物含有10重量％至30重量％的植物液体油和70重量％至90重量％的植物固体脂肪。
7.根据权利要求5所述的乳液，其中所述共混物含有30重量％至50重量％的植物液体油和50重量％至70重量％的固体脂肪。
8.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的乳液，其中所述植物脂质相包含第一植物固体脂肪和第二植物固体脂肪的共混物。
9.根据权利要求7所述的乳液，其中所述第一植物固体脂肪以80重量％至99重量％的量存在于所述共混物中，并且所述第二植物固体脂肪以1重量％至20重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。
10.根据权利要求5至9中任一项所述的乳液，其中所述共混物具有在20℃下至少50重量％的植物固体脂肪含量(SFC)。
11.根据权利要求6至9中任一项所述的乳液，其中所述共混物具有在20℃下40重量％至60重量％、优选40重量％至55重量％的植物固体脂肪含量(SFC)。
12.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的乳液，所述乳液包含酸度调节剂。
13.打发奶油，所述打发奶油能够通过打发根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的乳液获得。
14.打发奶油，所述打发奶油能够通过将空气掺入根据权利要求1至12中任一项所述的乳液中获得。
15.食物产品，所述食物产品包含根据权利要求1至12中任一项所述的乳液。
16.食物产品，所述食物产品包含根据权利要求13或14所述的打发奶油。

title: Beverage or foodstuff preparation system
abstract: A system (2) comprising a container (6) and a machine (4) for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff, the container (6) including: a body portion (62) with a storage portion (58) for containing a precursor material; a closing member (56) to close the storage portion (58); a machine-readable code (44) storing preparation information, said code (44) arranged on the closing member (56), the machine (4) including: a code reading system (18) to read the code (44) of the container (6); a processing unit (14) for processing the precursor material of the container (6), and; electrical circuitry (16) to control the processing unit (14) based on the preparation information read from the code (44), wherein the code reading system (18) includes a code reader (46), and a positioning mechanism (110) to translate along an axis the container (6) and code reader (46) relative to each other from a holding position, in which the container (6) is separated from a reading head of the code reader (46) and the code (44) is aligned along said axis with the code reader (46), to a reading position, in which the code (44) of the container (6) is in contact with the reading head.
claims:
1. A system comprising a container and a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff,
the container including:
a body portion with a storage portion for containing a precursor material;
a closing member to close the storage portion;
a machine-readable optical code storing preparation information, said code arranged on the closing member,
the machine including:
a code reading system to read the optical code of the container;
a processing unit for processing the precursor material of the container, and;
electrical circuitry to control the processing unit based on the preparation information read from the code,
wherein the code reading system includes a code reader, and a positioning mechanism to translate along an axis the container and code reader relative to each other from a holding position, in which the container is separated from a reading head of the code reader and the code is aligned along said axis with the code reader, to a reading position, in which the code of the container is in contact with the reading head, and in which the closing member presents a comparatively more uniform surface for reading of the code compared to the holding position.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the machine includes a guide portion, which is arranged to guide the cont

title: Beverage preparation system
abstract: Abstract There is described a beverage preparation machine comprising a centrifugal brewing unit (2) for preparing a beverage by centrifugation of an ingredient contained in a capsule and mixed with a carrier liquid, the centrifugal brewing unit (2) comprising a centrifugal cell (3) for receiving such a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C); driving means (5) for rotating the centrifugal cell (3); a regulator for regulating a rotation speed of the centrifugal cell (3) by controlling the driving means (5) based on a feedback signal representative of a difference between a desired rotation speed and a measured rotation speed of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) rotated in the centrifugal cell (3); the machine further comprising: liquid supply means (6, 4) for supplying carrier liquid to the centrifugal brewing unit (2); an optical reading arrangement (100) for reading a code on a periphery of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) while the capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) is rotated relative to the optical reading arrangement (100) in the centrifugal cell (3) and generating an output signal representative of the code; wherein the beverage preparation machine is 15 configured to compute the feedback signal using an output signal of the optical reading arrangement (100) representative of at least part of a code of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) read by the optical reading arrangement (100). claims:
1. Beverage preparation machine comprising: - a centrifugal brewing unit (2) for preparing a beverage by centrifugation of 5 an ingredient contained in a capsule and mixed with a carrier liquid, said centrifugal brewing unit (2) comprising: - a centrifugal cell (3) for receiving such a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C); - driving means (5) for rotating said centrifugal cell (3); - a regulator for regulating a rotation speed of said centrifugal cell (3) by 10 controlling said driving means (5) based on a feedback signal representative of a difference between a desired rotation speed and a measured rotation speed of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) rotated in said centrifugal cell (3); the beverage preparation machine further comprising: - liquid supply means (6, 4) for supplying carrier liquid to the centrifugal 15 brewing unit (2); - an optical reading arrangement (100) for reading a code on a periphery of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) while said capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) is rotated in said centrifugal cell (3) relative to said optical reading arrangement (100) and generating an output signal representative of said code; 20 wherein said beverage preparation machine is configured to compute said feedback signal using an output signal of said optical reading arrangement (100) representative of at least part of a code of a capsule (2A, 2B, 2C) read by said optical reading arrangement (100).
