title: Method for roasting coffee beans
abstract: The invention concerns an apparatus for roasting partially pre-roasted coffee beans comprising : - a vessel (1) to contain coffee beans, - an electrical heater (13) to heat coffee beans contained in the vessel, - at least one temperature sensor (23) to measure temperature in the vessel, - a control system (180) operable to control the heater, wherein the control system is configured to : - apply a roasting recipe dedicated to the roasting of partially pre-roasted beans comprising at least a temperature versus time profile, - measure the concentration of at least one volatile organic component (VOC) in the smoke produced in the vessel during the time the roasting recipe is applied, - detect an increase of the measured concentration in function of time, - stop heating if no increase of the measured concentration happens after a set reference time t
claims:
1. An apparatus for roasting partially pre-roasted coffee beans comprising : - a vessel to contain coffee beans, 5   - an electrical heater to heat coffee beans contained in the vessel, - at least one temperature sensor to measure temperature in the vessel, - a control system operable to control the heater, wherein the control system is configured to : - apply a roasting recipe dedicated to the roasting of partially pre-roasted beans comprising 0 at least a temperature versus time profile, - measure the concentration of at least one volatile organic component (VOC) in the smoke produced in the vessel during the time the roasting recipe is applied, - detect an increase of the measured concentration in function of time, - stop heating if no increase of the measured concentration happens after a set reference 5 timeti.
2. The apparatus according to Claim 1, wherein the concentration at least one component from the list of: CO, CO2, NO, NO2, SO2, formaldehyde is measured. !0   
3. The apparatus according to Claim 1 or 2, wherein the reference time ti is set to 5 minutes.
4. The apparatus according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the control system is configured to stop the electrical heater if the first increase of the measured concentration of the at least one volatile organic component (VOC) happens before a set reference time to.

title: Capsule for producing beverage
abstract: The invention relates to a capsule for use in a beverage preparation machine, said capsule containing soluble and/or extractable beverage ingredients, said capsule comprising:-a capsule body (2) defining a chamber (21),-a top membrane (3) closing a top opening and adapted to be pierced to inject a liquid into the capsule, and-a bottom membrane (4) arranged inside the chamber (21) so as to define a dosing chamber between the top membrane (3) and said bottom membrane, and-an opening device (5), and an opening device (5) provided inside the chamber and adapted to open the chamber during injection of the liquid by relative engagement of the opening device with the bottom membrane (4) under the action of an increase in liquid pressure in the dispensing chamber, where the opening device (5) is made of a biodegradable material, and the biodegradable material is a polymer composition comprising:-at least one polymer selected from the group consisting of a polyhydroxyalkanoate (PHA),-at least one or more nucleating agents,-at least one or more mineral fillers.
claims:
1.一种用于在饮料制备机器中使用的胶囊(1)，所述胶囊含有可溶和/或可提取的饮料配料，
所述胶囊包括：
-胶囊主体(2)，所述胶囊主体限定腔室(21)，
-顶部膜片(3)，所述顶部膜片封闭顶部开口，并且被适配为被刺破以将液体注入到所述胶囊中，和
-底部膜片(4)，所述底部膜片设置在所述腔室(21)内部以便在所述顶部膜片(3)与所述底部膜片之间界定配料腔室，和
-打开装置(5)，所述打开装置设置在所述腔室内部并且被适配为在注入所述液体期间在所述配料腔室中的液体压力增加的作用下通过所述打开装置与所述底部膜片(4)的相对接合来打开所述腔室，
其中所述打开装置(5)是由可生物降解材料制成的模制件，并且所述可生物降解材料是聚合物组合物，所述聚合物组合物包含：
-至少一种选自由以下项组成的组的聚合物：聚羟基链烷酸酯(PHA)，
-至少一种或多种成核剂，
-至少一种或多种矿物填料。
2.根据权利要求1所述的胶囊，其中所述聚合物组合物包含至少一种含有式(I)重复单元的聚羟基链烷酸酯：
-O-CHRi-(CH2)n-CO-
其中：
-Ri选自-H、C1-C12烷基、C-C16环烷基、C2-C12烯基，其任选地被至少一个选自以下的基团取代：卤素(F、Cl、Br)、-CN、-OH、
-COOH、-OR、-COOR(其中R＝C1-C4烷基、苄基)，
-n为零或1至6的整数，优选为1或2。
3.根据权利要求2所述的胶囊，其中所述聚合物组合物包含至少一种聚羟基链烷酸酯，其中Ri是甲基或乙基，并且n为1或2。
4.根据权利要求2或3所述的胶囊，其中所述聚羟基链烷酸酯是含有式(I)重复单元与至少一种来源于能够与羟基链烷酸酯共聚合的共聚单体的重复单元组合的共聚物或三元共聚物。
5.根据前述权利要

title: Method for obtaining outlet opening of capsule
abstract: The invention relates to a method for obtaining at least an outlet opening (8) of a carrier tray (7) which can be arranged in an interior space of a capsule (1) for preparing a beverage, the outlet opening (8) being adapted to allow the prepared beverage to flow out of the interior space towards the outside of the capsule (1) when the capsule (1) is used in the beverage preparation device. The method comprises the steps of:-providing a sheet material (70) from which the carrier tray (7) having the outlet openings (8) can be obtained,-cutting the sheet material (70) by means of a cutting device to obtain a first set of outlet openings (8),-cutting the sheet material (70) by means of an alignment element (101) extending through an alignment opening (71) provided in the sheet material (70) to obtain a second set of outlet openings (71), the first set of outlet openings is aligned with respect to the cutting device,-the sheet material (70) having the first set of outlet openings so aligned is cut by the cutting device to obtain a second set of outlet openings, and-the sheet material (70) is intermittently moved along different distances with respect to the cutting device.
claims:
1.一种用于至少获得承载盘(7)的出口开口(8)的方法，所述承载盘能够设置在用于制备饮料的胶囊(1)的内部空间中，其中当在饮料制备装置中使用所述胶囊(1)时，所述出口开口(8)适于使制备的饮料从所述内部空间朝所述胶囊(1)的外部流出，其中所述方法包括以下步骤：
提供能够从中获得具有所述出口开口(8)的所述承载盘(7)的片材材料(70)，
通过切割装置切割所述片材材料(70)以获得所述出口开口(8)的第一集合，
通过延伸穿过设置在所述片材材料(70)中的对齐开口(71)的对齐元件(101)，相对于所述切割装置对齐所述出口开口的所述第一集合，
通过所述切割装置切割具有如此对齐的出口开口的第一集合的所述片材材料(70)，以获得所述出口开口的第二集合，以及
相对于所述切割装置沿不同距离间歇地移动所述片材材料(70)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的方法，所述方法还包括以下步骤：
通过延伸穿过设置在所述片材材料(70)中的另外的对齐开口(72)的所述对齐元件(101)，相对于所述切割装置对齐所述出口开口(8)的所述集合，以及
通过所述切割装置切割具有如此对齐的所述出口开口(8)的集合的所述片材材料(70)，以获得所述出口开口(8)的另外的集合。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的方法，所述方法还包括以下步骤：
通过延伸穿过设置在所述片材材料(70)中的所述对齐开口(71)的另外的对齐元件(102)，相对于所述切割装置对齐所述出口开口(8)的所述集合，以及
通过所述切割装置切割具有如此对齐的所述出口开口(8)的集合的所述片材材料(70)，以获得所述出口开口的附加集合。
4.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的方法，其中所述出口开口(8)的一个集合的所述出口开口的至少一部分布置在所述出口开口(8)的相应其他集合的所述出口开口(8)之间。
5.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的方法，所述方法还包括通过所述切割装置切割所述片材材料以获得所述对齐开口(71)的步骤。
6.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的方法，其中在用以获得所述出口开口的所述第一集合的切割步骤中获得所述对齐开口(71)。
7.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的方法，所述方法还包括以下步骤：

title: Method for producing milk like products
abstract: A method for producing mammary gland cells and a method of producing a mammalian milk like product, for example a human milk like product comprising generating lactocytes derived from mammalian induced pluripotent stem cells (miPSC), for example human induced pluripotent stem cells (hiPSC), and expressing the mammalian milk like product, for example the human milk like product from lactocytes.
claims:
1. A method of producing a population of mammary gland cells, comprising: i) culturing mammalian induced pluripotent stem cells (miPSCs) in a culture medium comprising bone morphogenic protein 4 (BMP4) to generate embryoid bodies (EBs), and ii) growing the EBs to generate a population of mammary cells.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the culturing step i) comprises culturing the miPSCs in MammoCult medium and BMP4, in a 3D-suspension culture system thereby directing the iPSCs to differentiate towards non-neural ectoderm cells.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the growing step ii) comprises growing the formed EBs in a 3D embedding system for at least 30 days, for example for 32 days, to generate lactocytes.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the mammary gland cells are human mammary gland cells.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein BMP4 is added to the culture medium between day 0 and day 10 where day 0 is the time point where the iPSCs are first added to the culture medium.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein BMP4 is added to the culture medium for 3 days.
7. The method of claim 1, wherein BMP4 is added to the culture medium in a concentration of 5 to 20 ng/ml.
8. The method of claim 1, wherein the EBs express one or more mammary gla

title: Capsule, system and method for delivering a filter-like coffee extract
abstract: The invention concerns a capsule for preparing a filter-type coffee extract comprising a substantially rigid capsule body having a circumferential sidewall extending around an inner space of the capsule, a base wall covering the inner space at a first end of the sidewall, a flange arranged circumferentially at a second end of the sidewall of the base body, a lid removably attached to the flange and covering the inner space at a second end of the sidewall opposite the base wall and tightly closing the capsule, and a filter element positioned in the inner space of the capsule between the beverage ingredient and the lid in which the inner space of the capsule is at least partially filled with ground coffee, preferably roast and ground coffee, having a particle size distribution D4,3 of 500 microns +/- 30 microns and a fraction of fine particles between 2 and 9 % of the roast and ground coffee. The invention also relates to a system comprising said capsule, to the use of said capsule or system and to a method for delivering a filter-like coffee extract.
claims:
1. Capsule for preparing a filter-type coffee extract comprising - a substantially rigid capsule body having a circumferential sidewall extending around an inner space of the capsule, - a base wall covering the inner space at a first end of the sidewall, - a flange arranged circumferentially at a second end of the sidewall of the capsule body, - a lid removably attached to the flange and covering the inner space at a second end of the sidewall opposite the base wall and tightly closing the capsule, and - a filter element positioned in the inner space of the capsule between the beverage ingredient and the lid, wherein the inner space of the capsule is at least partially filled with ground coffee, preferably roast and ground coffee, having a particle size distribution D4,3 of 500 microns +/- 30 microns and a fraction of fine particles between 2 and 9 % of the roast and ground coffee.
2. Capsule according to claim 1 wherein the fine particles have an average diameter of less than 50 microns.
3. Capsule according to claim 1 or 2 wherein the ground coffee inside the capsule is in an amount between 4 and 5.5 grams.
4. Capsule according to anyone of the preceding claims, wherein the ground coffee in the capsule has a density between 380 and 450 g/l.
5. Capsule according to anyone of the preceding claims, wherein the coffee extract is delivered in a flow time of less than 40 s fo

title: Process for a dried instant noodle
claims:
Claims
1 . A process for the production of a dried instant noodle comprising cereal flour, Kansui salts, soy protein source and a flour selected from the group of a pulse flour, a flour from an oilseed press cake, a flour from a nut press cake, a flour from a barley spent grain or a combination thereof, the process comprising the steps of: a) Mixing the cereal flour, the soy protein source, the flour selected from the group of a pulse flour, a flour from an oilseed press cake, a flour from a nut press cake, a flour from a barley spent grain or a combination thereof and optionally other dry ingredients with the Kansui salts and water to form a dough; b) Sheeting and slitting the dough to obtain noodle strands; c) Steaming the noodle strands from step b); d) Cutting the noodle strands from step c) and optionally folding; e) Frying the noodle strands from step d) in oil or air drying the noodle strands from step d); f) Cooling.
2. A process for the production of a dried instant noodle as claimed in claim 1 , comprising 10 to 70wt% of cereal flour (by weight of the total composition), 0.2 to 3.5wt% of Kansui salts (by weight of the total composition), 3 to 20wt% of soy protein source (by weight of the total composition) and 5 to 40wt% of flour selected from the group of a pulse flour, a flour from an oilseed press cake, a flour from a nut press cake, a flour from a barley spent grain or a combination thereof (by weight of the total composition).
3. A process for the production of a dried instant noodle in any one of claims 1 to 2, wherein t

title: A nutritional composition comprising metabolites of HMOs to improve the gastrointestinal barrier
abstract: The present invention relates to nutritional compositions comprising metabolites of HMOs to improve the gastrointestinal barrier. In particular, the invention relates to nutritional compositions comprising metabolites of HMOs for infants with impaired microbiota since their microbiota may not be able to metabolize HMOs.
claims:
1. A method of improving the gastrointestinal barrier in an infant (child under the age of 12 months) or a young child (between 1 year and 3 years) or a child (aged from more than 3 years to less than 8 years);
5 the method comprising administering to the infant or young child a nutritional composition comprising metabolites of HMOs; or
the method comprising administering to the child a nutritional composition in the form of a growing-up milk comprising metabolites of HMOs;
wherein the metabolites of HMOs are obtained by fermenting a composition
10 comprising one or more HMOs selected from the group consisting of 2'FL, DiFL, 3'SL, 6'SL, LNT and LNnT in a composition comprising a baby microbiota, wherein metabolites of HMOs are obtained from 0.004-5 g/L of HMOs.
2. Use of a nutritional composition comprising metabolites of HMOs in the
15 manufacture of a medicament for improving the gastrointestinal barrier in an infant (child under the age of 12 months) or a young child (between 1 year and 3 years) or a child (aged from more than 3 years to less than 8 years);
wherein the nutritional composition to be administered to the child is in the form of a growing-up milk;

title: Bio-based polymer beverage capsules
abstract: The present invention relates to capsules for preparation of a beverage upon injection of liquid under pressure into the capsule, wherein the capsule body comprises or consists of a biopolymer film comprising polyhydroxyalkanoate (PHA) and polyglycolide (PGA), wherein the biopolymer film comprises a layered structure comprising PHA layer - PGA layer - PHA layer, and wherein the PHA has been chemically modified with one or more chain extenders and/or one or more compatibilizers.
claims:
1. A capsule for preparation of a beverage upon injection of liquid under pressure into the capsule, wherein the capsule body comprises or consists of a biopolymer film comprising polyhydroxyalkanoate (PHA) and polyglycolide (PGA), wherein the biopolymer film comprises a layered structure comprising PHA layer - PGA layer - PHA layer, and wherein the PHA has been chemically modified with one or more chain extenders and/or one or more compatibilizers.
2. The capsule according to claim 1, wherein the PHA is functionalised, optionally wherein the PHA is functionalised by carboxylation, hydroxylation, epoxidation, or by grafting.
3. The capsule according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the one or more chain extenders are multi-functional addition-type chain extenders that react with carboxyl and/or hydroxyl terminal groups, preferably wherein the one or more chain extenders comprise or consist of: (a) an epoxy-based chain extender, optionally wherein the one or more chain extenders comprise or consist of a Joncryl chain extender; (b) a phosphate/phosphite-based chain extender, optionally wherein the one or more chain extenders comprise or consist of triphenylphosphite (TPP) or tris(nonyl-phenyl)phosphite (TNPP); (c) a carbodiimide-based chain extender, optionally wherein the one or more chain extenders comprise or consist of polycarbodiimide (PCDI); and/or (d) an anhydride-based chain extender, optionally wherein the one or more chain extenders comprise or consist of pyromellitic dianhydride (PMDA).
4. The capsule according to

title: Beverage preparation system
abstract: The invention concerns a machine for preparing beverages from at least two different types of containers, said machine comprising: —a first extraction device (1) and a second extraction device (1) configured to prepare beverages from different types of containers, wherein the first extraction device is a motorised extraction device actuated by a motor (121) during the preparation of a beverage from the first type of container, —a fluid supply system (3), said system comprising at least a fluid source (31), a pumping means (32), a heating and/or cooling means (33) and a valve (4) configured for supplying the fluid either to the first extraction device (1) through a first outlet (422a) or to the second extraction device (2) through a second outlet (422b).
claims:
1. Machine for preparing beverages from at least two different types of containers, said machine comprising:
a first extraction device for extracting a first beverage by supplying an extraction liquid into a first type of pre-portioned single-serving container comprising a first beverage ingredient and a second extraction device for extracting a second beverage by supplying an extraction liquid into a second type of pre-portioned single-serving container comprising a second beverage ingredient,
said devices being of different types, wherein the first extraction device is a motorised extraction device actuated by a motor during the preparation of a first beverage from the first type of container,
a fluid supply system, said system comprising at least a fluid source, a pumping means, a heating and/or cooling means and a valve configured for supplying the fluid either to the first extraction device through a first outlet or to the second extraction device through a second outlet,
wherein the valve comprises a movable part configured to dispense the fluid through said first outlet or through said second outlet depending on the position of said movable part, and
the movable part of the valve is indirectly actuated by the motor of the motorised extraction device, when said motor actuates the motorised extraction device for the preparation of a beverage by said extraction device and is moved to a position where the fluid is dispensed through the first outlet, and
wherein, at rest, the movable part is positioned so that the fluid is dispensed through the second outlet.

title: Savory product comprising stable polyunsaturated fatty acid
abstract: The invention relates to a method of making a savory product, said method comprising wet mixing a composition comprising (i) one or more of flax seed, hemp or chia; (ii) oil source; and (iii) protein source; blending the wet mix; heating the blended mix; and cooling to form a savory product with a total solid content of between 10 to 65 wt%.
claims:
1. A method of making a savory product, said method comprising a) wet mixing a composition comprising (i) one or more of flax seed, hemp or chia; (ii) oil source; and (iii) protein source; b)     blending the wet mix; c)     heating the blended mix; and d) cooling to form a savory product with a total solid content of between 10 to 65 wt%.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the oil source and protein source are not derived from flax seed, hemp, or chia.
3. The method according to any one of claims 1 and 2, wherein mucilage has been substantially removed from the flax seed.
4. The method according to claim 3, wherein the mucilage has been substantially removed by mixing the flax seeds in water, adjusting the pH to about 6, and applying heat to the mixture.
5. The method according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the flax seeds are at least 50% dehulled.
6. The method according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the flax seeds are whole flax seeds.
7. The method according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein the wet mix is formed by shearing the one or more of flax seeds, hemp, or chia in water with crystals and with the protein sour

title: Beverage or food preparation system
abstract: A system comprising: a container for containing a precursor material, the container for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or a food product or a precursor thereof, the container comprising a machine-readable code storing preparation information for use with a preparation process performed by the machine, wherein the code comprises a reference portion for locating a data portion, where the data portion comprises at least one data unit arranged at an encoding distance (d) from the starting position along a virtual encoding line (D) as a variable to at least partially encode a value of a parameter of the preparation information; and a machine for preparing a beverage and/or food product or a precursor thereof, the machine comprising: a code reading system to read the code of the container; a processing unit for processing the precursor material of the container; and an electrical circuit to control the processing unit based on the preparation information read from the code, where the electrical circuit is configured to: read one or more of the coded distances (d) from the code; it is determined whether a validity condition associated with the or each data unit's location is satisfied based on one or more of the following: 1) identifying a predetermined number of data units on a portion of the encoding line; 2) the part of the coding line has no data unit or comprises a single data unit; and 3) a distance between the data units on the encoding line along the encoding line is greater than or less than a predetermined amount; converting the or each coded distance (d) into one or more values of the parameter; and control the processing unit based on the value of the parameter.
claims:
1.一种用于制备饮料和/或食品或其前体的机器，所述机器包括：代码读取系统，所述代码读取系统用于读取容器的代码，所述代码包括用于定位数据部分(D)的参考部分(R)，其中所述数据部分包括至少一个数据单元，所述至少一个数据单元被布置在沿着虚拟编码线(E)距起始位置的编码距离(d)处，作为至少部分地对所述制备信息的参数的值进行编码的变量；处理单元，所述处理单元用于处理所述容器的前体材料；和电气电路，所述电气电路用以基于从所述代码读取的所述制备信息来控制所述处理单元，
其中所述电气电路被配置为：
确定所述代码的所述数据单元的位置；
基于以下中的一者或多者来确定是否满足与所述数据单元或每个数据单元的位置相关联的有效性条件：
1)在所述编码线的一部分上识别到数据单元的预定数量；
2)所述编码线的一部分不存在数据单元，其中所述部分位于不同编码距离的相邻结束位置与起始位置之间；并且
3)沿着所述编码线在所述编码线上的数据单元之间的距离大于或小于预定量；
并且如果不满足所述有效性条件，则所述电气电路被配置为不进行以下操作：将所述编码距离或每个编码距离(d)转换为所述参数的一个或多个值，
并且如果满足所述有效性条件，则所述电气电路被配置为：将所述编码距离或每个编码距离(d)转换为所述参数的一个或多个值；并且基于所述参数的所述值来控制所述处理单元。
2.根据任一前述权利要求所述的机器，其中在所述容器上存在多个代码，并且如果不满足所述有效性条件，则所述电气电路被配置为：
确定部分读取条件，所述部分读取条件基于以下中的一者或多者；
识别到所述代码的参考部分的预定数量；
识别到所述代码的单元的预定数量；
如果满足所述部分读取条件，则所述代码读取系统被配置为再次读取所述代码。
3.根据权利要求2所述的机器，其中如果不满足所述部分读取条件，则所述电气电路被配置为不进行以下操作：将所述编码距离或每个编码距离(d)转换为所述参数的一个或多个值；并且基于所述参数的所述值来控制所述处理单元。
4.根据权利要求2或3中任一项所述的机器，其中所述代码读取系统通过处理所述代码的数字图像来读取所述代码，并且再次读取所述代码包括指示所述代码读取系统的摄像机系统来获得所述代码的后续数字图像。

title: Compositions and methods using one or more autophagy-inducing amino acids to potentiate musculoskeletal effect of one or more anabolic amino acids
claims:
1. A method of treating sarcopenia or frailty in an individual in need thereof, the method comprising administering to the individual in need thereof a composition comprising Lysine, anabolic amino acids and autophagy-inducing amino acids, wherein the anabolic amino acids consist of Leucine and Isoleucine, and wherein the autophagy-inducing amino acids consist of Proline, Glycine, Cysteine and Valine.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the composition induces autophagy in skeletal muscle.
3.     The method of claim 1 or 2, wherein the individual is an ageing individual.
4.     The method of any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the composition comprises protein that provides at least a portion of the anabolic amino acids and/or at least a portion of the autophagy-inducing amino acids, wherein the protein is selected from the group consisting of (i) protein from an animal source, (ii) protein from a plant source and (iii) a mixture thereof.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the protein is selected from the group consisting of (i) milk protein, (ii) whey protein, (iii) caseinate, (iv) micellar casein, (v) pea protein, (vi) soy protein and (vii) mixtures thereof.

title: Extrusion process for preparing food flavor products
abstract: The present invention generally relates to extrusion methods for making food flavor products. More specifically, the present invention relates to an extrusion process for preparing a food flavor product in which at least one vented obturator is located within the last 2/3 part of the total length of the extruder cartridge.
claims:
1.用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，所述挤出方法包括以下步骤：
a)向挤出机料筒（7）进料组合物，所述组合物包含至少一种载体、至少一种氨基氮源和至少一种糖源；
b)在35℃至170℃的温度下挤出来自步骤a)的所述组合物，
其中至少一个通气填塞器位于所述挤出机料筒的总长度的最后2/3部分内。
2.根据权利要求1所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，其中所述载体选自麦芽糖糊精、淀粉、面粉、盐、纤维或其组合。
3.根据权利要求1至2中任一项所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，其中所述食物风味产品包含5重量%至95重量%的量的所述载体。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，其中所述氨基氮源选自半胱氨酸、甲硫氨酸、精氨酸、谷胱甘肽、天冬酰胺、谷氨酸、赖氨酸、谷氨酰胺、硫胺素、丙氨酸、甘氨酸、苏氨酸、植物蛋白质、酵母提取物、细菌提取物、蔬菜提取物、水解植物蛋白质或其组合。
5.根据权利要求1至4中任一项所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，其中所述食物风味产品包含0.1重量%至35重量%的量的所述氨基氮源。
6.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，其中所述糖源选自蔗糖、木糖、核糖、葡萄糖、果糖、半乳糖、乳糖、阿拉伯糖、核糖、右旋糖、赤藓糖、鼠李糖、甘露糖、异麦芽糖、山梨糖、阿洛酮糖、麦芽提取物、稻米糖浆、玉米糖浆、角豆糖浆或其组合。
7.根据权利要求1至6中任一项所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，其中所述食物风味产品包含1重量%至35重量%的量的所述糖源。
8.根据权利要求1至7中任一项所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，其中步骤a)中的所述组合物还包含0.5重量%至10重量%的量的脂质。
9.根据权利要求8所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，其中在步骤a)中向所述挤出机料筒进料之前，将所述脂质与包含至少一种载体、至少一种氨基氮源和至少一种糖源的组合物混合，或者在向所述挤出机料筒干式进料之后注入所述脂质。
10.根据权利要求1至9中任一项所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，其中在步骤b)之后不使用干燥步骤。
11.根据权利要求1至10中任一项所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，其中在没有第一捏合和熔融区段的上游位置处不使用另外的通气填塞器（4）。
12.根据权利要求1至11中任一项所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤出方法，其中还将0重量%至10重量%的量的水加入到步骤a)的所述组合物中。
13.根据权利要求1至12中任一项所述的用于制备食物风味产品的挤

title: Method for preparing coffee
abstract: The invention concerns a method for producing a coffee beverage in a beverage preparation apparatus, said apparatus comprising : - at least one supply of roasted and ground coffee : beans container + grinder - at least one supply of soluble coffee : powder or liquid - a water supply system, - at least one extraction unit for receiving and extracting roasted and ground coffee with water, where the method for producing a coffee beverage comprises at least the following steps : - preparing a first coffee beverage (C1) in the extraction unit, and - preparing a second coffee beverage (C2) from soluble coffee, - producing the final coffee beverage by mixing the first and the second coffee beverages (C1, C2).
claims:
CLAIMS
1. Method for producing a coffee beverage in a beverage preparation apparatus, said apparatus comprising : - at least one supply of roasted and ground coffee, - at least one supply of soluble coffee, - a water supply system, - at least one extraction unit for receiving and extracting roasted and ground coffee with water, said extraction unit comprising a brewing chamber, where the method for producing a coffee beverage comprises at least the following steps : - ordering one final coffee beverage, - preparing a first coffee beverage (C1) in the extraction unit, and - preparing a second coffee beverage (C2) from soluble coffee, - producing the ordered final coffee beverage by mixing the first and the second coffee beverages (C1 , C2).
2. Method according to Claim 1 , wherein the volume of the first coffee beverage (C1) represents 10 to 90 % of the volume of the final beverage.
3. Method according to Claim 1 ,or 2 wherein the extraction unit comprises : - a brewing chamber for receiving roasted and ground coffee powder, and - an upper piston, and - a water inlet, and - a liquid outlet duct guiding extracted coffee beverage to a dispensing area, and - a lower piston wherein the brewing chamber and/or the pistons are relatively movable between : . an open position for introducing roast and ground coffee powder or ejecting ex

title: Filling for confectionery and confectionery comprising that filling
abstract: The invention relates to a confectionery composition and methods of making the same. In particular, the invention relates to confectionery fillings comprising water, sugar fat, and protein, and wherein the confectionery composition does not comprise hydrocolloid. Also provided is a process for the manufacture of a confectionery composition.
claims:
1. A confectionery composition comprising:
protein in an amount of 0.5wt% to 15wt%, preferably, 1.7 to 6.5wt%
water in an amount of 10wt% to 40wt%, preferably 10 to 20wt%
sugar in an amount of 35wt% to 80wt%, preferably 35 to 67wt%
fat in an amount of 2wt% to 35wt%, wherein the percentages are the weight percentages of the confectionery composition, and wherein the confectionery composition does not comprise hydrocolloid.
2. A confectionery composition according to claim 1, wherein the viscosity of the composition is between 5 Pa.S1 and 40 Pa.S1.
3. A confectionery composition according to claims 1 or 2, wherein the sugar comprises a mixture of fructose and glucose.
4. A confectionery composition according to claims 1 to 3, wherein sugar is comprised in an aqueous phase, and from 10wt% to 50wt% of the sugar in the aqueous phase is fructose.
5. A confectionery composition according to claims 1 to 4, wherein sugar is comprised in an aqueous phase, and from 20wt% to 65wt% of the sugar in the aqueous phase is glucose and/or dextrose.
6. A confectionery composition according to any preceding claim, wherein the fat comprises, con

title: Confectionery product
Method for determining the contribution of a dog breed to a test dog genome
abstract: The present invention relates to a method of determining the contribution of a dog breed to a test dog genome, comprising: a) providing a DNA methylation profile from a sample obtained from the test dog; and b) determining the contribution of a dog breed to the test dog genome by comparing at least part of the DNA methylation profile of the test dog to reference DNA methylation profiles from different dog breeds.

title: Chocolate products, ingredients, processes and uses
abstract: The present invention provides a new composition obtainable from a plant in the theobroma genus and the use of that composition as an ingredient in a chocolate product.
claims:
1. A paste derived from i) seeds and/or a portion of seeds of a plant in the Theobroma genus and ii) pulp and/or an extract of pulp of a plant in the Theobroma genus, the paste comprises: a sugar content, a total dietary fibre content, and a moisture content of between 20.0 wt % and 80 wt %.
2. The paste of claim 1, comprising between 20.0 wt % and 99.0 wt % of the seeds and/or portion of seeds, between 0.0 wt % and 80.0 wt % of a non-pulp and non-seed portion, and between 1.0 wt % and 80.0 wt % of the pulp and/or extract of the pulp.
3. A dried mass derived from i) seeds and/or a portion of seeds of a plant in the Theobroma genus and ii) pulp and/or an extract of pulp of a plant in the Theobroma genus that comprises a sugar content, of a mono- and di-saccharide content, from 8.0 wt % to 35.0 wt % and a fat content of from 18.0 wt % to 50.0 wt %.
4. The dried mass of claim 3, with a total dietary fibre content from 2.0 wt % to 40.0 wt %.

title: Personalized supplementation of nutrients
abstract: The present invention provides a nutritional composition (preferably a printed nutritional composition) comprising at least one nutritional substance for which a lack of nutritional substance intake and/or nutritional substance state is detected in an individual. Such a nutritional composition is included in an administration unit and the nutrient is present in an amount corresponding to a difference between a target value and an actual value of the nutrient intake and/or status of the individual. The invention also provides medical uses of such printed nutritional compositions, for example for the treatment or prevention of malnutrition. Also provided are administration units comprising such nutritional compositions, as well as systems and methods for producing the nutritional compositions and the administration units.
claims:
1.一种营养组合物，所述营养组合物包含至少一种营养物质，对于所述营养物质，在个体中检测到营养物质摄入量和/或营养物质状态的缺乏，所述营养组合物包含在施用单元中，其特征在于所述营养物质在所述施用单元中存在的量对应于所述个体的所述营养物质摄入量和/或状态的目标值和实际值之间的差值。
2.根据权利要求1所述的组合物，其中所述营养组合物为打印的营养组合物。
3.根据权利要求2所述的组合物，其中所述打印的营养组合物为喷墨打印或3D打印的营养组合物、2D打印的组合物，或被喷涂到食物产品或其他可食用产品上。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述营养物质为选自以下物质的常量营养素或微量营养素：蛋白质、氨基酸、碳水化合物、低聚糖、脂肪、脂质、脂肪酸、核苷酸、维生素、抗氧化剂、矿物质、痕量元素和电解质。
5.根据权利要求1至4中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述目标值和/或所述实际值以每餐或每种食物产品中的营养物质的量表示。
6.一种包含根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的营养组合物的施用单元，其中所述施用单元被设计用于口服施用，优选舌下施用、经舌施用或经颊施用。
7.根据权利要求6所述的施用单元，其中所述施用单元以选自以下的施用形式被提供：片剂、箔、膜以及糯米纸囊剂。
8.根据权利要求6或7所述的施用单元，其中所述施用单元和所述打印的营养组合物基于至少一种可溶于口腔流体中的药学上可接受的化合物，所述口腔流体优选为唾液。
9.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的营养组合物，或根据权利要求6至8中任一项所述的施用单元，所述营养组合物或所述施用单元用于预防或治疗个体营养不良。
10.根据权利要求9所述的组合物，或根据权利要求8所述的施用单元，其中所述个体为住在医院、公共机构或疗养院中的住院患者，优选外科患者和/或正经历创伤愈合的患者，或者正接受化疗或放射治疗的患者。
11.根据权利要求9或10所述的组合物，或根据权利要求8或9所述的施用单元，其中所述个体患有选自以下的病症：手术前或手术后的食欲不振或食欲丧失、恶心、呕吐、厌食、咽下困难、食管狭窄、咀嚼或吞咽障碍、口腔或咽喉的刺激或损伤或炎症或感染、口腔或咽喉的疾病或恶性肿瘤、甲状腺功能失调、甲状腺肿、定向障碍以及痴呆症。
12.根据权利要求9至11中任一项所述的组合物，或根据权利要求9至11中任一项所述的施用单元，其中所述个体患有术后恶心和呕吐(PONV)。
13.一种用于生产根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的营养组合物，或用于生产根据权利要求6至8中任一项所述的施用单元的方法，所述方法包括以下步骤：
(a)确定个体至少一种营养物质的目标值；
(b)计算所述营养物质的所述目标值和实际值之间的差值；

title: Improved composite materials for the preparation of coffee capsules
abstract: The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a fibre-based composite material, to the fibre-based composite material thus obtained, and to the use of the fibre-based composite material for the preparation of capsules for use in capsule coffee machines.
claims:
CLAIMS:
1. A method for manufacturing a fibre-based composite material, comprising the steps of: a) providing a substrate comprising cellulosic fibres; b) preparing a mixture comprising one or more alkoxy silane monomers and an acid catalyst in water; c) applying said mixture to said substrate; d) reacting said mixture with the cellulosic fibres of said substrate; e) subjecting said mixture to the sol-gel process; f) drying the treated substrate to obtain the composite material.
2. The method of claim 1 , wherein said cellulosic fibres are selected from the group consisting of cellulose fibres, jut, beggase, hemp, and combinations thereof.
3. The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the one or more alkoxy silane monomers are selected from the group tetraethyl orthosilicate, triethoxy(methyl)alkoxy silane, triethoxy(ethyl)alkoxy silane, riethoxy(propyl)alkoxy silane, butyltriethoxyalkoxy silane, triethoxy(isopentyl)alkoxy silane, (3,3-dimethylbutyl)triethoxyalkoxy silane, triethoxy(vinyl)alkoxy silane, 3-(triethoxysilyl)propan-1 -amine, 3- (triethoxysilyl)propyl methacrylate, tetraethyl orthosilicate, trimethoxy(methyl)alkoxy silane, trimethoxy(ethyl)alkoxy silane, trimethoxy(propyl)alkoxy silane, butyltrimethoxyalkoxy silane, trimethoxy(isopentyl)alkoxy silane, (3,3-dimethylbutyl)trimethoxyalkoxy silane, trimethoxy(vinyl)alkoxy silane, 3-(trimethoxysilyl)propan-1 -amine, and 3- (trimethoxysilyl)propyl methacrylate.
4. The method of any of claims 1 to 3, wherein alkoxy silane-to-cellulos

assignee: ベイラー カレッジ オブ メディスン

title: Method for producing chocolate product, material obtained from plant of genus theobroma and chocolate product containing obtained material
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to confectionary industry. Disclosed is a method of obtaining an intermediate product for production of a chocolate product composition. Intermediate product is a material obtained from a plant of Theobroma genus. Method involves reduction of size of seeds and/or part of seeds of plants of genus Theobroma, optionally in presence of following components: i. pulp and/or pulp extract of a plant of Theobroma genus and/or ii. a part of Theobroma genus plant fruit that does not contain pulp and seeds. If both of i and ii are not present at the step of reducing the size of seeds and/or part of seeds of the genus Theobroma plant, the product is mixed with each component or both components of both i and/or ii. Process steps a or b enable to obtain a paste. Preferably, the total amount of i and/or ii in the mixture ranges from 1.0 wt. % to 80.0 wt. % of the mixture and the amount of seeds and/or part of the seed in the mixture ranges from 20.0 wt. % to 99.0 wt. % of the mixture. Additionally one proposes a material for the chocolate product composition production, the dried mass for the chocolate product composition production and a chocolate product containing the said dried mass.EFFECT: invention provides improved consistency of product and process by fermentation and/or enzymatic hydrolysis of paste, and not separate beans (reduced number of poorly fermented beans); providing controlled fermentation of paste with specific controlled microorganisms; reduced contamination, since the cocoa shell is not subjected to fermentation and drying in potentially unsuitable conditions; increase of fibre content in chocolate products in a controlled manner within the framework of a more ordered process and more homogeneous drying and frying conditions due to removal of separate beans from the process.24 cl, 9 ex
claims:
1. Способ получения промежуточного продукта для производства композиции шоколадного продукта, причём промежуточный продукт представляет собой материал, полученный из растения рода Theobroma, при этом способ включает следующие стадии:
а. уменьшение размера семян и/или части семян растения рода Theobroma, необязательно в присутствии следующих компонентов:
i. мякоть и/или экстракт мякоти растения рода Theobroma и/или
ii. не содержащая мякоти и семян часть плода растения рода Theobroma,
b. если оба из i. и ii. не присутствуют на стадии a., смешивание продукта стадии a. с каждым компонентом или обоими компонентами как из i, так и/или из ii,
причём технологические этапы a или b обеспечивают получение пасты.
2. Способ по п. 1, в котором общее количество i и/или ii в смеси составляет от 1,0 до 80,0 масс.% смеси.
3. Способ по п. 1 или 2, в котором количество семян и/или части семени в смеси составляет от 20,0 до 99,0 масс.% смеси.
4. Способ по любому из пп. 1-3, в котором уменьшение размера на стадии (a) включает этап измельчения, размалывания, дробления, грохочения и/или измельчения до порошкообразного состояния.
5. Способ по любому из пп. 1-4, в котором уменьшение размера на стадии a. включает уменьшение до размера от 10 до 500 мкм.
6. Способ по одному из пп. 1-5, в котором паста имеет содержание влаги от 0,5 до 80% от массы пасты.
7. Способ по любому из пп. 1-6, в котором семена и/или часть семян не обжарены и/или являются неферментированными.
8. Способ по любому из пп. 1-7, в котором не содержащую мякоть и семян часть выбирают из группы, содержащей семяножку, плаценту, эндокарп, мезокарп и/или эндокарп.
9. Способ по любому из пп. 1-8, в котором смесь ферментируют после стадии b.
10. Способ по любому из пп. 1-9, в котором смесь обрабатывают для уменьшения содержания полисахарида в смеси.
11. Способ по любому из пп. 1-10, в котором смесь обрабатывают для увеличения содержания моно- и/или дисахаридов в смеси.
12. Способ по п. 10 или 11, в котором обработка включает в себя о

title: Freeze induced texturization of alginate and protein for fish analogs
abstract: The present invention relates to a method of making a plant-based fish analog, said method comprising mixing plant protein, alginate salt, and fat coated calcium salt in water to form a dough mixture; optionally emulsifying the dough mixture with oil or melted fat; transferring the dough mixture to a mold or a packaging; freezing the dough mixture so that the core temperature of the dough mixture reaches -10°C or less; thawing the dough mixture; and optionally cooking, chilling or flash freezing.
claims:
Claims
1. A method of making a plant-based fish analog, said method comprising a) Mixing soy protein, rice protein, alginate salt, and fat coated calcium salt in water to form a dough mixture; b) emulsifying the dough mixture with oil or melted fat; c) transferring the dough mixture to a mold or a packaging; d) Freezing the dough mixture so that the core temperature of the dough mixture reaches -10°C or less; e) Thawing the dough mixture; and f) Optionally cooking, chilling or flash freezing; wherein the dough is not heat treated before freezing the dough.
2. The method of making a plant-based fish analog according to claim 1, wherein fat coated calcium salt is added after the alginate salt has been hydrated in the water.
3. The method of making a plant-based fish analog according to any one of claims 1 and 2, wherein the freezing step d) is for at least 1 hour, preferably at least 5 hours, more preferably at least 9 hours.
4. The method of making a plant-based fish analog according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the soy and rice protein content of the plant-based fish analog is between 4 to 16 wt%.
5. The method of making a plant-based fish analog according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the plant-based fish analog does not comprise any further hydrocolloid.
6. The method of making a plant-based fish a

title: Recyclable dosing device
abstract: A dosing device made from moulded pulp fiber includes a container member with a defined volume corresponding to a pre-determined amount of composition to be dosed. The dosing device may be to be used for dosing food materials and may be biodegradable and/or compostable. A process for manufacturing such a dosing device is also provided.
claims:
1: A dosing device made from molded pulp fiber, the dosing device comprising a container member and a handle member, wherein the container member has a defined volume corresponding to a pre-determined amount of a composition to be dosed.
2: The dosing device in accordance with claim 1, wherein the molded pulp fiber is made from pulp comprising cellulosic fibrous material prepared by chemically and mechanically separating cellulose fibers from material containing the cellulose fibers.
3: The dosing device in accordance with claim 2, wherein the cellulosic fibrous material is selected from the group consisting of wood, fiber crops, waste paper, rags, and combinations thereof.
4: The dosing device in accordance with claim 1, wherein the dosing device is recyclable and/or compostable.
5: The dosing device in accordance with claim 1, wherein the pulp fiber comprises cellulose, hemicellulose and lignin.
6: The dosing device in accordance with claim 1, wherein the molded pulp fiber further comprises a compound selected from the group consisting of alkyl ketene dimer wax, a fluorine containing polymer moiety, sodium silicate, and combinations thereof.
7: The dosing device in accordance with claim 1, wherein the container member has a material thicknes

title: Omega-3 fatty acid, homocystein and vitamin D levels to identify and attenuate cognitive aging in individuals
abstract: A method for identifying pre-disposition to cognitive decline in a subject, the method comprising determining levels of: (a) omega-3 fatty acids, and vitamin D or a metabolite thereof; (b) omega-3 fatty acids, and homocysteine; (c) vitamin D or a metabolite thereof, and 5 homocysteine; or (d) omega-3 fatty acids, vitamin D or a metabolite thereof, and homocysteine, independently in one or more samples obtained from the subject. 20 24 20 08 82 12 F eb 2 02 4 A B S T R A C T 1 2 F e b 2 0 2 4 A m e t h o d f o r i d e n t i f y i n g p r e - d i s p o s i t i o n t o c o g n i t i v e d e c l i n e i n a s u b j e c t , t h e m e t h o d c o m p r i s i n g d e t e r m i n i n g l e v e l s o f : ( a ) o m e g a - 3 f a t t y a c i d s , a n d v i t a m i n D o r a m e t a b o l i t e t h e r e o f ; ( b ) o m e g a - 3 f a t t y a c i d s , a n d h o m o c y s t e i n e ; ( c ) v i t a m i n D o r a m e t a b o l i t e t h e r e o f , a n d 5 h o m o c y s t e i n e ; o r ( d ) o m e g a - 3 f a t t y a c i d s , v i t a m i n D o r a m e t a b o l i t e t h e r e o f , a n d h o m o c y s t e i n e , i n d e p e n d e n t l y i n o n e o r m o r e s a m p l e s o b t a i n e d f r o m t h e s u b j e c t . 2 0 2 4 2 0 0 8 8 2
claims:
1.     A method for identifying pre-disposition to cognitive decline in a subject, the method comprising determining levels of: omega-3 fatty acids, and 5          homocysteine; independently in one or more samples obtained from the subject.
2.     The method of claim 1, wherein: (a) a level of omega-3 fatty acids is determined and a decrease in the 10                     level of omega-3 fatty acids in the sample from the subject compared to a reference value is indicative of pre-disposition to cognitive decline; and (b) a level of homocysteine is determined and an increase in the level of homocysteine in the sample from the subject compared to a 15                      reference value is indicative of pre-disposition to cognitive decline.
3.     The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the one or more samples are independently selected from the group consisting of a blood sample, plasma sample and serum sample. 20
4.     The method of any one of the preceding claims, wherein the level of omega-3 fatty acids is determined in a blood sample, preferably an erythrocyte sample; and/or the level of homocysteine is determined in a plasma sample. 25

title: Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism
abstract: or a B. Longumtransitional strain having an identifying characteristic of the B. Longumtransitional strain deposited under deposit number CNCM
claims:
1. 一種以寄存號CNCM I-5942寄存於國家微生物菌種收藏(Collection nationale de cultures de micro-organismes, CNCM)的長雙歧桿菌( Bifidobacterium longum)過渡微生物株或一種具有以寄存號CNCM I-5942寄存的長雙歧桿菌過渡株之辨識特徵的長雙歧桿菌過渡株。
2. 一種長雙歧桿菌過渡微生物株，其與以寄存號CNCM I-5942寄存於CNCM的長雙歧桿菌株具有至少99%之平均核苷酸同一性(Average Nucleotide Identity, ANI)。
3. 如請求項1之長雙歧桿菌過渡株，其與以寄存號CNCM I-5942寄存的長雙歧桿菌過渡株具有至少98.1%之ANI。
4. 如前述請求項中任一項之長雙歧桿菌過渡株，其中該長雙歧桿菌過渡株對四環黴素(tetracycline)、紅黴素(erythromycin)、克林達黴素(clindamycin)及胺苄青黴素(ampicillin)中之任一者均不具有抗性；較佳地，其中該長雙歧桿菌過渡株對四環黴素、紅黴素、克林達黴素、胺苄青黴素、見大黴素(gentamycin)、鏈黴素(streptomycin)、氯黴素(chloramphenicol)及萬古黴素(vancomycin)中之任一者均不具有抗性。
5. 如前述請求項中任一項之長雙歧桿菌過渡株，其中該長雙歧桿菌過渡株包含醣苷基水解酶家族43_17 (GH43_17)基因；合適地，其中該GH43_17基因包含SEQ ID NO: 7或與SEQ ID NO: 7具有至少60%序列同一性之序列。
6. 如前述請求項中任一項之長雙歧桿菌過渡株，其進一步包含：主要易化子超家族(major facilitator superfamily, MFS)基因；合適地，其中該MFS基因包含SEQ ID NO: 37或與SEQ ID NO: 39具有至少60%序列同一性之序列；及/或AraC基因；合適地，其中該AraC基因包含SEQ ID NO: 39或與SEQ ID NO: 39具有至少60%序列同一性之序列；較佳地，其中該等GH43_17、MFS及AraC基因係包含在基因簇中。
7. 如請求項6之長雙歧桿菌過渡株，其中該長雙歧桿菌過渡株進一步包含GH31基因及LacI基因中之一或多者；較佳地，其中該長雙歧桿菌過渡株進一步包含木酮糖激酶基因及木糖異構酶基因；且進一步較佳地，其中該等GH43_17、MFS、AraC、GH31、LacI、木酮糖激酶及木糖異構酶基因係包含在基因簇(gene cluster)中。
8. 如前述請求項中任一項之長雙歧桿菌過渡株，其進一步包含針對一或多種選自GH43_17、GH43_22、GH43_27、GH43_29、GH121、GH43_24、GH127、GH30_5、GH 43_32及GH30的醣苷水解酶進行編碼的一或多種基因。
9. 如前述請求項中任一項之長雙歧桿菌過渡株，其中該長雙歧桿菌過渡株優先利用3-岩藻糖基乳糖(3-fucosyllactose, 3-FL)；較佳地，其中當在3-FL的存在下培養時，該長雙歧桿菌過渡株具有至少0.6 k的生長速率。
10. 一種益生菌組成物，其包含如前述請求項中任一項之長雙歧桿菌過渡株。
11. 一種組成物，其包含如前述請求項中任一項之長雙歧桿菌過渡株以及至少一種另外的益生菌及/或益生元。
12. 一種如前述請求
assignee: 瑞士商雀巢製品股份有限公司

title: Method of producing a freeze-dried soluble beverage powder
abstract: FIELD: coffee industry.SUBSTANCE: described is a method for producing a freeze-dried soluble beverage powder comprising steps of: providing liquid aqueous beverage composition (1) having a total solids content of 5 to 65 %, formation of liquid beverage composition layer (2) between two parallel flat surfaces (3a, 3b) and in contact with them, wherein the surfaces are separated by gap of 0.1 to 10 mm, cooling the liquid beverage aqueous composition layer to a temperature below -25 °C to form a frozen beverage composition and drying the frozen beverage composition, wherein the freeze-dried soluble beverage powder contains coffee dry extract particles having two substantially flat surfaces and a uniform thickness, wherein the particles have a median thickness of 0.2 to 1.5 mm, a surface roughness measured by profilometry is less than 12 mcm and a uniformity index measured by profilometry is greater than 0.6.EFFECT: invention allows to manufacture a product with an attractive glossy appearance.12 cl, 5 dwg, 1 tbl, 4 ex
claims:
1. Способ получения сублимированного растворимого порошка напитка, включающий стадии:
a. обеспечения жидкой водной композиции (1) напитка, имеющей общее содержание твердых веществ от 5 до 65%;
b. формирования слоя (2) жидкой водной композиции напитка между двумя параллельными плоскими поверхностями (3a, 3b) и в контакте с ними, причём поверхности разделены зазором от 0,1 до 10 мм;
c. охлаждения слоя жидкой водной композиции напитка до температуры ниже -25°C с образованием замороженной композиции напитка; и
d. сушки замороженной композиции напитка;
причём сублимированный растворимый порошок напитка содержит частицы сухого экстракта кофе, имеющие две, по существу, плоские поверхности и равномерную толщину, при этом частицы имеют медианную толщину от 0,2 до 1,5 мм, шероховатость поверхности, измеренную с помощью профилометрии, менее 12 мкм и индекс однообразия, измеренный с помощью профилометрии, более 0,6.
2. Способ по п. 1, в котором водная композиция напитка представляет собой экстракт кофе.
3. Способ по п. 1 или 2, в котором плоские поверхности представляют собой движущиеся полосы (6a, 6b).
4. Способ по п. 3, в котором охлаждение применяют к по меньшей мере одной движущейся полосе.
5. Способ по п. 4, в котором к одной движущейся полосе применяют большее охлаждение, чем к другой.
6. Способ по любому из пп. 1-5, в котором движущиеся полосы проходят через множество зон охлаждения.
7. Способ по п. 1, в котором частицы имеют открытые поры с отверстиями менее 4,5 микрометра, причём объем открытых пор с отверстиями менее 4,5 микрометра составляет более 50% от общего объема открытых пор при измерении с помощью ртутной порометрии.
8. Способ по п. 1, в котором частицы имеют открытые поры с отверстиями менее 2 микрометров, причём объем открытых пор с отверстиями менее 2 микрометров составляет более 20% от общего объема открытых пор при измерении с помощью ртутной порометрии.
9. Способ по п. 1, в котором частицы имеют медианный диаметр открытых пор менее 4,5 микрометра при изм

title: Enteral nutrition container cap and methods of making and using same
abstract: A package closure system may include a lid and a package outlet having a first connection unit, the lid configured to be removably connected to the package outlet using the first connection unit and including a second connection unit. The top cap may be configured to be removably connected to the cover using a second connection unit. A method for providing a nutritional composition from a container to the intestinal tract may include: removing a top cap from a cap configured to direct the nutritional composition through a channel within the cap, the cap removably connected to the container; sealingly connecting the cap to the intestinal tract; and applying pressure to the container to direct the nutritional composition from the container through the channel and into the intestinal tract.
claims:
1.一种容置营养组合物[132]的容器，所述容器包括用于与肠内饲管直接连接的一体式连接器，其中，所述一体式连接器配置成连接到连接器。
2.根据权利要求1所述的容器，其中，所述一体式连接器包括近侧端部和远侧端部，所述近侧端部用于连接到所述容器，所述远侧端部用于连接到所述肠内饲管，连接螺纹[13]从所述远侧端部延伸并且配置成附接到所述连接器。
3.根据权利要求2所述的容器，还包括顶部罩帽[70]，所述顶部罩帽配置成封闭所述容器。
4.根据权利要求3所述的容器，其中，所述顶部罩帽配置成使得其能从所述远侧端部按扣掉。
5.根据权利要求4所述的容器，其中，所述顶部罩帽是在顶部罩帽和远侧端部的界面处具有弱化部分的单个单元。
6.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的容器，其中，所述一体式连接器具有比

title: Medium chain triglyceride compositions
abstract: A composition comprising medium-chain triglycerides (MCTs) wherein the composition comprises (i) a MCT comprising three fatty acid moieties each with 8 carbon atoms (MCT-C8) and (ii) a MCT comprising three fatty acid moieties each with 10 carbon atoms (MCT-C10); wherein the ratio of MCT-C8 to MCT-C10 is from 10:90 to 90:10 (mol/mol) and wherein the combined amount of MCT-C8 and MCT-C10 make up at least 50 mol % of the MCTs in the composition.
claims:
1. A method of treating an individual having a brain energy deficiency condition or disease, the method comprising administering a composition comprising medium-chain triglycerides (MCTs) to the individual, wherein the MCTs comprise:
a MCT comprising three fatty acid moieties each with 8 carbon atoms (MCT-C8); and
a MCT comprising three fatty acid moieties each with 10 carbon atoms (MCT-C10);
wherein the ratio of the MCT-C8 to the MCT-C10 is from 10:90 to 90:10 (mol/mol), and
wherein the combined amount of MCT-C8 and MCT-C10 is at least 50 mol % of the MCTs in the composition, and
wherein the composition provides increased ketones and/or fatty acids as compared to a composition comprising MCTs comprising three fatty acids moieties each with a mix of C8 and C10 moieties attached and having the same C8/C10 ratio and molar amounts.
2. The method according to claim 1 wherein the ratio of MCT-C8 to MCT-C10 is 20:80 to 85:15 (mol/mol).
3. The method according to claim 1 wherein the combined amount of MCT-C8 and MCT-C10 is at least 90 mol % of the MCTs in the composition.
4. A method of treating an individual having a brain energy deficiency condition or disease, the method comprising administering a composition comprising medium-chain triglycerides (MCTs) to the individual, wherei

title: Jug with whisk retainer
abstract: A jug (10) for processing a liquid food substance, such as milk or a milk-based substance, is provided. The jug (10) comprises a container (12) delimiting a food cavity for containing said liquid food substance, the food cavity having a top opening (22), a lid (20) connected to the container (12) and movable between a closed position in which the lid (20) covers the top opening (22) and an open position in which the lid (20) at least partially uncovers the top opening (22) for filling and/or emptying the container (12), an impeller (38) removably received by the container (12) and configured for driving said liquid food substance in the container (12), and a retaining element (46) connected to the lid (20) and configured for retaining the impeller (38) in the container (12) when the lid is in the open position.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A jug (10) for processing a liquid food substance, such asmilk or a milk-based substance, comprising:- a container (12) delimiting a food cavity for containing saidliquid food substance, the food cavity having a top opening (22),- a lid (20) connected to the container (12) and movable betweena closed position in which the lid (20) covers the top opening (22) and an open position in which the lid (20) at least partially uncovers the top opening (22) for filling and/or emptying the container (12),- an impeller (38) removably received by the container (12) andconfigured for driving said liquid food substance in the container (12), and- a retaining element (46) connected to the lid (20) andconfigured for retaining the impeller (38) in the container (12) when the lid is in the open position.
2. The jug (10) of claim 1, wherein the retaining element (46)is configured for holding the impeller (38) in position inside the container (12) during tilting of the container (12), such as during tilting of the container for pouring the processed liquid food substance out of the container (12), preferably wherein the retaining element (46) is configured for holding a stem (40) of the impeller (38) in place during tilting.
3. The jug (10) of claim 1 or 2, wherein the retaining element(46) includes a catch-wall (48) configured to be abutted by a portion of the impeller (38), preferably during tilting of the container (12), more preferably during tilting of the container (12) for pouring the processed liquid food substance out of the container (12).
4. The jug (10) of claim 3, wher

title: Nutritional composition and infant formula for promoting myelination of the brain

title: Beverage or foodstuff preparation system
abstract: A container for use with a beverage or foodstuff preparation machine, the container comprising: a storage portion for containing a precursor material; a code storing preparation information used by said machine to process the precursor material, the code readable by a code reading system of the machine, which comprises: a lighting system to project an emission to the code, and; a camera system for obtaining a digital image of the code, the code arranged to overlap the precursor material, and; a support layer to support the code, the support layer at least partially transparent to the emission from the lighting system, the code comprising: an absorber layer, which is configured to absorb the emission and a reflector layer, which is configured to reflect the emission, the reflector layer is arranged to reflect the emission before it is transmitted to the support layer.
claims:
1. A container for use with a beverage or foodstuff preparation machine, the container comprising:
a storage portion for containing a precursor material;
a code for storing preparation information used by said machine to process the precursor material, the code configured to be readable by a code reading system of the machine, which comprises a lighting system to project an emission to the code, the code arranged to overlap the precursor material such that an emission from the lighting system projects into the precursor material;
the code comprising: an absorber layer, which is configured to absorb the emission and a reflector layer, which is configured to reflect the emission,
the container further comprising a support layer to support the code, the support layer being made with a material at least partially transparent to the emission from the lighting system,
wherein the reflector layer is arranged to reflect the emission before it is transmitted to the support layer.
2. The container of claim 1, wherein:
the reflector layer is continuous;
the reflector layer is connected to the support layer to adjoin the support layer, and;
the support layer extends in a plane defined by lateral and longitudinal directions and has a through thickness in a depth direction, and where the reflector layer to overlap the entire the support layer when vie

title: Edible animal chews containing concentrated fruit juice, and methods of making and using such edible animal chews
abstract: An edible pet chew contains a concentrated fruit juice in an amount effective as both a humectant and a plasticizer in the edible pet chew. A method of making an edible pet chew includes extruding a composition containing concentrated fruit juice, the concentrated fruit juice present in the composition in an amount effective as both a humectant and a plasticizer in the composition being extruded. A method of cleaning teeth of a pet includes orally administering an edible chew to the pet, the edible chew containing concentrated fruit juice in an amount effective as both a humectant and a plasticizer in the edible chew. The concentrated fruit juice may replace at least a portion of glycerin and/or propylene in the edible chew, while maintaining or increasing at least one of texture or occupation time for the edible pet chew.
claims:
An edible pet chew comprising concentrated fruit juice in an amount effective as both a humectant and a plasticizer in the edible pet chew.
The edible pet chew of Claim 1, wherein the edible chew is substantially free of glycerin and substantially free of propylene glycol.
The edible pet chew of Claim 1 or Claim 2, wherein the edible pet chew further comprises a starch.
The edible pet chew of any of Claims 1-3, wherein the concentrated fruit juice is selected from the group consisting of: plum, apple, carob, dates, blueberry, strawberry, pear, grape, peach, and mixtures thereof.
The edible pet chew of any of Claims 1-4, wherein the concentrated fruit juice is a mixture of apple and carob.
The edible pet chew of any of Claims 1-5, wherein the edible pet chew has a property that is at least one of improved texture or increased occupation time, relative to a reference edible pet chew that comprises glycerin and/or propylene glycol instead of the concentrated fruit juice but otherwise identically formulated.
A method of making an edible pet chew, the method comprising:extruding a composition comprising concentrated fruit juice, the concentrated fruit juice present in the composition in an amount effective as both a humectant and a plast

title: A nutritional composition comprising 6'SL and LNT in combination to improve the gastrointestinal barrier function
abstract: The present invention relates to nutritional compositions comprising 6'- sialyllactose (6'SL) and lacto-N-tetraose (LNT) for use in improving the gastrointestinal barrier. In particular, the present invention relates to improving gut barrier function in an infant, a young child or children aged above 3 years to 8 years.
claims:
1. A method of improving the gastrointestinal barrier in an infant (child under the age of 12 months) or a young child (between 1 year and less than 3 years) or a child (aged from 3 years to less than 8 years); 5 the method comprising administering to the infant or young child a synthetic nutritional composition comprising 6'-sialyllactose (6'SL) and lacto-N-tetraose (LNT); or the method comprising administering to the child a synthetic nutritional composition in the form of a growing-up milk comprising 6'-sialyllactose (6'SL) 10 and lacto-N-tetraose (LNT); wherein said improvement to the gastrointestinal barrier is improved barrier repair, improved barrier function, improved barrier maturation, improved barrier structure, and/or improved barrier protection. 15
2. Use of a synthetic nutritional composition comprising 6'-sialyllactose (6'SL) and lacto-N-tetraose (LNT) in the manufacture of a medicament for improving the gastrointestinal barrier in an infant (child under the age of 12 months) or a young child (between 1 year and less than 3 years) or a child (aged from 3 years to less than 8 years); 20 wherein the synthetic nutritional composition to be administered to the child is in the form of a growing-up milk; wherein said improvement to the gastrointestinal barrier is improved barrier repair, improved barrier function, improved barrier maturation, improved barrier structure, and/or improved barrier protection. 25
3. The method according to c

title: Process for treating protein-containing compositions
abstract: The invention relates to a process for treating a protein-containing composition. The process includes the provision of a protein-containing composition wherein the proteins comprise milk proteins and said milk proteins comprise at least 90 wt. % β-lactoglobulins. The composition is contacted with a transglutaminase to obtain a cross-linked protein-containing composition. This process enhances not only the heat stability, in particular in presence of calcium but also the texture properties of such protein-containing compositions. The invention also relates to cross-linked protein-containing compositions obtainable or obtained by said process, to a process for preparing dairy products or alternatives thereof with such compositions and to the resulting dairy products or alternatives thereof.

title: Hybrid moulded pulp object
abstract: The present invention relates to a moulded pulp article, the moulded pulp article comprising: a shaped pulp comprising cellulose fibres; and a polymer reinforcement. The polymer reinforcement may be in the form of polymer dispersed throughout the shaped pulp and/or in the form of a polymer interlayer disposed between the shaped pulp and a tactile layer.
claims:
CLAIMS:
1. A moulded pulp article, the moulded pulp article comprising: a shaped pulp comprising cellulose fibres; and a polymer reinforcement.
2. The moulded pulp article of claim 1 , wherein the polymer reinforcement comprises polymer dispersed throughout the shaped pulp.
3. The moulded pulp article of claim 2, wherein the polymer comprises up to 50 wt% of the total mass of the shaped pulp and the polymer reinforcement, optionally between 1 and 50 wt%, optionally between 10 and 40 wt%, optionally between 20 and 30 wt%, optionally about 30 wt%.
4. The moulded pulp article of any one of the preceding claims, wherein the moulded pulp article further comprises a tactile layer and the polymer reinforcement comprises a polymer layer located between the shaped pulp and the tactile layer.
5. The moulded pulp article of claim 4, herein the polymer layer is a net or a film, optionally with a thickness of from 1 to 200 pm, optionally of from 10 to 150 pm, more preferably from 20 to 120 pm, further preferably from 30 to 80 pm, yet further preferably from 40 to 60 pm, most preferably about 50 pm.
6. The moulded pulp article of claim 4 or claim 5, wherein the tactile layer has a paper feel, optionally the tactile layer is selected from a thin pulp layer, a paperboard, and a paper layer.
7. The moulded pulp article of any one of claims 4 to 6, wherein the tactile layer has a weight of from 5 to 150

title: Beverage or food preparation system
abstract: The present invention provides a container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or food product or a precursor thereof, the container comprising a machine-readable code storing preparation information for use with a preparation process performed by the machine, the code comprising: a reference portion (R) to locate the code; a data portion (D) to store the preparation information, where the data portion comprises a first predetermined position and a second predetermined position partially overlapping, the partially overlapping first predetermined position and second predetermined position encoding three conditions as: no data unit is present at both positions; there is a data unit at the first position and there is no data unit at the second position; and there is a data unit at the second location and there is no data unit at the first location.
claims:
1.一种用于容纳前体材料的容器，所述容器用于与用于制备饮料和/或食品或者其前体的机器一起使用，所述容器包括存储与由所述机器执行的制备过程一起使用的制备信息的机器可读代码，所述代码包括：
用以定位所述代码的参考部分(R)；用以存储所述制备信息的数据部分(D)，
其中数据部分包括部分重叠的第一预定位置和第二预定位置，所述部分重叠的第一预定位置和第二预定位置将三个条件中的一个条件编码为：
在两个位置处都不存在数据单元；
在所述第一位置处存在数据单元，并且在所述第二位置处不存在数据单元；以及
在所述第二位置处存在数据单元，并且在所述第一位置处不存在数据单元，
使得被编码的所述条件被紧凑地定位。
2.根据权利要求2所述的容器，其中所述数据单元和所述预定位置大小相等。
3.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中所述部分重叠的第一预定位置和第二预定位置以小于所述预定位置的面积的一半重叠。
4.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中所述部分重叠的第一预定位置和第二预定位置以大于所述预定位置的面积的5％或10％重叠。
5.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中所述部分重叠的第一预定位置和第二预定位置被布置在上。
6.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中所述数据部分包括至少一个数据单元，所述至少一个数据单元沿虚拟

title: Apparatus for roasting coffee beans (embodiments)
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: inventions group relates to coffee industry. Disclosed is an embodiment of a coffee bean roasting apparatus, comprising a vessel for holding coffee beans, a heating device for heating the coffee beans, a control system configured to control the heating device and configured to apply a roasting formula (R), providing preset temperature values for use in separate successive moments in time t1, t2 and so forth, wherein for a given number of m coffee beans of the type Cy loaded inside the vessel, the control system is configured to determine the number of m coffee beans and their type Cy loaded inside the vessel, and based on the obtained type Cy and the obtained quantity m, the control system is configured to determine the recipe Rym for roasting a quantity of m coffee beans of type Cy in the roasting apparatus by accessing: to a rule for calculating a roasting recipe adapted for roasting a certain number of grains, wherein said number is included in a list of predetermined number (M, M ± Δx) from any pre-existing roasting recipe adapted to roasting another number of grains in said particular type of roasting apparatus, wherein said other number is included in a list of predetermined number (M, M ± Δx), and to a list of said predetermined quantities (M, M ± Δx), and to at least one preset initial roasting recipe RyMoriginal, wherein said roasting recipe RyMoriginal is configured to roast one predetermined number of Moriginal beans Cy in said particular type of roasting apparatus, wherein said predetermined initial roasting recipe RyMoriginal provides predetermined temperatures applied at discrete successive points in time t1, t2 and so forth, respectively, and to said predetermined number of Moriginal grains, and based on a comparison of m, the available initial predetermined number of Moriginal grains and available predetermined number of list (M, M ± Δx), determination of the roasting recipe Rym for use on said number of m coffee beans. Other embodiments of apparatus for roasting coffee beans and a system of roasting devices comprising a set of said apparatus are also described.EFFECT: group of inventions provides identical process of roasting regardless of number of roasted grains and regardless of used apparatus for roasting of same type.17 cl, 9 dwg, 3 tbl
claims:
1. Аппарат для обжаривания кофейных зерен, содержащий:
- сосуд для размещения кофейных зерен,
- нагревательное устройство для нагрева кофейных зерен, содержащихся в сосуде,
- систему управления, выполненную с возможностью управления нагревательным устройством и выполненную с возможностью применения рецептуры (R) обжаривания, обеспечивающей заданные значения температур для применения в отдельные последовательные моменты времени t<sub>1</sub>, t<sub>2</sub>и т.д., соответственно,
причем для заданного количества m кофейных зерен типа Cy, загруженных внутрь сосуда,
- система управления выполнена с возможностью определения по меньшей мере:
количества m кофейных зерен, загруженных внутрь сосуда, и
типа Cy кофейных зерен, загруженных внутрь сосуда,
и
- на основе полученного типа Cy и полученного количества m, система управления выполнена с возможностью определения рецептуры Rym для обжаривания количества m кофейных зерен типа Cy в аппарате для обжаривания путем:
- получения доступа:
к правилу для расчета рецептуры обжаривания, адаптированной для обжаривания некоторого количества зерен, при этом указанное количество включено в список предварительно заданного количества (M, M±Δx), из любой ранее существовавшей рецептуры обжаривания, адаптированной к обжариванию другого количества зерен в указанном конкретном типе аппарата для обжаривания, при этом указанное другое количество включено в список заранее заданного количества (M, M±Δx), и
к списку указанных предварительно заданных количеств (M, M±Δx), и
по меньшей мере к одной предварительно заданной исходной рецептуре обжаривания RyMoriginal, при этом указанная рецептура обжаривания RyMoriginal выполнена с возможностью обжаривания одного предварительно заданного количества Moriginal зерен типа Cy в указанном конкретном типе аппарата для обжаривания, причем указанная предварительно заданная первоначальная рецептура обжаривания RyMoriginal обеспечивает заданные значения температур, применяемых в дискретные последовательные моменты

title: Paediatric formulations for phenylketonuria and tyrosinaemia and specific free amino acid mixture
abstract: This invention relates to infant formulae or follow-on formulae suitable for children under the age of 2 years, and their use in the dietary management of phenylketonuria and tyrosinaemia. In particular, the invention relates infant formulae or follow-on formulae comprising casein glycomacropeptide and free amino acids as well as their use in the dietary management of phenylketonuria and tyrosinaemia, and the symptoms thereof. The invention relates to a mixture of free amino acids for use in manufacturing the infant formulae or follow-on formula.
claims:
CLAIMS:
1. A formula for children under the age of 2 years comprising intact casein glycomacropeptide and free amino acids for use in the dietary management of phenylketonuria or tyrosinaemia in an individual in need thereof.
2. The formula for use according to claim 1, wherein the dietary management results in (a) good metabolic control, normal growth and/or improved gastrointestinal tolerance; or (b) good metabolic control, normal growth and improved gastrointestinal tolerance.
3. The formula for use according to claim 2, wherein (a) the good metabolic control achieves blood phenylalanine concentrations of 120- 360 pmol/L in an individual with phenylketonuria or blood tyrosine concentrations of 200-400 pmol/L in an individual with tyrosinaemia; (b) the normal growth results in maintenance, preferably an increase, of length for age, weight for age and/or BMI for age; or (c) the improved gastrointestinal tolerance is selected from the group consisting of reduced vomiting, regurgitation, abdominal discomfort or colic symptoms, flatulence, proportion or loose or hard stools, and/or difficulty feeding.
4. The formula for use according to any one of the previous claims, wherein (a) the use is for the dietary management of phenylketonuria; or (b) the use is for the dietary management of phenylketonuria and wherein the dietary management results in prevention or reduction in severity or frequency of one or more symptom selected from the group consisting of intellectual disab

title: An aeration assembly for lipid activation
abstract: In an embodiment to the present invention an aeration assembly (100) is disclosed. The aeration assembly (100) includes an aeration tank (102) with a closed top (110) and a curved base (112) to house a lipid to be aerated. The aeration tank (102) includes an inlet conduit (302) to allow passage of air for aeration of the lipid, a ring conduit (304) arranged along inner circumference of bottom of the aeration tank (102), a micronization assembly (306) having spargers (310) to receive air from the ring conduit (304) for micronization. Further, a propeller type impeller (308) arranged agitates the lipid in the aeration tank (102) to facilitate contact between the micronized air and the lipid for aeration of the lipid to obtain aerated lipid and by-products of aeration.
claims:
1. An aeration assembly (100) comprising:
an aeration tank (102) with a closed top (110) and a curved base (112) to house a lipid to be aerated, the aeration tank (102) includes:
an inlet conduit (302) to allow passage of air for aeration of the lipid to a ring conduit (304) in the aeration tank (102);
the ring conduit (304) arranged along inner circumference of bottom of the aeration tank (102);
a micronization assembly (306) including one or more spargers (310) and radially attached to the ring conduit (304) to:
receive air from the ring conduit (304);
micronize the received air by passing the received air through the one or more spargers (310); and
a propeller type impeller (308) arranged axially above the spargers (310) to agitate the lipid in the aeration tank (102) to facilitate contact between the micronized air and the lipid for aeration of the lipid to obtain aerated lipid with flavor modulation.
2. The aeration assembly (100) as claimed in claim 1, further comprising an air supply device (104) configured to :
receive atmospheric air pulled in by a centrifugal blower (118) ;
receive compressed air from a compressed air source;
combine the received atmospheric air with the received compressed ai

title: Compositions and methods for reducing the occurrence of diarrhea by promoting blautia obeum in the gut microbiota
abstract: Methods and compositions for treating diarrhea, reducing the occurrence of diarrhea and/or preventing diarrhea in an infant or young child, by promoting Blautia obeum in the gut microbiota of the infant or young child. Suitably, the methods and compositions use at least one arabinoxylan or arabinoxylan-containing material selected from the group consisting of (i) whole corn, (ii) corn arabinoxylan, (iii) corn bran, (iv) corn bran arabinoxylan, (v) whole wheat, (vi) wheat arabinoxylan, (vii) wheat bran, and (viii) wheat bran arabinoxylan.
claims:
1. A method for treating diarrhea, reducing the occurrence of diarrhea and/or preventing diarrhea in an infant or young child, comprising administering a composition that promotes Blautia obeum in the gut microbiota of the infant or young child.
2. The method according to claim 1 wherein the composition comprises at least one arabinoxylan or arabinoxylan-containing material in an amount effective to promote Blautia obeum in the gut microbiota of the infant or young child.
3. A method for treating diarrhea, reducing the occurrence of diarrhea and/or preventing diarrhea in an infant or young child; comprising administering an arabinoxylan or arabinoxylan-containing material to the infant or young child wherein the arabinoxylan promotes Blautia obeum in the gut microbiota of the infant or young child.
4. The method of claim 2 wherein the arabinoxylan or arabinoxylan-containing material is selected from the group consisting of (i) whole corn, (ii) corn arabinoxylan, (iii) corn bran, (iv) corn bran arabinoxylan, (v) whole wheat, (vi) wheat arabinoxylan, (vii) wheat bran, and (viii) wheat bran arabinoxylan.
5. (canceled)
