title: Uses of bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism
abstract: The present invention relates to the use of a Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism to metabolise one or more glycan substrates selected from the group recited in any of Tables 1 to 3.
claims:
1. Use of a Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism to metabolize one or more glycan substrates, preferably wherein the glycan substrate is selected from the groups recited in any of Tables 1 to 3.
2. Use of a Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism according to claim 1, wherein the Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism is used to promote or assist the transition from a milk-based diet to solid food in an infant and/or in a young child.
3. Use of a combination of a Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism and one or more glycan substrates to promote or assist the transition from a milk-based diet to solid food in an infant and/or in a young child, wherein the one or more glycan substrates is selected from the groups recited in any of Tables 1 to 3.
4. Use of a combination of a Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism and one or more glycan substrates to increase short-chain fatty acids (SCFA) production by the gut microbiome of an infant and/or in a young child, wherein the one or more glycan substrates is selected from the groups recited in any of Tables 1 to 3.
5. Use of a combination of a Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism and one or more glycan substrates to modulate the gut microbiome, wherein the one or more glycan substrates is selected from the groups recited in any of Tables 1 to 3.
6. Use of a glycan substr

title: Automatic system for dispensing roasted coffee beans and related method
abstract: The invention relates to a system (100) for dispensing a certain quantity of coffee beans into a beverage preparation machine to prepare a coffee beverage, the system comprising a tight variable volume container (20) with a volume receptacle (22) where the coffee beans are stored, the volume receptacle (22) being configured to modify its internal volume in order to adapt it to the quantity of coffee beans stored in it; the system (100) further comprising an active dosing device (30) configured to convey coffee beans with respect to the volume receptacle (22), the dosing device (30) being tight to the outside environment also while conveying coffee beans. The invention further relates to a method for actuating a system (100) for dispensing a certain quantity of coffee beans into a beverage preparation machine to prepare a coffee beverage.
claims:
5       1. System for dispensing a certain quantity of coffee beans into a beverage preparation machine to prepare a coffee beverage, the system comprising a tight variable volume container with a volume receptacle where the coffee beans are stored, the volume receptacle being configured to modify its internal volume in order to adapt it to the quantity of 10           coffee beans stored in it; the system further comprising an active dosing device configured to convey coffee beans with respect to the volume receptacle, the dosing device being tight to the outside environment also while conveying coffee beans; the dosing device in contact with the coffee beans being made of a compressible 15          material having a hardness that is lower than the hardness of the coffee beans.
2. System according to claim 1, wherein the dosing device is configured to act as a pump or as a reverse pump in order to convey coffee beans out of the volume receptacle or inside of the volume receptacle, respectively. 20
3. System according to any one of the previous claims, wherein the variable volume container comprises a piston element displacing by gravity inside the volume receptacle to adapt the internal volume of this receptacle to the quantity of coffee beans stored in it. 25
4. System according to claim 3, wherein the piston element further comprises a pressure valve with a threshold pressure equivalent to the weight of th

title: Mixture of HMOS and bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism
abstract: Mixture of HMOs and Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism The present invention relates to a composition comprising a Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism and a mixture of human milk oligosaccharides (HMOs) consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2'-FL), difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), and 3'-sialyllactose (3SL), and optionally 3-fucosyllactose (3-FL) and/or lacto-N- neotetraose (LNnT). The invention also relates to the use of the composition for preventing, reducing the risk of and/or treating an infection in a subject. The invention also provides the composition for use in promoting a long-term immune benefit in a subject, preventing and/or reducing the risk of allergen sensitisation, preventing and/or reducing the risk of developing a respiratory condition in a subject, and/or preventing and/or reducing the risk of developing asthma in a subject.
claims:
CLAIMS
1 . A composition comprising a Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism and a HMO mixture consisting of 2'-fucosyllactose (2’-FL), difucosyllactose (DFL), lacto-N-tetraose (LNT), 6'-sialyllactose (6SL), and 3'-sialyllactose (3SL), and optionally 3-fucosyllactose (3-FL) and/or lacto-N-neotetraose (LNnT).
2. The composition according to claim 1 , wherein the Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism: (i) is capable of metabolizing the HMO(s); (ii) preferentially utilizes 3-FL over 2’-FL; (iii) is capable of metabolizing a glycan substrate selected from the group recited in any of Tables 1 to 3; and/or (iv) encodes one or more CAZymes selected from the group recited in Table 1 , preferably wherein the Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism further encodes one or more CAZymes selected from Table 2 and 3.
3. The composition according to claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the Bifidobacterium longum transitional microorganism has an Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI) of at least 98% with at least one Bifidobacterium longum strain selected from the group consisting of CNCM I-5683, CNCM I-5684, CNCM I-5685, CNCM I-5686, CNCM I-5687, CMCC-P0001 (ATCC BAA-2753), and any combination thereof.
4. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the composition further comprises Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis.
5. The composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wher

title: Beverage pouch system with pouch identification
abstract: The invention relates to an extraction device for extracting a beverage ingredient from a capsule (3), said capsule (3) comprising a code (34), said device comprising:-upstream and downstream capsule enclosing parts (1, 2), the upstream and downstream capsule encapsulating parts are relatively movable between an open position and a closed position for inserting and removing the capsule (3); the invention relates to a device (1) comprising a path (41), a code reader (71),-a removable capsule stent (6),-a top insertion section (4) for introducing the capsule stent (6) into the device,-a capsule stent stop (42) for stopping the capsule stent (6) in an intermediate temporary position inside said path (41), and wherein in the intermediate temporary position, the capsule stent (6) is inserted into the path (41). The bag holder (6) is configured to hold the bag such that the code (34) arranged on the bag faces the code reader (71), and wherein during introduction of the bag holder into the device, when the bag holder reaches the intermediate temporary position, an operation of reading the code by the code reader is triggered by movement of the bag holder (6).

title: Process for preparing a berry composition
claims:
1. A process for preparing a berry composition comprising the steps consisting of: i) providing whole berries, wherein the whole berries comprise skin, seeds and/or pulp which are intact, and wherein the whole berries comprise inherent insoluble fibers, ii) grinding the whole berries to prepare a berry suspension, and iii) micronizing said whole berries in presence of a liquid medium to prepare a micronized berry suspension having D(90) particle size of less than 200 μm, wherein the process does not comprise any step of removal of the inherent insoluble fibers coming from the whole berries.
2. The process according to claim 1, wherein the whole berries are selected from the group consisting of whole wolfberries, whole blueberries, whole cranberries, whole white currants, whole red currants, whole blackcurrants, whole mulberries, whole blackberries, whole gooseberries, whole raspberries, whole sea buckthorns, whole strawberries, whole arbutus berries, whole grapes, and combinations thereof.
3. The process according to claim 2, wherein the whole berries consist only of whole wolfberries.
4. The process according to claim 1, wherein the whole berries: liquid medium ratio during the micronization step is of 1:1 to 1:20.
5. The process according to claim 1, wherein the whole berries are micronized by performing 1 to 5 passes into a micronization device.

title: composition
abstract: The present invention relates to an amino acid composition comprising threonine, serine, proline, leucine, and cysteine for use in improving liver function in a subject. The present invention also relates to an enteral nutritional composition comprising threonine, serine, proline, leucine, and cysteine and a method for producing the same.
claims:
1. A method for improving liver function in a subject by promoting gut healing comprising administering an amino acid composition comprising threonine, serine, proline, leucine, and cysteine to the subject.
2. A method for promoting gut healing in a subject, wherein the subject is at risk of or has impaired liver function comprising administering an amino acid composition comprising threonine, serine, proline, leucine, and cysteine to the subject.
3. The a method according to claim 1, wherein the subject is a critically ill patient and the subject has a condition selected from the group consisting of: sepsis, acute respiratory failure, trauma, surgery, pancreatitis, shock, severe burns, mucositis, inflammatory bowel disease, distorted gut barrier, intestinal mucosal lesions, and short-bowel syndrome.
4. A method according to claim 2, wherein the subject is a critically ill patient.
5. Method according to claim 1, wherein the amino acid composition resolves systemic inflammation and/or reduces liver injury in the subject.
6. Method according to claim 1, wherein the amino acid composition is administered by enteral administration.
7. Method according to claim 1, wherein the amino acid composition is in a form selected from the group consisting of a nutritional composition, supplement, and fortifier.

title: Bulk dosing unit and related system
abstract: The invention concerns a bulk dosing unit (100; 200) of bulk products contained in a bulk product container (10), wherein a sliding assembly (122) of the bulk dosing unit (100; 200) is provided for sliding a dosing element (121) between a closed position, in which a bulk product is not dispensed, and a maximum dispensing position, in which a bulk product can be dispensed at the maximum flow rate, and vice versa, wherein in the closed position an opening portion (121'') of the dosing element (121) is able to be arranged spaced away from a container aperture (11) of a bulk product container and simultaneously a device engagement portion (123'') is able to arrange an aperture cover (12) of a bulk product container (10) to completely cover a container aperture (11) of a bulk product container (10) and in the maximum dispensing position the opening portion (121'') of the dosing element (121) is able to be superimposed to a container aperture (11) of a bulk product container (10) and simultaneously the device engagement portion (123') is able to arrange an aperture cover (12) of a bulk product container (10) to substantially completely uncover a container aperture (11) of a bulk product container (10), allowing the dosing of a bulk product to be dispensed according to the position of the dosing element (121) in between the closed position and the maximum dispensing position.
claims:
CLAIMS
<div class="indep-clm" num="1"><seg-main>1. title: Package product, package set comprising at least two package products, method for manufacturing such package products
abstract: The package product (1) comprises a container (2) and a packaging (10) The container (2) comprises: - a container body (2.0) defining a cavity (6), - a food component (4) in the cavity (6), - a membrane (9) closing the cavity (6). The packaging (10) comprises: - a protection sheet (12) covering the container body (2.0), and - a closure sheet (14) covering the membrane (9) and part of the protection sheet (12) to enclose the container (2) between the protection sheet (12) and the closure sheet (14). The closure sheet (14) and the protection sheet (12) are attached along a sheet attaching section (20) extending around the membrane (9). A line of weakness (22) extends around the membrane (9) to allow separation of a lid (24) from the closure sheet (14) under a manual force (F) for the container (2) to be released.
claims:
Claims
1. Package product (1) comprising a container (2) and a packaging (10): wherein the container (2) comprises: - a container body (2.0) defining a cavity (6) and an opening (8) of the cavity (6), a dose of food component (4) contained within the cavity (6), the dose of food component (4) being suitable for interacting with a fluid introduced into the cavity (6) so as to prepare a food product, and a membrane (9) attached to the container body (2.0) so as to close the cavity (6), wherein the packaging (10) comprises: a protection sheet (12) arranged to cover an outer side (2.2) of the container body (2.0), and a closure sheet (14) arranged to cover the membrane (9) and at least part of the protection sheet (12), such that the container (2) is enclosed between the protection sheet (12) and the closure sheet (14), wherein the closure sheet (14) and the protection sheet (12) are attached to each other along a sheet attaching section (20), the sheet attaching section (20) extending around the membrane (9), and wherein the closure sheet (14) has a line of weakness (22) extending near or around part or all of the membrane (9), the line of weakness (22) being configured such that it allows at least partial separation of a lid portion (24) from the rest of the closure sheet (14) under a manual force (F) exerted on the protection sheet (12) to press the container (2) against the closure sheet (14) such that the line of weakness (22) tears partly or totally open and defines a release opening (26) in the closure sheet (14) for the container (2) to be released from the protection sheet (12).

title: Machine, cutting unit for such a machine and method for preparing a beverage with such a machine
abstract: The preparation machine (1) comprises: - a preparation unit (2) having i) a preparation chamber (6) for receiving the capsule (100) and ii) a fluid injection unit (8) for injecting the fluid in the capsule (100) to prepare the beverage, and - a cutting unit (4) having a cutting element (7), the cutting element (7) being configured to cut the capsule (100) open such that at least part of the beverage component is released from the cavity (102) after the capsule (100) has been processed in the preparation unit (2).
claims:
1. Preparation machine (1) for preparing a beverage by injecting a fluid in a capsule (100), the capsule (100) having i) a capsule body (101) defining a cavity (102) and ii) a beverage component (103) contained within the cavity (102), wherein the preparation machine (1) comprises: - a preparation unit (2) having i) a preparation chamber (6) for receiving the capsule (100) and ii) a fluid injection unit (8) for injecting the fluid in the capsule (100) to prepare the beverage, and - a cutting unit (4) having a cutting element (7), the cutting element (7) being configured to cut the capsule (100) open such that at least part of the beverage component (103) is released from the cavity (102) after the capsule (100) has been processed in the preparation unit (2).
2. Preparation machine (1) according to claim 1, wherein the cutting element (7) comprises a blade.
3. Preparation machine (1) according to any one of the preceding claims, further comprising a driving unit (10) configured to move the cutting element (7) to cut open the capsule (100), the driving unit (10) including a motor or a manual actuator.
4. Preparation machine (1) according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the cutting element (7) is movable in translation.
5. Preparation machine (1) according to any one of any one of the preceding claims, wherein the cutting element (7)

title: Beverage extraction system
abstract: The invention concerns a system comprising an extraction device of a beverage preparation machine and a pod, wherein - the pod comprises a pod body and a top lid, and - the extraction device comprises : - upstream and downstream pod enclosing parts relatively translatable between an open position for inserting and/or ejecting the pod and a closed position for forming an extraction chamber enclosing the pod during extraction, the downstream part comprising a downstream plane piercing arrangement for opening the lid of the pod, and wherein the body and the lid of the pod are made of a multilayer paper material comprising a layer of paper coated with at least a layer of plastic, and the external surface of the multilayer paper material of the top lid is covered by a layer presenting a surface tension inferior to 40 dyne/cm.

title: Methods and systems for facilitating the creation of food and/or beverage product concepts
abstract: A computer-implemented method for facilitating the creation of food and/or beverage product concepts, comprising: providing a plurality of content items obtained from one or more sources, each content item comprising structured or unstructured text, at least one of the content items comprising text that pertains, at least in part, to one or more food and/or beverage products, assigning, to each content item, one or more taxonomic labels, wherein each label comprises a term contained in a pre-defined taxonomy of terms and each label assigned to a respective content item is selected based on the particular language used in the respective content item, receiving, from a user, a query specifying a first term; in the event that the first term comprises a taxonomic label from the pre-defined taxonomy of terms; identifying one or more pairs of terms, each pair of terms comprising the first term and a respective other one of the taxonomic labels; determining, for each pair of terms, an association score, wherein the association score is based at least in part on the number of content items that have been assigned both of the taxonomic labels in the pair; and outputting, in a user-interface, a response to the query, wherein the response provides an indication of the association score(s) for each pair of terms.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A computer-implemented method for facilitating the creation of food and/or beverage product concepts, the method comprising: providing a plurality of content items obtained from one or more sources, each content item comprising structured or unstructured text, at least one of the content items comprising text that pertains, at least in part, to one or more food and/or beverage products; assigning, to each content item, one or more taxonomic labels, wherein each label comprises a term contained in a pre-defined taxonomy of terms and each label assigned to a respective content item is selected based on the particular language used in the respective content item; receiving, from a user, a query specifying a first term; in the event that the first term comprises a taxonomic label from the pre-defined taxonomy of terms; identifying one or more pairs of terms, each pair of terms comprising the first term and a respective other one of the taxonomic labels; determining, for each pair of terms, an association score, wherein the association score is based at least in part on the number of content items that have been assigned both of the taxonomic labels in the pair; and outputting, in a user-interface, a response to the query, wherein the response provides an indication of the association score(s) for each pair of terms.
2. A computer-implemented method according to claim 1 , wherein in the event that the first term in the query does not comprise one of the taxonomic labels in the pre-defined taxonomy, the method comprises: identifying one or more of the content items to which the first term is relevant, based on the particular language used in the respective content item; identifying one or more pairs of terms, each pair of terms comprising the first term and a respective one

title: Compositions and methods using a combination of oleuropein and vitamin b6
abstract: Composition comprising a combination of oleuropein or metabolite thereof and Vitamin B6 thereof are provided. The composition may be an oral nutritional composition, for example a nutritional supplement, an oral nutritional supplement, an RTD, an RTD concentrate, a food product, a food for special medical purpose (FSMP). The composition can be administered to an individual in need thereof for improving a physiological state linked to metabolic fatigue in one or more cells, (ii) increasing mitochondrial energy and mitochondrial calcium uptake in one or more cells, and (iii) increasing antioxidant capacity, reducing oxidative stress and/or enhancing mitochondrial function, (iv) treating or preventing a calcium deficiency/depletion disorder in an individual. Additionally or alternatively, the method can treat or prevent a mitochondria-related disease or a condition associated with altered mitochondrial function in an individual in need thereof or at risk thereof.
claims:
1. A method for use in (i) improving a physiological state linked to metabolic fatigue in one or more cells, (ii) increasing mitochondrial energy and mitochondrial calcium uptake in one or more cells, and (iii) increasing antioxidant capacity, reducing oxidative stress and/or enhancing mitochondrial function, (iv) treating or preventing a calcium deficiency/depletion disorder in an individual comprising administering a composition comprising a combination of oleuropein and/or a metabolite thereof and Vitamin B6, in a therapeutically effective amount to the individual.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein at least a portion of the one or more cells are part of at least one body part selected from the group consisting of a liver, a kidney, a brain, and a skeletal muscle.
3. The method according to claim 1, wherein the physiological state linked to metabolic fatigue comprises muscle fatigue or weakness, lack of energy, physical energy, lack of vitality or weakness.
4. The method according to claim 1, wherein the effective amount of a combination of oleuropein and/or a metabolite thereof and Vitamin B6 is orally administered daily for at least one week.
5. The method according to claim 1, wherein the metabolite of oleuropein is selected from the group consisting of oleuropein aglycone, hydroxytyrosol, elenolic acid, homovanillyl alcohol, isohomovanillyl alcohol, glucuronidated forms thereof, sulfated forms thereof, derivatives thereof, and mixtures th

title: Apparatus for roasting coffee beans
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: group of inventions relates to coffee industry. Disclosed is an apparatus for roasting coffee beans, comprising: a chamber for placing coffee beans, heating device for heating coffee beans placed in the chamber, a control system configured to control the heating device and made with possibility of application of roasting recipe R, providing temperatures applied at separate successive moments of time t1, t2, …, tfinal respectively, while for an individual mixture of coffee beans CA, CB, …, placed inside the chamber, the control system is configured to determine the roasting recipe Rym for roasting said mixture in the roasting apparatus by: obtaining for each type of coffee beans Cn, included in said mixture of at least: type Cn specified type of coffee beans, and quantity mn specified type of coffee beans Cn, placed in the chamber, and based on the obtained type Cn obtaining access to at least roasting recipes RMA, RMB, … different types of coffee beans CA, CB, ... respectively, wherein each recipe RMn is adapted to roasting one predetermined amount Mn of grains of the same type Cn and provides temperatures used at discrete successive moments of time ti, respectively, and temperature adaptation coefficients KA, KB, … said different types of coffee beans CA, CB, …, respectively, an individual mixture, and based on the obtained amounts of mn different coffee beans Cn and available recipes for roasting RMn and temperature coefficients Kn, determining the roasting recipe Rblend, which must be used for said individual mixture of coffee beans placed inside the chamber. Described also is a computer-readable data medium containing instructions which, when executed by a computer, a processor or a control unit, lead to the operation of the control system of the described apparatus.EFFECT: group of inventions makes it possible to improve the process of automatic roasting of coffee beans.12 cl, 9 dwg
claims:
1. Аппарат для обжаривания кофейных зерен, содержащий:
- камеру для размещения кофейных зерен,
- нагревательное устройство для нагрева кофейных зерен, помещенных в камеру,
- систему управления, выполненную с возможностью управления нагревательным устройством и выполненную с возможностью применения рецептуры обжаривания R, обеспечивающей температуры, применяемые в отдельные последовательные моменты времени t<sub>1</sub>, t<sub>2</sub>, …, t<sub>final</sub>соответственно,
при этом для индивидуальной смеси кофейных зерен C<sub>A</sub>, C<sub>B</sub>, …, помещенных внутрь камеры, система управления выполнена с возможностью определения рецептуры обжаривания Rym для обжаривания указанной смеси в аппарате для обжаривания путем:
- получения для каждого типа кофейных зерен C<sub>n</sub>, входящих в указанную смесь, по меньшей мере:
типа C<sub>n</sub>указанного типа кофейных зерен, и
количества m<sub>n</sub>указанного типа кофейных зерен C<sub>n</sub>, помещаемых в камеру,
и
- на основе полученного типа C<sub>n</sub>получения доступа по меньшей мере к:
рецептурам обжаривания RM<sub>A</sub>, RM<sub>B</sub>, … различных типов кофейных зерен C<sub>A</sub>, C<sub>B</sub>, … соответственно, причем каждая рецептура RM<sub>n</sub>адаптирована к обжариванию одного заранее заданного количества M<sub>n</sub>зерен одного и того же типа C<sub>n</sub>и обеспечивает температуры, применяемые в дискретные последовательные моменты времени t<sub>i</sub>соответственно,
и
температурным коэффициентам адаптации K<sub>A</sub>, K<sub>B</sub>, … указанных различных типов кофейных зерен C<sub>A</sub>, C<sub>B</sub>, …, соответственно, индивидуальной смеси,
и
- на основе полученных количеств m<sub>n</sub>разных кофейных зерен Cn и доступных рецептур обжаривания RMn и температурных коэффициентов Kn, определения рецептуры обжаривания R<sub>blend</sub>, которую необходимо применить для указанной индивидуальной смеси кофейных зерен, помещенных внутрь камеры.

title: Lactobacillus acidophilus to increase agmatine production by microbiota
abstract: Disclosed are probiotics, compositions and methods for producing agmatine using microbiota; and more particularly, isolated probiotics, compositions comprising the isolated probiotics, and methods for increasing production of agmatine and/or polyamines in the gastrointestinal tact of a subject, which provides to the subject certain health benefits, such as pain relief, antiaging effects, neuroprotective and antidepressant effects, improved vasodilatation and metabolic health, improved cellular health, decreased age-related memory loss, and/or longevity. The isolated probiotic is capable of colonizing and surviving in the gastrointestinal tract of the subject and capable of converting arginine to agmatine in the gastrointestinal tract of the subject.
claims:
1. A method for improving pain relief, antiaging effects, neuroprotective and antidepressant effects, improved vasodilatation and metabolic health, improved cellular health, and longevity, and/or reducing age-related memory loss of a subject in need thereof, the method comprising administering to the subject an effective amount of a composition comprising an isolated probiotic and arginine to increase production of agmatine in a gastrointestinal tract of the subject.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the isolated probiotic comprises a Lactobacillus acidophilus strain.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the isolated probiotic comprises a bacterial strain having at least 90%, preferably at least 95% sequence identity to a strain selected from the group consisting of Lactobacillus acidophilus NCC 2628 (CNCM I-2453), Lactobacillus acidophilus NCC 2766 (CNCM I-3848), Lactobacillus acidophilus NCC 2775 (CNCM I-3851), and Lactobacillus acidophilus NCC 2619 (ATCC 700396).
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the composition further comprises an ingredient selected from the group consisting of a starch source, a protein source, a prebiotic source, lipid source, vitamins, sugars, salt, spices, seasonings, minerals, flavoring agents, and combinations thereof.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the isolated probiotic comprises a Lactobacillus acidophilus strain selected from the group consisting of Lactobacillus acidophilus N

title: Beverage dispenser
abstract: The invention relates to a beverage dispenser comprising: a coffee machine for producing hot coffee and hot coffee mixed with milk, said coffee machine comprising a milk tank capable of replenishing cold milk; -a refrigerator comprising a refrigerating chamber and a freezing chamber; -a coffee cooler for cooling hot coffee produced by the coffee machine, said coffee cooler comprising a container to contain coffee dispensed from the coffee machine, and a wall of said container comprising a circulation path for a cooling fluid, wherein a freezing compartment of the refrigerator comprises a cooling fluid container for storing the cooling fluid, and wherein the beverage dispenser comprises an external cooling fluid circuit configured to circulate the cooling fluid between the cooling fluid container and a circulation path of the coffee cooler.
claims:
1.饮料分配器(100)，所述饮料分配器包括：
-咖啡机(1)，用于生产热咖啡和与牛奶混合的热咖啡，所述咖啡机包括牛奶罐(12)，所述牛奶罐能够补充牛奶，优选地冷牛奶，

-15℃的温度，

其中所述饮料分配器包括外部冷却流体回路(41)，所述外部冷却流体回路被配置成使所述冷却流体在所述冷却流体容器和所述咖啡冷却器的所述循环路径之间循环。
2.根据权利要求1所述的饮料分配器，其中所述用于存储和冷却所述冷却流体的容器(4)包括用于所述冷却流体的冰箱外部入口(43)和冰箱外部出口(42)，并且所述冷却流体回路包括泵(44)，用于使所述冷却流体从所述出口循环到所述咖啡冷却器的所述循环路径(32)并且返回到所述容器的入口。

-所述冰箱包括至少一个冷量生成单元(23)，所述冷量生成单元包括具有在其中循环的制冷剂的制冷回路(231)，并且包括用于处理所述制冷剂的压缩机(232)、冷凝器(233)、膨胀装置(234)，并且

6.根据前述权利要求所述的饮料分配器，其中所述用于储存和冷却所述冷却流体的容器(4)包括用于所述冷却流体的冰箱内部入口(72)和冰箱内部出口(73)，并且所述内部冷却流体回路包括泵(73)，用于使所述冷却流体从所述冰箱出口循环到所述冷冻机的所述热交换器(8)并且返回到所述容器的所述冰箱内部入口(72)。
7.根据前述权利要求

title: Compositions and methods for treatment of exocrine pancreatic insufficiency (EPI)
abstract: A method of treating exocrine pancreatic insufficiency includes administering to an individual in need thereof (e.g., an individual with cystic fibrosis) an effective amount of an enteral composition having a total protein consisting essentially of hydrolyzed protein and a total fat containing monoacylglycerols (MAG) that are at least about 30 wt. % of the total fat, and the total fat optionally further contains medium chain triglycerides (MCT) and/or fatty acids. In one particular non-limiting embodiment, about 60 wt. % of the total fat is from MCT and about 40 wt. % of the total fat is from MAG; in another particular non-limiting embodiment, the total fat is MAG with free fatty acids (esterified and/or bound) without MCT; and in yet another particular non-limiting embodiment, the total fat is MAG alone without MCT.
claims:
1: A method of treating exocrine pancreatic insufficiency (EPI), the method comprising administering to an individual in need thereof an effective amount of a nutritional composition having (1) a total protein consisting essentially of hydrolyzed protein; and (2) a total fat comprising monoacylglycerols (MAG) that are at least about 20 wt % of the total fat, the total fat optionally further comprising medium chain triglycerides (MCT) and/or fatty acids.
2: The method of claim 1, the method comprising administering to the individual the nutritional composition having at least one characteristic selected from the group consisting of: (i) an energy density of 1.0-2.5 kcal/ml; (ii) the total fat that is about 10 to about 90 energy % of the nutritional composition; (iii) an amount of medium chain triglycerides (MCT) that is about 1.0 wt % to about 10.0 wt % of the nutritional composition; (iv) the MAG that are about 0.1 wt % to about 10.0 wt % of the nutritional composition; (v) the total protein that is about 5 to about 50 energy % of the nutritional composition; (vi) a total carbohydrates that is about 5 to about 85 energy % of the nutritional composition; and (vii) the total carbohydrates that consist essentially of one or more of maltodextrin, maltose, maltotriose, sucrose, fructose, lactose, galactose, and high-maltose corn syrup, and optionally comprise slowly digested carbohydrates.

title: Dietary butyrate
Process for producing a bio-based polyethylene terephthalate (PET) polymer, entirely from bio-based materials
abstract: The invention relates to a process for producing a bio-based polyethylene terephthalate (PET) polymer, from at least one terephthalate compound obtained from at least one bio- based material, and at least one monoethylene glycol compound obtained from at least one bio-based material, Said process comprising the polymerization of the terephthalate compound and of the monoethylene glycol compound in the presence of at least one crystallization retarding compound, Said process being characterized in that the crystallization retarding compound is obtained from at least one bio-based material. The invention also relates to a bio-based PET polymer obtained by said process. Preferably, the process further comprises processing the bio-based PET polymer into a bio-based product such as a bio-based container or a bio-based packaging. The invention also relates to said bio-based product.
claims:
﻿ 14 Claims
1. A process for producing a bio-based polyethylene terephthalate (PET) polymer from terephthalic acid obtained from at least one bio-based material, and ethylene glycol obtained from at least one bio-based material, said process comprising polymerization through esterification of the terephthalic acid and of the ethylene glycol in the presence of at least one crystallization retarding compound at a temperature of 150-280oC, wherein the crystallization retarding compound is obtained from at least one bio¬ based material and is selected from the group consisting of isosorbide, isosorbide combined with one or more of 1,3-propanediol, 1,4-butanediol, 2,3-butanediol, 1,3- pentanediol, 1,4-pentanediol, 1,5-pentanediol, 2-methyl-l,4-butanediol (2-MBDO), diethylene glycol, triethylene glycol, propylene glycol, catechol, 2,5-dihydroxymethyl tetrahydrofuran, 2,5-bis(hydroxymethyl) furan, fumaric acid, glutaric acid, muconic acid, itaconic acid, succinic acid, adipic acid, malic acid, 2,5-furan dicarboxylic acid and p,p'- biphenyl dicarboxylic acid.
2. A process according to claim 1, wherein the crystallization retarding compound is in an amount from 0.05 to 7% mol, preferably from 0.1to 4% mol, with respect to the bio¬ based PET polymer.
3. A process according to claim 1or 2, wherein the bio-based material leading to the bio-based crystallization retarding compound is selected from the group consisting of sugars, starches, corns, natural fibers, sugarcanes, beets, citrus fruits, woody plants, cellulosic-containing compounds, lignocellulosic-containing compounds, hemicellulosic- containing compounds, oily wood feedstock, polysaccharides such as pectin, chitin, levan,

title: Method of making fermented plant-based products having umami taste and products thereof
abstract: The invention relates to a method of making a fermented plant-based product having umami taste. The method comprises a step of providing a plant protein substrate and a step of fermenting the plant protein substrate with a starter culture comprising Lactobacillus johnsonii. It also relates to such a fermented plant-based product and to Lactobacillus johnsonii strains suitable for the invention. It also relates to peptides that impart and/or enhance umami taste, method for preparing such peptides, composition comprising such peptides and use of such peptides as flavouring agent.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A method of making a fermented plant-based product, said method comprising providing a plant protein substrate, and fermenting the plant protein substrate with a starter culture comprising Lactobacillus johnsonii.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the plant protein of the plant protein substrate is pulse protein, preferably pea protein.
3. The method according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the plant protein substrate is a plant protein suspension.
4. The method according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the Lactobacillus johnsonii expresses the proteinase PrtP and/or the proteinase PrtM and/or the oligopeptide permease OppA.
5. The method according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the Lactobacillus johnsonii is selected from the list consisting of Lactobacillus johnsonii deposited at the CNCM under reference number CNCM 1-5910, Lactobacillus johnsonii deposited at the CNCM under reference number CNCM 1-1225, Lactobacillus johnsonii deposited at the CNCM under reference number CNCM 1-2474 or a combination thereof.
6. The method according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the fermentation step of the plant protein substrate with the starter culture lasts at least 16 hours, preferably at least 18 hours.
7. The method according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the fe

title: Hard-boiled egg analogue product
abstract: The present invention relates to a method of making a plant-based cooked egg analogue product, for example a hard-boiled egg analogue product, said method comprising providing a plant protein suspension; optionally adding oil to the suspension and mixing to form an emulsion; ensuring the pH of the suspension or emulsion is between pH 5 to 10, preferably between 7 to 9; adding a firming agent and mixing; optionally performing a cold set gelation at between 0 to 30°C; and performing a freezing step.
claims:
Claims
1. A method of making a plant-based cooked egg analogue product, for example a hard- boiled egg analogue product, said method comprising: a. Providing a plant protein suspension; b. Optionally adding oil to the suspension and mixing to form an emulsion; c. Ensuring the pH of the suspension or emulsion is between pH 5 to 10, preferably between 7 to 9; d. Adding a firming agent and mixing; f. Performing a freezing step, wherein the firming agent is a soluble mineral salt.
2. The method of making a product according to claim 1, said method after step d. comprising the step of: e. performing a cold set gelation at between 0 to 30°C.
3. The method of making a product according to any one of claims 1 and 2, wherein the plant protein suspension in step a) is a legume protein suspension, preferably a pulse protein suspension, for example a soy protein suspension and wherein the plant protein suspension in step a) has a protein concentration of between 3 to 30 wt%, preferably between 5 to 15 wt%.
4. The method of making a product according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein (i) the suspension is heated in step a) to at least 60°C, preferably to at least 90°C; or (ii) the emulsion is heated in step b) to at least 60°C, preferably to at least 90°C.
5. The method of making a product according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the cold set gel

title: Arabinose-containing and galactose-containing food composition and process of preparation
abstract: An arabinose-containing and galactose-containing food composition is disclosed. Said food food composition is liquid or semi-liquid or powdered. It comprises plant proteins, less than 5wt.%free uronicacid by dry weight and a free arabinose to free galactose weight ration of from 1:1.5 to 1:5. A process for preparing such a food composition is also disclosed. A method for selecting an enzyme comprising a pectinase activity suitable for the invention is also disclosed.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. An arabinose-containing and galactose-containing food composition, which is liquid or semi-liquid or powdered and which comprises: - plant proteins selected from the list consisting of legume proteins, seed proteins and mixture thereof, -less than 5wt.% free uronic acid by dry weight, -a weight ratio of free arabinose to free galactose (free arabinose: free galactose) of from 1:1.5 to 1:5, preferably 1:3.5 to 1:4.5.
2. The arabinose-containing and galactose-containing food composition according to claim 1, which comprises less than 30wt.% starch.
3. The arabinose-containing and galactose-containing food composition according to claim 1 or 2, which comprises at least 0.25wt.% free arabinose by dry weight, preferably free endogenous arabinose by dry weight.
4. The arabinose-containing and galactose-containing food composition according to any of the preceding claims, which comprises less than 30wt% non-starch polysaccharides by dry weight.
5. The arabinose-containing and galactose-containing food composition according to any of the preceding claims, which comprises less than 20wt.% pectic polysaccharides by dry weight.
6. The arabinose-containing and galactose-containing food composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the legume proteins come from the legume selected from the list consisting

title: Low density edible animal chews and methods of making same
abstract: Edible chews for pets have a low density (e.g. about 1.0 Kg/L or less) and a smooth exterior surface. One method by which the low density and the smooth exterior surface can be achieved uses a modified extrusion die to increase shear and restrict surface bubbles. Another method by which the low density and the smooth exterior surface can be achieved uses an extruder screw with a modified profile that holds a dough longer therein to create a whipping effect resulting in more bubble nucleation sites and hence a more uniform cellular matrix. The puffed (expanded) product was experimentally tested and provided better dental cleaning scores than a current unexpanded similarly formulated commercial dental product.
claims:
1: A method of making an edible pet chew, the method comprising:
preparing a dry mix comprising a pre-gelatinized cereal flour and further comprising sodium bicarbonate that is 0.2 to 1.5 wt. % of the dry mix;
metering the dry mix into an extruder comprising an extrusion die, the extruder further comprises a barrel comprising a vent and a vent-stuffer;
adding a polyhydric solvent to the dry mix to form a dough;
using the vent to provide ambient pressure in the extruder;
aerating the dough in the barrel comprising the vent and the vent-stuffer;
using a reverse element of the extruder to extend a time spent by the dough in the barrel comprising the vent and the vent-stuffer;
using mixing elements in the barrel comprising the vent and the vent-stuffer to whip the dough and promote nucleation;
promoting further nucleation of the dough by subjecting the dough to a combination of shear and temperature of at least 120° C. in the extruder, wherein the combination of shear and temperature is applied to the dough in a section of the extruder adjacent to the extrusion die, wherein the temperature in the section adjacent to the extrusion die is higher than a temperature of at least one previous section of the extruder; and
directing the nucleated dough through an opening of the extrusion die comprising grooves, each of the grooves has an open end and a bottom surface opposite to the open end, and the widt

title: AMPK activator (CBDA) and SGLT2 inhibitor for metabolic health
abstract: A composition includes a first compound having general formula I and a second compound for use in the synergistic activation of AMPK. A method of using the composition in the synergistic activation of AMPK is also provided.
claims: 1. A method for activation of AMPK comprising administering the composition to an individual in need of same, the composition comprising: a first compound; and a second compound; wherein the first compound has the general formula I, wherein R1 and R3 are each independently selected from the group consisting of OH; OCH3; O-aliphatic saturated or unsaturated acyl, O-glycoside; acylated O-glycoside; sulfated O-glycoside; and a sulfate; R2 is selected from the group consisting of OH; OCH3; O-glycoside; C-glycoside; acylated O-glycoside; acylated C-glycoside; sulfated O-glycoside; sulfated C-glycoside; a halogen; a primary, secondary, or tertiary alcohol; a ketone; an aldehyde; an ester; a primary, secondary, or tertiary amine; a primary or secondary amide; a cyano; a nitro; a sulfonate; a sulfate; substituted and/or branched C1 to C20 alkyl; substituted and/or branched, C2 to C20 alkenyl; substituted and branched, C4 to C20 polyalkenyl; substituted and branched C2

title: Device and method for separating stacked objects
abstract: A device for separating a stack (1) of objects, in particular cup-shaped capsules (1.1-1. N), in particular having a circumferential edge, comprises separating elements (2.1, 2.7) for engaging between adjacent objects (1.1, 1.2) of the stack (1) of objects. A plurality of separating elements (2.1-2.12) are arranged around the stack (1) in such a way as to engage into the stack (1), and the plurality of separating elements (2.1-2.12) are mounted so as to be radially displaceable. According to the invention, the plurality of separating elements (2.1-2.12) are individually elastically supported (3.1-3.12), and the device comprises means (5, 11.1, 11.2) for moving the plurality of separating elements (2.1-2.12) outwardly into a position in which the plurality of separating elements (2.1-2.12) are not engaged into the stack (1). The device allows for automatic separation of stacked objects which, although fragile, are at the same time firmly inserted into each other and still have irregularities in alignment within the stack.
claims:
1.一种用于分离物体堆叠的装置，所述物体特别是杯状胶囊，特别是具有圆周边缘，
其中，
存在分离元件，用于接合到所述物体堆叠的相邻物体之间，
多个所述分离元件以接合到所述堆叠中的方式围绕所述堆叠布置；并且
所述多个分离元件可径向移动地支承，
其特征在于，
所述多个分离元件单独弹性地支承，并且
所述装置包括用于将所述多个分离元件向外移动到不接合到所述堆叠中的位置的机构。
2.根据权利要求1所述的装置，其特征在于，所述多个分离元件弹性地支承，使得其径向向内压靠在所述堆叠上。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的装置，其特征在于，所述多个分离元件包括至少三个，特别是至少四个，其中，相邻分离元件之间的最大角度距离小于180°。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的装置，其特征在于，存在导向器，待分离的物体的所述堆叠可以位于所述导向器内。
5.根据权利要求4所述的装置，其特征在于，所述多个分离元件设置在所述导向器的一端。
6.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的装置，其特征在于，用于移动所述分离元件的机构包括套筒，通过所述套筒沿着堆叠轴线的移动，所述多个分离元件径向移动。
7.根据权利要求1至6中任一项所述的装置，其特征在于，所述多个分离元件横向于堆叠轴线围绕所述堆叠圆形布置，并径向对准。
8.根据权利要求1至7中任一项所述的装置，其特征在于，待从所述堆叠中移除的物体可以借助于可沿着堆叠轴线移动的载体临时固定。
9.根据权利要求8所述的装置，其特征在于，所述载体包括用于在所述待移除的物体的壁和

title: Composition for use
abstract: The present invention provides methods for identifying an infant or young child at risk of stunted growth and compositions for use in preventing and/or treating stunted growth in an infant or young child.
claims:
1. A method for identifying an infant or young child at risk of stunted growth, wherein said method comprises determining the abundance of Bifidobacterium pseudocatenulatum and/or Streptococcus thermophilus in one or more samples obtained from the infant.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein an infant or young child with reduced levels of B. pseudocatenulatum is identified as at risk of stunted growth.
3. The method according to any preceding claim wherein the stunted growth is stunted height or length; optionally wherein the stunted height or length is defined as a reduced length-for-age z-score (LAZ) or a reduced LAZ over time or a reduced height-for-age z-score (HAZ) or a reduced HAZ over time.
4. A composition for use in preventing and/or treating stunted growth in an infant or young child, wherein the composition promotes B. pseudocatenulatum and/or Streptococcus thermophilus in the gut microbiota of the infant or young child.
5. The composition for use according to claim 4, wherein the composition promotes B. pseudocatenulatum in the gut microbiota of the infant or young child; optionally wherein the composition comprises a B. pseudocatenulatum microorganism.
6. The composition for use according to claim 4, wherein the composition comprises a prebiotic.
7. A combination of a B. pseudocatenulatum a

title: Carbonated beverage bottle with improved petal-shaped bottom
abstract: A bottle for containing a carbonated beverage, the bottle comprising a body and a bottom having a substantially hemispherical bottom geometry (S1) extending from a lower end of the body. The bottom comprises a petaloid foot formation which is axisymmetric about the longitudinal axis (X) of the bottle and is formed by a plurality of feet protruding downward from the bottom geometry (S1), the recesses of which separate adjacent pairs of feet. The bottom line (81) of each recess substantially coincides with the underlying geometry (S1). The ratio of the maximum foot depth (F), which is the maximum vertical distance from the underlying geometry (S1) to the foot surface (S2), to the base radius, which is the radius of the maximum circle formed by the points in contact with the foot and the flat surface (9) when the bottle stands vertically on the flat surface, is 0.5 +/-0.01.
claims:

主体(5)；
底部(6)，所述底部从所述主体(5)的下端延伸，所述底部具有基本上呈半球状的底层几何形状(S 1)，所述底部包括：
从所述底层几何形状(S1)向下突出的多个支脚(7)；
凹陷部(8)，所述凹陷部将相邻的支脚(7)对分隔开，每个凹陷部(8)的底部线条(81)基本上与所述底层几何形状(S1)一致：
所述支脚和凹陷部一起形成围绕所述瓶子的纵向轴线(X)具有轴对称性的花瓣状支脚形成物；
最大支脚深度(F)，所述最大支脚深度是从所述底层几何形状(S1)到支脚表面(S2)的最大垂直距离；
底座半径(S)，所述底座半径是当所述瓶子垂直立在平坦表面上时由与所述支脚和平坦表面(9)接触的点(10)形成的最大圆的半径；
其特征在于，
所述最大支脚深度与所述底座半径之比为0.5±0.01。

6.根据权利要求3所述的瓶子，所述瓶子的所述最大支脚深度与所述底座半径之比为0.51；并且相邻支脚(7)对的相对凹陷部侧翼(11a，11b)对之间的角度为41度。
7.根据权利要求3所述的瓶子，所述瓶子的所述最大支脚深度与所述底座半径之比为0.50；并且相邻支脚(7)对的相对凹陷部侧翼(11a，11b)对之间的角度为44度。

10.根据权利要求1至8中任一项所述的瓶子，其中所述瓶子为1.5升型瓶。

title: Squeezable bottle filled aseptically with viscous food product, packaged viscous product, preform and method of filling queezable bottle
abstract: A semi-rigid bottle (10) for packaging viscous food products wherein the bottle (10) is made of a material suitable for sterile treatment, distillation and/or hot filling, is stable in profile, can be squeezed and collapsed by radially inward flattening grip forces, does not restore its original shape after collapsing, and is blow-molded. The bottle (10) comprises a wall (50) having at least one oxygen and light blocking layer, and a neck portion (20) extending from the wall (50) and comprising a dispensing opening (40) at the top of the neck portion (20), a thread (21), and an orifice section (41) extending from the top of the dispensing opening (40) to the thread (21) without any thread, wherein the inner diameter of the dispensing opening (40) is in the range of 6 mm to 28 mm, and wherein the nozzle section (41) extends in the range of 6 mm to 10 mm along a vertical distance.

title: Mixed triglycerides
abstract: The present invention relates to mixed triglycerides, in particular, the present invention provides a composition comprising a compound having the formula (1), (2), (3), (4) or a combination thereof wherein n1, n2, n3, n4, n5, and n6 are independently 4 to 10. # imgabs0 #
claims:

title: Functionalized compositions comprising an engineered phenylalanine ammonia lyase (PAL)
abstract: The present invention relates to a composition comprising a solid carrier, an engineered phenylalanine ammonia lyase or a fragment thereof immobilized on the surface of the solid carrier, a protective layer to protect the engineered phenylalanine ammonia lyase or a fragment thereof by embedding the engineered phenylalanine ammonia lyase or a fragment thereof, and a functional constituent immobilized on the surface of the protective layer, wherein the functional constituent immobilized on the surface of the protective layer is a polymer comprising repeat units wherein each repeat unit comprises at least one amino group and/or at least one thiol group. The present invention also relates to methods of producing said composition and uses thereof.
claims:
Claims
1. A composition comprising a solid carrier, an engineered phenylalanine ammonia lyase (PAL) or a fragment thereof immobilized on the surface of the solid carrier, a protective layer to protect the engineered phenylalanine ammonia lyase (PAL) or the fragment thereof by embedding the engineered phenylalanine ammonia lyase (PAL) or the fragment thereof, and a functional constituent immobilized on the surface of the protective layer, wherein the functional constituent immobilized on the surface of the protective layer is a polymer comprising repeat units wherein each repeat unit comprises at least one amino group and/or at least one thiol group.
2. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the polymer comprising repeat units wherein each repeat unit comprises at least one amino group and/or at least one thiol group is a polyglucosamin selected from the group consisting of chitin, chitosan, polyglucosaminoglycans, chondroitin, heparin, keratan and dermatan or a derivative thereof.
3. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the polymer comprising repeat units wherein each repeat unit comprises at least one amino group and/or at least one thiol group is chitosan or a derivative thereof.
4. The composition according to any one of claims 1-3, wherein the functional constituent is immobilized on the surface of the protective layer by non-covalent binding or by covalent binding.
5. The composition of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the protective layer embeds the solid carrier and embeds the engineered phenylalanine a

title: Compositions and methods for dehydrated pet food blends
abstract: The present invention provides compositions and methods relating to dehydrated pet food blends. The dehydrated pet food blend may include from about 15% to about 50% protein, from about 5% to about 40% fat, and from about 5% to about 50% carbohydrate. In addition, the blend may include a semi-wet coarse food, a dry coarse powder, and a dehydrated vegetable.
claims:
1.脱水宠物食品共混物，其包含：
约15％至约50％的蛋白质；
约5％至约40％的脂肪；以及
约5％至约50％的碳水化合物；
其中组合物包含半湿粗磨食物、干粗粉和脱水蔬菜。
2.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述半湿粗磨食物具有约10重量％至约30重量％的水分含量。
3.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述半湿粗磨食物以约10重量％至约50重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。
4.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述干粗粉具有约5重量％至约12重量％的水分含量。
5.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述干粗粉以约40重量％至约90重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。
6.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述脱水蔬菜具有约1重量％至约10重量％的水分含量。
7.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述脱水蔬菜以约5重量％至约30重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。
8.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其还包含抗氧化剂、矿物质或维生素，并且还包含防腐剂。
9.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述半湿粗磨食物涂有动物消化物。
10.根据权利要求1所述的脱水宠物食品共混物，其中所述共混物被配制为完全且营养均衡的宠物食品。
11.用于制造脱水宠物食品共混物的方法，所述方法包括：
挤出半湿粗磨食物；
挤出干粗磨食物；
研磨所述干粗磨食物以形成干粗粉；以及
将所述半湿粗磨食物和所述干粗粉与脱水蔬菜混合以形成所述脱水宠物食品共混物。
12.根据权利要求11所述的方法，其中所述半湿粗磨食物具有约10重量％至约30重量％的水分含量并且以约10重量％至约50重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。
13.根据权利要求11所述的方法，其中所述干粗粉具有约5重量％至约12重量％的水分含量，并且以约40重量％至约90重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。
14.根据权利要求11所述的方法，其中所述脱水蔬菜具有约1重量％至约10重量％的水分含量，并且以约5重量％至约30重量％的量存在于所述共混物中。

title: Beverage extraction unit with movable outflow obstructor
abstract: The invention relates to a beverage extraction unit (1) for extracting a beverage from an exchangeable single-serve portioned capsule (2) containing beverage ingredients and being configured with a flow restricting member for extracting capsules at different beverage pressure and flow conditions. The invention also relates to the beverage machine comprising the extraction unit.
claims:
1. A beverage extraction unit for extracting a beverage from an exchangeable capsule containing a beverage ingredient and comprising a liquid entry wall, the exchangeable capsule further comprising a beverage outlet membrane, the beverage extraction unit comprising:
a frame;
an injection part for accommodating the liquid entry wall of the exchangeable capsule and comprising at least a water outlet for injection of water in the exchangeable capsule; and
an extraction part delimiting with the injection part an extraction chamber in which the exchangeable capsule is housed during extraction, the extraction part and the injection part being relatively movable to open and close the extraction chamber, the exchangeable capsule being insertable into and/or removable from the open extraction chamber and the exchangeable capsule being extractible when housed in the closed extraction chamber,
the extraction part comprising an extraction plate having a plurality of beverage outlets for allowing the beverage to flow through the extraction plate; and
the extraction part further comprises a flow restricting member arranged relative to the extraction plate in a moveable manner between a standard outflow position and a reduced outflow position, wherein a flow surface area of the plurality of beverage outlets in the reduced outflow position is reduced compared to a flow surface area of the plurality of beverage outlets in the standard outflow position by obstructing a part of the plurality of beverage outlets, the part of the plurality of beverage outlets obstructed by the flow restricting member being partly or enti

title: Method for producing milk like products
abstract: A method of producing mammalian breast milk exosomes, for example human breast milk exosomes comprising generating lactocytes derived from mammalian mammary epithelial cells, for example human mammary epithelial cells, expressing the mammalian milk like product, for example the human milk like product from lactocytes, and purifying the exosomes from the mammalian milk like product.
claims:
1. An isolated human breast milk exosome, wherein Hypoxia up-regulated protein 1 (HYOU1), Apolipoprotein A-IV (APOA4) and Procollagen-lysine,2-oxoglutarate 5-dioxygenase 1 (PL0D1) are not detected by liquid chromatography - mass spectrometry in the exosome.
2. The exosome of claim 1, wherein C4a anaphylatoxin (CFA), Hypoxia up-regulated protein 1 (HYOU1), Apolipoprotein A-IV (APOA4), Procollagen-lysine,2-oxoglutarate 5-dioxygenase 1 (PLOD1), Threonine—tRNA ligase 1, cytoplasmic (TARSI), and Cytosolic non-specific dipeptidase (CNDP2) are not detected by liquid chromatography - mass spectrometry in the exosome.
3. The exosome of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the exosome comprises lactotransferrin (LTF), annexin A2 (ANXA2) and lactadherin (MFGE8), MUC1 and tetraspanins CD9, CD81 and CD63.
4. The exosome of any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the exosome comprises one or more miRNAs selected from miR-148a-3p, miR-22-3p, miR-125b-5b and miR-6126.
5. The exosome of any preceding claim, wherein the exosome comprises one or more lipids selected from cholesterol esters, ceramides, triacylglycerides, diacylglycerides, lyso-phospholipids, total phospholipids, alkanyl phospholipids, and alkenyl phospholipids.
6 The exosome of any preceding claim, wherein the exosome comprises one or more phospholipids selected from sphingomyelins, phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidyli

title: Wet pet food systems
abstract: The present disclosure is drawn to wet pet food systems and methods of packaging wet pet foods. The wet pet food systems include a sealed pouch constructed of a monomaterial of polypropylene and a wet pet food contained within the sealed pouch. The wet pet food can include a member selected from the group consisting of a mousse, a chunk-in-loaf, and chunks-in-gravy. The wet pet food includes an antioxidant including a soy sauce.
claims:
What Is Claims Is:
A wet pet food system, comprising:a sealed pouch constructed of a monomaterial of polypropylene; anda wet pet food contained within the sealed pouch, the wet pet food including a member selected from the group consisting of a mousse, a chunk-in-loaf, and chunks-in-gravy, wherein the wet pet food comprises an antioxidant including a soy sauce.
The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the sealed pouch is recyclable. 
The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the sealed pouch is constructed of a monolayer of polypropylene. 
The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the sealed pouch is more permeable to oxygen and water than an aluminum barrier pouch.               
The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the soy sauce is included in the wet pet food at from about 0.1 wt% to about 3 wt% based on a dehydrated soy sauce weight of a total weight of the wet pet food.
The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the soy sauce is added to the wet pet food at from about 0.25 wt% to about 2 wt% based on a dehydrated soy sauce weight of a total weight of the wet pet food.
The wet pet food system of claim 1, wherein the wet pet food includes from about 40 wt% to about 80 wt% water based a total weight of the

title: Centrifugal chamber with capsule positioning guide
abstract: A machine (1) is configured for preparing a beverage (4) from a flavouring ingredient (5a) supplied within a capsule (5b) in a processing cavity (5) by mixing it with water (4′) and centrifuging them about a processing axis (30′). The machine (1) has a handling system (10, 20) including a first ingredient handler (10) and a second ingredient handler (20) that are movable one relative to the other from a capsule transfer configuration to an capsule processing configuration. The machine has a capsule supply passage (60) provided with a capsule guide (61, 61a). The guide (61, 61a) is associated with a capsule stop (61b) to immobilize the supplied capsule (5b) between the first and second ingredient handlers (10, 20). The guide is integral with or fixed to an elastic arm (61c) to be movable towards and away from the processing axis (30′) between a capsule immobilization position and a release position.
claims:
1. A machine for preparing a beverage from a flavouring ingredient supplied within a capsule in a processing cavity by mixing said ingredient with water in said capsule and centrifugally driving such ingredient and said water about a processing axis to form said beverage, such machine comprising:
a rotatable ingredient handling system for holding said capsule and rotating said flavouring ingredient and water during centrifugation about the processing axis, the ingredient handling system having at least one beverage outlet and at least one water inlet for supplying said water to said ingredient, the system having a first ingredient handler and a second ingredient handler that are movable one relative to the other from:
an ingredient transfer configuration for receiving said ingredient within said capsule by the first and second capsule handlers and/or releasing said capsule from the first and second ingredient handlers; to
an ingredient processing configuration for centrifuging said ingredient and water within said capsule by rotation about the processing axis;
and vice versa;
a handler actuator, such as a motor or a user-handle, configured to relatively move the first and second capsule handlers between the transfer and the processing configurations; and
a machine frame and/or housing which is stationary when the ingredient handling system is rotated for centrifugation and which supports the ingredient handling system,
the machine frame and/or housing delimiting an ingredient supply passage configured to al

title: Piercing and fluid processing device
abstract: The invention concerns a piercing and fluid processing device (11) for piercing a pack (10), for providing diluent inside the pack (10) to prepare a beverage by mixing said diluent with an ingredient contained in said pack (10) and for dispensing the beverage from the pack (10), comprising a piercing end (113), a diluent inlet conduit (111) for introducing a diluent into said pack (10), and a beverage outlet conduit (112) for dispensing the beverage from said pack (10), wherein a beverage inlet end (112a) of the beverage outlet conduit (112) comprises multiple outlet holes (1121).
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A piercing and fluid processing device (11) of a beverage preparation machine (1) for producing a beverage from a pack (10), said pack (10) comprises a beverage ingredient configured to be mixed with a fluid to produce a beverage, said pack (10) presenting a plane shape oriented along a plane (P), and the bottom side (101) of said pack (10) being configured for being openable, said piercing and fluid processing device (11) being for piercing said pack (10), for providing diluent inside said pack (10) to prepare a beverage by mixing said diluent with an ingredient contained in said pack (10) and for dispensing the beverage from said pack (10), said piercing and fluid processing device (11) comprising: - a piercing end (113), - a diluent inlet conduit (111) for introducing said diluent into said pack (10), and - a beverage outlet conduit (112) for dispensing said beverage from said pack (1), wherein a beverage inlet end (112a) of said beverage outlet conduit (112) comprises multiple outlet holes (1121).
2. The piercing and fluid processing device (11) according to the precedent claim, wherein the smallest dimension of said multiple outlet holes (1121) is of at most 0.7 mm, preferably at most 0.6 mm, even more preferably at most 0.5 mm.
3. The piercing and fluid processing device (11) according to any one of the precedent claims, wherein the global surface defined by said multiple outlet holes (1121) is of at least 25 mm2, preferably at least 27 mm2for a flow said diluent entering the diluent inlet conduit (111) comprised between 50 and 400 ml/min.

title: Use of non-dairy beverage with rice and pea proteins for feeding babies with cow protein allergy
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: disclosed is the use of a non-dairy beverage with improved organoleptic properties for feeding babies with cow protein allergy, where the beverage contains hydrolysed rice proteins, pea proteins and optionally free amino acids, wherein the pea proteins are used in amount of 10 wt.% to 90 wt.%, and the hydrolysed rice proteins are used in an amount of at least 10 wt.%, wherein pea proteins, hydrolysed rice proteins and an optional free amino acid form the entire protein content in the non-dairy beverage. Also disclosed is the use of pea and rice proteins for improving the organoleptic properties of a non-dairy beverage.EFFECT: group of inventions enables to use a non-dairy beverage for feeding babies with cow protein allergy without bitterness and unpleasant astringent taste with an age-appropriate amino acid profile, as well as use of pea and hydrolysed rice proteins to produce a beverage with improved organoleptic properties.14 cl, 1 dwg, 9 tbl, 4 ex

title: Beverage or food preparation system
abstract: A container for use with a beverage or food preparation machine, the container comprising: a storage portion for containing a precursor material; a code storing preparation information used by the machine to process the precursor material, the code configured to be readable by a code reading system of the machine, the code reading system comprising an illumination system for projecting emitted light greater than 700 nm or 800 nm to the code, and a camera system for receiving the emitted light from the machine, a camera system for obtaining a digital image of a code operating at a wavelength of 700 nm or more than 800 nm, the code being arranged to absorb and/or reflect emitted light for capture by said camera system in the digital image; and an information carrying layer comprising container information visible at the wavelength of visible light and having a relatively low absorptivity and/or reflectance for said emitted light, where the information carrying layer is arranged to be effective in proximity to the code layer to hide the code.
claims:
1.一种用于与饮料或食品制备机器一起使用的容器，所述容器包括：
储存部分，所述储存部分用于容纳前体材料；
代码，所述代码用于存储由所述机器用来处理所述前体材料的制备信息，所述代码被配置为能够由所述机器的代码读取系统读取，所述代码读取系统包括照明系统和相机系统，所述照明系统用于将大于700nm或800nm的发射光投射到所述代码，所述相机系统用于获得以700nm或800nm以上的波长操作的所述代码的数字图像，所述代码被布置成吸收和/或反射所述发射光以便由所述相机系统捕获在数字图像中；和
信息承载层，所述信息承载层包括在可见光波长下可见并且被配置为能够由用户读取的容器信息，并且对所述发射光具有相对低的吸收率和/或反射率，
其中所述信息承载层布置成有效接近代码层，使得所述信息承载层和所述代码的位置布置使得所述代码被所述信息承载层隐藏或部分隐藏，与没有所述信息承载层时所述代码的情况相比，降低了所述代码在所述可见光波长下的可见度。
2.根据权利要求1所述的容器，其中，所述信息承载层对所述发射光具有小于20％的吸收率，并且对所述发射光具有小于30％的反射率。
3.根据权利要求1或2中任一项所述的容器，其中：
所述信息承载层是连续的；
所述信息承载层邻接所述代码；并且
所述信息承载层在由横向方向和纵向方向限定的平面中延伸，并且在深度方向上具有贯穿厚度，所述贯穿厚度从外表面延伸，并且其中所述信息承载层被布置成当在所述平面中观察时与整个代码重叠。
4.根据权利要求3所述的容器，其中，所述代码相对于所述信息承载层最接近所述外表面。
5.根据任一前述权利要求所述的容器，其中，所述信息承载层在由横向方向和纵向方向限定的平面中延伸，并且在深度方向上具有贯穿厚度，并且：
所述代码包括被配置为吸收所述发射光的吸收层和被配置为反射所述发射光的反射层；
所述反射层被配置为反射可见光波长；
所述信息承载层在深度方向上布置在所述反射层与闭合构件的外表面之间；并且

title: Beverage or food preparation system
abstract: The invention provides a container for containing precursor material and for use with a machine for preparing beverages and/or food products or precursors thereof, the container comprising a machine-readable code storing preparation information for use with a preparation process performed by the machine, the code comprising: a reference portion (R) to locate the code; a data portion (D) to store the preparation information, and; a code identification portion (I) wherein the code identification portion (I) is separate from the reference portion (R), and wherein the code identification portion encodes information relating to a geometric arrangement of the data portion relative to the reference portion.
claims:
1.一种用于容纳前体材料的容器，所述容器用于与用于制备饮料和/或食品或者其前体的机器一起使用，所述容器包括存储与由所述机器执行的制备过程一起使用的制备信息的机器可读代码，所述代码包括：
用以定位所述代码的参考部分(R)；用以存储所述制备信息的数据部分(D)，以及；代码识别部分(I)，
其中所述代码识别部分(I)与所述参考部分(R)分开，并且其中所述代码识别部分对与所述数据部分相对于所述参考部分的几何布置相关的信息进行编码。
2.根据权利要求1所述的容器，其中所述数据部分至少部分地将所述制备信息的参数的值编码为所述代码的数据单元沿着虚拟编码线(E)距布置在所述编码线上的起始位置的几何距离(d)，其中布置在所述编码线上的结束位置限定最大可允许距离(d)，
并且与由代码识别部分编码的所述信息相关的所述数据部分的所述几何布置包括以下中的一者或多者：
所述起始位置在所述编码线上的位置；
所述结束位置在所述编码线上的位置，以及；
所述数据单元能够被布置在其内的所述起始位置与所述结束位置之间的递增距离和/或增量数量。
3.根据权利要求2所述的容器，其中所述数据部分被布置为多个单独数据部分，所述多个单独数据部分各自被布置在所述编码线上，
并且与由代码识别部分编码的所述信息相关的所述几何布置包括在所述编码线上的多个单独数据部分。
4.根据权利要求3所述的容器，其中存在多条编码线，并且所述数据部分被布置为在所述多条编码线中的每一者上的一个或多个单独数据部分，
并且与由代码识别部分编码的所述信息相关的所述几何布置包括用于每条编码线的多个数据部分。
5.根据权利要求2至4中任一项所述的容器，其中所述参考部分被布置成限定线性虚拟参考线(L)，并且所述编码线是圆形的并且被布置成与所述参考线(L)相交，
其中所述起始位置和/或所述结束位置相对于交点的位置与由所述代码识别部分编码的所述信息相关。
6.根据权利要求2至5中任一项所述的容器，其中所述代码识别部分被布置为一个或多个离散位置，所述一个或多个离散位置被布置在相对于所述参考部分的预定义位置处，
所述离散位置包括或缺少用以将所述信息编码为与所述数据部分的所述几何布置相关的二进制信息的单元。
7.根据权利要求6所述的容器，其中所述代码识别部分被布置在所述或每条编码线远侧，其中所述或每条编码线被布置在所述代码识别部分与所述参考部分之间。
8.根据权利要求2至8中任一项所述的容器，其中所述代码识别部分对与数据单元的表示相关的信息进行编码，其中所述表示包括编码距离是否由一个或多个数据单元限

title: Compositions and methods for improving and/or maintaining optimal cholesterol levels using combination of at least one fiber and at least one probiotic
abstract: The composition contains a combination of at least one fiber and at least one probiotic and is formulated for administration to a subject in a condition of a challenged gut microbiome, such that the combination of the at least one fiber and the at least one probiotic improves and/or maintains an optimal cholesterol level in the subject under the condition of the challenged gut microbiome. Preferably, the subject is experiencing one or more of microbiome stressors, such as dietary stressors, antibiotics, other drugs, infection, strenuous exercise, stress, alcohol, travel, and combinations thereof; more preferably at least one dietary stress source; most preferably at least one high fat diet, such as a western high fat diet or ketogenic diet. The method may achieve at least one result that is to improve and/or maintain an optimal cholesterol level in a subject under the condition of a challenged gut microbiome.
claims:
1.用于改善和/或维持处于受挑战的肠道微生物组的状况下的受试者中的最佳胆固醇水平的组合物，所述组合物包含有效量的至少一种纤维和至少一种益生菌的组合。
2.根据权利要求1所述的组合物，其中所述受挑战的肠道微生物组是由所述受试者经历的微生物组应激源引起的。
3.根据权利要求2所述的组合物，其中所述微生物组应激源选自：膳食应激源；抗生素；其他药物；感染；剧烈运动；压力；酒精；旅行；
胃肠外喂养；肠道喂养；短肠综合征；肠道炎症；化疗；结肠癌；腹泻；质子泵抑制剂；无谷蛋白的饮食；不含可发酵的低聚糖、二糖、单糖和多元醇(FODMAP)的饮食；以及它们的组合；优选地至少一种膳食应激源；更优选地至少一种高脂肪饮食；最优选地西方高脂肪低纤维饮食或生酮饮食。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述至少一种纤维选自：不溶性纤维、可溶性纤维以及它们的混合物；优选地它们的混合物。
5.根据权利要求1至4中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述至少一种纤维选自：低聚木糖、亚麻籽、部分水解的瓜尔胶(PHGG)、葡甘露聚糖、纤维素、西梅粉、果胶诸如苹果皮果胶以及它们的混合物。
6.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述至少一种纤维包括至少两种纤维，诸如两种、三种、四种、五种、六种或七种纤维以及任选地更多种。
7.根据权利要求1至6中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述至少一种益生菌选自：嗜酸乳杆菌、乳双歧杆菌、鼠李糖乳杆菌、长双歧杆菌、植物乳杆菌、两歧双歧杆菌、加氏乳杆菌以及它们的混合物。
8.根据权利要求1至7中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述至少一种益生菌包括选自以下的菌株：嗜酸乳杆菌La-14、乳双歧杆菌BI-04、鼠李糖乳杆菌GG、长双歧杆菌BL-05、植物乳杆菌Lp-115、两歧双歧杆菌Bb-06、加氏乳杆菌Lg-36以及它们的混合物。
9.根据权利要求1至8中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述至少一种益生菌包括至少两种益生菌菌株，诸如两种、三种、四种、五种、六种或七种益生菌菌株以及任选地更多种。
10.根据权利要求1至9中任一项所述的组合物，其中将至少一种纤维和至少一种益生菌的所述组合口服施用于所述受试者。
11.根据权利要求1至10中任一项所述的组合物，其中所述受试者选自：人类婴儿、人类儿童、人类青少年、成人、老年人以及动物诸如伴侣动物。
12.根据权利要求1至11中任一项所述的组合物，其用于预防和/或治疗心血管、循环、内分泌系统和/或神经系统病症和/或疾病。
13.改善和/或维持处于受挑战的肠道微生物组的状况下的受试者中的最佳胆固醇水平的方法，所述方法包括向所述受试者施用根据权利要求1至11中任一项所述的组合物。
14.实现选自预防和/或治疗心血管、循环、内分泌系统和/或神经系统病症和/或疾病的至少一种结果的方法，所述方法包括通过向处于受挑战的肠道微生物组的状况下的受试者施用根据权利要求1至11中任一项所述的组合物来改善和/或维持

title: Complex coacervates of lactoferrin and osteopontin
abstract: The present invention relates to a complex coacervate comprising lactoferrin and osteopontin, a method for preparing the same, and a composition comprising the same. Furthermore, the present invention relates to a complex comprising lactoferrin and osteopontin for use in the treatment and/or prevention of metabolic and/or inflammatory diseases. Furthermore, the present invention relates to a complex comprising lactoferrin and osteopontin for use in promoting bone development, growth, strength and/or healing or in the prevention and/or treatment of bone diseases.
claims:
1.包含乳铁蛋白和骨桥蛋白的复合凝聚物，所述复合凝聚物用于促进受试者的骨发育、生长、强度和/或愈合或者预防和/或治疗受试者的骨疾病。
2.根据权利要求1用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述复合凝聚物包含5％w/w至50％w/w的量、优选15％w/w至40％w/w的量以及更优选25％w/w至35％w/w的量的蛋白质。
3.根据权利要求1或2用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述复合凝聚物包含50％w/w至95％w/w的量、优选60％w/w至85％w/w的量以及更优选65％w/w至75％w/w的量的水。
4.根据任一前述权利要求用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述复合凝聚物具有在最短维度上至少500nm、优选在最短维度上至少600nm、更优选在最短维度上至少700nm以及甚至更优选在最短维度上至少900nm的直径。
5.根据任一前述权利要求用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述复合凝聚物具有-15mV至+15mV范围内、优选-10mV至+10mV范围内以及更优选-8mV至+5mV范围内的ζ电位。
6.根据任一前述权利要求用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述复合凝聚物以组合物的形式施用。
7.根据权利要求6用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述组合物选自由食品组合物、宠物食品组合物、饮料、营养配方产品或营养品组成的组。
8.根据权利要求6或7用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述组合物是婴儿配方食品、一段婴儿配方食品、较大婴儿配方食品、婴孩食品、婴儿谷物组合物、成长乳、强化剂或补充剂。
9.根据任一前述权利要求用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述复合凝聚物口服施用。
10.根据任一前述权利要求用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述复合凝聚物以100mg/kg/天至10000mg/kg/天的剂量、优选以500mg/kg/天至5000mg/kg/天的剂量以及更优选以1000mg/kg/天至2000mg/kg/天的剂量施用。
11.根据任一前述权利要求用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述复合凝聚物增加骨生长和/或骨强度，优选地其中所述复合凝聚物增加选自以下的一种或多种骨参数：小梁骨体积和组织体积分数(BV/TV)、骨矿物质密度(BMD)、骨矿物质含量(BMC)、皮质骨体积(Ct.BV)、内外直径、前后直径、骨屈服力和骨刚度。
12.根据任一前述权利要求用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述骨疾病是代谢骨障碍，优选地其中所述骨疾病是低骨密度、骨质减少、骨质疏松、骨软化或佝偻病。
13.根据任一前述权利要求用于所述用途的复合凝聚物，其中所述受试者是少年、青少年、儿童或婴儿，优选地其中：
(i)所述受试者早产或具有低出生体重或经历宫内生长迟滞；

title: Beverage or foodstuff preparation system
abstract: A container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff or a precursor thereof, the container including a machine-readable code storing preparation information for use with a preparation process performed by said machine, the code comprising: a reference portion (R) to locate the code; a data portion (D) to store the preparation information, and; a code identifying portion (I), wherein the code identifying portion (I) is separate from the reference portion (R) and wherein code identifying portion encodes information related to a geometric arrangement of the data portion relative the reference portion.
claims:
1. A container for containing a precursor material for use with a machine for preparing a beverage and/or foodstuff ora precursor thereof, the container including a machine-readable code storing preparation information for use with a preparation process performed by said machine, the code comprising:
a reference portion (R) to locate the code; a data portion (D) to store the preparation information, and; a code identifying portion (I),
wherein the code identifying portion (I) is separate from the reference portion (R), and
wherein the code identifying portion encodes information related to a geometric arrangement of the data portion relative the reference portion.
2. The container of claim 1, wherein the data portion at least partially encodes a value of a parameter of the preparation information as a geometric distance (d) of a data unit of the code along a virtual encoding line (E) from a start position arranged on the encoding line, with an end position arranged on the encoding line defining a maximum allowable distance (d),
and said geometric arrangement of the data portion related to the information encoded by code identifying portion includes one or more of:
a location of the start position on the encoding line;
a location of the end position on the encoding line, and;
an incremented distance and/or a number of increments between the star

title: Methods for improving health outcome of dogs using biological age
abstract: The present invention is used for selecting a lifestyle regimen, dietary regimen or therapeutic intervention for a dog, the method comprising: a) providing a DNA methylation profile from a sample obtained from the dog; b) determining the biological age of the dog using the DNA methylation profile; and c) selecting a suitable lifestyle regimen, dietary regimen or therapeutic intervention for the dog based on the biological age determined in step b).
claims:
1.用于为狗选择生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预的方法，所述方法包括：
a)提供来自从所述狗获得的样本的DNA甲基化图谱；
b)使用所述DNA甲基化图谱来确定所述狗的生物学年龄；以及
c)基于步骤b)中确定的所述生物学年龄来为所述狗选择合适的生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预。
2.用于确定生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预对改善狗的生物学年龄的功效的方法，所述方法包括：
a)将生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预应用于所述狗，其中已经根据权利要求1所述的方法选择所述生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预；
b)在将所述生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预应用于所述狗一段时间后；使用来自从所述狗获得的样本的DNA甲基化图谱来确定所述狗的生物学年龄；
c)在遵循所述生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预的所述时间段后，确定所述狗的所述生物学年龄是否存在变化。
3.用于确定生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预对改善狗的生物学年龄的功效的方法，所述方法包括：
a)使用来自从所述狗获得的样本的DNA甲基化图谱来确定所述狗的生物学年龄；
b)将基于步骤a)中确定的所述生物学年龄选择的生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预应用于所述狗；
c)在将所述生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预应用于所述狗一段时间后；使用来自从所述狗获得的样本的DNA甲基化图谱来确定所述狗的生物学年龄；
d)确定所述狗的所述生物学年龄在步骤a)和步骤c)之间是否存在变化。
4.用于确定生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预对改善狗的生物学年龄的功效的方法，所述方法包括：
a)使用来自从所述狗获得的样本的DNA甲基化图谱来确定所述狗的第一生物学年龄；
b)将生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预应用于所述狗；
c)在将所述生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预应用于所述狗一段时间后；使用来自从所述狗获得的第二样本的DNA甲基化图谱来确定所述狗的第二生物学年龄；
d)在遵循所述生活方式方案、膳食方案或治疗干预的所述时间段

title: Container for producing a beverage capsule and capsule thereof
abstract: Container (3) for producing of a beverage capsule containing a beverage ingredient, consisting of a formed laminated structure comprising a cup portion (3) with a depth-to-width ratio of at least 0.3 and a peripheral flange (4); said laminated structure comprising an aluminium foil (9) as a middle layer and comprising on the inner side of the aluminium foil (9) a sealing layer (10, 16); wherein the laminated structure further comprises at least one outer polymer film (13) laminated on the outer side of the aluminium foil (9) using a laminating adhesive layer (15) and in that the outer polymer film (13) is printed at its inner surface and is made of semi-crystalline polymer.
claims:
Claims:
1.
